name: Alabama Adventure & Splash Adventure
address: 4599 Splash Adventure Pkwy, Bessemer, AL 35022, USA

reviews.text: We had an amazing time visiting from out of town. We didn’t know what to expect but found everything accessible, easy and walkable with a variety of slides and water features and extra entertainment at the water park. The free soda, ice and water was a huge plus on a hot day. We got here at opening and also got chairs under the umbrella for shade. They will fill up so go early or rent a cabana. The park was very clean and the staff was great! I would definitely come back to try the amusement park side next time. We give this place two thumbs up.

Good place to take small kids.  There were lots of water attractions for younger kids and you could rent strollers or wagons.  Free soft drinks throughout the park and free parking were two of the best features.

We really enjoyed the wave pool and lazy river! We got there as soon as it opened and the kids rode the water slides over and over. We really enjoyed the amusement park as well. Definitely recommend for family fun! I love that the drinks were free. DON'T bring cash!!

We haven't been in a few years but we're so impressed with all of the updates and changes. We were not nickel and dimes at every turn. Parking was free, discounts for purchasing our tickets on line was a plus, free drinks all day. Well placed sunscreen stations, lots of shady areas for those of us who can't do sun was a welcome plus. After  being given all the free extras, We gladly paid $30 for a pizza that was giagiantic and fed all 6 of us. Rides, shows and wave pools were some of the highlights. Plenty to do and I must say from the entrance to the exit the place was neat and Tidy. We got there at the opening and it wasn't crowded but as the afternoon progressed it did fill up.
A fun day and a definite place to tell my friends about. They really represent Birmingham well ❤️‍🩹
Cute little park.  The staff was very friendly and efficient.  Their big coaster is closed right now so we didn't get to ride that.

name: Funcity Adventure Park
address: 4671 Onondaga Blvd, Syracuse, NY 13219, USA

reviews.text: So many different activities for kids of all ages... trampoline basketball, trampolines, foam pits, games, ball pits and an amazing jungle gym, wall climbing, and so much more! . it's a little pricey, 1.5hrs $24, 2hrs $28 and 3 hrs for $32

Visited Fun City Adventure Park today and my son had a blast! There are all types of games for him to enjoy, and even the big trampolines are a hit. Adults can have a good time too. The staff are incredibly friendly and patient with the kids, making the experience even better. The price is fair, making it a great value for a day of fun. Highly recommend!

Disgusting and unsafe environment; If you are sending your child to a birthday party here or planning a birthday party for your child here, I would highly suggest that you reconsider. We walked in for my nieces 10th birthday party last night, only to be jumping for 10 minutes before a disgusting and vile fight broke out between a ton of adults who also involved their children in the fight. This fight went on for over 15 minutes before security, any of the employees, or police stepped in! Fighting and cussing and being disgusting right in the front lobby in front of all of the staff who were blatantly ignoring them and subjecting every child there to this trauma. When my family member asked for a refund for the $500 birthday party she just paid for, the staff refused and only agreed to partially refund her her money. They made her pay for jump socks and 4 pizzas that we weren’t even able to utilize and still kept over $200 of her money! Everyone who checked in at 5pm were forcibly removed from the premises, but if you had reservations at 7pm or later, you were allowed to come back and jump. My niece’s entire birthday party ruined for some ghetto disgusting fighting. Even more disgusting that all the staff and security just stood there watching a huge fist fight break out in their lobby in front of all these children! You will NEVER get my money again dirty fun city. Do not send your children here they are not safe!!!

Booked a party room and the room was not ready when we got there. The staff at the front told my guests that they needed to check in with the host in the party room and would get their socks at that time. Every time we would have to hunt down a host who then needed to go and find our host. They never asked what size socks the kids needed just gave them some and left the room. My guests had to go back upfront to get a different size because they gave them all small. They only provide one juice or one water per jumper. So if parents want something to drink they charge you $2.00 for a water and because we went on a weekend they charged $2.50. Their website says that the host will help with set up, service and clean up. They did not do any of that. While we were doing cake a host come in the room and took the utensil/plate/napkin hold her. I advised that we were not done and they responded with “I’m taking it to refill it”. It was returned after we got done. While picking up the room a staff member come in and asked who to give the bill to. While we were carrying things out someone else come in and asked us if we were using the card on file to pay the bill. They then walked me to the front counter to make sure we paid.

Very poor customer service. Would not recommend having a party here.

Plenty of parking. Nice place to bring the kiddos for a few hours or the day. It's $24 for 1.5 hrs $28 for 2 hrs or $30 for the day. If you pay $30 for the day you are allowed to leave and come back if you want. It also requires jump socks which are $3.50 a pair. They have a ball pit with slides and some tunnels to crawl through. This is a area for kids 10 and under. They also have different structures and wall structures to climb with a adventure course. This area also says for kids 10 and under. They have a foam pit you can jump in. A trampoline dodge ball area,basket ball area. Various trampolines and a foam pit obstacle courses and a small zip line going over one foam pit. The arcade they have costs extra and is not included
They have some massage chairs you have to pay for to sit at. Also various metal benches you can sit on. Definitely a place to check out. My kids loved it. They have ample parking this is located in a shopping plaza area.

They have some massage chairs you have to pay for to sit at. Also various metal benches you can sit on. Definitely a place to check out. My kids loved it. They have ample parking this is located in a shopping plaza area.

name: Tropic Falls at OWA
address: 1501 S Owa Blvd, Foley, AL 36535, USA

reviews.text: It was a great weekend getaway! Every employee was awesome! The kids loved everything. OWA and Tropical Falls are not Disney or Universal but were perfect for our family getaway. We will go back for sure. Ages 5,7,9 to 18, and 20 in my family and even adults enjoyed the water rides, Rollercoaster, and twister. Could probably do it all in one day speeding, but we did two days, and the second day was just as much fun.

Excellent and Fun water park for family fun!!! The kid ride section is very large and has plenty of options for young kids to enjoy. With the amusement park plus the indoor water park, this place is a winner. Compared of other places, prices are not bad. Highly recommend

Amazing! Amazing! AMAZING!! For our very 1st spring break family vacation at Tropic Falls, we had a BLAST! We went around the entire theme park and water park and had so much fun! BUT WAIT... so our very first ride choice was the Twister.... Let's just say, NEVER AGAIN!!! ... in a good way! The ride operator was fun and made us laugh but we will never ride that bad boy ever again lol! Cheers to those who rode it multiple times and didn't even scream! Like what's wrong with you lol! Nevertheless we definitely still had a great time! The roller coaster 10/10! The flying carousel 10/10! The Alabama-whama 10/10! Go see for yourself! You'll have a blast!

We visited yesterday and our family had a really fun day in the water park and theme park! I will say the people working the theme park were far more friendly and upbeat than the workers in the water park. I did appreciate the amount of lifeguards around the water! It was a chilly Spring morning and we were nervous walking into the park but the second we stepped inside it felt like the Tropics!! So nice and warm, it was perfect temp. Bathrooms and changing rooms were very clean. The pizza was delicious and the drink cups were a good value. When I asked if we could bring back our cups next visit to recharge them for another day the worker said he wasn’t sure. Would be great if we can bring them back next visit to recharge for the day at discounted rate! We had not been to the water park as the price was too steep for our family, but the neighbor family 4pk pass was an excellent value we couldn’t pass up! Looking forward to more visits this year!!

Nice park, and it is not overcrowded. The new indoor water park is very nice and fun for the kiddos. It is a little overpriced for its size.  If you're specifically looking to travel for a theme park, it is the same cost overall for travel with expenses and park admission cost. Compared to  some of the larger theme parks in the south region of the country.

name: Castles N' Coasters
address: 9445 N Metro Pkwy E, Phoenix, AZ 85051, USA

reviews.text:
We had a blast at this great mini-golf park! The customer service was excellent, and the course is really well maintained.  They have a fantastic variety of holes, and the creativity in the design is really impressive. We'll definitely be back!

A fun date night, family day, or adult activity!

Pros:
- Free parking
- Easy access to restrooms
- Clean
- Great customer service
- Value comparable to price

Cons:
- Rest rooms could be cleaner and no feminine products are available
- No trash bins within the golf course, so trash is dropped in random areas

I love this place so much! It’s a good place to go if you have friends and don’t know what to do. They have an arcade and an amusement park outside! The park opens at 5 but the arcade at like 12. It is very pricey also, so make sure to bring a lot of money (at least 100). Overall a great place to hangout with family and friends or for an event but just really pricey.

Giving this place 4 stars because it wasn’t crowded. If it was, then it would only be 3 stars. The advertisement is misleading and lacking much needed information on pricing and all of the costs and options. The UNLIMITED THRILL RIDE PASS does not include the Fun House nor XD Dark Ride. Those are extra $$. Also, the Sky Wire and Ropes Challenge are only open on the weekend. Plus one ride was broken. So we paid for an unlimited pass that didn’t include 5 of the ‘rides’. The gamer pass only lets you play arcade games but not accumulate tickets (which is half of the fun). The roller coaster only runs every 10 minutes. All the exceptions are really a turn-off. Overall, the kids had fun (except for the Fun House which was scary for my 7 and 8 year old and more like a haunted house). The mini golf courses were solid with lots of decor to add interest.

Fun place with rides, an arcade and challenging miniature golf courses. No shade outside though. Restrooms were clean. Water is $4 for a bottle of Dasani.
Can cash on tickets at the arcade for candy and other fin stuff.

Wasn’t a fan of the glass on the basketball net and skeet-ball. Air hockey was fun but the driving game have loose wheels.

cute family theme park - we did an “elite” pass that allowed us 1 game of mini golf, limitless coaster rides, and 1 hr of arcade. our favorite part was the mini golf! they don’t tell you that in your 1 hr of arcade NONE of the digital tickets you win are allowed to be redeemed :( sad day. wish they told me that before i won 1,000+ tickets 😤

name: Enchanted Island Amusement Park
address: 1202 W Encanto Blvd, Phoenix, AZ 85007, USA

reviews.text: We took our daughter here for the Winter Wonderland play area they had and were very disappointed. We used to come to just the amusement park all the time and that part looked pretty run down. We went to buy tickets for the Winter Wonderland part and we’re very disappointed were told that even though as her parents we wouldn’t be participating in the snow slide or bouncy castles we still had to pay for a full price ticket. They made you take the train around to get in which just took us in a big circle and when that wasn’t necessary. They told us she would be able to do the slide for 15min or 20min. Even on the unlimited you only got a few minutes before being kicked out of that area and would have to go all the way out and take the train again to play on that again. We chose to get the 1 time pass instead however I timed it from the time we got off the train to the time that they told us we had to leave that area and it was exactly 6min 32sec. That gave my daughter time to only slide 2 times and there was about 20 people on the train we took. If there were anymore we may have only gotten her on 1 time. No where near 15 which we told was the minimum time. We could go to the bounce area and play for as long as we wanted however there are no bathrooms for portapotties in the fenced off area. You have to leave to go and if you don’t have an unlimited pass they would not let us back in if we left to use it. And the unlimited passes would have to take the train to get back in. Even if you have an older kid they would not allow them to go in by themselves selves. It was basically a way to get a lot of money and provide very little. If they are going to make everyone pay then you would think that they would also have something that you could do/play with your kids and at the very least restrooms or access to one without having to leave. One things for sure we will not be going back and I suggest you don’t either. I have included pics so you can see how small the snow slide is. The workers also had their family there and their kids who were “helping” and able to play and slide as much as they wanted. They were rude at the ticket counter and lied about the time you would get to get your money. That’s all they cared about. This the season. So sad.

A nice oasis - clean park. Nice for a leisure stroll and some light thrill fun for younger families. Perfect spot for little kids. The amusement park is connected to a nearby network of parks and recreation centers geared for all ages. The park is free to enter. The cost of rides can really add up for a larger family. We did not attend when there were any discounts but it looks like they offer them frequently. There is plenty of things to do and see in the area to make leisurely afternoon of it.

This place is so cool!! Perfect for our young kids. We got the pack of 20 tickets and it lasted us about an hour, we did plenty. Everyone is so kind and the rides seem well cared for even though they're obviously not new. I hope the water park portion opens again one day, that would absolutely justify a full day pass. Lots of shade and misters, bathrooms are clean.
Excellent time! Park is really clean and everyone is so kind. The trees provide alot of shade and the rides are great for the kids. My baby girls birthday party was a success!
Lots of activity’s kids loved it. Loved the paddle boat rides, the train, the food. Beautiful atmosphere.

name: Golfland Sunsplash
address: 155 W Hampton Ave, Mesa, AZ 85210, USA

reviews.text:
Last weekend, we had an absolute blast meeting up with friends and family for a night of mini golf! As soon as we approached the entrance, we were greeted by the sight of a massive castle adorned with vibrant neon lights. It set the perfect mood for an evening filled with fun and laughter. The air was electric with the sounds of arcade games all around us, including some of the beloved classics that sparked happy nostalgia for many in our group.

Despite the bustling atmosphere, we made our way to the back to grab our golf clubs. There was a sense of excitement in the air as we prepared for our adventure on the course. We opted for the full 18 holes since we had a large crew, and honestly, I can’t think of a better way to bond and challenge each other than some friendly competition.

As we stepped onto the course, I noticed it was in great shape! Some reviews had mentioned issues, but we found everything to be tidy and well-maintained, aside from a few stray leaves,  which was perfectly understandable given the season. Each hole presented unique obstacles and creative designs that kept us on our toes and added a fun twist to the game. From tricky slopes to whimsical decorations, every play was a new adventure and a chance for a laugh.

The excitement was palpable as we all took turns, cheering each other on and playfully teasing those who missed easy putts! At one point, we even had a spontaneous dance-off between holes. I’m pretty sure the other players must have thought we were a bit wild, but who could blame us? The energy was infectious!

Overall, it was an evening filled with joy, laughter, and maybe a few friendly rivalries. As the final scores were tallied, we were already making plans to come back for another round. If you’re looking for an entertaining night out with friends or family, this mini golf spot is a winner. We had such a fantastic time, and I can’t wait for our next adventure there!

We did the medium golf course and it was a good challenge but not too hard that you wanted to smash a clowns nose. It was roughly 16$ per person for one round and it took us about an hour or so. It's right off the interstate. A few holes a ball would get stuck and you could tell it was a problem so they really need to fix some of that. Birds are all over, and their poop. But very pretty trees! We didn't use the arcade or get food so can't comment on that. But the one course was fun and they had music going.

We have been coming here for our spring break for years and it's always fun and worth it with all the things a pass comes with.
But a special shout out to Ben who was working the bumper cars last weekend.
What a delightful person!  So friendly, helpful and looked like he truly enjoyed his job.
He made this last time truly memorable.

Overall, this is a great place.  Season passes are a must and well worth it. There is lots of stuff to do for the whole family! The managers are very helpful and great to work with. However, some of the other staff are not quite up to par, especially in the arcade area when ordering food. This is not an isolated incident, it has been on a number of occasions.

When is the last time you guys updated this place? The laser tag is from the 80s for sure. Everything is literally falling apart. And getting help from anyone takes a long time , and honestly the whole ring door bell thing is really ghetto. Your staff is amazing doing the best they can, there is not enough of them. I spent a lot of money, and me and my kids waited for every single attraction over 15 min , and we were the only ones in line. When we came in we asked about the arcade add on but she did not know how to do it. Then my kid lost his golf ball wanted a certain color, and couldn’t get it. So I could have spent more money but. I did not. And I won’t be coming back. It was cool when I was a kid, I am now 36 and you guys need to update it for this generation of kids , and get more staff. I wish I could have my money back!

name: Mattel Adventure Park
address: 9601 Cardinals Way, Glendale, AZ 85305, USA

reviews.text:
This park isn't even open yet and somehow it's getting reviewed poorly and perfectly. Like all things to come patience is a virtue.

And for the negative Nancys get a grip on life for Pete’s sake.

Then again this is Arizona where people go 90 In the right lane and 60 in The ultra-fast lane.

To the people who are complaining that your children will be too old by the time it's built... Like it's Mattel's fault for not having it ready for your child at a certain age... That would be like Mattel telling your children to stop aging until it's built. 🤣

Imagine the reactions when they aren't tall enough to get on a ride.
I understand the hype of wanting it to open quickly but it's not going too so the kids will have to learn patients and understanding. I'm pretty sure age isn't going to be a huge factor for when it opens. People of all ages attend Disneyland and fairs. This will be no different.

It's fantastic to see the area grow and especially targeting children. I'm sure the price tag will be a bit high.But should be worth every penny. Matel and disney are kind of like marvel and Disney. You usually side with one. Disneyland has become so overpriced that you have to take out a second mortgage for a family of 4. Hopefully this will have deals for locals and time of year price drops. It's been exciting watching the build.

This place is great. My 3 kids ages 6, 11 and 14 all loved it. Low attendance so wasn’t crowded. Bring your own food and snacks because not too many places to eat. But I am sure they will provide more places to eat the more they build. I highly recommend going!

Honestly, I know so many people are waiting for this to open but, as a consumer, it fills me with so much joy to know that they’re taking all this time to ensure that everything is up to code and safety measures. I mean, why else would this not be open yet? Like, they have to be triple-checking everything down to the last micrometer to ensure our safety and wellbeing.

name: Christmas at Schnepf Farms
address: 24810 S Rittenhouse Rd, Queen Creek, AZ 85142, USA

reviews.text: I have been taking my son here for the last 3 years and he still loves it! The illumination train is my favorite it's so fun! There are lots of different light displays with great music and it's a decently long (but not too long) ride too. The lady working at the train is awesome, she has so much energy and she even got my son and a few other kids out dancing with her while waiting in line for the next train. The food is kind of expensive, I paid $8 for a small cup of Mac n cheese and my son was still hungry after so ended up spending another $12 I think for funnel cake. At least it was good food. If you want to see Santa I suggest getting there right when they open. Last year we got there before they opened and the line was still really long but this year we got there 15 minutes after opening and the wait was already 1 hour long which is way too long for a 5 year old boy to stand in one place doing nothing and it stayed that way the rest of the night so the last 2 years we missed out on seeing Santa. I think that's the one thing they could improve on especially considering that's probably a big part of the reason people go. Feeding the reindeer is another favorite but I suggest going to do that sooner than later as they seem to get full or less interested in taking food from the kids later in the evening. Bathrooms are decent and seem to be kept up with pretty well. If you are looking for a place to have some Holiday fun Christmas at Schnepf Farms should be on your list!
Great Christmas experience. Definitely recommend getting tickets in advance and showing up when the place opens to make sure you can do everything. Kids had a great time. Would come back next year.

I have come here for the past 5 years, I love the lights and atmosphere. Workers are very nice, I would love to rate it more stars, but past 2 years it has been beyond packed. You spend more time waiting in lines than actually enjoying the activities. 3 hrs and literally 3 activities done, another 30 min in line for a funnel cake. 1hr after opening and they ran out of s'more kits, which is unfortunate since  my kids really looked forward to it.

This was such a fun experience! We haven’t gone in past years because it always seemed a little over priced for what they offered. However, this year was amazing! The train ride through the lights was very well done and my kids loved it. There were many things to do which we didn’t have time to get it all done. My only negative thing to say is that it is still pretty pricey. Most things to do a “pay per event” type thing. So your admission cost doesn’t cover most things. It’s still a fun experience worth doing every year as tradition.

A family tradition since 2018!! Every year is, for lack of better words, magical. LOVE that they extended the train and teamed up with World of Illumination. The ice skating is always a great time as well. Wouldn't mind lower prices on simple things like coffee and hot chocolate, I mean, we paid enough just for tickets, add ons and food..... Come on....

name: Magic Springs
address: 1701 E Grand Ave, Hot Springs, AR 71901, USA

reviews.text:
Thank you Magic Springs for such a great time. 🥳
You bring so many families together. 💕 We met so many new people. 🗣
👉Your staff was so excellent, providing great service. 💐
👉 I will definitely recommend this place as a "go to" for families and friends. Kudos to 👍 Magic Springs!
The view of the mountains, just gorgeous!🥰
👉The waterpark for kids and adults..... this was a plus for me. We love it!😄
New bonds made.🥰
The food 🍟🍗🍧🍦🥤 was fresh and great as well.
😄Thank you once again for a job well done.😊

Enjoyed everything! No long wait accept the food stands. But the food was worth it. The entire family members enjoyed themselves from 2yr toddlers to our teens and our adults. No complaints! I must say I enjoyed the pronto pop and my souvenir cup. What a great time I had celebrating Mother’s Day💐🥰💐

Great amusement park for its size. There’s a nice mix of rides for smaller kids and for older ones. It can get hot and exhausting to hike up and down the hills in the theme park. I definitely enjoyed it more when the water park was open. It’s still hot in October and we would have appreciated the cool down. Season passes are a fabulous deal! They pay for themselves in less than 2 visits. Plus you can bring guests for a discount and even bring guests for free at certain times. Well worth the cost of the pass. The food is priced so high that it’s almost ridiculous. I paid $90 for a few snack foods for a family of four. Completely outrageous.

Had a good time here. Riding roller coasters. They have three three extreme roller coasters here. The rest are pretty much for kids. We did enjoy ourselves and they also serve beer. Food prices are not too bad. I did not visit the water park but it looked fun.

If you get the season pass they make you go to processing which is another line and you have to register w your phone and take a pic. That was peeving
The park itself is pretty good some attractions closed. I'm gonna try to get a western pic done again today I hope I get to this time!

name: Blackbeard's Family Entertainment
address: 4055 N Chestnut Diagonal, Fresno, CA 93726, USA

reviews.text: Wife husband and 13 year old son. About 40$ for one of the mini courses. We went early and that turned out to be cool if you don’t want to be rushed.  I can see even slightly crowded you’re gonna have to move along.  Great atmosphere. We only did mini golf but they have so much more.

It’s a little confusing to find where you can buy the tickets and stuff but it’s just at any counter even where they have food. It’s 16 dollars per person for one golf round and it’s honestly super fun. It wasn’t too busy when I went there during the weekend and I totally recommend doing golf here. Fun environment and it’s super cute to do when the sun is setting!

I hadn't visited since I was a teenager and it definitely needs updating. We were invited to an birthday party and I had no idea they have tables in the back with grills. The pass we got came with a card with $2.50 on it to use for some rides and the arcade. The games in the arcade are. 25, .50, .75 up to $1 I believe so it wasn't a big deal to add cash and still have plenty to do. I will say there were a handful of games that would take the card but wouldn't work. I told the employees to block them off so other people didn't lose coins on them but the games were still on when we walked past. Overall a fun place for the kids, fair atmosphere with the carnival rides.

Lack of restrooms for so many people ( especially kids ) , not sure how they got city permit for Public park ? And they don’t add people even if there is Space. So you buy 2 hour tickets and get cheated easily :) am glad I called reception and then they started filling up empty seats in roller coaster and not wasting time of parents
Place was a mess. Amazing fun and price try not that bad. I don’t see why it’s not packed and for baseball the cage were awesome.

name: Boomers Boca Raton
address: 3100 Airport Rd, Boca Raton, FL 33431, USA

reviews.text:
We celebrated the birthday of our daughter there last weekend. Well.. I’m not satisfied with the room, that we paid for… no decorations, not enough light. The host wasn’t helpful enough, me and my daughter were preparing everything, decorating and cleaning the table and the room!
Yes, there is fun to spend time, but it doesn’t worst that amount of money to celebrate a birthday party.
We won’t be back…

We had an amazing time at Boomers during spring break! The spring break deal was worth it. My son had a blast, and we loved that the facility was clean, the attractions and arcade games were modern and well-maintained, and the staff was friendly and helpful.

The only downside was the food prices—$15 for a personal pizza and $40 for a family pizza felt excessive. That being said, everything else exceeded our expectations, and we’ll definitely be back. Highly recommend Boomers for a fun-filled family outing

Fun for the whole family! This is the perfect place to spend an amazing day. There’s something for everyone: from super exciting go-karts to arcade games and mini golf. It’s ideal for both kids and adults—we had so much fun! Definitely a place we’ll be returning to.

We are visiting the area from Michigan, and we had a blast at Boomers.  We had 14 people and everything that we did was just the greatest.  The staff was so friendly and accommodating.  The whole place was clean.  The rides were great!  And the miniature golf was so fun.  I would recommend this place to anyone visiting the area!  And to those of you who live here, you are so lucky to have a place like this!

I wanted to take my daughter here for her 9th birthday. I wanted to buy tickets in advance, but was unable to complete the transaction. When we arrived at Boomers I told the manager that I tried to buy tickets online but was not able to. The manager accommodated me by honoring the online price. I was very pleased. My family had a great time. We bought the elite tickets and did all of the activities and played the arcade games. All of the staff we encountered were so friendly and helpful. The place was clean, the bathrooms were clean. Overall we had a great experience. My daughter really enjoyed her birthday there. Thanks Boomers for helping to make my daughter’s birthday a memorable one 😊

name: California's Great America
address: 4701 Great America Pkwy, Santa Clara, CA 95054, USA

reviews.text:
Even during the holidays, it didn’t seem too crowded. However, for popular rides, the lines are long, and you’ll have to wait at least an hour.

There’s a $45 Fast Lane pass per person, so I highly recommend purchasing and using it.

In addition to the rides, there are impressive decorations and various events to enjoy.

There aren’t many rides suitable for children under six, but the ones they can enjoy are grouped under the name "Snoopy."

Fun activities for all age group .. kids to youth to adult. Everyone can enjoy rides which suits them. Lots of eating options but but pricy as with other parks. Recommended buying tickets and parking in advance. Plan to come on weekdays and non holiday as it gets super crowded especially near the year end.
You can bring your own food and water or drinks. Ample restrooms.

You will have to walk a lot so plan to get stroller or carts for the young kid if you don't want to carry them around.

Purchased 7 tickets for Winter Fest.

I injured myself, I can't walk long distances. (I'm new to needing a wheelchair.)
We didn't know the wheel chairs and electric wheelchairs would sell out (you can purchase in advance online).

We tried our luck as we entered. Nothing. So I stayed near the carousel until about an hour and a half until closing when someone turned in their rental.

I politely asked to speak to a supervisor, I asked for a discounted rate since it was such a short time, but the supervisor said it was not possible to offer any discounts.

So let me break it down a bit. The electric wheelchairs are $55 plus tax, coming out to $62 total. (at the Oakland zoo for example the are only $30)

It literally feels like and did cost me double what it costs an able bodied person to not ride anything but the stardeck.
Had I gotten the chance to rent the entire time, it would have come out to $10 per hour.

I ask that Great America look into its policy and evaluate their customer service. Most of the people who work at the theme park are very young and able bodied (thank goodness). I am available to answer questions.

We went for the wringer fest, they are only open from 4 to 10, in general is a good experience with the kids but if you want to get into all the rides it’s impossible. The lines are too long, the rides last les than a minute (I’m not joking) and the workers take like 10 minutes between rides to get people in or out. I think that’s when we lost most of our time. Workers were friendly tho. Also there are some rides that you have to pay extra when you are inside the park, which I think should be included in your ticket. I don’t think I’m coming back. It was an OK experience for me.

Went to Great America multiple times and every time is an absolute blast! With Friends, Family, or simply by Yourself is no different when it comes to immersing the thrilling rollercoasters (Flight Deck, RailBlazer, Demon) but also soothing rides (carousel, swings, and Planet Snoopy). I went there during the Halloween month and the aesthetics is awe inspiring. Food Court variety is solid.

name: Children's Fairyland
address: 699 Bellevue Ave, Oakland, CA 94610, USA

reviews.text:
Fantastic child centered experience! The cafe food was so healthy, clean and delicious! We were so impressed with the gorgeous flowers all around the park.

The Jolly Trolly train was the highlight for our infant. It’s really magical for ages 2-8/9, but adults and older siblings can really get joy from reading and helping littles understand the stories.

You can bring your own picnic in as well. And there are many spacious areas to sit and eat and let kids run around.

It was a wonderful experience.

Fairyland is a great little amusement park for children between 2-8 years old. The attractions and rides are mostly based on known fairy tales, from Mother Goose stories to Alice in Wonderland. At each attraction, children can listen to a short version of the fairytale from a speaker box, activated with a collectable key (3$). Attractions include a puppet theater, a train ride, a child sized ferris wheel, a carousel, numerous slides, and live animals. The park opened in 1950 and has been a popular attraction ever since. There is a restaurant on site, as well as picnic tables.

We had our sons birthday party here in January and it was awesome! Fairyland is what 4 year dreams are made of. The whole park is thoughtfully designed with little ones in mind. We reserved the Japanese Tea Garden Picnic area and paid extra for a balloon bouquet & keys for the kids. Worth every penny. So easy for us parents and the kids had a blast. Parking was easy for guests (we gave our guests a heads up about the $5 parking fee) and our party coordinator met our guests outside and escorted them to our zone. Our party was during Lunar New Year so we even got to see the dragon dancers - so cool!! Highly recommend!

Good fun for the whole family. My four year old had a ball here and there was so much to see and interact with that we didn’t make it to every attraction over 3 hours. He especially liked the carousel and Ferris wheel. The ticket value is reasonable given that once you pay a flat rate and enter, no nickel and dime experiences, just enjoy the park.
The park was in good shape with very few exhibits closed for updates.

What a joke. It'd be funny if it weren't so expensive. We paid $16 per person (so $48 for my wife, my 3 year old, and myself). It's so incredibly run down. The train wasn't even working. A nice (free!) playground is 100x better. At least there's stuff to do in a playground. The talking boxes scattered around don't have buttons, but rather they require a "magic key" to be inserted which costs $3 to buy. The audacity to charge even more just to listen to the boxes. And then they even ask for them back once you exit the park!

I'm shocked this place still exists. Are we all so desensitized to being ripped off? People, just let it go and stop coming here. Incredible...

name: Fairytale Town
address: 3901 Land Park Dr, Sacramento, CA 95822, USA

reviews.text: Good and affordable to bring kids. I had recently visited Sacramento and decided to take my girls here (5&3). They loved it we spent 3 hrs here and they did not want to leave. Parking does get hectic because it’s right next to the zoo so if you want to get good parking go right when they open.

Recently renovated, with beautiful landscaping and kid friendly attractions all nursery rhyme themed.

There is even a wonderful learning center at the heart of the grounds. My 4 yo enjoyed the live story time about “pollito loco,” and the animation segment to make his own animations using props.

There was tons of shade, plenty of open area, several recycle and garbage cans. My family had a nice time together. My favorite part is that it was inexpensive to enter ($8 fee per person).
Great for children ages under 11. Highly recommended 👌

Fairytale Town is a staple in our family. I’ve been going since I was a kid and it continues to be a loved location with my kiddo. He loves their new reading building and I love the improvements they have added.

Seriously, if you skip on this with your kid, you’re missing out! It is SO MUCH FUN!
I love this place. Perfect for my 2 & 4 year old granddaughters.

name: Funderland Amusement Park
address: 1350 17th Ave, Sacramento, CA 95822, USA

reviews.text:
Affordable fun, and a perfect place to tire out the kiddos for nap time. Lots of rides including a mini roller coaster, and a play structure as well. Parking was easy and it's located next to Fairytale Town and the Sacramento zoo, as well as a grassy park area.
Adults $18
Kids $25 (34 inches or taller)
Seniors $10
No tickets for rides, entry fee is all that's needed.

Funderland in Sacramento has been an iconic family destination since 1946. This small amusement park consists of 10 rides, such as merry-go-round, rollercoaster, spinning teacups, etc. The target audience is 3-10 year old children. One ride (Octopus) is only for children, and other rides (like airplanes or stagecoach) are too narrow for most adults.

Entry fee is currently $17 for each adult and $24 for children. The entry fee includes unlimited rides.

There are snack and sweet stands on site, but no full restaurant.

Overall, it's a fun day out for families with small children.

Funderland has really gone downhill. To begin, $86 for 2 adults and 2 kids is not worth it. These are small carnival rides and indoor playgrounds usually charge $12/kid (adults are free) and the kids have way more to do than this place. The "rideshare" program makes the experience even worse since you have to wait long times to ride rides due to the lack of staff. The staff are constantly on breaks, inefficient rotations of rides, lots of them just wander around and don't appear to even be working. With that said, they are VERY nice and great with the kids. Back to the cost...I expect more for the amount we paid. Are they putting money back into the business? Rides are falling apart, you can tell where they "rig" something up just to make it limp along. Hopefully nothing bad happens/falls apart and a kid gets hurt. Food/snacks are way overpriced for what you get. The nacho cheese was cold and literally turned solid on the chips within minutes.

Went for our Grandson's seventh birthday. It was a lot of fun. The wait for the rides was short. This is a park for younger children. My Grandson was too tall for one of the rides. I don't like that the only bathrooms are Honey Buckets. They were kind of gross.

Great place for a family with young children, My son really enjoyed a lot with small rides n train ride ,there is a small food stand too ladies are soo friendly , n all the rides are running n seemed to be in good condition  best part is parent can ride with kid. children's really enjoy this place. Very friendly environment with friendly staff😌.

name: Gilroy Gardens Family Theme Park
address: 3050 Hecker Pass Hwy, Gilroy, CA 95020, USA

reviews.text:
We went for my kids spring break on opening day. It's such a great smaller amusement park with plenty of fun rides for everyone. We love the nature aspects of the park, how beautiful it is to walk around and the art building for kids crafts.
We bought a membership last Halloween 2024 and so glad we invested in one. We're planning to visit a few more times this year.

Worth your money! Go early to get the parking and do the rides more faster. If you go late to see the decorations you will have to wait for long lines. Kids friendly rides. There is a playground where kids like to play a lot. First Aid centers are also available. Book your parking ticket online for 20 dollars elsewhere you will be charged 25 dollars if you buy it at the location. Show the bar code once you have paid online parking ticket. It was really awesome!

Gilroy garden has become one of our usual favorite places to visit. There is lots of games for the whole family. Some days are busier than others, but when it’s not busy the lines are usually around 10 to less minutes. I tend to go Fridays because my premium card allows me to take in a friend for free. I think the membership is definitely worth it as long as you plan 3 to 4 visits a year and we usually do more. Specifically during the holidays when the park changes themes for Halloween and Christmas.

Went to Gilroy Gardens Winter Fest, and it was amazing! The lights were beautiful, and the rides were so much fun. My kids loved meeting Santa, and the ice skating was a nice touch. It wasn’t too crowded, but food lines were a bit slow. Overall, a great holiday outing for families!
Awesome place to go. Super instagramable. But the lines to go to the attractions are too long, around 1-2hours to get on the train. And the same for the other ones.

name: Golfland Sunsplash
address: 155 W Hampton Ave, Mesa, AZ 85210, USA

reviews.text:
Last weekend, we had an absolute blast meeting up with friends and family for a night of mini golf! As soon as we approached the entrance, we were greeted by the sight of a massive castle adorned with vibrant neon lights. It set the perfect mood for an evening filled with fun and laughter. The air was electric with the sounds of arcade games all around us, including some of the beloved classics that sparked happy nostalgia for many in our group.

Despite the bustling atmosphere, we made our way to the back to grab our golf clubs. There was a sense of excitement in the air as we prepared for our adventure on the course. We opted for the full 18 holes since we had a large crew, and honestly, I can’t think of a better way to bond and challenge each other than some friendly competition.

As we stepped onto the course, I noticed it was in great shape! Some reviews had mentioned issues, but we found everything to be tidy and well-maintained, aside from a few stray leaves,  which was perfectly understandable given the season. Each hole presented unique obstacles and creative designs that kept us on our toes and added a fun twist to the game. From tricky slopes to whimsical decorations, every play was a new adventure and a chance for a laugh.

The excitement was palpable as we all took turns, cheering each other on and playfully teasing those who missed easy putts! At one point, we even had a spontaneous dance-off between holes. I’m pretty sure the other players must have thought we were a bit wild, but who could blame us? The energy was infectious!

Overall, it was an evening filled with joy, laughter, and maybe a few friendly rivalries. As the final scores were tallied, we were already making plans to come back for another round. If you’re looking for an entertaining night out with friends or family, this mini golf spot is a winner. We had such a fantastic time, and I can’t wait for our next adventure there!

We did the medium golf course and it was a good challenge but not too hard that you wanted to smash a clowns nose. It was roughly 16$ per person for one round and it took us about an hour or so. It's right off the interstate. A few holes a ball would get stuck and you could tell it was a problem so they really need to fix some of that. Birds are all over, and their poop. But very pretty trees! We didn't use the arcade or get food so can't comment on that. But the one course was fun and they had music going.

We have been coming here for our spring break for years and it's always fun and worth it with all the things a pass comes with.
But a special shout out to Ben who was working the bumper cars last weekend.
What a delightful person!  So friendly, helpful and looked like he truly enjoyed his job.
He made this last time truly memorable.

Overall, this is a great place.  Season passes are a must and well worth it. There is lots of stuff to do for the whole family! The managers are very helpful and great to work with. However, some of the other staff are not quite up to par, especially in the arcade area when ordering food. This is not an isolated incident, it has been on a number of occasions.

When is the last time you guys updated this place? The laser tag is from the 80s for sure. Everything is literally falling apart. And getting help from anyone takes a long time , and honestly the whole ring door bell thing is really ghetto. Your staff is amazing doing the best they can, there is not enough of them. I spent a lot of money, and me and my kids waited for every single attraction over 15 min , and we were the only ones in line. When we came in we asked about the arcade add on but she did not know how to do it. Then my kid lost his golf ball wanted a certain color, and couldn’t get it. So I could have spent more money but. I did not. And I won’t be coming back. It was cool when I was a kid, I am now 36 and you guys need to update it for this generation of kids , and get more staff. I wish I could have my money back!

name: Happy Hollow Park & Zoo
address: 748 Story Rd, San Jose, CA 95112, USA

reviews.text: This was the first time I've visited with my grandchildren.  I used to bring my kids here years ago. The entrance used to be in the front, but the new back entrance has ample parking. I love the new suspension bridge. The price is GREAT!!! To visit for the day it's only $18 a person and children under two enter free. My grandchildren had a great time at the petting zoom and seeing all the different animals. The rides are definitely for younger children. I visited on a Sunday, and it wasn't overly crowded. We didn't have to wait more than 5 min to access each ride. The new trian was still under construction, so we didn't get to do the whole tour. Definitely recommend this place for a cheap, fun experience with younger children!!!

Great family fun at Happy Hallow Zoo !

We visited Happy Hollow Zoo on a weekend, and the weather was just perfect—not too hot, making it an enjoyable day outdoors. Our kids had an amazing time exploring the zoo and enjoying the rides. The wait time for the rides was about 10 to 15 minutes, which was quite reasonable.

We were lucky to see all the animals, which made the visit even more exciting! Bringing our own food worked out well, as there were plenty of spots to sit and eat. Overall, it was a fantastic experience, and I highly recommend visiting with kids at least once. A must-visit for families!

This Park and Zoo is amazing. My 1 yr and 4 months old son loves it. It was his first time going to the zoo. He was super happy when he pet the goat. Even the goat was smiling and happy, lol.

The place was very clean, friendly staff and the restaurant food was good too. We ordered the chicken tenders combo that came with fries. The staff had excellent customer service. Very friendly.

I highly recommend this Park and Zoo if you want to bring your family.

A very well maintained small zoo but a lot to do with kids.Some of the major advantages of this place is free rides which is a wow for young ones. A lot of rides to keep them busy. Parking is additional 10$ but otherwise a must go for all parents with young ones.
We LOVE happy hollow! My kids request to go every single day. So many fun things to do each time you go.

name: Playland Fresno
address: 890 W Belmont Ave, Fresno, CA 93728, USA

reviews.text:
My 7 year old loved Playland! I would say this park is for kids 8 and younger. All of the staff was exceptional.  The rides were fun and some were very unique. I really appreciated their half price Wednesday deal.  The machines were not working but the staff handled it quickly and efficiently got us in.  We went after we did a visit to Storyland and the two parks really complement each other.

I am giving 4 stars instead of 5 because of the silly no outside food policy.  The park is geared for people with young children and everyone knows young children need lots of snacks! I assume Playland is hoping that people will buy their food but i actually think they are hurting themselves because families will leave the park in order to feed their children. The park offers a very limited menu of junk food and many family will not be able to find anything for their families to eat.

FYI: the train is $3 (3 tokens/tickets) for each passenger. The games are 5 tickets each.  Don’t buy the extra 10 tokens when you check in because I got stuck with 4 extra tokens on my wristband. Once inside, you can add a ticket at a time using one of the kiosks.

We are rooting for you Playland! Thanks for an awesome day!

Improvements have made the experience better for children and adults. A new variety of rides for children. Bright colors cheer things up. Decent bathrooms available. Three bounce houses for small children added, one with a slide. Adult size ferrous wheel, carousel, tea cup ride and giant slide that can be enjoyed as a family. Snack bar is pricey but has a pretty good menu. Regular entry price ( $20 children, $10 adults) covers unlimited rides and mini golf. Train ride and games are extra. Look for special pricing days online at Playland Fresno.

Loved it! I had the opportunity to be at Playland at the evening and nighttime when it was supposed to be their last day. I wish they'd do more night time events. So much fun to do the rides at night! This place has grown and offers more rides than whe I was a kid and when my children were kids. I hear they'll be offering more reasonable prices and making efforts to save it. Great memories here for generations of my family. Highly recommended Playland!

Great day at Fresno playland! We arrived at 10:30 a.m. the park has new hours. General admission tickets are $20 for children $10 for adults. General admission tickets allow you to ride most rides in the park and have access to the water play area. Children ages 3 to 8 would thoroughly enjoy this park! The park is not crowded we were there on a Saturday from 10 :30 until 12:30 and never had to wait for rides . In fact we rode many of the rides alone and multiple times ! The park is clean and the staff is welcoming. A shout out to Jeannie working in the canoe area on Saturday the 8th. She worked very hard to get my grandson the Blue Canoe! Food is not allowed in the park. They are semi-strict about this. Parking is a bear because of the zoo. But parking is free. At least it was for us the day we visited for some reason.

Me, my uncle, and our nieces and nephews (his great nieces and nephews) and my lil cousins had a blast! No long wait times for the rides, all the staff was friendly, and there was so many things for the kids to do. We even got on the rides too! It reminded of my childhood when my dad, uncle's, and grandmother would take us up here to have fun and ride the paddle boats and train and stuff! #goodFamilyFun

name: Pixieland Amusement Park
address: 2740 E Olivera Rd, Concord, CA 94519, USA

reviews.text: Great place to bring the kiddos to play! No entrance fee, you just buy tickets. Each ride is 2 to 4 tickets. Most rides allow adults, except for the airplane ride. There's food and drinks available to purchase. Their unique merry go round has a fun superhero theme. Fun for all ages but especially for toddlers.

Very nice for toddlers, and I say  toddlers because there aren't many options if you are looking for something for your older kids. The park caters more to toddlers ages 2-5 to be safe. The rides are really nice for them, as well as the train ride around the park. The staff is very welcoming and friendly and a clean overall place for families with little ones. They also have a big area for parties as well as a small one that's optional too with plenty of shade on hot summer days.

Be aware the prices are a bit high for the rides but you are allowed to use your tickets wherever you visit the park again, since there are no real expiration dates on them.

So I would recommend starting off with purchasing the smallest amount of tickets since any adult with their baby/toddler can ride free, you only have to pay one entry fee per ride and most rides are about 2-3 tickets per ride and there are only 6-7 rides there.

Parking is free, as well as entry.
Also if you don't want to eat the food there, just bring your own for your little ones, there are plenty of tables with shade for you to sit and eat at.

I was appalled at the ticket prices! Thirty tickets cost $65, and that was because I paid cash.
Some rides require 3 tickets. I had my 3 grandchildren visiting from out of state. We were there for 45 minutes, and I spent $107 on tickets. The roller coaster and the cars go around ONE TIME. The carousel is by far the best value. I was very disappointed that this place that used to be so affordable is no longer that way. Prices up, ride duration cut…will invest $55 for unlimited ride wristbands at Six Flags if they come visit again!

Great for kids 10 and younger. There are about 6 rides that small kids will enjoy. Really good for about 90 minutes max as there just isn't a lot to do. Staff are kind and helpful. Prices for ride tickets weren't bad but food, games were a bit more. The nice thing about the games is that you pay for the prize (i.e., $10 for a small blow-up microphone, plushies were quite a bit more) and your child plays until they win. Parking is free and you can bring lunch and sit in the surrounding park area. Pretty scenery.  Overall, it's a local gem and my kids had fun.

You can purchase tokens and pay per ride. Each ride costs 1-3 tokens/ride. Each token is about $2.5 depending on how many you bought. It gets a bit expensive and you quickly use up the tokens especially if you have little ones that you have to ride with.

My toddlers enjoyed it very much.

name: Storyland
address: 890 W Belmont Ave, Fresno, CA 93728, USA

reviews.text: It was a nice playground for kids under 10 years old. They only bad part was that there were duck poops everywhere, and it was gross. I had to make sure my 1 year old doesn't step on or touch it.

Storyland is truly a hidden gem in Fresno.  I remember going there as a child as well as taking my children and now my grandkids are having so much fun. We will keep coming back. We are looking forward to the future pirate ship

So much fun for kindergarteners & toddlers.
Cute little sculptures, play areas , stories & rhymes related stuff.
Tickets are pretty cheap - $4 per kid & $6 per adult. You can also get a key for additional $5 which can play stories at different story stations/setups.
We spent about 2 hrs in the morning,
Temperature was quite high (96 🥵) but there was a lot of shade around. Kids had super fun reading stories & singing rhymes.

Parking is shared with zoo, has digital pay.
Just feel like it can be better maintained as some of the areas are little dusty.

This place is great for kids around ages 3 to 9. Older kids aren't too impressed as it's small houses and stories being read aloud. On some days characters will walk around and kids can take pics with them. Little red riding hood and Jack and Jill came out while we were there.
The price range is fair, $4 for kids up to age 10 and $6 for 11 and older. I do think all kids should be $4, honestly the older kids don't care for it but cost more, same for adults. Either way the price isn't bad. A season pass is $50, that gets 2 kids in and 2 adults, unlimited for a year.
They could use some remodeling, but overall it's cute and small kids love it. Watch out on those slides though they are old school metal slides and they go fast. I love the shaded areas and the patches of flowers, we saw a lot of butterflies, hummingbirds and dragon flies when we were there.

A great experience for toddlers and preschoolers! Love all the outdoor play opportunities. My kids love being able to play with all of the extra “fun stuff” that’s brought out for events like large building blocks, trains, art projects.

name: Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk
address: 400 Beach St, Santa Cruz, CA 95060, USA

reviews.text: Visited here for the first time today with my family and it was fairly busy due to spring break. Parking is located conveniently across the street for $25. The place busy but there was no wait for any of the rides and they offer a large variety of rides for kids young and old. The shops are really cute and offer a large variety for every person visiting. They have spacious restrooms throughout the boardwalk that have several stalls and changing stations for babies in the men's and women's restrooms. The chocolate dipped ice cream cones were delicious. We will definitely be coming back as our kids get older to go on more rides and eat delicious food!

The Santa Cruz Boardwalk on a weekend feels like a mini Disneyland by the ocean! The blend of classic amusement park vibes with stunning ocean views is unbeatable. You’ve got thrilling rides like the Giant Dipper roller coaster that keep your heart racing while you take in the beautiful coastline. The ocean-view thrillers are a real standout, giving you an adrenaline rush with a backdrop of the sparkling sea. From fun carnival games to delicious boardwalk treats, it’s a non-stop adventure for all ages. The atmosphere is lively, with a unique mix of nostalgia and excitement that makes it feel like a hidden gem. Whether you’re chasing thrills or just enjoying the view, this spot is perfect for a weekend escape!

I 100% recommend stopping by the Santa Cruz boardwalk. My children love coming here every summer. We usually stop by for our spring break early April and the crowds are easy. Minimal lines, plenty of shops and food options open, beautiful weather, I mean what more could you ask for?
I appreciate that they have plenty of rides for the younger crew 5 and under.

Admission prices for a wristband were $10 cheaper / per person when you purchased tickets online. You have to order them at least a day before. So I'd definitely recommend going that route.

Well maintained, family friendly and safe- a great place for fun.
A landmark for almost a century this venue offers fun for the whole family. It is operated very well, including maintenance, security, staff training, variety of rides and activities and food offerings. It offers discount evenings, passes and group purchase options which can help reduce the cost of a visit. While not cheap, it offers so much more than a visiting carnival. The location is beautiful and on an iconic beach. I am very impressed by the training that seems to go into staffing, the uniforms and visible security. I highly recommend visiting this coastal gem.

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

Absolutely love this place! The perfect mix of sun, beach, and amusement park fun. The energy here is amazing—music playing, people laughing, and the scent of the ocean in the air. Walking along the pier, watching the birds, and feeling the ocean breeze is pure happiness. A fantastic spot for all ages, full of life and joy!

name: Scandia Family Fun Center
address: 5301 Redwood Dr, Rohnert Park, CA 94928, USA

reviews.text: I love this place. My friends and I enjoy coming here to be kids again. We went on a Wednesday when school was in and there was no one. Mini golf is always fun and arcade also

I’ve been coming here since I was little and I’m so happy this place is still here to bring my kids to! We’ve noticed they’ve gotten a new ride outside too and a bunch of new games! Definitely one of our favorites to make a whole day out of.

This is the most expensive kid entertainment in the area. $60 for a few friends to play mini golf for an hour is insane. Also I believe the go carts are rigged. They don’t all go the same speed, and they’re electronically controlled to slow you down if they see you’re wining.

Fun. Arcade was a blast. Golf course was great except for the unplayable parts. Golf course had some construction on it, would have been nice to know before hand as a large section was unplayable and hard to move babys stroller through. Lots of great arcade games but some are worn out. Light gun games that don't fire or are missing pieces, axe throwing game that never records a hit right, stuff like that. But still super fun to take your kids. My baby was in a stroller for most of it but still had a great time, fell asleep and let Mom and I have fun. I would return.

The go carts where super fun and the tower that drops you was also pretty cool some fun games. Ordered chicken strips and twice they had to remake them because they were still cold and uncooked on the inside So we finally said forget it and gave up on the snack but games and activities were cool to do.

name: Six Flags Discovery Kingdom
address: 1001 Fairgrounds Dr, Vallejo, CA 94589, USA

reviews.text: Had an good time! Took my girlfriend on a date here. We fed giraffes, watched big cats play, and enjoyed the butterfly exhibit. The lines for the rides were still over an hour. Just like I remember as a kid. I bought the Flash Pass premium package so we could just go straight in the flash pass line.. still a 30 min wait for some of the bigger rides.. but over all I enjoyed the day and prices were not outrageous.

I have pretty mixed thoughts about Discovery Kingdom. I think the back of the park where all the animal exhibits are is very nice with lots of trees and a beautiful view of the lake. The exhibits themselves are good! Nothing mind blowing but it is nice to see. Then you get to the front of the park, where all the major coasters are and it is just ugly, especially the DC universe area. The ugliness is accentuated by the blacktop pathways which do go all over the park, but it is most noticeable here. It has zero landscaping with little theming. The operations at this park are very bad too. They run 1 train on everything, and it takes 5 minutes to dispatch a train! Do something about it six flags! If you are going on a busy day, I very highly recommend flash pass. There is no way you will be able to ride everything in one busy day here. The park's coaster collection is pretty good though! My favorite coaster by far is Joker. Also Medusa, Superman, and Batman are good supporting coasters, just avoid Kong. I like this park for the coasters and the zoo in the back. I do recommend a visit here, it can be a verry fun park! Just go into it knowing these things.

The biggest and main roller coasters were closed, huge disappointment. Loading took forever, half of their animals were gone, and mostly all staff except for one guy, were not helpful, or didn't know common questions (not confusing or detailed ones)
However, the thrill of the park rides were quite fun, and the kid section was up and running and very large. Would recommend for kids, not teens.
Also, the very few animal attractions were the most fun we had at the park.

Fun, quick spring break trip. Went with a group, meal deal is a must but use the app to order the lines for food are as longer than some of the rides. Need to do some work on reducing transaction times, especially with 90% of the menu being items that should be in constant rotation. But, overall a great time. Rides are a true thrill, even under estimated the Joker, which ended up being my favorite ride(get the front seat).

We had an incredible experience at Six Flags Discovery Kingdom on New Year’s Eve! The park exceeded all expectations in every way. The kids (ages 2.5, 6 and 10) were able to enjoy all the rides they wanted—some even twice—thanks to the short lines. They loved the food (ate it all), and the holiday lights created a magical atmosphere. The $20.00 meal deal is awesome and the four for $20 special was sooooo worth it!!!!

What stood out the most was the exceptional customer service. Every staff member we interacted with was friendly, helpful, and made the day feel truly special. Seriously! Everyone was so nice, and that is not common these days. Additionally, the value for the price was unbeatable.

Closing out the evening as the last to leave the park was the perfect way to end a memorable day (and year for that matter). Highly recommend Six Flags Discovery Kingdom for a festive and enjoyable holiday outing! A+++

name: Sonoma TrainTown Railroad
address: 20264 Broadway, Sonoma, CA 95476, USA

reviews.text: I went with a group - 6 adults and 4 kids. The age range was 6.5-2 YO. All the kids enjoyed it, parents had to ride on rides with kids so that increased the ticket prices. What I like is its pay as you go instead of an admission fee. The 20 min, separate mini train rides was def worth it. Bring quarters for the alpacas, goats and bunnies at the end

This place has a cute little scale railroad that stops at their petting zoo. Great for the kids! The older kids will like the mini roller coaster and the other carnival rides and the Ferris wheel is good for a birds eye view of the venue. Gets a little busy during summer break so arrive early.

Absolutely love the place. Kept seeing on Instagram so finally decided to go there and it is a pretty cool place for kids. Even though they only have five rides besides the train but for little kids it's a magical place. We as adults definitely enjoyed the train ride which was probably the best part of the whole place. Love that they have little towns and houses and lakes made so you can get an idea of how it feels to be on a real train. Also you have to go there and buy tickets. you cannot buy them online. Train tickets are separate from the ride tickets and they want coupon tickets which you have to purchase from the counter
Such a fun affordable option.  Have been there many times over the last 30 years. Kids always have a great time
This place is so much fun! It is very good for kids about 7 and under. It can get crowded and the wait times can be long, but it is well worth it. Prices were fair for the area.

name: Adventure City
address: 1238 S Beach Blvd, Anaheim, CA 92804, USA

reviews.text: Took my 2 boys here for their first time on 1/3/25, ages 5 & 3. They were in the sweet spot and this park is great for ages 2-8 or so depending on their thrill level. I came here as a kid 20+ years ago and was thoroughly impressed by how well the park is maintained, clean, and operated. Bathrooms were great for families and the food was better than expected (see photo of the menu and prices). It was not that crowded despite it being Winter Break still so we rode everything multiple times and felt happy to leave after 3.5 hours and lunch inside the park. Overall it was a great visit!

This establishment is well-received by both children and adults. Our visit on a Friday resulted in shorter wait times for rides compared to weekends. Dance performances are scheduled throughout the day, with showtimes at 12:00 PM, 1:30 PM, 3:00 PM, and 4:30 PM. The park offers various attractions, including an arcade, petting zoo, thrilling roller coasters, and a drop zone. It is a relatively small park that can be experienced within approximately three hours, depending on queue lengths. It is worth noting that some rides were closed for maintenance during our visit, which was disappointing. Parking is complimentary, which is an advantage over other nearby theme parks. The admission fee has increased from a reasonable price to $29.95 per person. It is hoped that future price increases will be avoided to maintain the value proposition of the park.

My kids LOVED this place. My friend and I brought 3 kids (13, 11, and 3 years old) and all five of us has such a great time. My two older kids loved this place and the big orange roller coaster in the back. They loved that there was no line which was great. The three year old had such a blast on the train and carousel. And there was a Starbucks! Overall 5 stars because it was such a great value for the cost. Highly recommend.

The best little amusement park for the little ones.  Can do everything in about 3 hours.  Take your time and relax.  Very clean.  There's only one diaper changing station in the whole park so there can be a line if there are several babies needing to be changed at once.  Some of the rides can be a little too extreme for those below the age of 2.  The food was good and the prices are average of what amusement parks typically charge.  Our family had a great time.  We live kind of far so we may go back next year.

Took my daughter for her 3rd bday and we had a blast!! Parking is free and prices are so affordable to have fun. Love the size of the park and all the rides were so fun, although she didn’t/couldn’t go on the “bigger” roller coasters but i love that they’re there for older kids too. Had a great great experience. Friendly staff, SUPER clean park, the food was affordable and HOT when we got it. We had an amazing time, I will 100% bring her back and already telling my friends with kids about our amazing time.

Edit: just to also shout out again to the park, I was so impressed by the cleanliness and landscaping. I saw staff cleaning during their shifts and really we had such a wonderful time! Really overall for the whole experience is a 10/10 for me.

name: Belmont Park
address: 3146 Mission Blvd, San Diego, CA 92109, USA

reviews.text: We had absolute fun at this place. Went without a plan. Got parking which is free. Parking is little compact and difficult but it’s right next to the park and free. The ticket line wasn’t so big. But we could also buy it online and it takes 10 mins to activate online purchase. $65 for day long pass with unlimited rides excluding the golf, jungle gem n escaplogy. But it’s worth taking it. The park is nice comprising of various fun rides as well as rock climbing, laser tag etching for kids to enjoy. Can spend a good half to full day here. Little kids also have 5/6fun rides. Food is also available for purchase.

This was a family friendly amusement park for!  Right next to the Plunge. Parking free pass the park. Shopping, beach walk, ice cream, food.
Something for everyone!
Bubbles were being released on the beach by Julie. Made it even more enchanted for all ages.
Buy tickets for the rides individually $5 and up.
So much to do at this park!
The wooden roller coaster is the oldest in the world. Fun fact.

Belmont Park reminds me of the places I loved going to as a kid—a classic seaside amusement park with just the right mix of rides, games, and fun food. Sitting right on Mission Beach, it has that old-school boardwalk charm, making it the perfect spot for a few hours of laid-back entertainment.

It’s not a huge park, but that’s part of its charm. There are just enough attractions to keep families entertained without feeling overwhelming or overpriced. Whether you’re riding the iconic Giant Dipper Roller Coaster, playing arcade games, or grabbing a bite at one of the food stands, there’s something fun for everyone. It’s the kind of place where you can spend a couple of hours having a blast without breaking the bank.

For a little bit of nostalgia, ocean breezes, and classic amusement park vibes, Belmont Park is a must-visit in San Diego!

Really nice place to take your kids too. The beach is right there and there's a few shops as well as food places. Across has another playground for the kids with parking, I have 2 toddlers under 5 yrs old and they absolutely loved the beach and no matter how cold the water was they wanted to stay lol. We than took them to the playground across the street because they couldn't ride some of the rides and they just wanted to climb things. We went 2 days in a row which made our vacation worth coming!!

This park is awesome! It’s completely free to enter, and you only pay for the rides and games. I love running through the park during my weekly runs and feeling the fun vibes. It’s also a great place to get funnel cakes and other fair foods anytime of the year. 💗 Parking is also free!

name: Boomers Boca Raton
address: 3100 Airport Rd, Boca Raton, FL 33431, USA

reviews.text:
We celebrated the birthday of our daughter there last weekend. Well.. I’m not satisfied with the room, that we paid for… no decorations, not enough light. The host wasn’t helpful enough, me and my daughter were preparing everything, decorating and cleaning the table and the room!
Yes, there is fun to spend time, but it doesn’t worst that amount of money to celebrate a birthday party.
We won’t be back…

We had an amazing time at Boomers during spring break! The spring break deal was worth it. My son had a blast, and we loved that the facility was clean, the attractions and arcade games were modern and well-maintained, and the staff was friendly and helpful.

The only downside was the food prices—$15 for a personal pizza and $40 for a family pizza felt excessive. That being said, everything else exceeded our expectations, and we’ll definitely be back. Highly recommend Boomers for a fun-filled family outing

Fun for the whole family! This is the perfect place to spend an amazing day. There’s something for everyone: from super exciting go-karts to arcade games and mini golf. It’s ideal for both kids and adults—we had so much fun! Definitely a place we’ll be returning to.

We are visiting the area from Michigan, and we had a blast at Boomers.  We had 14 people and everything that we did was just the greatest.  The staff was so friendly and accommodating.  The whole place was clean.  The rides were great!  And the miniature golf was so fun.  I would recommend this place to anyone visiting the area!  And to those of you who live here, you are so lucky to have a place like this!

I wanted to take my daughter here for her 9th birthday. I wanted to buy tickets in advance, but was unable to complete the transaction. When we arrived at Boomers I told the manager that I tried to buy tickets online but was not able to. The manager accommodated me by honoring the online price. I was very pleased. My family had a great time. We bought the elite tickets and did all of the activities and played the arcade games. All of the staff we encountered were so friendly and helpful. The place was clean, the bathrooms were clean. Overall we had a great experience. My daughter really enjoyed her birthday there. Thanks Boomers for helping to make my daughter’s birthday a memorable one 😊

name: Castle Park
address: 3500 Polk St, Riverside, CA 92505, USA

reviews.text: I visited on a Saturday, which to my surprise was not crowded. I went for the miniature golf. Course number one was very crowded so we went to course two which had no wait. There were 3 out of the 18 holes closed, but overall, it was fun and easy to navigate and is perfect for date night or family fun. If you plan to visit, I definitely recommend buying the tickets online and also, there is a $15 parking fee.

We have spent three hours at this park. Enjoyed the mini golf a lot! (Not using the rest area)
Pretty interesting - variety of fields. Starting from the middle it was not always obvious what is the next field. I’d recommend them to make many signs on that.
The park is pretty old, but the lack of crowds and the overall atmosphere make this mini golf get to the list of returning places , we’ll come back for sure!

Castle Dark was worth everything! The rides were fun. I ordered pizza with no sauce I got a little trouble at first but then I explained to them that I'm type 2 diabetic and I saw an allergen sign posted right on their window next to me. The female cook looked a little upset about it but she ended up making my pizza with no sauce thank you so much. The park was clean. The customer service could have been better on the merry-go-round. All of the Park monsters who were very entertaining and scary that was the best part about the park. The doctor smiley was the best character! All of the attractions such as the mazes and stuff like that were amazing. The food was great the dancing party after was fun. There was rides for all ages. I highly recommend you purchase your tickets and your parking online. There is a lot of security and police officers so your teenagers will be safe. I highly recommend for families of all ages.

Castle Dark is the official event I attended. It was fun, a lot of good energy from the scare talent. Went there for "Inland Empire Goth"  park take over event.

The park itself is both big and small at the same time in a good way. Staff was polite/helpful, security through and curtious, grounds were clean and bathrooms well stocked.

I haven't been here in years, and when I tell you, my family had a blast, we had a blast LOL . I love how there is so much to do. From the rides, to the food, to the water park area, to the arcade and miniature golf. It is best to see what great deals they have online compared to purchasing things at the actual park. You definitely get your money worth here. The entire vibe was amazing. We will be going back soon.....

name: Disneyland Park
address: Anaheim, CA 92802, USA

reviews.text:
Disneyland is amazing! Truly, a magical place for the whole family. Whether it's your first time visiting or you're a regular, Disneyland will make you feel like a kid again.

Entering the park and walking down Main Street, seeing the castle for the first time is the best! Once you're inside the park, there is SO much to do. Rides, events, shows, shopping, delicious food, and so much more!

There is no doubt the memories you will make and share coming to Disneyland!

Happiest Place on Earth is not what workers would call this place. The rides are great but waiting an hour in line for one ride is stupid. One Flash Pass per day is a joke. Disney has changed how waiting line could be so many times. Stop cramming so many people in at a time and it make this place where people would get their money’s worth. .
