Based on the hundreds of dollars spent just to get in, you’d expect a better from Disney. California Adventure saves Disney on how many people want to go there. My advise, save your money and go to another park. Just until Disney can figure out a better use of their revenue. Enjoy the pics.

A memorable and magical day from start to finish! We got to the park bright and early so parking was easy and far less crowds. I recommend getting a Lightning Pass for each person- saved us a ton of time waiting in lines and all our professional photos from the park were free! We stayed till 9:30 to watch the fireworks show over the castle which was of course magical! Some highlights were definitely touring the castle, Pirates of the Caribbean, Haunted Mansion and Fantasyland. Whether you are a princess, space ranger or everything in between, there is something for you to love at Disneyland!

Woohoo! We had such an amazing time here! From the moment we arrived, everything was absolutely perfect. The place is beautiful, well-maintained, and incredibly clean, making it ideal for a family vacation. The atmosphere is warm and welcoming, and it truly feels like a magical escape.

Yes, it is on the pricier side, but it’s worth every penny. The staff goes above and beyond to ensure that every detail is taken care of, making the experience smooth and stress-free. They are friendly, attentive, and genuinely dedicated to making your stay special.

The food is nothing short of extraordinary! No matter what you order, every dish is prepared with great care and tastes absolutely delicious. Whether you’re enjoying a quick bite or a full-course meal, the flavors and presentation are top-notch.

The entertainment is another highlight. Everything is seamlessly organized, with professional artists delivering captivating performances that the whole family can enjoy. There’s always something exciting happening, and it never feels rushed or overcrowded.

If you’re looking for a place that blends history, authenticity, and the true Disney magic, this is the perfect destination. Whether you’re a first-time visitor or a returning guest, the experience is unforgettable. We can’t wait to come back!

We love Disneyland... it is always a fun time!   We love all the stores on Main Street... from the clothes to the toys there is just so much to see.  A definite stop and our first stop is at Starwars Land for the coffee, it’s a must have.  Best place to have dinner is at Plaza Inn, food is delicious and it’s not bad pricing for the food you get to enjoy and I love the feel of being there, for a moment you are back in those days!  Every land has it’s own thing to offer!  I cannot say which one is my best as they are all wonderful to visit!  Churros are also a must from Disneyland.

name: Disney California Adventure Park
address: Anaheim, CA 92802, USA

reviews.text: We had such an amazing day at Disneyland Adventure Park! From start to finish, everything was incredible. The food alone was unforgettable — the clam chowder absolutely stole my heart. The attractions were fun and exciting — I nearly lost my soul on the roller coaster, but it was totally worth it! We’re definitely coming back again.

Wonderful place for family! Staffs there are very friendly and helpful. Some notes for playing there:
1. Download app Disneyland
2. Reserve your ticket on app
3. Make your own plan with lightning lane ticket
4. Mobile order for your food to save lots of time

California Adventure Park was a tad bit less crowded than Disneyland, but still very crowded. They have mobile ordering and there is a little more space for people to eat vice Disneyland. I have been to Disneyland and I do think California adventure is the true Disneyland and brings the spirit of the park. I was always told that they don't have rides for young kids but they have rides for adults, teenagers and young kids.

This place is awesome! I definitely like it more than Disneyland. The rides are amazing (especially the roller coaster and the Toys rides), restaurants are delicious and not to over priced, dessert at Ghirdeli Chocolate is so sweet! yummy!!! The World of Color Show to end the night is perfect. Don't get me wrong, Disneyland has its great things but California Adventures takes the cake!

Disney California Adventure Park is a nice place to visit, but I’d recommend managing your expectations. A few rides were enjoyable, but overall, I felt the experience didn’t justify getting a Lightning Lane pass—it’s not worth the extra money. If you start early, you can cover most of the rides without it. Honestly, the Disneyland theme park is better in comparison, so missing a few rides here isn’t a big deal. I visited during Christmas time, and while the festive atmosphere was lovely, the park was overcrowded, which affected the experience.

name: Golf N' Stuff
address: 10555 Firestone Blvd, Norwalk, CA 90650, USA

reviews.text:
I have always just passed by this place, but I had a chance to go in with my family this time around. This place is a pretty big family fun center. They have a ride outside where the restrooms are, they got bumper boats, Mini Golf.. You are going to have to come back to try everything. I mainly stayed in the arcade, and I have to say I am quite impressed by their selection of games as well as how affordable the prices are. The minimum for a game is 50 cents, but most games are $1 to $1.50. They have different choices to reload a card, and I’m happy to say that it doesn’t cost you anything for a new card. I think the best deal they have it the $35 package, which gives you $50 worth. Easily able to be there over 2 hours, and was able to obtain over 700 tickets.

I would seriously come here more often if I lived closer. If we are in the area again sometime, will definitely stop by, and try out their other fun activities. Until next time!

Went on a Saturday evening. There were 6 of us. 5 adults one preteen.
Super packed, we had to wait for the family ahead of us to finish before we went up next, much like always... But it seemed rushed to wait on and be waited on. Had a wristband for 2 hours rides, but it was too cold and I only saw like 3 rides, didn't stick around for it. Arcade was extremely packed, got a panic attack just walking by. Took no part in it. Parking was $5, and you could use it as credit for a payment towards the golf, arcade, or rides. Parking was full when I arrived.

I want to thank the manager today for the generosity shown to us today.  We came there to celebrate my husband's 78th birthday with my 2 young grandsons.  But their card reader was down and only excepting cash as payment.  All I had was a gift card and my credit card.  She accepted my gift card as full payment. Which only paid for 1/2 .  Thank you for helping us celebrate!

It’s not all that for the price. For 5 adults we paid $125 for 2 hours on the outside activities, really expensive considering half of that time we waited in long lines and only did 1 activity which is a total of 2(the go karts, the boats) We did get to go on the disco ride 4 times. The employees are somewhat nice, could be nicer if they said please, thank you and you’re welcome when talking / ordering people around. Also the snack bar lady Daisy was pretty rude, she doesn’t know how to say you’re welcome after two people clearly and loudly said thank you TWICE. She has no smile when serving customers but when her male coworkers came in to order lunch after us she’s all smiles and nice lol which made us feel she had a problem with us. However, the older lady working at the snack bar is the best, she’s so nice and well mannered, great customer service on her part. She’s 5 stars. Overall it was fine, fun ride, fun activities that are short lived. Not worth it for the money tho, go somewhere else or save for something worth it if there’s long lines here.

Really fun time, we came right when it was opening and I highly recommend that time if you’re looking to get in and start riding the rides. Food was good too, we’re coming back with friends for sure :)

name: Golfland Sunsplash
address: 155 W Hampton Ave, Mesa, AZ 85210, USA

reviews.text:
Last weekend, we had an absolute blast meeting up with friends and family for a night of mini golf! As soon as we approached the entrance, we were greeted by the sight of a massive castle adorned with vibrant neon lights. It set the perfect mood for an evening filled with fun and laughter. The air was electric with the sounds of arcade games all around us, including some of the beloved classics that sparked happy nostalgia for many in our group.

Despite the bustling atmosphere, we made our way to the back to grab our golf clubs. There was a sense of excitement in the air as we prepared for our adventure on the course. We opted for the full 18 holes since we had a large crew, and honestly, I can’t think of a better way to bond and challenge each other than some friendly competition.

As we stepped onto the course, I noticed it was in great shape! Some reviews had mentioned issues, but we found everything to be tidy and well-maintained, aside from a few stray leaves,  which was perfectly understandable given the season. Each hole presented unique obstacles and creative designs that kept us on our toes and added a fun twist to the game. From tricky slopes to whimsical decorations, every play was a new adventure and a chance for a laugh.

The excitement was palpable as we all took turns, cheering each other on and playfully teasing those who missed easy putts! At one point, we even had a spontaneous dance-off between holes. I’m pretty sure the other players must have thought we were a bit wild, but who could blame us? The energy was infectious!

Overall, it was an evening filled with joy, laughter, and maybe a few friendly rivalries. As the final scores were tallied, we were already making plans to come back for another round. If you’re looking for an entertaining night out with friends or family, this mini golf spot is a winner. We had such a fantastic time, and I can’t wait for our next adventure there!

We did the medium golf course and it was a good challenge but not too hard that you wanted to smash a clowns nose. It was roughly 16$ per person for one round and it took us about an hour or so. It's right off the interstate. A few holes a ball would get stuck and you could tell it was a problem so they really need to fix some of that. Birds are all over, and their poop. But very pretty trees! We didn't use the arcade or get food so can't comment on that. But the one course was fun and they had music going.

We have been coming here for our spring break for years and it's always fun and worth it with all the things a pass comes with.
But a special shout out to Ben who was working the bumper cars last weekend.
What a delightful person!  So friendly, helpful and looked like he truly enjoyed his job.
He made this last time truly memorable.

Overall, this is a great place.  Season passes are a must and well worth it. There is lots of stuff to do for the whole family! The managers are very helpful and great to work with. However, some of the other staff are not quite up to par, especially in the arcade area when ordering food. This is not an isolated incident, it has been on a number of occasions.

When is the last time you guys updated this place? The laser tag is from the 80s for sure. Everything is literally falling apart. And getting help from anyone takes a long time , and honestly the whole ring door bell thing is really ghetto. Your staff is amazing doing the best they can, there is not enough of them. I spent a lot of money, and me and my kids waited for every single attraction over 15 min , and we were the only ones in line. When we came in we asked about the arcade add on but she did not know how to do it. Then my kid lost his golf ball wanted a certain color, and couldn’t get it. So I could have spent more money but. I did not. And I won’t be coming back. It was cool when I was a kid, I am now 36 and you guys need to update it for this generation of kids , and get more staff. I wish I could have my money back!

name: Knott's Berry Farm
address: 8039 Beach Blvd, Buena Park, CA 90620, USA

reviews.text: Best place for family fun!!! We love the rides, the market, the food, the boysenberry everything, and the unique worlds within worlds around every corner. Our kids get to have hands on experience along epic roller coasters. We love the Peanuts themes and can’t wait for the next adventure!! Plan ahead, get there earlier than you want too, and definitely get the food pass!!!

My wife and I come here everytime we visit my family from Seattle! We are season pass holders and we always get fast passes and all day dining. We love this park and all the rides. Never had an issues using fast lane but I do see regular lines always having 30+ minute wait during the afternoon/evening. Highly recommend coming early and knocking out the big rides or even getting fast pass. All day dining is a great plan if you like to eat lol. We share on dining pass as she likes most of the sides and I eat the entree and we time every hour and a half to eat again to get out money's worth. Great place for people starting their Rollercoaster journey as they have family friendly rides to thrill rides!

Absolutely loved this theme park. The theming was amazing and the ride choice is exceptional. Didn't plan on visiting for my week in LA but so glad I did. The top rides were Ghost Rider and Silver Bullet but the western themed area (Ghost Town) is worth the price of admission alone. The staff are so friendly and most clearly enjoy working at the park.

My family
Loved this place! We had a great time! Stopped in to eat the family style fried chicken dinner. Then off to the park!
The park was clean. I loved the Peanuts and Snoopy.
There was adequate seating and being able to bring n your own snacks (not drinks) was not only a money saver but a trouble saver too because kids can be picky.
The rides were great for all ages.
The staff was young but professional and kind.
Parking was easy.
Really enjoyed this place and will be back - so impressed- we bought season passes!

We enjoyed ourselves so much. Family of 6 was able to enjoy a day with 2 food passes, 2 drinks, parking and photos all for $450.00. This was truly a day to remember. Sophia is the photo area was a life saver. She stayed after to help upload all our photos since we paid the digital download for 29.99. She made our experience even better

name: LEGOLAND California
address: One Legoland Dr, Carlsbad, CA 92008, USA

reviews.text:
Legoland itself is awesome. Don't know if I'd take my kid here if she was over 10. Definitely geared towards younger kids. Make sure you ask the staff for Badges!! That was a fun part of going around, seeing if we could collect all the badges.
Sea Life is awesome!!! I could spend all day in there.
I also wish they had a better package for their "Reserve and Ride". $35 for 4 rides a person... Just give us a day pass...
The food prices are ridiculous 😭😭 Started ordering, and they wanted $50 for 2 chicken tender & fries meals.. not including the $6 drinks.. we didn't even finish adding all the meals and walked away. Invest in the refillable drink cups.... worth your money. Cherro's con chocolate was bomb and worth it as well!

My family had such a great time at Legoland California. This is definitely geared towards kids approximately 12 and under. Our son is eight and he had a great time. The park itself was clean, and the customer service was excellent especially in the overcrowded BBQ dining area. It didn't take longer than about 30 minutes to get on each ride w/o the ride and reserve pass. We were hoping that the driving school reopened but we were informed that it would be back this summer. The driver/pilot license is such a cute idea, our son was really excited to be a Legoland certified pilot. We unfortunately ended up losing our son's sweatshirt we purchased that day as we were leaving the park, and that was a bummer once we arrived home. Nevertheless, we contacted the park and are hoping that they either find or replace it. Overall, a great experience, the miniland, and the underwater explorer were some of our biggest highlights. We can't wait to return again.

My children ages 5 and 3 had an absolute blast at Lego land. We ended up buy annual memberships and plan to come back for Easter and summer break. The value is easily there. There was some construction going on but it doesn’t affect the fun.
Only goes to show you they are continuously adding new experiences. Highly recommended to any family of any age group.

Legoland Visit Review

We visited Legoland last Sunday as a family with a discounted Sealife Hopper ticket. Arriving early at 10:15 AM, we had a great time exploring the park, which is perfect for kids aged 4 to 12. The rides were fun, and the app was useful for tracking wait times. With around 15 rides, one day is enough if planned well, but two days are better for experiencing everything. We managed about half the rides in a day.

Bringing your own snacks and drinks is allowed, and purchasing a parking ticket in advance saves time. Some rides can get you wet, so extra clothes are recommended. Restrooms were clean, and overall, it was a well-organized and enjoyable experience.

The only reason I would give it 4/5.stars, is the location. It's a perfect place for kids about 4-12. As adults we enjoyed it. Our 3 kids enjoyed it. It's relatively clean. About 100x better than bugs Bunny land, or available options at Disneyland.

name: Mountasia Family Fun Center
address: 21516 Golden Triangle Rd, Santa Clarita, CA 91350, USA

reviews.text: I highly recommend going here it's the best fun center and the best fun center near me the go carts are the best also the Arcade but mostly everything is the best it's a fun place where me and my friends go to

This place was top choice for the children. They host birthday parties, and do a shout out to the birthday child, and sing happy birthday. Management even came over to see how we were enjoying our experience. Thumbs up. Not to mention the many venues they offer. Great place.
Lots of fun for hour 5 and 4-year-old, did mini golf, bowling, and arcade. It was busy on a Saturday afternoon, with lots of parties going on, but still had no wait for anything!

Always have fun coming here. The courses are never too full. The waterfalls and running streams give this place a nice peaceful ambiance. The arcade is very divers from newer style games to classic arcade game ls. They have a good go kart track. They also have batting cages and bumper boats. We al wa ays have a good time when we come here!

Good place to take a family. Prices are moderate. It's an old Valencia establishment, but they have done a decent job maintaining the place. Golf, go carts, bumper water boats, an arcade laser tag, laser alarm arena, pizza, ice cream, and batting cages.

name: Mulligan Family Fun Center- Murrieta
address: 24950 Madison Ave, Murrieta, CA 92562, USA

reviews.text: My family and I really enjoyed playing mini golf. It was a lot of fun. It’s $15 per adult and $10 for child under 12. It was kinda pricy but it’s worth it. It took us probably 2 hours. And it’s 18 holes. There were 4 of us.

Took the kids and bought the $75 package which added an additional $25 to our family fun card. I didn’t understand the set up but the staff member helped us explaining everything. We started with the starter go karts which the kids loved because they could drive themselves, followed up by racing doubles on the adult karts, a little laser tag and then arcade games 🕹️ too. We left with money still on the card to use for next time- which I thought was excellent- for a family of 4. We had a great time and the staff was kind- only one person seemed to have some negative energy going but I saw his team members intervene quickly. We had a great time and will be sure to visit the mini golf ⛳️ next time.

If I could give a negative I would. My son had a banquet there I have 2 sons the banquet was for my 12 year old (old enough to rome a little more freely then my other) I stuck to my 4 year old. He LOVED the junior go carts so we literally back to back for a good hour no line no older kids bullying the little ones. Took a good break came back more kids all ranges of ages (some should not have been able to get on at all period just saying) so there's a line of about 20 kids my son is probably around the 10th, mind you he's going alone no friends not in a group nothing. The associate that was working the carts is a dwarf one of the kids at the front of the line(in a bigger group of kids no chaperone all ages)called him a midget. I didn't hear it I can't tell you the context situation nothing. All I know is my son didn't say it and he's been in line for about 20 minutes because kids keep pushing him back cutting in line. The associate gets mad yells at the kids all of them and some random guest a nobody gets in front on the entire group and addresses ALL parents and kids calling us all disgusting we are a disgrace we shouldn't be parents so on and so on. I look at him and said don't address my son and don't speak on me and mine without knowing who the hell I am. He insisted on being a "hero" yelling at a bunch of kids and women. Okay so myself and another mother left the kids with siblings and confronted the man about how he is wrong. He owes us an apology and he needs to learn to handle situations better if he's going to try and save the day you figure out who said it you fine the parent and you address it period. So it escalated got ghetto because the husbands and bfs coaches weren't going to let this man talk anyway to our kids and women and think he's off Scott free. He was singing a whole different tune now. Then I went back to my youngest STILL IN LINE! the associate is skipping and taking whoever is basically being pushy and handing him the card first. Mind you my son's a shy 4 year old alone he's just excited to "drive" so of course he's getting skipped I can't even trust him to not lose his card so the adult has it. That's crazy my son's now been in line about 35 40 minutes a manager comes out of the carts are after speaking with the associate about what happened and I politely said excuse my son's been in line for over 30 minutes because he's not going in order of the line that's ridiculous and unfair my son didn't do anything to deserve that type of behavior her response was I trust his judgement and what is doing and I'll have his back. Oh great management skills, so trust that everything that went down was justified and trust me your lucky. Is there any type of management skills customer service skill anyone that has some type of common sense to de-escalate the situation so you can make everyone happy. Clearly I'll never come back I'll never suggest it and honestly I don't for see this place ever becoming a must see attraction. Horrible stay away from this place.

Took our youth group here for a fun evening.  The go carts are a blast, as is the mini golf. The course doesn't look that long, but it is. Everyone had a great time! The staff were helpful and friendly too. Definitely worth an afternoon or evening to relax and have some fun with the kids.

First time here. It's a great place for fun. However be very careful on the bridge handrail. They're super sharp on edges. It's so easy to get wood splinters. It could ruin your fun in an instant. Management should look into this immediately. It's a safety thing.

name: Pacific Park on the Santa Monica Pier
address: 380 Santa Monica Pier, Santa Monica, CA 90401, USA

reviews.text: This was a very fun experience! It’s pretty pricey for adults but great for kids with the unlimited ride bracelet. The rides are super fun and safe. They have a good variety of rides for kids and adults. The Ferris wheel has incredible views. The staff were nice and friendly.

Busy spot but iconic from you know which game :-)
Felt like I’m In a video game or a dream at some times. We walked around the pier and then a stroll along the beach. Sunset was beautiful glad I stayed for it.

Feb 2025

Friends took us to Santa Monica Pier and we played some arcade games and rode some rides.  This is similar to most fairs and definitely a far cry from the Houston Rodeo's offering, but it wasn't bad.  $17 per person for the roller coaster and $7 for the arcade games is a fair price.  The place wasn't too crowded and was just beautiful.  Lots of hawkers peddling various wares, but nothing crazy.  Check it out!

The amusement park situated along the Santa Monica waterfront is truly iconic and embodies the essence of the city itself. Visiting occasionally with my son, indulging in the various rides, and enjoying the whimsical arcade games, evokes a sense of nostalgia reminiscent of scenes from classic films. While the rides may not be the cheapest or the premier in California, the expense is justified by the sheer joy and positive atmosphere it offers for a delightful afternoon outing.
The kids loved it but it’s definitely overpriced for the number of rides. It’s kind of a one and done thing. They had fun but we likely wouldn’t pay that much again.

name: Scandia Family Fun Center
address: 5301 Redwood Dr, Rohnert Park, CA 94928, USA

reviews.text: I love this place. My friends and I enjoy coming here to be kids again. We went on a Wednesday when school was in and there was no one. Mini golf is always fun and arcade also

I’ve been coming here since I was little and I’m so happy this place is still here to bring my kids to! We’ve noticed they’ve gotten a new ride outside too and a bunch of new games! Definitely one of our favorites to make a whole day out of.

This is the most expensive kid entertainment in the area. $60 for a few friends to play mini golf for an hour is insane. Also I believe the go carts are rigged. They don’t all go the same speed, and they’re electronically controlled to slow you down if they see you’re wining.

Fun. Arcade was a blast. Golf course was great except for the unplayable parts. Golf course had some construction on it, would have been nice to know before hand as a large section was unplayable and hard to move babys stroller through. Lots of great arcade games but some are worn out. Light gun games that don't fire or are missing pieces, axe throwing game that never records a hit right, stuff like that. But still super fun to take your kids. My baby was in a stroller for most of it but still had a great time, fell asleep and let Mom and I have fun. I would return.

The go carts where super fun and the tower that drops you was also pretty cool some fun games. Ordered chicken strips and twice they had to remake them because they were still cold and uncooked on the inside So we finally said forget it and gave up on the snack but games and activities were cool to do.

name: SeaWorld San Diego
address: 500 Sea World Dr., San Diego, CA 92109, USA

reviews.text: First time taking kids to sea world, we had a great time. We did all the rides that were open. Great weather. Park was a lot bigger than I thought it was going to be. We were able to see all shows. Tons of food options and alcohol for the parents :)

First time here and had a blast. All the animal shows are splash shows so make sure you bring your poncho. It was really cool seeing all the animals up close. Some rides were closed which was a bummer. DO NOT eat here. I spent over $70 just for 4 hot dogs and a churro disney and universal have much better food prices

I went here for my birthday and I just didn’t really appreciate SeaWorld as much as I used to, I would always be so excited. It’s insane to me that I had to pay $30 for parking and the price is not included in the ticket. Not to mention that the park was not all that great all the rides were shut down for whatever reason what is extremely odd to me, the weather conditions where perfectly fine. I went with my boyfriend and it really sucked we could not experience the park to its full capacity with rides working and everything, I also understand times have changed but the entire park is cashless. The dolphin and orcas were cool but I really don’t understand why I paid the full price of the tickets and didn’t get to experience it for the price I paid

We came here while going on tour. It was my first time to SeaWorld, and my family hadn't been for years, and that was the one in Florida, so this felt completely brand new, and I was not disappointed. The service was quick, the lines never felt slow, and the shows were incredible, especially the orca show. I mean, a flipping killer whale was doing flips and jumping in and out of the water. I'm also a sucker for turtles, and do that immediately boosted it for me. The roller coasters were incredible, with a short wait time and a thrilling experience.
The food does need some work. Granted, it's theme park food, so it's not the best, but other than that, the day was thrilling and a magical experience. Plus, the sea lion show was fun to watch. They made it like a little story, and that appealed to me.

Great time to go (Spring Break). Lines are short, lots to see, petting fish and small sharks, some rides, and informational shows about the animals there. Memorable moments! Definitely will be returning.

name: Sesame Place San Diego
address: 2052 Entertainment Cir, Chula Vista, CA 91911, USA

reviews.text: We visited the park during the off season for the water features, so really only had the opportunity to see half the park. My kids loved it and were pleased with the rides, shows and character interactions. As a parent, I appreciate the park being small enough to see in a day and that there were no lines for pretty much all the rides. Wasn't happy about the overpriced $40 parking fee and I felt like I was parking at a Walmart. The food was expectedly overpriced but good enough.  We live 45 minutes away and would not consider the annual passes; it's not particularly special to return to but cool enough to check out once.

Went with my family at 01/19/2025. I had a lot of questions before coming in here but couldn't find answers online, so here is some information that might help you.

- Yes, pools are closed at this time of the year.
- They currently open on weekends only.
-  Purchased military pass online for only $92 with unli visits and free parking for the whole year. Should be worth it if you have little ones and from around here. If you only have a single day ticket I heard they charge $30+ for parking.
- Download the app before going so you can see the park schedule and directions!
- Park is not too busy and almost no wait time for all the rides and picture taking with the characters.
- I have a 2 year old and was able to enjoy 4 different rides!
- The atmosphere is amazing, it's very open and a perfect place to spend the day with your little one.
- I heard a lot of negative comments about this place and was hesitant to go at first, but after our visit, we actually loved it.
- Park says outside food and beverage are not allowed, but they let us in with a lot different toddler food/snacks.
- I personally think the photos from them are not that good lol. It doesn't look professional just a normal photo. I purchased a printed one with elmo for $25.
- Parade starts at 3:30, nothing too fancy but i keep reminding myself it's not for us, its for the kids 😂
- Will go back for sure! Excited for summer :))

Sesame Place San Diego is a fantastic destination for families, offering a fun and engaging atmosphere for kids of all ages. The rides, water attractions, and character interactions create a magical experience that brings Sesame Street to life. The park is well-maintained, and the staff in most areas are friendly and accommodating.

However, the food service, particularly at Monster Snack, needs significant improvement. The wait times for food are excessively long, which can be frustrating, especially with hungry children. Additionally, I noticed employees eating chicken tenders while taking orders, which is highly unprofessional. Food handlers should maintain proper hygiene, including wearing gloves, especially when serving meals to kids.

Overall, while Sesame Place excels in entertainment and family fun, the food service experience detracts from the visit. Improving efficiency, enforcing stricter hygiene standards, and ensuring professionalism among staff would greatly enhance the park’s overall quality.

My 4 year old daughter has fun every time we come . Summer time is the best cause of the water attraction. Water slides are for people of all ages to enjoy . . It’s a great place to have a child birthday party .

Lots of fun to be had at this giant amusement park. They have monster dance parades periodically with the Sesame favorites. One thing I wish I did was wear my bathing suit. There are tons of water rides and pools that I didn't know about before hand. I guess next amusement park I'll do my research. Still, even without using all the water rides, there are plenty of dry activities and rides.

name: Six Flags Magic Mountain
address: 26101 Magic Mountain Pkwy, Valencia, CA 91355, USA

reviews.text: Very fun park. Thrilling roller coasters. Themeing of the different areas is great. If you're not using the Flash Pass, be prepared to wait a while to get on some rides. I was in the park for 6 hours and was able to get on 6 coasters. Be prepared for lots of sun with sunscreen, shade, etc. But it was worth it in the end. I will be back.

Six Flags Magic Mountain – The Ultimate Thrill Seeker’s Paradise! 🎢🔥

If you’re an adrenaline junkie, Six Flags Magic Mountain is a dream come true! Known as the “Thrill Capital of the World,” this park is home to some of the most insane roller coasters you’ll ever experience.

From the record-breaking Twisted Colossus, which keeps you guessing with its wild inversions, to the high-speed Full Throttle, which launches you at mind-blowing speeds, every ride here is an absolute heart-pounding thrill. ⚡🔥 X2 is a must-ride—with its rotating seats and fiery effects, it’s an experience like no other!

The park has something for everyone, with family-friendly rides, water attractions, and great food spots to refuel between the adrenaline rushes. 🍔🥤 Weekends can get crowded, so Fast Passes are a lifesaver! The staff is friendly, and the park is well-maintained, making the overall experience even better.

If you love non-stop thrills, jaw-dropping coasters, and an unforgettable adventure, Six Flags Magic Mountain is THE place to be! Highly recommended for every roller coaster enthusiast! 🚀🎡🎠

Amazing Experience at Six Flags!

We visited Six Flags on a Monday and had an incredible time!
•	Tickets: Purchased online for $50 per person, and we upgraded to Fast Track for $95 per person. Totally worth it for skipping the long lines!
•	Parking: Paid $70, and it was super convenient—located very close to the entrance.
•	Lunch: Had a delicious meal at Johnny Rockets. Their Double Burger with Angus beef and onion rings was the highlight of our day!

Overall, it was a very satisfying and memorable experience. Highly recommended for a fun day out!

Best adventure park with thrilling rides. Wait times are little longer unless you purchase the flash pass. If you are visiting for one time, I do recommend the flash pass so that you can cover all the rides in single day.

Six Flags Magic Mountain, located in Valencia, California, is a world-renowned amusement park known as the "Thrill Capital of the World." Opened in 1971, it boasts an impressive collection of over 20 roller coasters, the most of any amusement park globally. Iconic rides like **Twisted Colossus**, **X2**, and **Goliath** offer adrenaline-pumping experiences for thrill-seekers, while family-friendly attractions ensure fun for visitors of all ages. The park is also home to themed areas, live entertainment, and seasonal events like **Fright Fest** and **Holiday in the Park**, which add unique experiences throughout the year. With its picturesque setting and record-breaking attractions, Six Flags Magic Mountain attracts millions of visitors annually. It is a must-visit destination for roller coaster enthusiasts and families looking for unforgettable adventure and excitement.

name: Boomers Los Angeles
address: 17871 Castleton St, City of Industry, CA 91748, USA

reviews.text: The girl at the counter helped us out. It was our first time and she was very friendly and patient. She was very knowledgeable too. We had a great experience. Definitely coming back.

We took my 12 year old daughter there and three of her friends for her birthday. We bought the unlimited day pass. We got there at 12:00 and it wasn't very busy.  The quality of food is not great. I think next time we would leave and come back. They had a good time on the go carts. They sped through the miniature golf. They liked the arcade and the bumper car things. We spent five hours there and I think they could have spent another hour. The staff was friendly and helpful. By the time we left the go karts were busy. I'm glad we came early.

Came here to take my spawnling to go go-karting. Spawnling had a blast, managed to get some wheel time before intake them to do real life driving. The best part is how my spawnling is getting to learn how to do proper over takes, proper drive lines, and apex turns.
My kids had a great time. The go carts are so fun! Sorry to the workers for my kids almost crashing into them 🤣 the only thing negative is that the games inside the arcade cost wayyyy to much.

We went here for my birthday with my wife and 3 kids, and the staff was very accommodating and friendly. We couldn’t have picked a better place to enjoy my 40th birthday. Julian was super awesome and helpful. He went above and beyond to make sure we were satisfied throughout our time there. We will definitely be coming back because we all had a great time and a memorable experience. Thank you everyone at Boomers, you guys were awesome and thank you Julian for the birthday gifts!

name: Boomers Los Angeles
address: 17871 Castleton St, City of Industry, CA 91748, USA

reviews.text: The girl at the counter helped us out. It was our first time and she was very friendly and patient. She was very knowledgeable too. We had a great experience. Definitely coming back.

We took my 12 year old daughter there and three of her friends for her birthday. We bought the unlimited day pass. We got there at 12:00 and it wasn't very busy.  The quality of food is not great. I think next time we would leave and come back. They had a good time on the go carts. They sped through the miniature golf. They liked the arcade and the bumper car things. We spent five hours there and I think they could have spent another hour. The staff was friendly and helpful. By the time we left the go karts were busy. I'm glad we came early.

Came here to take my spawnling to go go-karting. Spawnling had a blast, managed to get some wheel time before intake them to do real life driving. The best part is how my spawnling is getting to learn how to do proper over takes, proper drive lines, and apex turns.
My kids had a great time. The go carts are so fun! Sorry to the workers for my kids almost crashing into them 🤣 the only thing negative is that the games inside the arcade cost wayyyy to much.

We went here for my birthday with my wife and 3 kids, and the staff was very accommodating and friendly. We couldn’t have picked a better place to enjoy my 40th birthday. Julian was super awesome and helpful. He went above and beyond to make sure we were satisfied throughout our time there. We will definitely be coming back because we all had a great time and a memorable experience. Thank you everyone at Boomers, you guys were awesome and thank you Julian for the birthday gifts!

name: Universal Studios Hollywood
address: 100 Universal City Plaza, Universal City, CA 91608, USA

reviews.text: My experience from buying tickets to exploring the park was good. Between Florida and California, I prefer Florida because it’s bigger, much bigger. However Hollywood gives good areas for what they do have. I didn’t like that majority of the rides were simulated, got very light headed after one. The Jurassic Park ride was fun, that was the best ride experience to me. They were building a physical ride there I’m not sure of what it will be. The Harry Potter experience was good. I will say buying the ticket for the early bird super Mario experience made it worth it. I would say that the time of season matters. California kids are not on spring break during March so no bad wait in lines. Basically just tourists there. The decorations were good and we enjoyed it. There is a shopping center on the outside that’s really cool. We finished the park really quick and went there. Oh they do serve the beer butter. The staff was nice. Parking was easy.

Lots to do but the crowds were huge. We didn't go on any rides because of the long lines. The tour was fun and the other activities were too. The food, drinks, and snacks were pricey but at least the drink cups had free refills throughout the day. I don't know if I'll go back. I feel like I got more out of the other studio's tours for less money.

An unforgettable day at Universal Studios Hollywood! This place is pure magic — from the moment you walk in, you’re immersed in the world of movies, excitement, and nonstop fun. The rides are top-tier (Harry Potter and the Forbidden Journey and the Studio Tour are must-dos), and the attention to detail throughout the park is amazing.

The staff are super friendly and helpful, and everything feels well-organized, even when it’s busy. The food was surprisingly good for a theme park — don’t skip the Butterbeer or Toadstool Cafe!

Whether you’re a movie buff, a thrill-seeker, or just out for a good time with family or friends, Universal Studios Hollywood delivers. 100% worth it — can’t wait to go back!

It has really good rides, just not very many. Lots of new attractions since the last time I visited and more are coming soon. Must check out the times for Water World so you don't miss it. Check what time it closes a day before so you can plan accordingly.  It closed at 6pm when we went.

Nintendo World was the BEST! it’s UNREAL the attention to detail! The Toadstool Cafe was worth it! Make sure you run to a kiosk at the opening of the park to get a reservation at the cafe or you will either have a very long wait or you won’t get in at all. Every place was amazing and the tour was great! You need at least two days to get to everything IMO.

name: Epic Discovery at Breckenridge
address: 170 Watson Avenue, Breckenridge, CO 80424, USA

reviews.text: The experience was beyond disappointing. After paying an absurd price for a family of 5 to play mini golf at $125 for an 18 hole course, the conditions could not have been worse. There was mulch all over the course, the bricks and groundwork were falling apart, and the putting green was absolutely destroyed in multiple holes. Additionally, for that price, they didn’t provide scorecards. There was nothing redeeming about the course for the price paid when a majority of courses are almost a third of the price. Absurd to see the lack of care provided for that price. Will never come back again.

Went here for snowmobiling as a family. the quality of the instructors is amazing! They take the time to be sure that everyone knows how to operate the snowmobile safely and then separate you into smaller groups by family. the trails are well maintained and can be as challenging as your skills permit. the guides decide how well you're doing and if you're ready for something more advanced.

The newly named fun park is still just as fun. Due to the new construction they moved all the kids activities to the same area which is much nicer. Still love the alpine coaster and the alpine slide. Worth it just for that. It's still one of the best things to do on the mountain. Only gripe is, it's amusement park prices. Still too high for what you get, but knowing that makes it easier when you buy. Best deal is the family pack. Makes it more feasible.

Although we did have a great time and we were prepared for the massive amounts of people it was still really busy.   I spoke with some people that work there and they said most people think going on the weekends is more busy but Monday and Tuesdays are there busiest days.   We rode the gondola up stood in line for about 15 minutes.   Got to the top to buy tickets and did in line there for about 15 minutes.   I read to do the alpine ski first so that is what we did and did in that line for about 30.  Everything else was decent times except the roller coaster that was about and hour.   We only road the rides 1 time.   We left the mountain about 4.  All in all we had a good time.

Great day at Epic. We have a four year old and an infant. We brought our stoller with us for storage of all the things you might need in a day. So, yes, it fits in the gondola. At the top there are lots of picnic tables and chairs so plan on bringing your own food if you don't want to buy food (it can be pricey).  Also, for younger kids buy the three pack pass. By the time you stand in lines and walk around its the perfect amount of activity for the day. We were there about 6.5 hours and had a blast. There was also some live music which made for for great place for me to park with the infant while daddy rode the alpine slide with the older child.

Not all rides were open due to some maintenance, but our four year old didn't seem to mind.

name: Funcity Adventure Park
address: 4671 Onondaga Blvd, Syracuse, NY 13219, USA

reviews.text: So many different activities for kids of all ages... trampoline basketball, trampolines, foam pits, games, ball pits and an amazing jungle gym, wall climbing, and so much more! . it's a little pricey, 1.5hrs $24, 2hrs $28 and 3 hrs for $32

Visited Fun City Adventure Park today and my son had a blast! There are all types of games for him to enjoy, and even the big trampolines are a hit. Adults can have a good time too. The staff are incredibly friendly and patient with the kids, making the experience even better. The price is fair, making it a great value for a day of fun. Highly recommend!

Disgusting and unsafe environment; If you are sending your child to a birthday party here or planning a birthday party for your child here, I would highly suggest that you reconsider. We walked in for my nieces 10th birthday party last night, only to be jumping for 10 minutes before a disgusting and vile fight broke out between a ton of adults who also involved their children in the fight. This fight went on for over 15 minutes before security, any of the employees, or police stepped in! Fighting and cussing and being disgusting right in the front lobby in front of all of the staff who were blatantly ignoring them and subjecting every child there to this trauma. When my family member asked for a refund for the $500 birthday party she just paid for, the staff refused and only agreed to partially refund her her money. They made her pay for jump socks and 4 pizzas that we weren’t even able to utilize and still kept over $200 of her money! Everyone who checked in at 5pm were forcibly removed from the premises, but if you had reservations at 7pm or later, you were allowed to come back and jump. My niece’s entire birthday party ruined for some ghetto disgusting fighting. Even more disgusting that all the staff and security just stood there watching a huge fist fight break out in their lobby in front of all these children! You will NEVER get my money again dirty fun city. Do not send your children here they are not safe!!!

Booked a party room and the room was not ready when we got there. The staff at the front told my guests that they needed to check in with the host in the party room and would get their socks at that time. Every time we would have to hunt down a host who then needed to go and find our host. They never asked what size socks the kids needed just gave them some and left the room. My guests had to go back upfront to get a different size because they gave them all small. They only provide one juice or one water per jumper. So if parents want something to drink they charge you $2.00 for a water and because we went on a weekend they charged $2.50. Their website says that the host will help with set up, service and clean up. They did not do any of that. While we were doing cake a host come in the room and took the utensil/plate/napkin hold her. I advised that we were not done and they responded with “I’m taking it to refill it”. It was returned after we got done. While picking up the room a staff member come in and asked who to give the bill to. While we were carrying things out someone else come in and asked us if we were using the card on file to pay the bill. They then walked me to the front counter to make sure we paid.

Very poor customer service. Would not recommend having a party here.

Plenty of parking. Nice place to bring the kiddos for a few hours or the day. It's $24 for 1.5 hrs $28 for 2 hrs or $30 for the day. If you pay $30 for the day you are allowed to leave and come back if you want. It also requires jump socks which are $3.50 a pair. They have a ball pit with slides and some tunnels to crawl through. This is a area for kids 10 and under. They also have different structures and wall structures to climb with a adventure course. This area also says for kids 10 and under. They have a foam pit you can jump in. A trampoline dodge ball area,basket ball area. Various trampolines and a foam pit obstacle courses and a small zip line going over one foam pit. The arcade they have costs extra and is not included
They have some massage chairs you have to pay for to sit at. Also various metal benches you can sit on. Definitely a place to check out. My kids loved it. They have ample parking this is located in a shopping plaza area.

name: Elitch Gardens
address: 2000 Elitch Cir, Denver, CO 80204, USA

reviews.text:
I'm a couple years late but I just remembered our Luminova experience at Elitch Gardens and had to review!

We went on the coldest night of the year and had an absolute blast. Because it was so cold, we were basically the only people there -- we had the carousel to ourselves, a lot of the rides, and a lot of the light displays for photo opportunities. Had a great time!

We always have so much fun here. I love that they accommodate anyone with disabilities (including mental disabilities) so anyone that wants to have a good time here has the opportunity. They keep it cleaner than most theme parks and there's so much different food types to choose from you can pretty much find anything you could have a craving for as long as you're willing to look for it (different stalls for different types of food so you may have to search a bit if you have something specific in mind). The pictures are from Luminova which is their holiday light display.

I will start off by saying my son and his friend had a great time, granted they are both 8. Seems like the past reviews are accurate. A lot of rides are just shut down. Food selection is not very good but decent I guess. I would say the fair has better overall options though. When we arrived at noon it was bad. As the day went on it seemed to get a little more lively. I read the past reviews and the most disappointing thing is that it seems the “owner” just copy and pastes his reply to any and all negative reviews saying he would pass it on to the management. Bro you are the owner, why don’t you do something about it. It is kind of sad because I feel like it has true potential with know one really wanting to improve it. The wooden roller coaster really needs to be inspected! You can see it move and shake more than it should. There are nuts, bolts, and washers everywhere! Try caring about your park just a little more. Cleaning and upkeep would make a world of difference. Overall not terrible but not great.

We enjoyed Elitches this season. For the most part we had good experiences. I definitely think the season pass is the way to go. You will save a lot of money on parking on top of being able to bring friends, plus you get a discount on nearly everything in the park. Fright Fest and Luminova were a lot of fun. It's cool to be able to see the park transform. The food and drinks are really expensive and not the best. The pizza place near the entrance is usually less busy and a little quieter than the main food court. I would recommend bringing your own water bottle to refill. There's a water fountain outside the bathrooms by the main entrance. If you have never been and are on the fence, I think it is a memorable experience and a good way to spend time with family and friends.

Loved coming for Luminova. Always super nostalgic to be here and I appreciated the discount during non-peak days. Took a star because holy moly the rides break so often here. I was stuck dangling in the air in the freezing cold because a ride broke down. Also hope they consider adding heaters to the lines since it's always below 40 during winter nights. Hoping this improves in the future, the rides here are so much fun!

name: Glenwood Caverns Adventure Park
address: 51000 Two Rivers Plaza Road, Glenwood Springs, CO 81601, USA

reviews.text:
Review: A Fun-Filled Day at Glenwood Caverns

Glenwood Caverns is an absolute blast! The gondola ride up the mountain alone is worth the price of admission, offering incredible views before you even reach the amusement park at the top.

The park features four awesome rides, and I had the chance to try two of them. The alpine coaster was a huge hit—both my son and I loved it. The slingshot ride, which launches you right off the edge of the mountain, is perfect for thrill seekers looking for an adrenaline rush.

One of the highlights of the visit was the cave tours. The standard cave tour is included in the $56 full-day ticket and lasts about an hour, with a knowledgeable guide sharing fascinating details about the caves and their preservation. We also opted for the blacklight cave tour for an additional $20, and it was totally worth it—such a fun and unique experience!

Plan to spend around 5 to 6 hours here for a full experience. The park is open from 10 AM to 6 PM, so there’s plenty of time to explore. The gift shop on the mountain is a nice stop, offering fun souvenirs and even free fudge samples. There’s also a cafeteria and a bar behind the gift shop, making it a great spot to relax.

I visited with my wife, a friend, and my seven-year-old son, and we all had an amazing time. Glenwood Caverns is definitely worth a visit for families and thrill seekers alike!

We had such a fun day here! It’s such a great spot on a sunny Colorado day. We loved everything it had to offer, loved the slide, gondola, canyon swing, cave tour! The workers were so friendly and welcoming! We could have easily spent more time here but had to catch our train home. Great little gift shop too and loved their fudge. Really fun spot and would recommend!

We were in Glenwood Springs for a surprise weekend getaway Iron Mountain Hot Springs (a sister company)...
We decided to stop and ride the Gondola up to take in the views, and it didn't disappoint! It was a little expensive, but a nice ride, and once you are up there, you can pick and choose what else interests you for entertainment. The weather was ok for November (typical Colorado) but not super conducive to being on a mountain top trying to do alpine slides or walk the shops... staff was helpful, and I would like to do the Cave Tour at some point. 5 out 5 - 4 sure 😆

This was such a great experience and adventure. The caverns were amazing, and the history surrounding it was incredible. Curtis was such a great tour guide and made us laugh every second with all his puns and storyline examples lol. The gondola ride makes of a beautiful view up the mountain and back down. So many ride attractions and plenty to see. Definitely worth coming here.

We were there in winter. Unfortunately, not much was open. Only the alpine coaster and the caves.
Sometimes we had to wait for over an hour.
The view from up there was phenomenal, especially in winter.
The waiting time for the gondolas was very short.

name: Lakeside Amusement Park
address: 4601 Sheridan Boulevard, Denver, CO 80212, USA

reviews.text: My favorite amusement park. Every time I go I feel at home. Nothing matches atmosphere the smell and the fun. All the Roller coasters are classics and are super fun. The Flat rides are also super fun and there are a lot of one of a kind flats here too. The Lights at night are so pretty (Not all lights are working sadly like the tower, casino & the light house) The Buildings and signs are also super pretty and the way they were designed is so amazing. The Park feels like a trip back in time and its super cheap too. Lines are about 5 to 30 mins depending on the ride and the day you go.

My friend and I had the best time. In my opinion this is more fun than Elitches. Yes, the amenities are fewer and yes- it feels like a step back in time. Some of the rides aren’t operating and many things are dated or in need of a fresh coat of paint. But I can’t remember the last time I went to an amusement park and barely had to wait in line, talked with nice staff, and just left feeling much happier than when I came in. So many smiles all around and $25 to wander around getting happier and happier and free parking? A good deal in my opinion.

This place is hanging on by a thread and poor loyal customers. It's a good thing they allow outside food because the concession foods are limited. However, the food is dirt cheap, entry is $5, parking is free, and the scenic train still works. As for the rides, some work, some don't, and some should be placed OOS. This place reminds me of South of the Boarder in South Carolina.

A shell of a time long past.

My best advice is to come to Lakeside expecting an old, run down yet charming amusement park. I felt like I time traveled. I read reviews so I had low expectations, but in reality Lakeside far exceeded those. It's an amusement park experience from yesteryear. My kids absolutely loved Kiddieland, as they have about a dozen rides for young children. We got a whole pizza for dinner which was actually very tasty, but order it with light cheese. Many rides were broken, some in pieces, yet it was a fascinating trip to a different time of amusement parks. I'll bring my kids back for sure.

Came here before season closing. This place reminded me of Indiana Beach so much, so being able to experience a little time capsule, was comforting. Food prices were amazing, rides were as expected, staff was friendly. Definitely coming back next season.

name: Santa's Workshop, North Pole, NY
address: 324 Whiteface Memorial Hwy, Wilmington, NY 12997, USA

reviews.text: Very pricey. Same price for my 3yr old as it is for an adult. Hasn’t been updated since the park opened 75 years ago but nostalgic in that sense. The girl working in the hat factory though did not seem happy to be there as I walked in to say hello and got no smile or response when she looked at me. The little show they put on outside was cute. The Santa they have working with his helpers were very accommodating and friendly. The train,carousel and another ride weren’t working when we were there this past weekend which was a bummer. Really enjoyed seeing the live reindeer they had in their stalls though. Kids had fun so that’s what counts. Not busy there at all.

This Saturday we had breakfast with Santa and visited his home and workshop. My kids are 4 and 7 years old. They absolutely loved it. So magical. They both said "best day ever". To my children this was more magical than Disney world. Noel the Elf at the Photoshop was so kind, funny, and had such patience with my children. The lady at the toy shop was helpful and kind too. Santa and Mrs. Claus were as sweet as one would expect. Thank you Santa for having a heart of gold and answering all the children's questions. Thank you to everyone for making this day special and keeping their hearts full of belief and wonder.
This is an amazing expierence for the whole family. It’s an outdoor wonderland amusement park geared for children. If you haven’t been, I suggest you get there

⭐️very special time capsule of a place
⭐️#nostalgic
⭐️#imaginative + creative
⭐️welcoming + friendly
⭐️fun, #FamilyTrip

I went here as a kid and am thankful to be able to bring my babygirl here as well to make memories. The ride operators are so sweet…

🚂 before hopping on the train the conductor says each time “look to the left in the woods to see where the elves live in the trees” and then there they are ! Little doors on the trees. When we tried to tip him for the 3 times he took our gang on the loop he would not accept saying “you pay enough to come through the gate” (which at $30 dollars for adults and kids 2+ I thought was far beyond reasonable)

🥣we went on a chilly, Autumn day and were glad to have some warm split pea & ham soup to warm us up as we sat inside the lunchroom chalet. We arrived around 230pm and realized they closed at 3pm. Instead of rushing us out, the gentleman that runs the kitchen sat down and had a chat with us, reassuring us there was no rush for us to leave. After living in Miami for the last 8 years and NYC for 10 years prior to that…it warmed my soul to have genuine and kind conversation.

🛝there’s a (bit of a hidden) slide in the workshop (that even Mom’s can go down)

If you’re visiting the #Adirondacks be sure to stop by! #Kidfriendly
My kids had a great time. They truly enjoyed the park. I just wish the park was a little bigger.

name: Lake Compounce Amusement & Water Park
address: 185 Enterprise Dr, Bristol, CT 06010, USA

reviews.text:
We came here for the first time because it was Phantom Fall Fest. I would suggest buying tickets online before going. If you pick your specific day, it’s $20 cheaper. It’s $30 for parking which I’m not sure why. I guess you can’t escape paying extra when you go anywhere. Cashless so make sure you have a credit or debit card for parking.

There are 4 haunted houses to go in. One was boring and not scary. The other three were fun. I don’t scare easily but they definitely put effort into it. Overall it was a lot of fun. It is the oldest amusement park in the US. Lots of fun rides, games and concession stands. Water rides are open during the summer.  They have a variety of Pepsi products that are free while you are there. Overall a great value for a few hours of fun.

Lake Compounce has been a special place for me ever since I was a kid in summer camp. It’s where I conquered my fear of rides on some of my first roller coasters, creating memories that I’ll never forget. Over the years, I’ve loved seeing how they’ve updated and improved the park while still keeping its charm. Working at the Phantom Fall Fest was an incredible experience—so much fun and such a unique way to see the magic behind the scenes. Lake Compounce is truly a place filled with nostalgia, excitement, and amazing moments!

This review is for the Holiday Lights event at Lake Compounce.

This is the oldest operating amusement park in the U.S. and it opened in 1846. It's 365 acres and located in Bristol and Southington, CT. The body of water located in the park is the Lake Compounce; there is a beach at the lake and a water park. The name of the lake came from a native American who signed a deed over to the settlers; Chief John Compound, who was from the Mattatuck-Tunxis tribe.

There are 44 attractions, 5 rollercoasters, and 13 water rides. Wildcat is the 14th oldest wooden rollercoaster in the world. They also have a newer award winning wooden rollercoaster called Boulder Dash; this has been named the #1 wooden rollercoaster in the world for 5 years. The historic Lake Compounce Carousel was built around 1890 and moved to the park in 1911.

In December, they host the Holiday Lights event which runs through December 31. It's a fun event for children and adults. They deck the park with lights and have the tallest Christmas tree in CT, which is 100 ft tall. There were plenty of rides, games, and activities. Some activities include letters to Santa, DIY snow globe, and personalized ornaments.

There's an opportunity to visit Santa, holiday characters, and storytime. There are some dining options onsite such as Johnny Rockets, a food truck, and dining hall. The prices were high which is typical for amusement parks. I've read that people bring their own food/drinks and would go eat it in the car and go back into the park after.

We went on a Saturday evening which was pretty busy but not too overwhelming. There was a parking booth, large parking lot, and attendants showing people where to park. Upon entering the park, you can't miss that beautiful large Christmas tree. The restrooms were plentiful and clean. There are ticket booths and the lines moved pretty quickly. The rides were plentiful, cute, and fun for the kids. It was very cold and in the teens; there were some fire pits if you want to warm up. The lines for the rides were short and quick; the longest was the train ride.

We were there for 3.5 hours and left right before it closed. We didn't get to ride all the rides but felt like we got our money's worth. Overall, my family and especially my child enjoyed the the park. This is definitely going to be a family tradition going forward. Also, I can't wait to check it out in the summer and will provide another update.

Had a great time. It was a fun Christmas activity. The balloon man was amazing and made her a candy cane and a snow globe. The unlimited hot chocolate cup and churros were a hit too.  Munchkin loved the train ride around the lake and of course visiting with Santa was the best part. It was not crowded at all and she had a great time.

Had an absolutely amazing time with some friends for the holidays! The train ride was stunning and the rides were so fun, lots of fun things to do there. However, if you don’t buy your ticket online you must pay double to get in, which I find very silly and disappointing. So buy beforehand online! They also do not accept cash, but this isn’t anything new. It’s only a little inconvenient but they will provide cards for you to use in the park. Just be aware! This place is amazing all year round despite those!

name: Ocean Beach Park
address: 98 Neptune Ave, New London, CT 06320, USA

reviews.text:
$30 parking fee for weekdays and $40 for weekends.

We went on weekday afternoon and it was not too busy. Water slide was not open yet. Amusement park rides are very old but cute. Great for young kids.

Boardwalk was nice and new. Loved the splash pad and playground for kids. Pool was closed.  Beach was beautiful and had a variety of different sea shells. Unfortunately, there was quite a lot of garbage (dirty tissue, cigarette butt, food wrappers) on the sand from people who did not use the garbage cans. Alewife Cove nature trail was nice and the water was shallow. It was great for wading in and seeing cute little crabs and hermit crabs in the water.

Absolutely Ideal Beach !! Especially for Gatherings with and Family, Friends!  Beautiful Beach! Clean, rock free, clear, great Bay/harbor for swimming or fishing off the jetty! Ideal for kids to bring their nets and buckets for crabs or clamming! I Love the Lagoons to walk through when the tide is out! Splash pad for the kiddos and amusement park @ dusk! Excellent family and gathering spot. Cookouts and events (Reservation in advance) We had such a Lovely time and will be back again and again!

Great board walk, perfect for watching the sunrise,  or set, dealers choice.  It's a great beach bc there's also a lovely lil wet land habitat to explore and marvel in with kiddos, or solo. There's a splash park open in summer.There are public restrooms. They have really fun things in summer like Car shows on Monday,  I think, and free line dancing on Thursday, lots live music during summertime. It's a great lil beach, check it out, you'll probably like it too 😀
Very peaceful beach to visit in the winter/spring. Lots of parking, beach sand was soft, lovely paths to walk along in the low tide. Not sure how it would be in the summertime

The sand at this beach feels amazing. There's a lot to do here. They have the ocean so swimming and fishing and playing in the sand making sand castles. We have rides and waterslides here. They have a nature walk and the broad walk. Volleyball right on the beach is awesome 😁  The restrooms need to be cleaned a little more often. There is no dog allowed here. Plenty of picnic tables but only picnics no grills are allowed. Plenty of parking... The is a splash pad and pool too.

name: Quassy Amusement & Waterpark
address: 2132 Middlebury Rd, Middlebury, CT 06762, USA

reviews.text: Quassy has done an excellent job staying family-friendly and affordable. There is a wide assortment of children's rides, a handful of adult rides, a fun arcade, and affordable food options that can be eaten with a beautiful view of the lake. It's definitely a great place to spend a summer day!
Courteous waitstaff and zero / minimal wait time for rides. Adults can accompany toddlers on most kids ride if needed. Kids had a great time both in the water and on rides

This was our first time at Quassy and it was a lot of fun! The park is smaller but I think it's good for children especially due to that! The pricing is very reasonable, and there's a lot to do for everyone!

Yes, I'm giving it 5 stars. Reality says it shouldn't- as only a pint sized 6 flags, the food is overpriced, the bathrooms are not cleaned enough. But for younger kids this old fashioned and quaint park did amuse my family for half a day. They have some exciting tubing slides and wonderfully creative splash tower including many filled buckets to douse persons below and working water cannons, etc. I forget the name of the knockout roller coaster because for good reason no cell phones are allowed on the ride and I forgot to take a picture) that defies gravity; the rickety metal track clanged so hard I thought we'd be the ones that finally broke off the guard threatening our lives(but is too short a ride). There is also the "Frantic" which spins and turns you upside down. We are next to one of the food establishments and sat on some of the many stools with a majestic serene view of the lake. For an extra charge they allow paddle boats of two to four passengers. Outside food is permitted and Quassy serves alcohol. Definitely parents can have fun here. I think the place is right-sized and doesn't feel missing per se compared to the sprawling Lake Compounce. For the youngest patrons, they will find themselves occupied in awe. It is just the older teenagers that might find the place wanting for more. So highly recommended for parents and their children between 36 inches and 13 years old. PS- I think they also had a magic show but we missed it. Also, the picture I have of the roller coaster is called "Little Dipper" and is NOT the hair raising one I described above.

My husband and I always have a great time in the lake. We fish, swim, sun and relax. This past weekend, as we were docking the boat. I saw a black water snake. It scared me as I was getting off of the boat and stepped on land, the snake darted out of the water at me. I don't like snakes at ALL! Come to find out, it's not a venomous snake, but they do bite. Be careful out there while enjoying your the lake.

name: Fun Land of Fredericksburg
address: 1351 Central Park Blvd, Fredericksburg, VA 22401, USA

reviews.text: It was super easy to host a party at FunLand. The staff were friendly and professional. The main “issue” we had was that you couldn’t add food other than pizza with your host. If you wanted to get chicken tenders or fries you would have to leave the party to order then leave again to pick up, which is difficult if you have a room full of young people. There was a lot of things out of order and some  machines would take ur play points, and the line to get help was too long.

We had a great time, was not crowded at all. We were there from about noon until 6:30 PM on a Saturday. Never had to wait longer than two minutes to get into any of the rides or laser tag. Staff was great and attentive when we needed help. Place was pretty clean. Food was decent.  Had a pizza (which is hard to mess up!  Definitely will return.
Due to the previous snowfall, everything outside was closed

We had fun And it was definitely worth the money.  The discount by using the app was great. It was not busy and everyone especially the ticket counter guy were great. He even gave us three extra tickets just to get my 5-year-old up to 75 credits so we could get a lollipop. I would have given a five star review but some of the games were down and some of the attractions were not working.

Amazing amazing place for dates, group hang outs and much more! A lot of the games were pretty cool even though I lose in half of them it’s always fun to be here! Highly recommend this place to those who just want a quick trip to Funland! Much better than Dave n Busters!🤩
Took my   15,12,7 year old they loved it fair price on family packages. This time we dint try the cafeteria so I left the one star open for our next visit.

name: Adventureland
address: 2245 Broadhollow Rd, Farmingdale, NY 11735, USA

reviews.text: Not a bad place to visit especially since it’s in Long Island. Not a lot of ethnic diversity either to be honest but still pretty friendly. This place is mainly for kids aged 4-10 years. Lots of kiddie rides and height restrictions like 44-48 inches in order to ride alone or at least with an adult 18+ years of age. Lots of classic carnival games to play like ring toss, basketball shot, water pistol shooter etc with tons of prizes for choose from winning which it should since it is an amusement park. Food is also ok but pricing could use a little adjusting. Plenty of car parking around and they even have special events and conditions for birthday rentals. Bumper cars were kind of boring and the arcades could use a lot more variety in games. Overall I did like the park but gave it 3 star because it reminded me of a much less mundane version of 6 flags. The wait times were the best part as I managed to get through the whole park in 2 hours. Summer time maybe much busier so I can’t really say for certain but this place does have its moments. Some of the rides was actually inspired by 6 flags like the fireball or tornado. The day pass was $40 and came with a silver wristband which looked pretty nice. Bunch of places to take pictures and make memories.

This is a Good spot to bring the kids, this is one of those go here to kill some time adventure parks. The rides are good, atmosphere is good, park is clean, bathrooms are maintained, food and drink are a bit more pricey then u would want, but since it’s the only spot, u got no choice. still worth it and will definitely be returning

Came here Sunday for a birthday party always have a good time at Adventureland. This is a Long Island staple it has definitely gotten better over the years. The rides are fun for all ages. The games are fun as well but a little pricey. the security guard Bob was wonderful very nice and welcoming. My only gripe is at the food. Isn’t the best in my opinion could use some work other than that I’d recommend family coming here to spend the day or even if you wanna have a birthday party this is a great location.

Season pass holder for the past 3 years to take my now 6-year old son during summer time. A lot of fun rides: bumper car, rescue boat, Ferris wheel, to name a few. They also have a nice indoor arcade with claw machines, video games, etc. Nice place to spend a day with kids.

name: Race City
address: 9523 Front Beach Rd, Panama City Beach, FL 32407, USA

reviews.text: What an amazing time! Great activities and arcade. We loved the race track and arcade games. Haunted house was so much fun! The manager Matt was excellent and super friendly. He made sure we were all having an outstanding time!! Enjoyed our visit so much, definitely will be back!!

Had a lot of fun here last night. The staff was all very friendly and the rides were FUN! Our 11yo son also loved the arcade. But don't go in the Haunted House if you're a wimp like me! Haha. Hope to go back soon!

Had a great time, essentially no lines except for the larger racetrack. Nice place for families with children of all ages: has rides for the smaller children.

The unlimited wrist band is definitely worth it for the rides.  The haunted house artwork was great and glowed at night. It was full of bumps in the night and suspense!

Unfortunately, the roller coaster is down for upkeep. The flume opens when it is little warmer, but the water bumper boats are open.

Arcade was fun! Very clean, all the glass games were spottless: no finger prints or smudges on them.

Pleasant staff, facilities clean: no litter on the ground anywhere, bathrooms were upkept and clean.

This place was really fun. My kids enjoyed coming here, and we came back to back one day for all the rides and the next day for the arcade. I would recommend coming and trying this place for a family fun day.  Also you can see all the prizes we left with.

Great small sized amusement park but half the really fun rides weren’t working, including the ONLY roller coaster. May not be worth the unlimited wristband when so many rides don’t work. I just paid per ride for the few things I wanted to ride. The go-karts were fun though.

name: Splash City Adventures
address: 6709 Pensacola Blvd, Pensacola, FL 32505, USA

reviews.text: I brought my great granddaughter to the splash park... she had a blast, they has an area for the smaller children, which was great. the life guards payed close attention. all the employees were amazing. the park looked 100% better from when I was there awhile back.  from the landscaping, to the rides. will be returning. thank you for the fun and great low prices.

I took my teenagers on a weekday evening. Not much is open at that time (laser tag, go karts, and mini golf), but this was disclosed online before we came, so I was fine with that, and the boys had a good time. Some people who had not looked at the website and were also there when we were seemed more disgruntled, but the park fully discloses this before you pay. We had some discounted tickets, and for a few hours of good fun with very little wait, it was very much worth it. Much of the outside part of the park is run down, including the mini golf, but I overheard discussions about repairs and updates that are being made, and there were workers in the water park getting it ready while we were there. I really want to compliment the staff. When I had a question about the location of an attraction, I had no trouble finding someone. Naraysia W. checked us in, and she was also really helpful running the laser tag room when the boys wanted to play. Every staff member I interacted with was smiling and kind. We will definitely go back on a weekend when everything is open.

Only a few rides open, but totally worth the small cost to entertain the kids.
We found the place on Groupon.  It was $35 for 4 tickets.

Go karts, laser tag, rock climbing, and some rides.

My first time at Splash City Adventures was extremely enjoyable. One of the prettiest looking arcades that I’ve seen for a long time. The staff is super friendly, and they are posted at each available location ready for you to walk up and enjoy your time.
