The laser tag is “fire” according to my son, but I preferred the goofy golf challenges. I’ll definitely be coming back!!

We had a BLAST! We found a coupon from Groupon for a family of 4 for 40! Very budget friendly! We drove a hour from another state just to do this! The water parks near us want 400 for 4 people, which is ridiculous! We stayed here all day! Something for everyone! Laser tag, go carts, water slides, amusement park, arcade and food!!!  Some of the slides at the water park was closed and some of the rides at the amusement, which was a bummer but we still had a lot of fun and WILL BE BACK!! Oh!! There was a member of the staff and her name was CLOVER. She was a sweet and helpful as it gets!!!

name: Swampy Jack's Wongo Adventure
address: 284 Powell Adams Rd, Panama City Beach, FL 32413, USA

reviews.text: Swamp Ape is so entertaining. It looks like a dark creepy forest where the scrambler ride is located. We heard the song Welcome to the Jungle during our time on the ride. The whole place is themed to swamp creatures and is especially fun at night. All staff members were engaging and attentive.
Huck is the nicest guy ever and what an old soul. You’re lucky if you get to meet him. He’s the tall dude. What a well-kept facility and the putt course is more like a nature sanctuary. Wow.

Great clean and fun place for the family! We did putt putt for $12/person and the course was well maintained! They had little spin wheels that gave you a task for some of the holes which made it interesting! The staff were so nice! I would definitely go back!

What an absolute GEM of a place. We have been to PCB several times and had no clue this place was here. Let me first start by saying the staff was so freaking nice. Everyone was smiling and asking how we were doing. We loved the mini golf course, it really gave the swamp vibes this place is aiming for. The swings were awesome and the lady working them was so kind. We loved the go karts, me and my 8 year old aimed for all the coins to make it more fun for her. The indoor scrambler was our favorite part. It was AWESOME. The music, the strobe lights, the fog and the workers made it so much fun. The painting on the walls was so cool. The kids did it multiple times. We will absolutely come here every time.
So much fun! Everyone was kind and helpful and welcoming! Super clean location. Reasonable prices. Rides felt very safe and well attended. Will return.

name: Trackside Pro Karting Center
address: 2374 NY-414, Watkins Glen, NY 14891, USA

reviews.text: I have nothing but good things to say about this business and its accommodating owner! Scott, the owner of Trackside Pro Karting Center outdid himself! I had been planning a surprise Bachelorette party for my sister for a few months and began collaborating with Scott in June of 2021. Upon arrival, he let us decorate my sister's kart, use the event center room and ordered us some pizza, and offered us to use the mini golf course! His staff was an awesome group and made sure to take pictures/videos of us to add to our memory book. The gas-powered go karts are FAST and fun- if you like adrenaline you will LOVE his place! You have options as there are 2 courses to race on, an airsoft field, a gift shop, mini golf, the event center room with some awesome arcade games inside! We will for sure be back with our old friends AND new friends. Spread the word, slay the course, and eat my dust bunny!

It was definitely fun. Inside was clean.  A safety education video was shown and equipment is in great shape. Staff is very helpful and accommodating. That being said. It was a tad on the expensive side costing me 39.99$ for myself and my 6 year old son. You get 10 minutes of track time. A printout of your lap times is made available on request. Over all I definitely enjoyed myself.  During our visit they we're hosting live entertainment (A band)and had local breweries and a food truck. We didn't participate in that.

We celebrated our sons 10th birthday here today! 100% satisfied. Over the top customer service, tons for the kids to do as well. VR, air hockey, Go-Karts with 2 different tracks; large and small loop, mini gulf.. the list goes on and on! The kids had a blast and it made things so easy on us parents!
Such an awesome place! We had a great experience, the employees were a joy, and Scott went out of his way to make our day memorable. We will be back 🏎💯

My daughter and I had an amazing time at Trackside! 25 years later and this place is still just as fun as I remember it! When another family accidentally went ahead of us in line, the owner took notice and did everything to rectify the situation. Though I assured him it was okay, he still made sure we left with goody bags and free passes for a future ride. Impeccable customer service, clean environment, well kept grounds, and the carts were SO MUCH FUN. My 9 year old won’t stop taking about it! An overall amazing experience and we will absolutely be back soon!

name: FastTrax Fort Myers
address: 17455 Summerlin Rd, Fort Myers, FL 33908, USA

reviews.text:
Wow this place has more than I initially imagined. Our son is 19 months, 33 inches tall. He is 3 inches shy of enjoying most of the kiddie rides. He was, however, ok to ride the little kid train! We were invited to a private event upstairs. Very nice space for a work party. LOTS of good arcade games.
Overall, very good experience. Will be back when little man is a tiny bit taller!

We always visit here when we are in town. If you have smaller kids, it's a great price for what you get. Sometimes you have to wait for someone to come to a ride to operate it, but it's never long. The staff is friendly with kids, the arcade is great and they have a really good variety of food as well. The go karts are pretty fun for all ages too!

We had an enjoyable afternoon with our daughter. She played for a solid 3 hours on rides and in the arcade.
The ride attendants were polite and helpful, except for one, who was distracted by his friends talking to him while he was operating a ride that my daughter was on. I asked him to pay attention to the controls that he was blindly operating and he returned his focus to the machinery.
Mostly a place for very young kids, good way to burn half a day. Try to go when it's not too hot, there isn't a ton of shade.

Nice staff and decent rides for younger kids. Hours didn’t care for to much. Some days they were open from 4-9pm. I would prefer to have ride and play(arcade) packages. My kids got bored riding the same bunch of rides and wanted to go insides and play games. And they were to young to do the go cart and bumper boats.
Good place to take the kids. Go Cars are overpriced is 11:99 for a few minutes for a ride that's why the 4 stars. Machines inside are good and workers are so nice and helpful.

name: Enchanted Forest Water Safari
address: 3183 NY-28, Old Forge, NY 13420, USA

reviews.text: We went for the first time in 20 years. The kids (5&7) had a blast, and it's just like we remembered. Lazy river, water rides, wave pool, enchanted forest, and dry rides! The locker system is very nice. We paid $12 for a medium locker for our things. The machine gives you a waterproof wristband to wear. You scan it, and the locker pops open. We rode the train to get to the back and front of the park multiple times throughout the day. Lines were kind of long, but we went on a Friday. Food was not as pricey as I expected.

Enchanted Forest Water Safari is such a massive park. I will be honest I had no idea that this park was this large when I went there for the first time. They have some really great slides that are a lot of fun.
I recommend going on the Curse of the Silverback ride. I probably waited a half hour for this ride in the hot sun but it was worth it. They have a family deal for tickets if you purchase ahead online that offers a pizza, ice cream cones and large refillable soda/water cups for all family members.

The park itself is massive so it is important to have a system if you are going with a lot of kids to make sure they are all supervised. They have a story time land for smaller kids with older still reenactments of classic stories from the Black Forest.

They also have a petting zoo which is pretty cool as well. The slides and the water park are spread out pretty much everywhere you go so you can’t miss it.

On top of all of this, they have a bunch of rides like helicopters, bumper cars, boats, Ferris wheels, and so much more. They also have a live performers at this large amphitheater outside as well, and a train that runs through the park nonstop as well.

There are beach cabanas for rent and the next time I go back I would definitely get one of those. Having shade during the hot months is something that is going to make you feel so much better because you will be able to enjoy your day more.

All in all, this is a large entity to take on as just one family but it can a lot of fun. There will never be a shortage of anything to do which is nice as well. It’s amazing that this park has held up so well over the years, the owners really do a nice job taking care of everything.

This place is adorable. We went in August 2023, my kids ask to go back all the time. They're 9, 6 and 4 and they all had a great time. My youngest especially loved the little fairytale statues, she wanted to go back 4 times to take pics with them all. Also the rides being included was so nice. We're planning another trip for this summer to bring my sister and her kids along.

Came in for brunch on a Saturday. Beautiful build out for this new restaurant. First off Bei our server was exceptional. For the food we ordered  wasabi lobster roll of the brunch menu which was delicious in flavor albeit could use a little more lobster. The sashimi was very fresh and the flavor was exceptional. Perusing the dinner menu there are a lot of intriguing dishes. It’s a big place with space for your big parties !

We loved our first time at this place! Weather was perfect! But a lot of the venders were closed & not every ride was open on opening week.  Their Nashville chicken sandwich in the main food vender wasn't bad either! A little dirty in the one lazy river but overall we will return because we stay at the old forge camp resort every year!

name: Fun Spot America Theme Parks — Atlanta
address: 1675 GA-85, Fayetteville, GA 30214, USA

reviews.text: Weekday visit but only 4 rides are operating plus the arcade. Honestly, this was such an enjoyable time with the family. Getting to do go-karts over and over again was awesome! Unlimited coaster rides! And the smoothest coaster at that. We definitely had a great time!

Very fun and inexpensive place to take the kids! You don't have to wait in long lines, it's not overly crowded, and there is a lot of different rides and things to do. I don't recommend the food there, but that's the only thing we didn't like. They have a big arcade inside as well, which the kids enjoyed!

Dearest esteemed reader,

It is with great delight that I recount my recent excursion to the extraordinary realm known as Funspot Atlanta. Upon my arrival, the foremost wonder that captured my attention was none other than the illustrious Arieforce One, a masterful creation by the renowned artisans at Rocky Mountain Construction. From the very moment of ascent to the finality of the break run, I found myself enraptured by its splendid craftsmanship. Though brief in duration, this marvel delivers an unparalleled thrill that leaves one utterly astonished.

The remaining attractions within this delightful park are equally worthy of admiration, particularly the commendable Go Kars. These conveyances afford a most splendid experience, indeed! I must implore you not to underestimate the modesty of this establishment, for it harbors treasures that await discovery by the discerning visitor.

I beseech you, noble friends, do not hesitate to include this charming venue in your plans. A visit here is an opportunity not to be regretted; you shall find it to be every bit as magnificent as my words profess!
Arieforce is an airtime machine a must ride for any rollercoaster lover definitely worth the drive they also have other fun options for kiddos and go cart efishenatos

Fun Spot America is great for a Down South getaway and trying to travel to Six Flags. Get in early and be able to ride everything without a long wait time. They have go carts which is why I actually came to this location and it was close to my house. The ticket prices should be a bit cheaper due to the accommodations they offer hopefully the build more attractions moving forward. Basically get the all day pass and show up as soon as they open for the best experience.

name: Lake Winnepesaukah Amusement Park
address: 1730 Lakeview Dr, Rossville, GA 30741, USA

reviews.text: Loved it! The parade for Halloween was fun and the decorations. Had a great time with my family going through their haunted attractions and the rides. Great atmosphere for the family.

I've come here in the past for their Halloween events in costume without issue. Props and all. I've heard this establishment has been going downhill but didn't know how bad. Tonight I showed up with my brother, sister, and brother's girlfriend in costumes. On the way in there was not one complaint from staff or customers. Some people even asked to take photos. A nice gentlemen even gave us free tickets. After scanning our tickets, a bitter employee got snappy with my brother and I and she told me to take his and my props back to my truck. I didn't hesitate to comply cause I knew people like her were just gonna try to punish you more if you tried to argue, so I walked for a few minutes, put them up, then came back. Then another one of Lake Winnie's finest told me I can't wear a mask, an essential part of this costume I worked hard on. He told me that nobody over 12 could wear masks for "security reasons". What a joke. If you enjoy Halloween and want some public Halloween fun outside of just trick or treating, go somewhere other than Lake Winnie 👎

I grew up going to this park and loved it so much then, but the owners have done an AMAZING job of renovating and adding new features and rides but keeping the nostalgia! I moved away a long time ago and was pleasantly surprised when I came home for a visit! I took my daughter for the first time and she has an absolute BLAST!! The ticket prices are affordable as well! The entire family had an awesome day filled with precious memories to last a lifetime ❤️

My 12-year-old granddaughter loves this place. We only visited the amusement side this time, and while they have a nice selection of rides, from toddler to the thrill rides like the 140 ft drop, there were a surprising number of attractions that were closed. She has a season pass and mentioned that some had been closed for a long time. That was disappointing. I will give kudos to the staff as everyone we encountered was very friendly and outgoing and seemed to actually enjoy their job. There are plenty of places to rest in the shade and places to buy a drink. Parking is plentiful. I appreciated the senior rate of $32.95 as it was a $10 discount. If you are looking for a place to take the kids with a water feature and rides close to home, this is a nice option.
Old school fair feel. Perfect for family day and letting kids enjoy safe amusement rides. It was not crowded, and we felt safe compared to most amusement parks when taking kids.

name: Six Flags Over Georgia
address: 275 Riverside Pkwy, Austell, GA 30168, USA

reviews.text:
I had a lot of fun at Six Flags Over Georgia on Saturday (3/22), and my visit was honestly a mixed bag.

Firstly, the ride operations definitely need improvement. Some of the major coasters like Batman The Ride, Georgia Scorcher, and Twisted Cyclone, were running only one train very early in the day, leading to significantly long wait times. The Flash Pass queue management had left much to be desired. Even with the discount, the lines were STILL excessively long and the experience for many people wasn't as efficient as it should be, which CAN diminish the time-saving benefit.
Additionally, there were noticeable ride delays and breakdowns that could have been addressed much more efficiently, especially when you consider the frustration from the number of people waiting in line (regardless of whether or not they had a Flash Pass). I understand these things happen, but ride management would significantly benefit from a more diligent & proactive approach and better communication when handling these disruptions. Therefore, these solutions along with clearer updates would greatly improve the overall guest experience.

On the positive side, the weather was absolutely PERFECT and ideal for enjoying the rides - from the thrilling ones to the more family-friendly ones. It was fantastic to have such a great day for coaster riding, making it a comfortable day for everyone. The park itself was also noticeably clean, and the staff maintained a high level of cleanliness and professionalism (which is commendable). A huge shoutout to Guest Relations, who were incredibly kind, sincere, and attentive, and they listened to my concerns. The atmosphere was incredibly electric and exciting, especially since it was my birthday weekend!

OVERALL, this park has a lot of great potential and I'm glad that they're stepping it up. I had an amazing and memorable time due to the excellent weather, exciting atmosphere, clean park and friendly staff! I sincerely hope that Six Flags Over Georgia can address the ride operation and efficiency concerns that I've noticed AND maintain the positive atmosphere, high level of cleanliness and high level of customer service throughout the entire season.

Six flags is always a fun day. Six Flags Over Georgia is a clean, fun amusement park. The rides are fun. We used the fast pass, worth it! Easy to go from ride to ride. We enjoyed the VIP room. Short one star because some of the employees were extremely rude. My kids left the line at Catwoman after waiting there for 45min because they couldn't stand how the employees were yelling at and treating the people getting on and off the ride. They couldn't stand to watch it over and over again as people try to get on and off. Sad that 2 people can ruin it for everyone. They also don't have all the drink refill stations open yet, probably because it's the start of the season. Be aware of you by the cup, you may be waiting in a food line to refill. Quick, easy parking and entry into the park. Over all a clean park.

Having engaged in a lengthy pursuit of leisure at the esteemed establishment known as Six Flags Over Georgia, I find myself compelled to share the particulars of my recent expedition. This occasion, while marked by some measure of expectation, ultimately proved to be rather lackluster, indeed, akin to a rather ordinary affair.

Alas, the operations of the park were nothing short of disconcerting. It appears that the management may benefit from a more diligent approach to the orchestration of their attractions, for the overall experience left much to be desired. Perhaps it is my penchant for the extraordinary that renders this so grievous to my sensibilities. The anticipation that accompanied my visit was soon eclipsed by the disarray encountered amidst the attractions.

That said, one must commend the cleanliness of the park—it was maintained with a vigilance that is often hard to find in such establishments. The throngs of visitors, indicative of the park’s popularity, did create a vibrant atmosphere, yet one cannot help but feel that such busyness further compounded the operational challenges at hand.

Among the various amusements, the introduction of the Georgia Goldrusher stands as a notable highlight of this expedition. This new addition possesses a certain charm and is splendid in its execution, although I find myself wishing that they might consider omitting the spinning component; the thrill of such contrivance is rather lost upon me.

In summation, while I would earnestly encourage those who find themselves in the vicinity to pay a visit to this park, I opine that it does not warrant an extensive journey. My final judgment, after careful consideration of all factors—both the delightful and the disappointing—leads me to a rather modest appraisal of 6 out of 10. It is a harmonious blend of merriment and mediocrity, deserving of both patronage and critique in equal measure.

We have been before, but this trip was to see the holiday lights. We waited until after Christmas, Friday of the last weekend for the lights. It was not busy compared to our summer visit! We hardly had to wait in line for any of the rides, which was absolutely excellent for my teen who gets very anxious waiting in line for rides.

It did start drizzling some later in the evening, but everything stayed open and running until the rain got a little heavier. Then some rides had to close. However because we did not have to wait in line earlier, we got to ride everything that we had wanted to ride! It was a really fun afternoon.

We loved all of the holiday lights and decorations. They had a s'mores roasting station, some places serving hot cocoa, and even a North Pole area where you could play in fake snow and do some crafts if you wanted to.

Great experience.  First time in over 15 years.  We brought our kids (17, 8, and 4), all had plenty to do and loved it.  Food prices are high, but that was expected (we brought ours in a cooler, there are picnic tables near where the parking lot is).  Season tickets are affordable and there is safety officers/police officers throughout.  The staff followed the policies and it felt very much like they all were trained well.  They were not afraid to tell someone no but were not mean about it, very professional from what I had saw in the past. Mostly everything I saw was clean besides a few spills that had just happened.  Definitely recommended and will be back.

Wish the app had wait times like Disneys/Dollywood, but wait times were posted throughout the park.  The wait times were never that long.  It was all fine, there were some kinks with rides and maintenance but now is the time to work those out.

name: Wild Adventures
address: 3766 Old Clyattville Rd, Valdosta, GA 31601, USA

reviews.text: There are some great rides here for the thrill seekers, but my advice is to not go during Fall like we did. Many of the rides were closed. My advice, go in summer when the water park is also open. Get a season pass if you love close by and use that, because they are good value for return visits. The Christmas light spectacular is also wonderful looking. A really great place for young children with lots of options for them.

This place is truly a hidden gem. I’ve gone here since I was a child and now I’m happy to take my children. It has rides and attractions for all ages to enjoy. It’s clean and it’s easy to pick a time to avoid the crowds. If you want to go to a top quality park and not spend the whole day waiting in lines, this is the place to go.

I went on a Saturday between 12pm and 2pm. No wait to get inside and the ride lines didn't take long either. Most people arrived in the evening. I'm assuming because of the holiday decor and lights. They were beautiful. I had a blast. It was my 1st time there.

Getting in was no problem. We did find a parking spot the second time around! All the workers were friendly and helpful but the sodas at Safari Burger were $5 a piece with no lids and no straws. The fireworks were worth the 4-hr drive to and from Sopchoppy, FL. We enjoyed it very much.
Took my 4 kids for the first weekend of the Christmas lights, beautiful and had a great time, three of us live close so just bought season passes! Excited since i just moved here.

name: Roaring Springs Water Park
address: 400 W Overland Rd, Meridian, ID 83642, USA

reviews.text: Lots of family fun and experiences at this water park and fun zone. We go back every year and have a blast. Very affordable for families and yearly pass options available. This water park is safe and fun for the entire family with lots of workers and a clean atmosphere. Enjoy the watersides and the lazy river.

It's a great park, a good size and has great staff. It's all pavement - no real trees or grass, a bit like a parking lot and right next to the highway. I came for Slide Nights, which is definitely the way to go to save money and time. It's only $20 for 6-10 pm on Friday and Saturday nights in the summer if you bring a coke can or use the promo code on the website - they tell you exactly what to put in. The regular park hours go until 8 pm, so if it's been a hot day, I'd wait to arrive until 8 pm for the crowds to really disappear. I arrived at 6 pm and still rode everything I wanted to, twice, within 2 hours.

Now, I only did the tube slides, the lazy river, and the wave pool, but the kids areas looked nice, especially the Idaho-themed splash tower. I don't get the "class 5 canyon" lazy river with waves. They offer a kick-board to lean on but you can't really ride the waves that way and any adult will immediately sink one (and they don't let you stack them up.) It would be much more enjoyable with tubes. Otherwise, everything looks great.

Cool place to chill out with family. Good eating options, not a lot of vegetarian options but one can survive on options available. This is a smaller park area wise than other water parks, which is good so you need not have to walk a lot from one attraction to another. I also liked their spectator option so you can pay only half of the fee if you are not going into the water, but just going for taking care of kids. They also have a lot of sitting areas under shade. I went on a Monday so its not too crowded.

Super fun waterpark for everyone! The avalanche was really fun. They have slides from relaxed to intense. The area for kids to play is really nice. They serve food like dip and dots, corn dogs, shaved iced and more. The staff have been nice every time we have gone. We purchased the season passes and are glad we did.

Kids love it. Food is just okay, but what do you expect from a water park. We’ve gotten a cabana both times we’ve gone and it’s so nice to have a shady spot with comfy chairs and couches plus a table, a locker for your valuables and a staff member assigned to helping you. We always had fresh water and never waited in line for food. Love the expansion, our cabana was right along the brand new lazy river. Staff is friendly, helpful and they work hard! Younger generation of lifeguards and wait staff and all were BUSY! I never saw a single one of them standing around doing nothing. They search your bags for food (annoying, but it’s the rules) and the pavement is hard to walk on for hours in bare feet… but I am old. 😆 It’s pricey, even without a cabana, so we we only go once a year and stay open to close. Overall we feel VERY fortunate to have a wonderful waterpark nearby!

name: Silverwood Theme Park
address: 27843 US-95, Athol, ID 83801, USA

reviews.text: Visited last summer and had a great time here. Tremors blew me away its a really good ride while Timber Terror blew out my back that one maybe could use a retracking but the park is still fantastic overall and is really clean. I also recommend doing the train ride its long and is a fun ride.

We had a great time at Silverwood Theme Park right before school started for us. There’s two parks. Once you get through the main gate you can go to the amusement park side or the water park side. The first time ever visiting it was packed. We started off at the water park right at opening time. We claimed some seats to set our stuff and wandered around. We spent a lot of time in lines for water attractions. If you don’t like to wait in line you can go to the wave pool, ride a tube around the lazy river, or go to a toddler area to watch your little one run around. After playing at the water park we went to the amusement park side. On this side there’s many rollercoasters and also some small rides for toddlers. The next day we had a better understanding of it all. My son and I went and dropped off our towels and headed towards the most popular attractions right off the bat! Our second day it was cold and rainy. We froze, but the bright side of it all was there wasn’t any lines! We went down all the rides several times. We got our moneys worth on our final day! Next time maybe I’ll wear a wet suit and choose a rainy day again! No lines!

Silverwood was good for spending time with family and kids. Time approximately for waiting in water areas around 60-80 minutes. Most staff are young teenagers and friendly. But food is not good at all. Sugars everywhere. Don’t try to find healthy food : rice , pasta or salad. Unfortunately there isn’t much variety of food. Be prepared for your own.

What an awesome place! We stayed at the campground and had so much fun that we ended up staying an extra day. Very clean safe and friendly environment. The staff was overly friendly and happy to have customers.

Took some drone photos before we took off for the day!

This was our first trip here! It was amazing for $367.00 It got us into the park two days in a row. It was well worth the money.All of the rides were a blast and the lines shockingly were not very long. I love the way they have little mister spots throughout the park.To keep you a little bit cool. You aren't allowed to bring big coolers in, but you are allowed to bring some bags and littler coolers, so that helps a lot. There were a couple lines that were a little longer and took a minute to get through, but out of all of the rides they have there, it wasn't, that bad. The ones that were along for the most part.You didn't have to wait in line very long. We booked it last minute. We were going to not go, but it was well worth it.And i'm glad we went. I can't wait to go visit again!

name: Bengtson's Pumpkin Farm and Fall Fest
address: 13341 W 151st St, Homer Glen, IL 60491, USA

reviews.text:
My husband and I went for the first time earlier this month. It was amazing. The price is worth all the attractions. Bengtson’s petting zoo was my absolute favorite. I loved all the cute animals especially the baby goats.
We went early morning. It was perfect. Very short lines and the weather was beautiful.
Food was delicious! I recommend taking some apple cider donuts, strawberry jelly jar, and popcorn home. Everything tastes so fresh.
On top of the wonderful experience, everyone was welcoming and kind.
We will definitely be visiting again.

Bengtson’s Pumpkin Farm is the perfect autumn escape! 🍁🎃🍂 From their beautifully laid-out pumpkin patches to family-friendly rides and attractions, the farm has something for everyone. The food options are fantastic (don’t miss the apple cider donuts!), and the farm is set up with photo-worthy spots at every turn. Whether you’re picking out the perfect pumpkin or enjoying the petting zoo, it’s a charming spot to make memories. Highly recommend it for a cozy fall day out!

It was such an amazing experience. Everything is super cute and kid friendly. Loved that they had different food options usually it’s just sweets and coffee but I really enjoyed the food options. The donuts were amazing. I would really recommend this place and be definitely go there again next year.

10/10 recommend visiting Bengtson’s Pumpkin Farm each fall. They are your one stop shop for fall fun! Pumpkins, the BEST apple cider donuts, rides, so many cute farm animals, a massive corn pit, and so much more! We visit each season and always have the best time. The tractor town ride is my favorite! 🎃

We had a great time last Sunday! Kids had fun and the place is really worth visiting. Minuses: very long lines, some of them took us 30-40 min. But we came early and visited some spots we wanted with mostly no lines.
Would be great to mark parking raws somehow (like raw 1 or A), I spent too much time to find my car in the evening. Recommend to visit!

name: Grady's Family Fun Park
address: 1501 Morrissey Dr, Bloomington, IL 61701, USA

reviews.text: If you nothing to do in Bloomington, you can enjoy the place. They have good mini golf area and small go kart track. Mostly never crowded. They have multiple rides, tried spider ride was fun. Both adults and kids can enjoy the rides
It's fun enjoyed ourselves lots of smiles the whole time. We only did the rides not the batting cage or golf.  Per ticket is expensive so you might want to get a band.

This is a really great family time. Rides, arcade, go carts, bumper boats, batting cages, mini golf, and more. Parking is tight for bigger vehicles/trucks. They are understaffed, but workers are very courteous and friendly.

Best family park for kids in town.
Affordable price.

My kid loves this place.
2$ per ride for kids
4$ per ride for adults.

If you are in Bloomington-Normal then it’s must visit with kids.

Highly recommend this place, kiddos had a blast, I'm glad I decided to stop! We loved the bummer cars, the tornado, the bummer boats btw they spray water, the bigger rollercoaster kids liked alot! Will be planning a second trip

name: Malibu Jack's Lafayette
address: 2415 Sagamore Pkwy S, Lafayette, IN 47905, USA

reviews.text: I used to really enjoy bringing my kids here, but lately, it seems like the toddler and jump areas aren’t being thoroughly cleaned. Since small children play there, the equipment should be regularly sanitized. There’s a $10 fee to enter, which would feel more worthwhile if the area were properly vacuumed, dusted, and maintained. I hope management considers hiring night staff for cleaning. Also, several of the games are out of order and could use some repairs. We do like the place it just needs a little attention and care.

Before I start, I will say that the negative experience we had was reconciled with management in the right way. But I’m still going to point it out because it was our one & only experience of this place so I’m not sure if it’s the norm or not.

This is a fun place and has the potential for a fantastic day with friends/family.

Unfortunately, we were limited on what could be experienced because over half of the rides were shut down and over half of the games didn’t work due to a “glitch in the system” at customer service. We chose this place to come from out of town to meet friends who also traveled from out of town so we were bummed & felt our time was kind of wasted, esp for being the middle of a weekend day. We were unable to do go-karts or bumper cars because they were shut down. The bar was closed for the day and we were told we were limited on what we could get from the food/drink area. Our kids played games but when we went to redeem our tickets, the system said we didn’t have any. Again, very sad kiddos for a fun day at the arcade. We all had a blast during laser tag but we were told we had to wait 30min before we could play? It made no sense since there were only a handful of people in the whole place while we were there and no one went in or out of the laser complex while we waited. Overall, we’d try it again but for what you pay, I expect everything to be up & running correctly.

The Malibu Jack Lafayette team was absolutely incredible. They helped every step of the way making my son’s birthday the best experience possible. We can’t wait to make a tradition of this! Thank you MJ team we appreciate you!!

Family members from different parts of Indiana came to have a Christmas party event.  It was a hit for all ages! The Holiday package with meal and 4 hours of unlimited play time was perfect for our group.

My boys just had the best night of their lives—core memories were made for sure!!! This place has every fun thing you could ever want to do as a family! It is truly awesome!!! The palm trees and waterfall are a whole vibe, too. We had a small issue, and Nequila (and her manager that was working, but I didn’t catch her name) went above and beyond to fix the issue. She made our night, and she and her manager just ensured our future business.

name: Santa’s Village Amusement & Water Park
address: 601 Dundee Ave, East Dundee, IL 60118, USA

reviews.text:
the place is old but it is a great attraction for the kids, it got a little of everything for all ages(kid)

$27.99 per person

$69.99 season pass (if you come 2.5 or 3 times a season it is worth it) also come with discount for food/drink, birthday and other events promotion

We came here 2018 and 2019, they welcomed ppl bringing their food to picnic but when we came here in 2024 no longer let you bring cooler, food.  They do allow kid snack and a water bottle person.

We normally there about 3hrs, got to play about 50% of the rides.  The lines are not bad at all!  Most of them you should get on it immediately or wait a turn…there are some it maybe 2-3 turns but those are worth the time!

Growing up as a kid my family would come here yearly and I’m happy they reopened it and now I’m able to bring my grandsons and nieces. The memories I have from this place are priceless and now my grandkids will have their very own memories. Love how they’ve expanded the waterpark and hope it continues to grow. The petting zoo is perfect for the kids and they love being able to interact with the animals. It’s busy on the weekends and I highly recommend purchasing your ticket online. They have a few vendors but nothing to brag about and you’re able to bring a cooler with certain items so check their websites for the rules and regulations as they tend to change.

This place was absolutely worth it. If you are thinking GO. The kids had so much fun during fall fest, can't give you insight to the water park, it didn't look that big but they had paintballing which looked fun but we didn't partake. This place is Good for the little kiddos and the donuts were fresh and apple cider was the 💣 10/10 recommend so much to do we literally went from 11-5 and surprisingly couldn't believe we did everything in that time frame and more than once. Would def come back looking forward to it, we even saw Santa!
Christmas lights drive thru was fun and entertaining for my sister's dog as well. You can't bring dogs into the park but we were fine with the car viewing .

The coolest thing about this place is that they have original rides from way back in the day for the little ones. There is literally a ride for all my kids ages and pretty much all 3 of my kids got away with riding everything together (that I was able to fit on too)..otherwise my 10yo was able to bring the toddler on rides with her. Ages 2, 5 and 10 it was a blast. VERY expensive and not practical at all. It's similar to the cost of six flags and for a local amusement park I wish it was a little cheaper so we could go more often. It's always clean there too.

name: Scene75 Entertainment Center I Columbus
address: 5033 Tuttle Crossing Blvd, Columbus, OH 43016, USA

reviews.text:
Decided to have some fun during the middle of the week because we prefer less of a crowd, which was nice. Putt-putt golf was neat. Had a great variety of games & go carts were cool. Love the bumper cars in the back. Unfortunately the coaster was down so we couldn't try that. Employees were friendly. There is a concession area to get a snack or drink for the kids. We plan on visiting again!

Update: We visited on a Sunday evening & it was busy with limited staff who seemed a bit over worked & annoyed, dirty restrooms. Concession stand ran out of some food. They did have security. Escalator was still unavailable to use from a few weeks ago.

This was an awesome place to bring my toddler he enjoyed himself a lot he actually cried because we had to leave. I wish they would open up a location in Indianapolis. That would be awesome 👌🏾 for $25 .
My son played games for almost 1 hr. This is also a great place to have birthday 🎂 parties 🥳 or any kind of celebration 🍾

Amazing family entertainment center, with two levels full of all kind of games, attractions, and arcades. We had a blast at Laser-tag, go-karts, mini-golf, and beer-bee (throwing frisbee with a drink on the other hand). They have all kind of arcades, all entertaining and fun. There is also a full bar and restaurant onsite. Everyone was so friendly. I would definitely return.

I took my 2 boys ages 8 and 6 yesterday and they had a blast. We were there for 4 hours and still didn't do everything.  The prices are not bad at all for all the attractions like go karts, Bumper cars, roller coaster, laser tag, drop zone, and a whole lot lore. I will say the arcade will eat your money up the machines isn't over priced there is just so many machines that I kept reloading. I will not do that when we go again. We have went to urban air, get air, magic mountain,  chuckle cheese, ect, and this was the best place

Took a group of 20 and 30 year olds who wanted to feel like kids again and everyone had a great time!

We were able to do go carts, roller coaster, 4 rounds of Lazer tag (our favorite!) and even got some bumper cars in at the end of our 1.5 hour session! Definitely worth the price compared to other venues and the staff was awesome as well. Overall highly recommend whether you're 9, 29, or 49 years old!

name: Six Flags Great America
address: 1 Great America Parkway, Gurnee, IL 60031, USA

reviews.text:
I recently visited Six Flags America and had an amazing time! The variety of rides is fantastic, catering to all thrill-seekers and families alike.

The park was clean and well-maintained, and the staff were friendly and helpful throughout the day. There are plenty of dining options, and I found the food to be surprisingly good for a theme park.

The atmosphere was vibrant, with plenty of entertainment and activities to keep everyone engaged.

Overall, Six Flags America exceeded my expectations. It’s a perfect destination for a fun-filled day with friends or family. I can’t wait to go back!

We went for Freightfest what a great time! Entertainment was wonderful and so much fun. Food was delicious. Now the bad lines were ridiculous. We bought the next year season pass with the drink plan that was supposed to include the rest of this year... we could not get the drink plan to activate I was sent to customer service 3 times finally a young lady just gave me the cups. My son who is nearly 22 was denied alcohol because she said his ID went the wrong direction??? She said the birthday doesn't matter??? So that ruined all plans of having drinks.  She was rude and barely spoke English.

Pretty park. Despite the huge crowds for their haunted event,they worked hard to keep the park clean and did a good job for the most part. They're adding another roller coaster so this meant that there's an entire area we cannot through which unfortunately holds another coaster. But we were able to ride all the others this past Saturday. We had the all day dining plan which meant we got to sample a good bit of food here. Sadly,they closed their large indoor seating restaurant over an hour and a half early ,and several others as well. That's not ok especially since there's no posted times that they close on the restaurants. This park have very little markings as to where you find things. We observed many spots where they could've placed the newer screens that have maps on them,or sign posts with arrows pointing which direction you'd find rides,restaurants, shops or shows. That's truly frustrating to newcomers.  There's not 1 single automatic door in this park. So if handicapped people do not have a person with them they have to struggle to open doors,and that's really frustrating and embarrassing. All of the exits om each roller coaster is WAY too long,and all but the last few newer ones,they're way too narrow. This park seriously needs to do a LOT of work to be more handicap accessible. Their 1 coaster ,the whizzer,doesn't even have a ramp or loft of any kind for accessibility! But I'll say this,the ride operations here were leagues above the 6 other six flags parks We've visited. Especially at raging bull and Viper. WONDERFUL  crews there this past Saturday November 2. Six flags' policy of charging extra for their haunted attractions is also complete nonsense.  It isn't right.
I'm hoping with the recent merger with cedar fair that the six flags parks can be improved to a better over all park experience exper. This one was the best out of all 7 six flags we've visited for sure.

I am a huge thrill seeker and I can confidently say that this park is one of my favorite places in America! HUGE rides but also some family friendly rides too if going upside down isn’t your thing. I love it here and come every year. I recommend getting flash passes to get the most out of your day and also check out fright fest when Halloween comes around

I enjoy coming here and especially during fright fest. I have a season pass which is such a great gift for someone if you don’t know what to get them- and they have a variety of rides I suggest going in the morning because lines can have a hour wait time sometimes especially during fright fest season.

name: Holiday World & Splashin' Safari
address: 452 E Christmas Blvd, Santa Claus, IN 47579, USA

reviews.text: Absolute best place ever. I am 12 and I have  been going here with my family as long as I can remember. I have never had a bad visit, the roller coasters are so unique and fun. The water park will have you swimming all day, and the fact that there are AIR CONDITIONED stations with completely free drinks makes the experience so much better. Along with free sunscreen. I highly suggest going, and i can almost guarantee you will have a great time.

Holiday World & Splashin' Safari: A Fantastic Weekend Getaway

I visited Holiday World at the end of August for a weekend getaway and had an overall great experience. We purchased tickets online for Saturday and ended up buying additional tickets at the park for Sunday.

The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful throughout our visit, which really enhanced the experience. However, because the park is closed during the week in August, Saturday was extremely busy. We arrived about 30 minutes after the park opened, and the parking lot was already full—a mistake on our part. Due to the long lines, we only had time to ride four water attractions that day.

Sunday was a different story. We arrived 30 minutes before the park opened and were among the first in line to enter. This made a huge difference! We were able to ride The Voyage twice, The Thunderbird three times, and then we changed into our swimwear to enjoy the water rides. The park has lockers available, which made storing our belongings convenient.

The variety of things to do is truly endless. From the rides to the gift shops and dining options, there’s something for everyone. Although we didn’t eat inside the park, it was great that we could pack a cooler and return to our vehicle for meals, as re-entry is allowed. Another standout feature is the unlimited free soft drinks, including water, which adds great value to the visit.

It was an amazing experience for the whole family. My kids had a blast, and we’re already looking forward to returning in the

They also serve adult beverages 🍻

A Jolly Good Time at Holiday World!

Stepping into Holiday World in the enchanting town of Santa Claus, Indiana, felt like diving into a year-long holiday celebration! My family and I had a blast wandering through lands dedicated to Christmas, Halloween, 4th of July, and Thanksgiving, each one bursting with festive spirit, holiday music, and delightful themed rides.

Starting in Christmas Land, we were greeted by the familiar jingle of holiday tunes and towering, twinkling trees that made us feel like it was December—even in the heat of July! Halloween Land was spooky fun, with eerie decorations and thrilling rides that got our adrenaline pumping. When we reached the patriotic vibes of the 4th of July section, we couldn’t resist waving imaginary sparklers and enjoying a few “red, white, and blue” treats. Thanksgiving Land, of course, served up classic autumnal decor and a few delicious pumpkin-flavored treats.

Now, let's talk food. While not quite what you'd expect from a holiday feast, it was enough to keep us fueled as we ran from ride to ride. But no complaints here—we were way too busy exploring each land's attractions to notice!

The star of our day was the Cheetah Chase in the water park! It’s honestly the most exhilarating water ride I’ve ever been on, with twists and turns that had us laughing, screaming, and bonding all at once. The kids and I couldn't get enough, racing down the slides with pure joy.

To top it off, the Christmas-themed stores just outside the park kept the holiday magic going a bit longer. We wandered through aisles of ornaments and festive knick-knacks, feeling the spirit of the season long after we left the gates. Holiday World delivered a unique, fun-filled day that left us tired, happy, and just a little bit festive all over

Great place for a family getaway. I was really surprised at how clean the park was. It was well kept, something for everyone. I definitely recommend getting a locker for the day. It just makes life easier. There will definitely be lines, so plan ahead. Food options are decent, and they have multiple buildings to get out of the heat. Having unlimited and free (nonalcoholic) drinks around the park is a plus. Alcohol is available for purchase by responsible adults. All the lifeguards I saw there were attentive and professional. No complaints. Thanks!
Beautiful park. Very clean. Hills are a little rough to walk but can be accomplished. Gluten-free food options are limited, but it kept me safe....no adverse reaction.

name: Indiana Beach
address: 2371 Untalulti Dr, Monticello, IN 47960, USA

reviews.text: Is it dated? Yes. That is the appeal. It has a hometown feel. I have many memories here. Is everything perfect? No. Is it affordable for the price yes. Would I recommend traveling over 3 hours for it? No. But I love this place. My kids ride until they can't ride anymore. No 3 hour waits. Lots of rides for shorter children as well. It's safe. Parking is easy if your legs work well. We tailgate. We snack inside. We close it down sometimes. We open it up sometimes. We bring friends. Don't plan on getting a decent cup of coffee. Bar across the street makes Amazing pizza. Plan on tailgating for lunch in the huge grassy parking area and get a relaxing break and hit it again. Every ride will not be open at all times. It's a rural area and I think employees rotate. Just go with the flow and enjoy.

The reason for 4 stars is the value. For $21 there's a lot to do. If it cost much more than that, the rating would drop.

Overall this place needs a lot of work. It's not a show piece and is a bit rundown. The food options aren't great, it's all the standard fair food. They need something to help elevate that.

The rides are good and what bring the rating so high. Is relatively inexpensive for a family to spend all day and night here. Splash pad and water slides are fun for the younger kids along with a kiddie land section for the young ones. My youngest was obsessed with the carp feeding area.

This was the second time being there. It was definitely busy this time in a good way however the line for the rides were long. Still wasn't able to get a ride on the Hoosier Hurricane and get that coaster credit maybe next time. This park has a old school charm that you don't find at most other parks and that's what is good about it. And how could I forget to mention the food, the food in this place is awesome and worth the time to go. We'll be back again and hopefully I'll be able to get that coaster credit.

Great family fun.   Great prices for entrance and food.   Fun rides.
This yr everything was open. Fresh paint, lots of stuff fixed.  Lifeguards seemed to be watching.  Looks a lot better

Horrible experience! We were charged full price for Labor Day weekend, but most of the waterpark was closed. They stated they were short lifeguards; however we counted 10 in a small area. 5 for half the lazy river (yes, half was closed) and another 5 sitting around the pool. The open swim area only allowed people to walk out 5 feet. Never again. Pictures of all the water coasters closed down and the 5 feet to swim. The park should have been prepared for a holiday weekend!

name: Lark Ranch
address: 3145 Killion Ml Rd, Loogootee, IN 47553, USA

reviews.text: We had a great family outing at Lark Ranch. Nothing but positive things to say about the workers. All were very nice and willing to assist with any questions or help we needed. The food was great and quickly made. Will definitely be back!
This place is the best fall time experience for your family!!!! I had so much fun I forgot to take photos 🤦‍♂️

After spending our second year at Lark Ranch, we will still continue to visit this place every fall. There is so much to do it makes it well worth the price. The kids love it. Highly, highly recommend.

We visited the ranch on 12/8/2024 for the Christmas in the country. We had an amazing time I had 2 16 year olds with me and there was something for everyone. The decorations and lights were so beautiful. I would recommend you go out and visit the ranch it will definitely get you in the Christmas  spirit.
Our favorite place to spend our weekends in October.  You won’t be disappointed.  Although we do miss the Kids zip line :)

name: Malibu Jack's Lafayette
address: 2415 Sagamore Pkwy S, Lafayette, IN 47905, USA

reviews.text: I used to really enjoy bringing my kids here, but lately, it seems like the toddler and jump areas aren’t being thoroughly cleaned. Since small children play there, the equipment should be regularly sanitized. There’s a $10 fee to enter, which would feel more worthwhile if the area were properly vacuumed, dusted, and maintained. I hope management considers hiring night staff for cleaning. Also, several of the games are out of order and could use some repairs. We do like the place it just needs a little attention and care.

Before I start, I will say that the negative experience we had was reconciled with management in the right way. But I’m still going to point it out because it was our one & only experience of this place so I’m not sure if it’s the norm or not.

This is a fun place and has the potential for a fantastic day with friends/family.

Unfortunately, we were limited on what could be experienced because over half of the rides were shut down and over half of the games didn’t work due to a “glitch in the system” at customer service. We chose this place to come from out of town to meet friends who also traveled from out of town so we were bummed & felt our time was kind of wasted, esp for being the middle of a weekend day. We were unable to do go-karts or bumper cars because they were shut down. The bar was closed for the day and we were told we were limited on what we could get from the food/drink area. Our kids played games but when we went to redeem our tickets, the system said we didn’t have any. Again, very sad kiddos for a fun day at the arcade. We all had a blast during laser tag but we were told we had to wait 30min before we could play? It made no sense since there were only a handful of people in the whole place while we were there and no one went in or out of the laser complex while we waited. Overall, we’d try it again but for what you pay, I expect everything to be up & running correctly.

The Malibu Jack Lafayette team was absolutely incredible. They helped every step of the way making my son’s birthday the best experience possible. We can’t wait to make a tradition of this! Thank you MJ team we appreciate you!!

Family members from different parts of Indiana came to have a Christmas party event.  It was a hit for all ages! The Holiday package with meal and 4 hours of unlimited play time was perfect for our group.

My boys just had the best night of their lives—core memories were made for sure!!! This place has every fun thing you could ever want to do as a family! It is truly awesome!!! The palm trees and waterfall are a whole vibe, too. We had a small issue, and Nequila (and her manager that was working, but I didn’t catch her name) went above and beyond to fix the issue. She made our night, and she and her manager just ensured our future business.

name: Adventureland
address: 2245 Broadhollow Rd, Farmingdale, NY 11735, USA

reviews.text: Not a bad place to visit especially since it’s in Long Island. Not a lot of ethnic diversity either to be honest but still pretty friendly. This place is mainly for kids aged 4-10 years. Lots of kiddie rides and height restrictions like 44-48 inches in order to ride alone or at least with an adult 18+ years of age. Lots of classic carnival games to play like ring toss, basketball shot, water pistol shooter etc with tons of prizes for choose from winning which it should since it is an amusement park. Food is also ok but pricing could use a little adjusting. Plenty of car parking around and they even have special events and conditions for birthday rentals. Bumper cars were kind of boring and the arcades could use a lot more variety in games. Overall I did like the park but gave it 3 star because it reminded me of a much less mundane version of 6 flags. The wait times were the best part as I managed to get through the whole park in 2 hours. Summer time maybe much busier so I can’t really say for certain but this place does have its moments. Some of the rides was actually inspired by 6 flags like the fireball or tornado. The day pass was $40 and came with a silver wristband which looked pretty nice. Bunch of places to take pictures and make memories.

This is a Good spot to bring the kids, this is one of those go here to kill some time adventure parks. The rides are good, atmosphere is good, park is clean, bathrooms are maintained, food and drink are a bit more pricey then u would want, but since it’s the only spot, u got no choice. still worth it and will definitely be returning

Came here Sunday for a birthday party always have a good time at Adventureland. This is a Long Island staple it has definitely gotten better over the years. The rides are fun for all ages. The games are fun as well but a little pricey. the security guard Bob was wonderful very nice and welcoming. My only gripe is at the food. Isn’t the best in my opinion could use some work other than that I’d recommend family coming here to spend the day or even if you wanna have a birthday party this is a great location.

Season pass holder for the past 3 years to take my now 6-year old son during summer time. A lot of fun rides: bumper car, rescue boat, Ferris wheel, to name a few. They also have a nice indoor arcade with claw machines, video games, etc. Nice place to spend a day with kids.

name: Arnolds Park Amusement Park
address: 37 Lake St, Arnolds Park, IA 51331, USA

reviews.text: Went here last June and its a small park but its something fun to do in the area plus its right on the lake. If you got a good 3 hours to spend this is something you got to try

The most amazing place for all ages! We’ve taken our children there for years and now living in the immediate we are taking our grandkids there all the time. All the staff there are exceptionally friendly and the park and surrounding facilities are alway clean and inviting. We are looking forward to 2025!

The lake front at Arnold’s Park in Okoboji, Iowa is a beautiful spot to visit. They have a wonderful walkway and the views of the lake are spectacular.
They new Art sculptures are beautiful.
A very family friendly place to visit.

Lovely for cruises,  Lovely for family time,  Lovely for getaways, Lovely everything !!!!!!!! ❤️ parking is great, the atmosphere is amazing!!!!!! Beautiful water, the scenery is sensational absolutely gorgeous 😍 ❤️ ✨️ 💕
Great little amusement park and pier, you can catch a boat ride to go out on the lake or sit and take in the sites and feel the cool breeze off the water.

name: Lost Island Themepark
address: 2600 E Shaulis Rd, Waterloo, IA 50701, USA

reviews.text:
Me and my group had a lot of Fun!
Been wanting to explore this park since opening day.

However, the roller coasters were really rough. My back and shoulders hurt really bad after them. They were also really quick like 1-1.5 mins max.

Almost no shade kinda sucks but I understand because it's still new. The characters were so fun! Love the aspect of the park.

Food was good! Somewhat reasonable it's alright. Love the indoor spaces for them.

The dark ride was awesome was nice to experience an interactive ride like that in the Midwest.

Overall would recommend a vist definitely worth it!!! Needs some work but hey no where is perfect. Will be back in 2025!

What an amazing theme park! This park easily has the best theming outside of Disney and Universal. The story is well-crafted and is carried through in the details found in each of the park's lands - from the lampposts to the concrete treatments and the music. There's a nice variety of rides. When we visited (on a Saturday in August), the park was uncrowded and there was virtually no wait for any of the attractions. The park is clean and well-landscaped. Food prices were reasonable. We'll be back - hopefully to ride the carousel and new roller coaster advertised as coming in 2025!

We had so much fun & I can’t believe this place is in Iowa. My 4 year old had an absolute blast on so many rides and the characters were amazing; my child has autism & can sometimes be both standoffish & at other times far too close & the characters not only stayed in character but they were so sweet and patient. So much to do, the food was delicious, ride operators were thorough with ensuring safety & were very kind. Nothing but the best things to say about it. I do hope they continue to do more promotions like the Friday nights to help get more people in our area out there to see the magic!

Went here for our first family vacation and it was amazing! Staff was friendly and welcoming, as well as meticulous about safety.
This park isn't as well known as its water park, so there were zero lines. Every ride was a walk on, which worked out really well for our multiple autistic kids.
Immediately when you walk in the thought that went into this park is evident, the different themed worlds are unique while still being cohesive with the rest of the park.
Everything is easily visible and I was able to let my older kid break off from the group occasionally to go ride rides the little ones couldn't.
The tamariki area is amazing for the little ones, my 2 year old was able to do all but 2 of the rides (with an adult)
We are already planning next summers trip back, it was well worth the 5 hour drive from Wisconsin!
We hope the theme park gets more business so they can stay open, it really is a fantastic park for all ages & abilities.

Our family truly enjoyed our visit to Lost Island Theme Park!! There was plenty to do for the adults and older kids and also for the younger one (age 9 but plenty for littler ones too). It was fun and interactive with characters walking around and all the staff was great and friendly! Our favorites were the bumper cars and roller coasters. Also ate lunch (they have two indoor restaurant places) and food was good and quick to get! Lots of bathrooms and water fountains throughout the park as well. Everything was clean and the whole family had fun! We went on a Tuesday so hardly any lines but everything was open and ready for us to ride.

name: Malibu Jack's Lafayette
address: 2415 Sagamore Pkwy S, Lafayette, IN 47905, USA

reviews.text: I used to really enjoy bringing my kids here, but lately, it seems like the toddler and jump areas aren’t being thoroughly cleaned. Since small children play there, the equipment should be regularly sanitized. There’s a $10 fee to enter, which would feel more worthwhile if the area were properly vacuumed, dusted, and maintained. This is a fun place and has the potential for a fantastic day with friends/family.

It made no sense since there were only a handful of people in the whole place while we were there and no one went in or out of the laser complex while we waited. The Malibu Jack Lafayette team was absolutely incredible. They helped every step of the way making my son’s birthday the best experience possible. We can’t wait to make a tradition of this! Thank you MJ team we appreciate you!!

Family members from different parts of Indiana came to have a Christmas party event.  It was a hit for all ages! The Holiday package with meal and 4 hours of unlimited play time was perfect for our group.

My boys just had the best night of their lives—core memories were made for sure!!! This place has every fun thing you could ever want to do as a family! It is truly awesome!!! The palm trees and waterfall are a whole vibe, too. We had a small issue, and Nequila (and her manager that was working, but I didn’t catch her name) went above and beyond to fix the issue. She made our night, and she and her manager just ensured our future business.

name: All Star Sports
address: 8333 W 21st St, Wichita, KS 67205, USA

reviews.text: Amazing! Family friendly, for all ages! Some 30 min lines but over all worth it!

We had a great day playing with our kids. We went during the week so it was slow which meant we had zero lines. It was over 100 degrees and we went early. We got the pass for five activities. Our family loves racing on the go karts and my husband always wins. I asked the guy if he could hold him back to give the kids a chance to win. Our daughter won and it was awesome to see how happy she was. The only downside was the bumper boats only had four boats so we couldn’t all go together. We spent $200 for the day because I had a visa gift card to use up but you could easily spend less.

I took my grandkids here and I have to say if I didn't have a Groupon for the four of us I would have been really bummed with paying $22.95 a person online. The miniature golf course is fun although it has some rough patches, the employees are just there, they don't really seem outgoing or friendly except for the man at the beginning where you pay. The rock climbing no one had anything to say and they made my granddaughter do the toughest part because the two climbers couldn't be next to each other, it would have made sense to split them so they could enjoy it. Laser tag was fun but one gun stopped two minutes before the others, I told the employees but they didn't give a care, just doing a job. I would advise maybe putting money back into the business and training employees better.

Went there 4/8-2025 and walked in behind a group of black younger adults and the go carts were closed and they walked out. I started mini golfing and they were waiting outside for a ride and a manager came out side very aggressive with his hands up yelling for them to leave and they told him they were waiting for a ride and he kept yelling I immediately knew he was being very racist one of the men even said it’s because I’m black and once there ride showed up he finally calmed down. I just think that’s very disrespectful and for sure discrimination and racism. I was by them the whole time and they were never once disrespectful or anything to make him act like that besides pure racism

Great place for the whole family. The Inside is clean and tidy and most of the employees are friendly! Would highly recommend coming here and checking out the mini golf, I personally think it's the best in Wichita!

name: Mattel Adventure Park
address: 9601 Cardinals Way, Glendale, AZ 85305, USA

reviews.text:
This park isn't even open yet and somehow it's getting reviewed poorly and perfectly. Like all things to come patience is a virtue.

And for the negative Nancys get a grip on life for Pete’s sake.

Then again this is Arizona where people go 90 In the right lane and 60 in The ultra-fast lane.

To the people who are complaining that your children will be too old by the time it's built... Like it's Mattel's fault for not having it ready for your child at a certain age... That would be like Mattel telling your children to stop aging until it's built. 🤣

Imagine the reactions when they aren't tall enough to get on a ride.
I understand the hype of wanting it to open quickly but it's not going too so the kids will have to learn patients and understanding. I'm pretty sure age isn't going to be a huge factor for when it opens. People of all ages attend Disneyland and fairs. This will be no different.

It's fantastic to see the area grow and especially targeting children. I'm sure the price tag will be a bit high.But should be worth every penny. Matel and disney are kind of like marvel and Disney. You usually side with one. Disneyland has become so overpriced that you have to take out a second mortgage for a family of 4. Hopefully this will have deals for locals and time of year price drops. It's been exciting watching the build.

This place is great. My 3 kids ages 6, 11 and 14 all loved it. Low attendance so wasn’t crowded. Bring your own food and snacks because not too many places to eat. But I am sure they will provide more places to eat the more they build. I highly recommend going!

Honestly, I know so many people are waiting for this to open but, as a consumer, it fills me with so much joy to know that they’re taking all this time to ensure that everything is up to code and safety measures. I mean, why else would this not be open yet? Like, they have to be triple-checking everything down to the last micrometer to ensure our safety and wellbeing.

name: Beech Bend
address: 798 Beech Bend Park Rd, Bowling Green, KY 42101, USA

reviews.text: Went there for Camaro Fest, a 4 day event in August every year. It’s sooooo great, there’s drag races that you can race your own car, a drifting course, a chance to enter your car in a “Best in Show” competition. There’s venders for after market car parts and stuff, and there’s a few food trucks. So many great Camaros, all generations!!!!

The wooden roller coaster was so good and it was fast.  Went on it a few times.  Went to the water park that was nice as well.  The life guards paid  very close attention to their surroundings.  One of the older teenage kids was disorderly and I saw the water park manager talking to him in a calm manner and this kid was yelling at the mgr.  Great place and I'm glad we found it.

We had a blast !!
My only suggestion is to update your tubes and buy more. Also, we had our tubes constantly taken by others. We would have to wait on someone to give up there's.
We loved the option of amusement park and water park in one.
Drinks were very pricey.
I loved that they had free sunscreen, that was super nice.
We had a hard time finding seats.
Another dislike was the roughness of the floor in the lazy river. My son cut his knee on the floor.
But overall we had fun and will be going again next year.

Love this park. Very small, friendly vibes. Staff are friendly and you almost get to know them over the day. Stayed a few days here and we've came here 2 years in a row now all the way from NE Ohio. Great assortment of fun and unique rides. Kentucky Rumbler, of course, is the star of the show. There's not a bad seat on that coaster. Water park is pretty solid too. And you can't leave out the beautiful grass and tree shaded parking lot. Great way to beat the heat when you head to the car for a snack or picnic. Very pleased with this park. Wish we could've stayed to see the drag races.

Visited for Camaro Fest 2024. Awesome little park. Plenty of attractions on side, though we mainly visited the Drag Strip and the Road Course area. Can't wait to be back! Bathrooms were extremely clean and even air conditioned; awesome!

name: Kentucky Kingdom Theme & Water Park
address: 937 Phillips Ln, Louisville, KY 40209, USA

reviews.text: We Loved Christmas at the Kingdom!!!  So much fun... so many decorations and the snow tube hill was a blast... loved the old fashioned car ride & the Rudolph ride was fun!   The Spirit of the season show was particularly fun for our family... we loved the singing and the cast was fantastic!   Great time for the whole family!!!

This was a treat for my 8 year old twins. They had never been to Kentucky Kingdom, so, they got a little taste of what will come next summer. We had a blast and the park was gorgeous all lit up for Christmas. Just wish we could have gotten to everything. So little time, so much to do!😁

Visited Christmas at Kentucky Kingdom and had a great experience! Everything was decorated beautifully for the holidays, the Christmas cocktails were yummy and the snow tubing ride was (scary at first) but so fun! Will definitely go next year!

We went for the Christmas party and it was such a great time. The lines weren't long at all like in the summer season and most rides were open. Sledding was so much fun! Family friendly, plenty for all ages and wonderful accommodations.

Had a great time with my kids at the Christmas festivities at Kentucky Kingdom. The tubing hill was a lot of fun and hopefully something my kids will remember and look forward to doing again.  Great time for whole family.

name: Malibu Jack's Lafayette
address: 2415 Sagamore Pkwy S, Lafayette, IN 47905, USA

reviews.text: I used to really enjoy bringing my kids here, but lately, it seems like the toddler and jump areas aren’t being thoroughly cleaned. Since small children play there, the equipment should be regularly sanitized. There’s a $10 fee to enter, which would feel more worthwhile if the area were properly vacuumed, dusted, and maintained. I hope management considers hiring night staff for cleaning. Also, several of the games are out of order and could use some repairs. We do like the place it just needs a little attention and care.

Before I start, I will say that the negative experience we had was reconciled with management in the right way. But I’m still going to point it out because it was our one & only experience of this place so I’m not sure if it’s the norm or not.

This is a fun place and has the potential for a fantastic day with friends/family.

Unfortunately, we were limited on what could be experienced because over half of the rides were shut down and over half of the games didn’t work due to a “glitch in the system” at customer service. We chose this place to come from out of town to meet friends who also traveled from out of town so we were bummed & felt our time was kind of wasted, esp for being the middle of a weekend day. We were unable to do go-karts or bumper cars because they were shut down. The bar was closed for the day and we were told we were limited on what we could get from the food/drink area. Our kids played games but when we went to redeem our tickets, the system said we didn’t have any. Again, very sad kiddos for a fun day at the arcade. We all had a blast during laser tag but we were told we had to wait 30min before we could play? It made no sense since there were only a handful of people in the whole place while we were there and no one went in or out of the laser complex while we waited. Overall, we’d try it again but for what you pay, I expect everything to be up & running correctly.

The Malibu Jack Lafayette team was absolutely incredible. They helped every step of the way making my son’s birthday the best experience possible. We can’t wait to make a tradition of this! Thank you MJ team we appreciate you!!

Family members from different parts of Indiana came to have a Christmas party event.  It was a hit for all ages! The Holiday package with meal and 4 hours of unlimited play time was perfect for our group.

My boys just had the best night of their lives—core memories were made for sure!!! This place has every fun thing you could ever want to do as a family! It is truly awesome!!! The palm trees and waterfall are a whole vibe, too. We had a small issue, and Nequila (and her manager that was working, but I didn’t catch her name) went above and beyond to fix the issue. She made our night, and she and her manager just ensured our future business.

name: Blue Bayou Water Park
address: 18142 Perkins Rd E, Baton Rouge, LA 70810, USA

reviews.text: My wife and I took our children and grandchildren here for the 4th of July. Wheat early enjoyed it. My wife spent most of her time in the lazy river and the wave pool which she loved. I rode some of the rides with our children and grandchildren. They were a lot of fun! We had hot dogs and hamburgers at one of the cantina's. They were pretty good. I'm sure we will be going back next year.

Great water park, lots to do, fun for all ages. I went opening day this year, credit card machine was down but they got us through! Only recommendation is that they put some cover over the eye bolts sticking out of the ground in the first sled slide area. Food lines could use some assistance.

We Love our weekly trip to Blue Bayou!!! They are very accommodating and allow us to bring in fruit and veggies for us to have healthy snacks too!  They have plenty of places to have lunch at and they staff are very friendly.  I do wish that they had more bathrooms at the front of the park but that’s ok. My kid loves the rides and even said that he enjoys them almost as much as Disney rides;) the park is Very clean. The water is clean.

Pretty big water park.  The lazy river is a little too shallow.  You can only go around once with the park provided tubes.  And you have to ride in/on the tube. No free swimmers.  The wave pool was being worked on and closed. It had some nasty brown stuff all in the shallow end and some workers were trying to suck some stuff out of the deep end. That’s kind of a disappointment.  We came down from Jackson, MS with a Girl Scout troop.  No way to get your group inside until all are there.  Seems like you could have some sort of will call to help speed this part along.

We read the lemonade was good so we got some. And yes it’s good.   Cost 4 tickets (4 dollars). But seems reasonable for park food.

This place is falling apart. Some rides are very old and need lots of maintenance. Only about 50% of the attractions even run. Over priced. They don’t pay their employees enough to care about their job. And they also tell their employees to post fake reviews in order to boost their standing! Last time I went there they didn’t have the sprinklers on the side walks so if you were barefoot you got roasted!!

name: Carousel Gardens Amusement Park
address: 7 Victory Ave, New Orleans, LA 70124, USA

reviews.text: This place is magical, especially at Christmas time. They have discounted tickets midweeks. You must buy tickets in advance for a specific time slot for the driving tours.

Perspective is everything. To my seven-year-old, Carousel Gardens Amusement Park provided two hours of fun running from ride to ride. They sell pizza and ice cream. Kids love this place. (At least my seven-year-old did. However, in a few years, she'll outgrow the rides.)

To parents, this place is a great way to spend a few hours visiting City Park, but it comes with a price. It was $21 for our daughter and just over $12 per parent. However, once you pay, you get unlimited rides.

The rides themselves are old and run down, but the plus is there were no lines on a Sunday afternoon in April. It has clean restrooms and the train is a fun way to see a part of City Park.

Next door is Storyland, a storybook-themed playground that's free.

Amusement park at City Park reminds me so much of Central Park in NYC. If you’ve kids, there’s nothing like it in New Orleans ‘heaven’. I bought the Family season pass for 4 for $265 and have no regrets. Babies absolutely love it.
