Pay attention to the height chart, otherwise, a parent can always accompany a child almost on all the rides. Even an infant can go on 4 rides. Train, Ferris wheel, roller coaster, carousel garden etc are the highlights with 20+ Rides. They’re open from Thur - Sun from 11a-8p and I usually go on Sundays, when there’s no rush whatsoever. The staff consists of teenagers who are super friendly. I would highly recommend the Amusement park. And next door Storyland is also included with the season pass😊

I used to come here with my family as a child very often.. multiple times a year. This was my first time in 5 years and I enjoyed it so much! I felt like a kid again!!! The rides, the lights, the food, the music!!! It was AMAZING! SO MUCH FUN! My fiancé and I went twice this week!
The Carousel was great , it was fun and very clean but outside was a different story. The benches and tables were filthy.  The look place looked like it wasn't clean for a week.

name: Funtown Splashtown USA
address: 774 Portland Rd, Saco, ME 04072, USA

reviews.text:
This little amusement park/water park hits way above its league for big rides.

For coaster fans, the big draw is its CCI wooden coaster, Excalibur, the biggest roller coaster in Maine and one of the best woodies in New England. (I think it might actually be my personal favorite wooden coaster in the region, though it's not the biggest or most forceful.) There's some nice theming there--the station is themed like a castle, and the whole coaster lies beyond the "Camelot Bridge" through a peaceful wooded area. It's running fantastically well now, possibly thanks to a retracking involving Gravity Group's precut wooden track.

The other big-ticket rides in Funtown include a new and amazingly slick shooting dark ride through the very haunted "Whispering Pines Hotel"; a gigantic drop tower; New England's tallest log flume; and the "Astrosphere", an indoor Scrambler with atmospheric music, lights and projections. There are also go-karts included in park admission.

The layout of the place is kind of haphazard and I've heard that this can be a crowd control problem on busy days, but it was not an issue when I visited. The food I had there was not great, probably the park's biggest failing, and it's less well supplied with games and shows than some of the area's other amusement parks. But it's a surprisingly great place to go for big thrills given that it's such a little park.

As with some other small local parks in New England (but definitely not Six Flags), parking is free. Transit connections to the park, from what I can tell, aren't great. Amtrak actually goes to Saco but getting from the station to the park could be an issue.

Its water park, Splashtown, is quite big for the size of the park--I did not sample its attractions on my visit but my wife enjoyed the slides and pools. It's possible to buy individual admission to one or the other.

In terms of size, I'd compare the whole place to Canobie Lake Park in Salem, NH, except that relative to Canobie, there is less dry park and more water park, so the sizes are roughly equal. Its atmosphere isn't quite as nice as Canobie's on the whole. But the *big* rides here blow away anything at Canobie; I suspect they are less subject to neighborhood limits.

A nice little park with a great wooden coaster and amazing dark ride. The wild mouse says no single riders but they let me ride as I was alone.  I went after 3:00 and got my money’s worth in that time and saved money. Parking is free.

Great experience. Took kids 6 and 8 during the week and didn’t wait in many lines. There were several camps there (5 school busses full) but didn’t feel crowded. We spent almost the entire time at splashtown and we rented one of the cabanas they were amazing!

Awesome smaller amusement park. On June 24th we took our three girls ranging from 14 to 7, and we all had a blast.
We brought lunch with us to reduce some of the cost of the day. You can leave the park if you choose and come back as long as you still have your band.
The flow of the park is lovely and not overwhelming. The young staff was very friendly. The park was very clean and well kept.
Fair fees just under $60 per person, for the day (park is only opens for 8hrs).
Bring water! At $4 a bottle, on those hot days, it could add up fast.
We do plan on returning on our next yearly visit to Maine.

Have been going here every year since I was about 5. Always fun and I have to say, they do an amazing job with maintenance of the park. At always looks in good shape, clean, friendly staff, and well landscaped. There is something for all ages and we look forward to this every year! Glad they are still open!

name: Palace Playland
address: 1 Old Orchard St, Old Orchard Beach, ME 04064, USA

reviews.text: Very clean beach! Be aware though of shell shard and some glass sometime when people are not careful. The sand is very coarse / big grain.

Always a great family adventure!!! Rides are well maintained. There are some real thrill rides and a great choice of kiddie rides. Food galore for your bellies!!! If you want to ride several rides, your best bet is the All Day pass, aka Unlimited. Rides are pricey if you get the points instead of the pass, and you'll be out before you know it. Then, to unwind the beach is steps away. We go every year!

This is an amazing and fun place to take your family, friends, or kids, the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the prices are pretty steep especially when it comes to the games in the arcade.

If price isn't a problem for you it's $40 for a day pass per person to use all of the big games like the ferris wheel bumper karts and all of the main attractions.

The arcade is massive and full of awesome and fun games just like I said before a little steep on their prices especially if you have a whole family, but there's definitely some games you can play that will make the arcade card you purchase go a little further.

I probably only spent an hour in the arcade and I spent about $80 between me and my one friend.

I wish I could say more about the big attractions like the bumper karts etc but unfortunately I didn't purchase the day pass do to me just coming out of surgery on my hand and not wanting to hurt it.

There are still A few seaside amusement parks left, this is probably one of the best left.

Rides are extraordinarily well maintained and safe.

A huge arcade and plenty of the usual carnival games of chance are available.

One thing I should point out this area does actually have some particularly good beach food.

Amusement park right next to the ocean, that's something else!
They have some cool games and challenges for people of all ages.
Plenty of food and snack options for sure. You have to buy a card which you recharge to use on the games, the more you recharge the best deal you get 😉

name: York's Wild Kingdom
address: 1 Animal Park Rd, York, ME 03909, USA

reviews.text: YWK has been around since I was about 10 years old. I'm pretty sure my mom took me the first year it opened. Since then, I have taken my own children there, and for the past 2 years, my granddaughter. This year, we went on Labor Day 9/2, and it was so awesome!! She's 2 1/2 this year and absolutely loved it!! This is one of the very few amusement places that have rides for little kids like her. (Funtown does too, but so pricey, and there's no animals.) The costs here are far more reasonable! We did the animal park first. It is very clean and well kept. The animals look content and well cared for, and they are an interesting and varied crew. The goats are the biggest hit with the little ones! The different types of primates are very cool, and some are super funny, too. There's lots more, but you get the idea. The amusement park part is more geared toward younger kids, but there's some decent "adult kid" rides as well. The only downside I can think of is how expensive food and drinks are at their concession stands. I mean, I get it. It's a money maker for upkeep and animal care, and probably helps keep admission prices lower. But for your littles, who are a group known to waste food and spill drinks, bring drinks and snacks from home. They are fine with it. They have nice, covered tables to eat at, too. It's definitely an affordable, entertaining, and educational place to spend a few hours!! Highly recommended by this Maine Nana!!

We had a great time visiting York Wild Kingdom. We had a 4 year old and a 16 year old with us. Rides are definitely geared more towards little kids but there were a few rides that adults and older kids could go on and still have a good time. I went as a child and there have been a few updates to the park but some things could definitely use a paint job. Staff was incredibly nice. (Aside from the girl running the bounce house- she was not friendly, she didn't give any direction on if the kids needed to wait to go inside and then wasn't loud when it was time for children to get off the ride and switch for the next group. There wasn't a lot of people on the rides and most were longer than rides at a fair. Our kids enjoyed the Pony and Camel rides the most.

I went to feed the budgies, most of the 200 in the flock stayed in the roost due to the earlier presence of a hawk. Which is understandable just a little disappointing. The butterfly exhibit was fabulous! There were so many blue Morphos to see, astounding! We fed ducks, deer and goats. We saw an interesting prairie dog exhibit and many other lovely animals, the keepers were great giving insight with different species like the African spurred tortoises. Riding the camel around the ring was fun, his fur was so soft like an alpaca. Great value for $18.

The animals are well cared for,  and all of them beautiful! Staff is friendly.  A wonderful place to be! I haven't been here in 26 years and it's better than I remember! Really big amusement area with awesome bumper cars! I enjoy central park zoo, buttonwood zoo, Roger Williams zoo, Bronx zoo as well,  but York Animal Kingdom is the best of them all! Check out the awesome prarie dogs!!!!

This zoo is absolutely amazing. It has easily become my favorite zoo so far! my son was so happy he got to visit. The staff are extremely nice and friendly and there is so much to do here between the zoo itself and the rides and even the food was great here as well, we cannot wait to come back and visit.

name: Jolly Roger Amusement Park
address: 2901 Coastal Hwy, Ocean City, MD 21842, USA

reviews.text: this is one of the best amusement park for families and friends. We can go anytime of the year, particularly the best in the summer. The ticket is reasonable if you go about 3 PM so instead of the morning or the evening. The ticket is usually $ 25 per person. A lot of free parking right next to their event you can go multiple places from there great hotels around and very close to the Broadwalk in Ocean City. No need to scare for anything.

Went to the water park July 4th week. Not bad wait times and great rides like Aqua Loop. Workers were all great, especially James working the aqua loop. Give that man a raise. He deserves it. "Have a nappy day" - Jay the employee.

Their website shows that this weekend is specifically the first weekend that things are open with limited hours. We made a stop in ocean city specifically for this. Why update your website to say your open on a specific date if you aren’t?? All 3 of these attractions were closed. If we’re ever in the area, we will not be back. Do not recommend.

Found mini golf nearby gave them our business, will make sure to give them our business again if we ever come back instead of Jolly Roger.

I have come here for the last twenty years and today was horrific. We ( two other 4 year olds) came on August the 10th. My 4 year old daughter received a blue wrist band and we rode the 4 person ride without issues allllll day ,multiple times with different lifeguards and workers present. Today I go with family that was in from out of town my daughter was given a pink wrist band. I didn’t pay it any mind on the color never do. Sorry, for the Karen’s that do. Anyway, she rode the same ride 3 times today before we get told on the fourth time she is to short. She began crying because she didn’t understand why we had to walk back down. No one cared there at allll how they upset my child even after I showed pictures and videos of my daughter on that ride. Did she shrink in just a week? The vice president Steve was the worst. For him to be in costumer service is unbelievable. He was so dismissive it was ridiculous. I’ll still be going every year but how we were treated today just doesn’t sit well with me at all and wanted to know my rights or thoughts.  Posting photos of the week previous. How do employees or company hire employees mind you multiple ones that don’t abide by the height restrictions because per jolly Roger’s today she was a couple inches under. I know she couldn’t have shrinked that much in one week. Then I feel like if she was to small why did you put my child In danger multiple times the week before and give her the blue wrist band . It’s not my job to know all your height requirements for each ride.

The whale guy should get a raise!!! He was so wonderful with all the kids. He truly seemed to love his job or at least wanted to pass the time. Either way he was great, I can’t say enough great things about him.  My son LOVED him and asked everyday to go back just to ride the whales. He was truly a gem. He needs a parking spot!!
We also loved circus smile, that was a lot of fun and different. Really really enjoyed it. The rides do need an upgrade and get some umbrellas for the ride operators. The sun was crushing them!!! They were great all around and deserve that much! Thanks for a great time

name: Jolly Roger at the Pier
address: 401 S Atlantic Ave, Ocean City, MD 21842, USA

reviews.text:
A fair amount of rides and attractions. We got the platinum card, which was 300 points. Within 2 hours, we couldn't spend all the points. We had about 100 left over. 300 points cost $150.

Some rides were worn down and rough. I would not recommend getting on the haunted house ride.... It's a waste of points.

Ride the "hurricane" and the "big wheel." The other rides were okay.

Ocean City is a popular place where people will get to hang out smoke a lot of weed and little bit of like marijuana. Some people think it’s a paradise place to be in a nice popularity area when you call at home and having friends with you hanging out with you so you know it is nice to have a nice environment, peaceful and Maryland states and the countryside is very peaceful for people to be in Ocean City and being a countryside of the United States of America. It’s good to hang out with good friends. See people enjoy themselves guess some nice items and pocketbooks and some treasure value items that you just be on the beach on summer day like it was a beautiful time of the year. It’s a real wonderful first time in years and see that for a special occasion, see that for a blessing peaceful days are summer day for vacation. There’s no better place to do in Ocean City. Any day is better today.

Had amazing fun there yesterday! Took me back to my childhood days! Got an evening pass for $35 which allowed us to almost unlimited rides in the park. One thing to keep
in mind is the unlimited pass only allows you to enjoy the rides. The slingshot ride and other activities like bursting balloons, etc are separately chargeable.
We enjoyed Kraken - and there is a story to ride. The Ferris wheel gives you amazing views of the boardwalk and the Atlantic Ocean from a height. The hurricane and roller coaster are surely gonna get you the adrenaline rush!

There are few amusement parks in ocean city but this one was pretty close to boardwalk. We came here just for the slingshot but my kids started to play all games . We spent about 150$ for 300 points which was very very expensive .  300 points goes away within 15-30 mins . Games are good but tooooo expensive . Will never go back for the pricing they have . Customer service isn’t that good . My kids liked the slingshot though. Should have just finished that and walked away .

We paid $37 (with tax) for a night time arm band for each of our kids. We got there at 8 (night time bands are 7-12) they had time to do about 6-7 rides each. The lines for the rides are pretty long I’d say they had to wait about 3 times through each ride before it was their turn. They enjoyed the roller coaster, morbid manner, hurricane, kraken, and power surge the most, but liked all the ones they tried. There was one ride that was not working while we were there. A few were too young for my kids. The slingshot was separate ticket price. Line to get tickets was a little long but they have several spots to purchase. Over they had a great time. It is free to enter and walk around, you only need to pay if you will be riding rides. They have some food booths as well.

name: Six Flags Great Adventure
address: 1 Six Flags Blvd, Jackson Township, NJ 08527, USA

reviews.text: Best amusement park I ever visited, one of most amazing amusement parks in the world, it has three areas, Rollercoaster, water and safari parks. The once tallest and fastest Rollercoaster Kingda Ka is the most thrilling ride, even though it last only 45 seconds from launching to stop, some even say only 27 seconds 😑, it is like rocket launches, shooting up right and down straight. Unfortunately after 27 years run, it was exploded early 2025 during closing winter period without pre announcement 😕, otherwise many Rollercoaster needs would take a ride before closing of 2024 season. There are super man ride, riders positioned like flying heroes,  Green lantern ride, players in a standing position. Water park and safari has their own entrance, you can pay in one shot or choose what you want to play.

Fright fest sucks. Overcrowded, nothing scary, very weak attempts.... the concept is great, the execution is weak.
Nitro is an awesome ride! Best ride there! El toro is also awesome, one of the best wooden roller coasters I've ever been on...
The great American scream machine was fun
Batman and Robin was a good ride
The free fall was also very cool
They need a makeover big time. There's still some fun stuff there.

Nice to return to a park of my childhood. It was always a yearly trip our parents would take us too. Nice to see some of the ‘classic’ attractions and rides are still around. Some of the attendants overseeing the roller coasters seemed a little too lackluster in their efforts. Grounds were clean but some of the walking areas have cracks and uneven. Getting a ticket was very challenging and should be a simple procedure for those of us not wanting a yearly pass. Expensive for my taste.

Enjoyed Six Flags during their fright fest.
The rides were all open, and everyone had a wonderful time. We enjoyed the show at the end.
Make sure to stop in if you are in the area. They have the best roller coasters.
Lots of food and rides and great memories to be made.
Parking was a lot, but it was definitely not stopping us.

Great Adventure is one of the better Six Flags parks. El Toro is the best coaster there, and is in my top 10 coasters of all time. The food is ok, I recommend trying Fatburger or Macho Nacho. The park will not be the same without Kingda Ka, but there is still plenty to do. This is a park for all ages, with big coasters and rides for little kids.

name: Trimper Rides of Ocean City
address: 700 S Atlantic Ave, Ocean City, MD 21842, USA

reviews.text: Took our 4 year old here for the first time. He wasn't tall enough to ride everything, probably only about half of the rides but there was still plenty for him to do. We bought the day wrist band which is good for 4 hours and we spent close to 3 hours there. Although Ocean City was extremely busy and packed with people there was no wait for any of the rides. It was a sunny day so most people were probably at the beach. Definitely recommend to give it a shot, just check the height requirements so you know how many rides they'll be able to go on.

Always great to visit in the evening to enjoy all the lights. This year it was not overly crowded. The lines were short and the kids got on multiple times with no wait. The park was clean and had an easy flow to get around. They have outdoors and indoor rides. Keep in mind the indoor rides are for younger children.
The unlimited wristbands were $40 each with a card to be scanned for each ride.
Overall the kids had a good time and I got my step goals for the day.

Took my two kids there for the first time and they loved it. I will say if you plan on riding a lot. Get the daily pass and do as much as you can. The rides are expensive if you do it per ticket. But the facility is really clean and the staff is nice and helpful. I will definitely be going back.

I'm reviewing the boardwalk in a whole. You walk up and down the boardwalk with basically the same shops selling the same things but c'mon it's the beach and that's always the best time with the best memories. Ocean City Maryland is one of my favorite places to go on vacation. Love all the seafood and the beach is always clean. The beach and boardwalk,  it's doesn't get any better.

Well, I had a great time at Ocean City Trimmer Rides. Reason being is that they have the Professional Bull Riding happening in June the beginning of summer weekend. I had a blast there. It’s my first experience going to the PBR Stadium and watching the show in real life.

name: Edaville Family Theme Park
address: 5 Pine St, Carver, MA 02330, USA

reviews.text: This is a cute little family place to enjoy a train, ride some amusement rides, and Christmas lights. The scrambler and the drop tower were closed which is very disappointing, but we had fun on a few of the other rides and the little roller coaster was fun. There were quite a few little specialty shops with handmade items such as ornaments, scars, food items like jams, specialty spices and rubs for seasoning. There was one really great shop there with antiques and collectibles. The antique shop had lots of interesting stuff that was reasonably priced.

Our four year old enjoyed the trip for a Day Out With Thomas. Train ride was fun through the park. Food and beverage prices were little expensive $4 for water, $6 for Gatorade, help yourself counter in cafe food looked unappetizing. Wish the pretzels were heated because they tasted stale.

First visit and we will definitely come back. So much to do and everyone enjoyed themselves. One thing is to bring your own food and water as the cafeteria food is not good at all and super expensive.

Pleasantly surprised! Brought my 2 grandsons ages 3 & 5. They loved it! Perfect age for the rides. This is not a park for teens or older pre teens, but for 2-7 it hits the mark. The park was clean and well staffed. Food is expensive, but that is the norm at all parks. We spent 4 hours and did all the rides and enjoyed the train ride and Xmas lights.

Highly recommend!

Our second visit to Edaville and unfortunately we were very disappointed to learn Thomas and Friends were no longer there. The Dinoland was also closed although you could see a dinosaur off in the dark behind the gate. Some of the rides weren’t operational but overall the ones that were, were fun for the kids.

The staff was very nice and of course the train ride to see the lights was the best part of the experience. The food was over-priced and not very good, though it’s not expected to be at an amusement park. The drinks were over-priced as well, but nice to have.

name: Jiminy Peak Mountain Resort
address: 37 Corey Rd, Hancock, MA 01237, USA

reviews.text: Highly recommend this great ski mountain, especially for beginners.   My daughter had her first ski lesson with Chance and he was amazing! She now loves to ski!  Loved the little ski village with ski shops, a coffee shop, country store etc.  We didn’t stay at the hotel on site but we enjoyed the tavern at the base of the mountain and restaurant in the hotel.  We look forward to our next visit!

My boyfriend and I visited Jiminy Peak for night skiing on his birthday, and it was an awesome experience! Since we were beginners, we rented skis and started on a small slope, which was really fun. The area is beautiful, and the mountains look stunning at night. Skiing truly feels like the best therapy. We had to park a bit far from the entrance, but a kind valet worker gave us a ride to and from the entrance, which was super convenient.

I love the midweek deal and 50% off the second night.  So great getting a complimentary lift ticket the afternoon I arrive.  The Inn and lodge could use some modernizing but they keep it very clean.  Staff is great !  Trails are always in good shape.  Food is consistently good at the lodge and bars.   I’m a regular. See ya next week.

Did not stay at the resort but came for skiing and snowboarding lessons here with some friends. The instructors are amazing.
Cheers to Bob who took his time and taught us the basics of skiing really well.

We took a ski vacation to Jiminy with three other families.  We thoroughly enjoyed the ski conditions and facilities.  Most of the staff was amazing and helpful.  We did have a bad experience with the man attending bar in Jjs tavern.  He insisted on harassing us about bags near our table.  We explained they were not ours, yet he berated us about them. We then watched him yell at other families about their bags. Sadly, despite having a great day skiing and snowboarding was shaded by this angry individual. Hopefully he learns to be nice and not tarnish the experience of this great resort.

name: Six Flags New England
address: 1623 Main St, Agawam, MA 01001, USA

reviews.text: The amusement park is very large, to say the least. There is plenty of parking, but the distance from the lot to the park can be quite far. Thankfully, there are transport buses available. If you are a thrill ride seeker or a water park enthusiast, then this park is definitely for you. However, the food prices are outrageous, and the quality is not great. Despite this, the time spent with family having fun outweighs the negatives. I recommend eating before and after your visit to the park.

Great as always. Beware the standard parking is about 30 dollars and 0.5 mile walk from the park. You can take a shuttle, then it is only about a 300 meter walk.

They have rides here for everyone. Rides you can take your little kids on, and more crazy rides that may give you a headache!

Lines can vary depending on the ride. We went on the weekend on a nice day, and the longest line was 1.5 hours, and the shortest line was 2 minute wait.

One question I had that I found the answer for:
You may or may not be able to bring lose items on the rides like hats, and purses for example. It depends on the ride.
If you don't take the item on the ride, you can either put it in a locker which I think costs money, or you can put the items on the far side of the ride in a bucket. Then get it after the ride. The problem with this, is it could be stolen, but you will probably be fine, since you can get it right after the ride, and only people on your ride and staff will have easy access to it.

Food is expensive as expected. About 20 bucks for a burger with fries for example.

You can’t go wrong with six flags, I mean all summer and autumn I was at this place! My favorite place on earth.Awesome staff and rides! And food.However some places at the water park smells bad but it doesn’t matter because it’s fun!!.I made awesome memories and I am super exited to come back again this summer . Six flags will always have a special place in my heart! #LIVELAUGHLOVESIXGLAGS

With this being my home park, I have A LOT to say about Six Flags New England! This park has AMAZING attractions and staff, so let’s dive right in! This park has 7 major areas. Main Street, which includes the 1909 Illions Grand Carousel. Rockville, Which has AMAZING theming, but no attractions. Loony Tunes Movie Town, which is an area designed for little kids. Crackaxle Canyon, Which is a western themed area with attractions including Tomahawk, Houdini, and the all new for 2025 Quantum Accelerator! Kidzopolis, which is another area designed for little kids. Gotham City, which has attractions including Harley Quinn Spin-sanity, Riddler Revenge, Batman the Dark Knight, and Joker! And finally, DC Universe, which includes the WORLD FAMOUS SUPERMAN THE RIDE! It has won 5 GOLDEN TICKET AWARDS for BEST STEEL COASTER IN THE WORLD! Another roller coaster, Wicked Cyclone, is also a mindblower with whippy transactions and inversions, which people say that these two coasters are the BEST 1 2 PUNCH! More fun attractions including Thunderbolt, Gotham City Gauntlet, Flashback, Pandemonium, New England Skyscreamer, Scream, and Blizzard River are also worth checking out! This park also probably has the best Waterpark in all of New England with 17 MAJOR ATTRACTIONS! The only negative thing about this park is the parking, which will take you roughly 10-30 minutes of walking to the entrance depending where you park. Overall, I would HIGHLY recommend checking out this park if you’re in the area!

Very fun for jack and the friends. Wicked cyclone is the best and Superman is quite a thrill. As a certified yelper I belive this is a very nice cosy park. Has well set themes of the park. Longest line I waited in was 10 minutes for queen harley. It was an amazing expierence and staff members were very nice to jack. Overall I recommend.

name: Cedar Valley's Wild Frontier Fun Park
address: 3780 Weaver Rd, Comins, MI 48619, USA

reviews.text: My family and I drove over 2 hours from Flint to be let down. The website for this place is more than deceiving. The go carts are not even on the track. The "roller coaster" is shut down. The "water" ride looks like sewer water, and almost all the rides r closed. The merry go round is tiny, the fun house looks like a splinter trap for small children, and I'm pretty sure the balls in it were donated from a McDonald's in the 90s and have never ever been cleaned. Ever. There's a birds nest under one of the rides. None of the games were open. The food is SUPER over priced. There were about 10 other families there and not a one had a smile on their faces. The putt putt golf hasn't been updated or maintained since before covid. The signs have been updated to deceive u into thinking u have driven to and walked into fun. U haven't. DO NOT GO HERE!

Amazing place, my 5 year old daughter had so much fun, hidden gem. Super friendly staff, got to be as close as having a theme park to yourself as possible, rides are old but well taken care of , state inspection stickers on all of them, cheep putt-putt.  And classic carnival food.  They need more advertising, wish I knew of this place sooner.

This is a hidden gem in Northern Michigan.  We go at least twice a year when visiting our cottage and so do others in my family as well.  Prices are average with other amusement parks but they let you ride twice as long.  They just open a ferris wheel this year and will have a water ride next year!!!

As a coaster enthusiast, this place is awesome! The website doesn't do it justice! Now this isn't cedar point, it's a mom n' pop kinda place, so don't go in expecting it to be on the same level as a major theme park. This is a park with a collection of many older rides, that have been restored to their original (or as close as they can be)glory! Everyone there was so friendly, including the teenage ride operators, who I can tell were kids with good heads on their shoulders, and all love working there! They do take the time to make sure you feel safe, and secure. It wasn't busy when I visited on a Thursday evening, so it felt almost like I was getting my own VIP tour! It's a charming place to take kids, and adults! They have some rare rides that I've never gotten to experience anywhere else! Overall, I'd give it 5 out of 5! Even though a few of the rides weren't operational, I still had a great time! This would be an awesome place for a company picnic, or even birthday parties! Hope to back again soon!

Not enough workers 35 dollars for wristband and only had 3 rides active for older kids. Ran like a Genesee county skill center for high school students. Have been going there since they first open. Has gotten progressively worse every year as far as ride up keep and workers not competent of there job. Best of luck to your endeavors. If I were you I would skip this place save your money and hit a local beach.

name: Craig's Cruisers - Grand Rapids
address: 5730 Clyde Park Ave SW, Wyoming, MI 49509, USA

reviews.text:
As far as the arcade, the arcade is awesome. They're constantly updating new machines and new venues in the arcade.
Mini golf (mortal jungle) is pretty awesome. Just be careful when you're playing with a bunch of kids. Make sure to learn how to duck.
Newly added slides are safe and fun for all ages.
We come here every year for the past 8 years and gets better every time we arrive.
As far as the food they have a buffet style and actually great tasting food with a salad bar and desert bar.
Definitely cost efficient for a family or birthday party.

This was an affordable and very fun way to spend a day off. We spent about $50 and was able to enjoy a fantastic buffet as well as mini golf outdoors and indoor glow golf. We did do some arcade games but as usual was pretty expensive and only played for like 10 minutes with about $10 in credits. It's a lot of fun and definitely recommended.

This was a fun spot to spend with my son who loves games for his birthday.  Lots of games to play although a bunch were out of order which was disappointing.  Go carts were fun and they loved it,  we also loved the glow in the dark mini golf! They games are kind of expensive and it takes a LOT of tickets to get prizes which are not really that great. For $20 each person got 2 attractions and $6 in arcade games. Large parking lot so no issues with parking. They do have food available but we did not eat there. Overall my kiddos had fun and it was ok in price.

It’s always fun and exciting to come here and today was no different. The new glow mini golf was GREAT! It wasn’t too big and perfect for both my boys to enjoy. (9 and 4) The jump park was also great! It’s perfect for all ages as well. We didn’t get to enjoy the slides as the lines were long, but many kids were having so much fun on them! The hanks for a great time!
This place was so fun, with hotels nearby. A great price for how much they have to do and how long you get to play.

name: Michigan's Adventure
address: 4750 Whitehall Rd, Muskegon, MI 49445, USA

reviews.text: This park is small and can get busy still with a lackluster ride collection but its still a good park just needs some improvment and a new roller coaster, the ride operations were also slow causing long lines. Shivering Timbers is the star of the park and should always be ridden when visiting.

Wow, do they take advantage of tourists who only go to the park for 1 or 2 days.  Basically, if you go there more than 3 times, it's worth getting the season pass with the food pass.   We paid close to 100 for 2 tickets,  plus an additional 25$ just to park my car myself,  plus 15 $ for a locker at the water park, and an outrageous 25$ for a single burger, fries, and a drink, and additional 30$ for games.   We waited longer in the food line than at any of the rides.  My son wanted fries.  They ran out of fries twice while we were in line.  It took several minutes each time for the fries to come out.  I was with my young son so I  had to carry the heavy tubes myself in the water park.  Some of the water rides are probably not calibrated correctly.  There are two slides at the end ( yellow and orange )  I caught air on the yellow slide, slamming my back against the slide on the way down.  The orange slide just hurts.  You skid across the water at the bottom, water is hard when you hit it fast.  My butt hurts still hurts 3 days later, and my son has some red abrasion down his back from the slides.  For those into old school costers, the Shivering Timbers is a great ride, especially in the front car.  My son had fun, so I bumped my score up to two stars.

I try to get here yearly and always have fun. Shivering Timbers is one of the best wooden coasters in the country, it may even be the best. It certainly can contend with Voyage and El Toro. My only complaint is that MA needs to offer night rides. Would it be possible to maybe open one day a week late, maybe 5pm-Midnight?
Great place by the way there’s a water park that opens later in season very fun, oh and ride at the back if you want tog get wiped around more have fun!

We absolutely love this place. It was our first time going and they had something for everyone of all ages. The only downfall is most rides have weight restrictions. And someone bigger and taller in build cannot ride most the coaster and water rides. But it was still a very fun and adventurious day. They even offer electric wheelchairs for handicapped people.

name: Nelis' Dutch Village
address: 12350 James St, Holland, MI 49424, USA

reviews.text: This little village was cute, had a great gift shop, food and activities for small children. The rides are dated and meant for children but it was all part of the experience. We rode the swings, ferris wheel and carousel and everyone had a good time! We petted some cute animals at the barn area and overall it was fun! The place is so cute and plenty of opportunities for photos!

We visited 2 years ago and def see a huge improvement in all the buildings and overall park. There’s more fun things for the kids to do!

We loved the petting farm specially the chickens🫶🏻.
You have to try the freshly made Wafers next to the fudge store.

We appreciate all the costumes, the dancing show and all the hard work from each and every person that works here.

Coming to this place has become a tradition now!

My husband and I had seen Holland, Michigan and the Dutch Village on social media, so we did some research. It looked like a really interesting place. We took my parents and 2-year-old. It was awesome for the price of the tickets. There were a number of different opportunities for kids to drive tractors or other little attractions. There was also a small Ferris wheel, carousel, swings, and a petting zoo. My daughter loved it. Overall, a great experience, especially with kids!

Fun little place. Interesting selection of merchandise and food products to browse and purchase. Cool that they do demos of things like cheese making and wooden shoe making and traditional dance, etc.
Entrance fee is a bit high based on the available activities that are included once inside, but nothing crazy. Worth a stop to check it out with the family. Looks like they are adding some new attractions as well including axe throwing.

This was such a fun little experience. There were a lot of cute little shops, opportunities to learn about the culture, fun foods (definitely hit up the cheese store! Theres a variety of cheeses to try any buy!) and a ton of photo ops! A few rides for the kids and the petting zoo was so adorable!!! There was also a discount for ordering tickets online so we did that from the parking lot!

name: Como Town
address: 1301 Midway Pkwy, St Paul, MN 55103, USA

reviews.text:
Completely unacceptable. Nothing is open or running at Como Town. Asked at the ticket desk if ALL of these rides were closed down and they said  that they were waiting on parts from Italy. I don’t believe for one minute that the roller coaster, swings, frogged, splash pad, Hodge Park (not a ride) are ALL out of commission.

When you drive from out of town 2.5 hours to spend the day at the zoo and the amusement park it’s a complete waste of the day.

Last year same song and dance; no roller coaster, no swings.

My guess is no workers.

Won’t be coming back. MN Zoo and MOA. At least you are guaranteed half of the exhibits and rides will be going.

It’s been years -took the grandkids to ComoTown.  Did the after 3pm twilight wristband.  They had a great time.  There was 5 rides down but my kids didn’t seem to care and the ride attendants were friendly and helpful.  It was clean, colorful  and they did have good fair food.  There was a dinosaur exhibit and really cute dinosaur rides too.  It’s just steps from the zoo, the picnic area and a nice water park, the golf course and Como Lake.  But…. Bring your checkbook!

We drove 5 hours to get here and the best rides were shut down.  We paid $29 for a wristband and there were barely any rides to go on.  Let us know before we drive 5 hours.  AND they price gouge water.  $3 for a bottle of water is ridiculous.  Most of the ride operators dont even look like they want to be there.  No smiles or anything.  AND we saw a ride operator on her phone while the ride was going.  We won’t come back for this again.

A lot of fun for kids with the unlimited ride option.  We go every year because the kids love it.
Need a few smoother rides.  The rollercoaster is a little too jerky with the slowdown spots.
Hint:  Go at opening to avoid longer lines.
Overall, I would give it a 3 because of the rides but my kids would give it a 5.

Great time for kids they had a lot of fun!
Wonderful place for toddlers, but crowded on Peak days.
My daughter enjoyed the tiger rides and she repeats many times😆

name: Sylvan Beach Amusement Park
address: 112 Bridge St, Sylvan Beach, NY 13157, USA

reviews.text: This is such a nice area of NY State. I spent a few days in the area and took part in a ghost hunt - super fun! At night, the rides sure seemed spooky. There are a few cool restaurants too, I'll be back again, for sure.
It’s a window into a delightful old style amusement park. Get the unlimited ride wristbands and enjoy the day with rides and fun. Close to the beach to enjoy between rides.

I think we spent all summer here this year. Definitely going to look in to getting season passes for next year. If you're not swimming, then relax on the beach, or go fishing, or ride rides, or play games, or go to the playground  or eat..there's always enough to do in this tiny park. And then right outside of it as well either shops, bars, candy stores, wine slushies, ice cream stands and gift shops. It's free to enter, but $10 to park, if you park inside the amusement park/Beach.

Old school rides. .25 cent games. What a beautiful place!  Steel horse carrosel. Original Zotar. Love it!

7 8 2023
I absolutely love this park! If you want to enjoy an old school theme park by the lake take the time to visit.

8 29 2024
Still loving the old school theme park. Everyone is so friendly. I'm from South Carolina and hospitality is rare these days. I would definitely bring my grandchildren here and have no worries. Thank you for keeping this park clean and safe.

Just a nice place to do a lot of different things. The Casino, walks, fishing, boating, the beach.. food. Dog walking was popular.
The car show was well behaved, the breeze was perfect..

name: Nickelodeon Universe Theme Park
address: 1 American Dream Wy, East Rutherford, NJ 07073, USA

reviews.text:
What an amazing experience at American dream mall.  Jonas Brothers were great,  how they went from one location to the next to accommodate all fans. They will be traveling to more cities. So many families with little children were enjoying a free event. They did have vip up grades that were pricey. I would just get their early in line  and do the free events. Such an awesome experience to share with my daughter and her best friend.  As in the picture they both towel with Joe Jonas on it.
My daughter who is 21. First concert ever was at 6 yrs old a it was the Jonas Brothers and then again at her sweet 16. They are so talented and put on a great show!!!

Worth every penny! I recently took my kids to the Nickelodeon park, and we had an absolutely fantastic experience! This place is a dream for families, especially with young children. From the moment we arrived, we were impressed by how spacious, clean, and well-organized everything was.

There’s so much to do — rides, games, arcades, and even mascot appearances during the day. The variety of activities is perfect for different age groups, from toddlers to older kids. My kids loved the mini roller coasters and the soft play areas, while my preteens enjoyed the more thrilling rides.

What really stood out was how safe and kid-friendly the park is. The staff were friendly and attentive, and we always felt like our kids were in good hands. The attractions were well-maintained.
Now I didn’t find much food options at the park itself but it’s in a mall so we just took a quick break, walked to the nearest restaurant and had a bite to eat there before going back.

We ended up spending the entire day there because there was just so much to explore. It’s a fantastic spot for a family outing, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a fun and stress-free day with the kids. We can’t wait to go back!

Great rides for all ages.  Clean spaces all still look new. Bought the all-day pas. We got the bang for our buck. The lines weren't long. Plenty of sitting areas for those waiting and smooth surfaces for strollers. Restrooms could use some attention.

Nickelodeon Universe is one of the prime attractions in American Dream.mall, as it proclaims to be the largest indoor theme park in western hemisphere. It took me 4 years to finally visit this park, and I must say I was impressed at the vastness, rides and overall experience of the park. There’s a huge section for arcade games in the right corner of the entrance area.

I loved the fact that there’s no ticket needed to enter the park. Anyone can enter the park, watch the rides and  use the common amenities. Passes or points are required to get on rides or to access the Paw Patrol Adventure Bay obstacle course and play area.

They offer seasonal passes which are worth it in my opinion. Took my daughter on back to back days, and she had 4+ hours of fun and entertainment. There are more than 10 rides suitable for kids under 42 inches. They also have characters meet and greet. We got to see SpongeBob and Patrick.

But seasonal passes a mess. They print with the date of purchasing the pass, not the date of visit. On our subsequent visits the scanners failed to confirm our tags. Bunch of crew members gave us a hard time to get on ride. Some made us wait until they talked to the supervisor, others made it sound like they are doing us a favor. Some told us we were trying to use tags from previous days. Seemed like so many of them didn’t know how the winter/seasonal pass works!!!

Vending machines and snack stations are super expensive at the park. A water/soda bottle is around $4, a cotton candy is $13, and bowl of dipping dot is $11. On my second day, there were issues with our seasonal pass. Scanners were not able to verify our passes due to system glitch. A lot of the associates gave us hard time at the entrance of rides. In one case the supervisor had to come and clarify our passes were good.

What a great place for all ages. Parking isn’t bad, I usually go up to the top and it’s empty. It’s definitely overpriced however, that’s the city for you. Cotton candy was $15 from the machine, yikes! Tickets are $10 cheaper if you buy them in advance. The lines are not that bad. I did wait 20 mins for a baby ride.  The young lady running the ride definitely didn’t want to be there, to be fair what teenager really wants to be at work lol. I’ll definitely be back. It’s a great place to escape to with the kids or even adults.

name: Paul Bunyan Land Amusement Park & Campground
address: 17553 MN-18, Brainerd, MN 56401, USA

reviews.text:
My favorite part was This Old Farm with the antiques.

Had lots of fun talking to Paul, and that's a big man. Learning the history, even if it does not  matter how to my heritage, was still nice.

I would bring my grandkids for sure.

Our kids (6 & 3) had a great time at Paul Bunyan Land! The rides are a bit dated but they're still lots of fun for small kids. The staff was really fantastic! They were so fun and accommodating. Thanks for a wonderful day!

Pretty spendy. BUT, also pretty fun. Lots of rides, although there is some wait as they don't staff all the rides at once. But, no different then if there were a bit longer line.

Animals animaled. Food service was real slow. Might have been something wrong with the grill.

Staff were all super friendly. My boys talking to Paul and him talking back was the highlight of the trip. Gift shop was more reasonable in price then I assumed it would be.

We'll be back, it will just be 4 or 5 years. :)

How much fun is this place!? So fun! Our family and I enjoyed the rides, attractions and treats very much. I wonder what they'll do with the old collectibles if they would ever close. I like that we could bring our own food and have a picnic outside the fence.

This shall now be known as Death Trap Park. I am seriously in disbelief that they haven't been shut down for safety concerns. Old rusted metal rides with belts that cut into your kids clothing and leave scars on their bodies. Bumper cars are so violent my 5yr old was crying in pain everytime someone hit us, aka no bumper = no fun. The entire place is filthy and coated shoes and sweatshirts in dirt. $10 per person is too much for this place, let alone the $27 they charge. I would be more satisfied if it was just pay for the Paul and photo with babe and make it a pit stop. If your kids are up to date on tetanus shots than go ahead and spend $100 to get dirty for the day at the town carnival I suppose. Never again for us.

name: Valleyfair
address: 1 Valley Fair Dr, Shakopee, MN 55379, USA

reviews.text: Fun place! I love valley fair. Perfect place to have some quality fun in Minnesota. When I have friends and family that come visit, first place we go is valley fair! This is a great small amusement park with everything you can ask for in an amusement park. It would be cool to see more food options though, and maybe some more theme events just to add a bit more kick to it. However, if you have a family or a hot date, and want to have some thrill fun this place will not disappoint! Have some fun y'all!

Had a great time last year. Even tho it is a smaller park its still got a good collection of rides with Renegade being my favorite. Also dont forget about Excalibur hidden in the back its a good ride that doesnt normally get a line due to how hidden it is.

$400 to wait in lines…VALLEY SCARE BEWARE! 56 minutes to get into parking lot. 50 minutes to then get into the park. Then another 38 for the first haunted house. Some of the other lines were shorter but the last haunted house was 45 minutes again so we only got to do 4 attractions. Very disappointing. We had friends from Texas that came as well and they had to get out of the parking lot line to get gas and use restroom (which there is none until you get in the park) and they didn’t end up getting in the park until 10:38pm (leaving them only 82 minutes in the park till close) 😕 in which they also had 6 people  in their family and got to do 3 attractions. OH, but there was a short line to spend $65 on corn dogs so that’s good.

It felt like a ponzi scheme honestly! WAAAAAY oversold tickets and the infrastructure simple cannot handle nearly that many people!

I only give it 2 stars because once you get in it’s really well set up and very cool atmosphere.

Suggestions for park:
-instead of having every car stop and pay for parking, include it in the prepaid ticket so people can drive right in! Seems like the obvious first change.
-Better system to get into the park to avoid line skipping kids preventing those waiting in back from ever getting in.
-Offer refunds! If I can’t get into the park for 2.5 hours someone shouldn’t have to pay full price because of the parks ignorance and lack of planning.
- more staff dedicated to check in

We went to Valley Scare for the first time. I had a huge amount of fun, and I will diffently do Valley Scare again. For your information only, this is not a complaint: Because our group was over 21 and no children,  we entered through and express lane to the park, no waiting. But driving to Shokopee
lines of cars to get into the parking lot were very long ... we were in slow traffic while on the highway  for more than 30 minutes, just to get to the parking lot. There were a few families,  but mostly adults enjoying Halloween. The weather was perfect for an October night. There were at least six places to eat dinner, and many pop-ups to buy adult beverages. There were huge crowds everywhere, and long lines for the rides.

We had an amazing ValleyScare visit this past weekend! While it was CRAZY busy, there was enough to keep us moving, and the haunted maze lines weren’t too terribly long! The scare actors were absolutely fantastic and made us jump quite a few times. We also thought that the mazes/houses were more creative and immersive than we remembered them. My favorites were the Undertakers, the Boundary Waters, and the 7 Sins (although the 7 sins wasn’t really scary- just cool looking!) We are so happy ValleyScare is back!! Beware of the guests though! We experienced a lot of folks cutting in line, people scaring other guests, shoving or running into people, and just overall not cool behavior! I think this is typical for these types of events though, so it is to be expected and wasn’t that much of an issue. It would not dissuade us from coming again! People will be people, but ValleyScare does a fantastic job. There was also a lot of security and the crowd was controlled very well. We also really enjoyed the Hide and Seek show!! We caught the 11:30 showing right before park close and were super impressed. Hope to come back a second time this year!!

name: Paradise Pier Fun Park
address: 195 Beach Blvd, Biloxi, MS 39530, USA

reviews.text:
Great time, we just went to ride the ferris wheel and grab some pics of the sunset. Oh and a Pina Coloda!!😋
Very clean place, staff was very nice, and the sunset was amazing!

Our cheer team had a fun night here after Nationals last month.  Management was great in setting up the event. They were flexible with our needs and very responsive. Even when weather made the outside portion shut down for an hour, inside has more than enough to keep everyone happy. The park was so much fun. Bigger than I thought, because there is an inside gaming area, rock wall, ropes course, and more. The girls had so much fun!  Thank you for such a fun night!

My wife and I came here on a Saturday night. We had dinner in Margaritaville And then walked over to Paradise Pier Fun Park. Shortly after we got there they had a live DJ and they turned on all of the lights on the rides and in the fountain. It was so much fun watching all of the kids dance to the music that the DJ was playing and see all the beautiful lights on the rides. We can't wait to come back and bring our grandchildren with us.

Went on a Monday, wasn’t crowded. Bought the all day pass in the morning and enjoyed some rides in the morning. Later came back when the sunset to enjoy the rest of the rides. The lights in the park was beautiful at night. Kinda bummed you had to pay $22 for a ride in “the sky”. A really cool one time experience though. But Brittany our host was fantastic in making conversations, her energy was really good. The rides were very thrilling.

Our experience at this Fun Park was definitely short of fun  especially after driving all . Upon entering the establishment , we were informed that two rides were down and if there were 3 rides were done we would be offered a discount . We noticed immediately that 3 rides were down ( see pictures attached) and went back to the lobby to inquire about the closed rides and the discount . After speaking with the supervisor Evan ( see picture attached ) he told me that they have a shortage of personnel but that is why 3 or more rides would be closed at certain times . As a paying patron , we paid to have access to all rides except for the ones that were closed . It should have also been disclosed while we were paying to enter the fun park that several more rides would be unable to be accessed due to personnel shortages . We would have not paid to enter the park on 8-1-24 , and the supervisor Evan did not honor the discount for 3 rides being closed . This was a small incident that could have been easily taken care of which I did tell the supervisor , but unfortunately he was unwilling to honor what was stated to us . I will add that the ladies working the admissions were very sweet ( see picture ) . Thank you to the ladies working admissions and shame on you supervisor Evan !

name: Branson Mountain Adventure
address: 935 Historic Hwy 165, Branson, MO 65616, USA

reviews.text: Super fun ride! This coaster is faster and longer than the other 2 in Branson. The wait, however, goodness. It's a long one. We went on Sunday afternoon and we waited an hour and a half! I don't believe you can buy tickets in advance.
Loved it was worth the long wait it was a hour and half wait time. My family had a blast.
I just wish I could let up off the brake and fly down that sucker but I'm a chicken 🐔 😕.  It is a lot of fun and my grandchildren were old enough to ride down with their parents.
We had a blast. We did the mountain coaster at night and it did not disappoint.
Fast and fun. Save your self a lot of line standing by filling out the waver as soon as you get to the building. And make sure it's fully done. The coster is fast and the Corkscrews are awesome

name: Copperhead Mountain Coaster
address: 6021 W 76 Country Blvd, Branson, MO 65616, USA

reviews.text: We went on a Monday no wait time at all walked up and paid. Make sure you get your $2 off coupon from one of the advertisements. Ride was a little shorter than Mountain coasters in TN and GA. I also rode during the day. I also did the extreme zip line. It was super fast and a great view.

This was a huge thrill! So awesome.  I would recommend riding at least twice. Once to see the view and go slow, then ride again full speed ahead for the thrill!

Dont worry you cant fall off! Super safe and safety is a priority for them. Very friendly staff,all smiles and fun! Must try!

Be sure to fill out waiver online and purchase tickets for little to no wait!
Coaster was great! Such a nice ride with gorgeous views! However, if you want to ride the elevator in the overlook afterwards, it is $10 per person.

The Nighttime coaster ride is absolutely awesome but it gets very busy. Busy is a good thing so it stays open for business. Would recommend going during lunch if you want few rides back to back since it didn’t seem to be as crowded then. But definitely go after dark for an awesome experience. The staff are super nice. It’s very clean, no trash laying around. It was pretty hot (106*) when we went so would make sure you drink plenty of water before getting in line.

This was probably our favorite adventure for our first time in Branson.  Our family and friends rode the coaster twice - once at night with the track lit up and again in the day.  Both were fun and all ages had a great time (10 to 48 yrs old!).  I personally think it's worth the price after you spend a few dollars at other places around Branson including Steal Your Dollar City.  Give it a shot.  Great hospitality by all employees as well.

name: Shepherd's Adventure Park
address: 5585 W 76 Country Blvd, Branson, MO 65616, USA

reviews.text: Canopy zipline:  beautiful property to zipline through.  The views are stunning.  Our two guides, Jonathan and Josh,  were very knowledgeable , personable and kept us laughing the whole time.  They were very sweet with my daughter who was 12.  I completely trusted them to take her tandem.  We will definitely return to zipline again the next time we are in Branson.

An absolutely beautiful place!  We took the 1 hour horseback ride tour and had a lovely time!.  The wranglers were very patient and happy to answer questions!  We were a family of 5, with 3 being teenagers, and fun was had by all.  Rented bikes for the 6.5 mile ride along the trails…took a backpack along with snacks and drinks, stopped along the way for a few breaks for snacks and drinks, plenty of wonderful scenic places to do so…...waterfalls were stunning!

Our kids always have a fun time at Shepherd of the Hills Adventure Park! They especially love the Mega Slide, mini golf, and the new Sky Trail. Seeing the Ozarks hills from the top of the Inspiration Tower is quite the sight as well. Always a wonderful time together as a family!

We enjoyed our time there.  I had my 10 & 5 year old grandchildren with me.  The wait for the coaster was outrageous. We will not do the coaster again.  There were many activities to do throughout the park.

Our guides at the zip lines were very good and we had so much fun. We love zip lining and if you want good learning zip lines and good views, you will love it. This is a great experience for anyone of all ages.

name: Silver Dollar City
address: 399 Silver Dollar City Pkwy, Branson, MO 65616, USA

reviews.text: Very enjoyable day. Definitely didn’t need an entire day to experience it all, but well worth the money spent. Food was above par for theme park food. Many rides were unashamedly rip offs of Disney rides. No complaints there, other than I believe they could benefit from at least trying to be more creative (even the names of rides and attractions were almost identical). Live entertainment was solid. Definitely a high mark in my book. All in all, a great amusement park.

Silver Dollar City is one of the greatest highlights in Missouri.  It’s best enjoyed with a season passport so you can attend each time they change the park theme throughout the year.  With every change comes new shows, new decorations, and a new experience.  My family has made some of our best memories here.

There are rides for all ages and thrill seekers.  The gift shops and shows are fun and engaging.  The fireworks display is the biggest and best I’ve ever seen in person.  The musical performances are fantastic.  And, the cave is definitely worth exploring.

If you can only go one time this year, you absolutely have to go for Christmas.  The lights are truly breathtaking.  It’s hard to describe how incredible they look and the feeling you get just standing there.  There is no better way to get into the Christmas spirit than the warm glow of the lights at Silver Dollar City.

I highly recommend this place for your next family adventure!

Amazing family fun. We had so much fun we ended up staying until the park closed.

Going during Christmas time you'll see the park decorated everywhere with Christmas lights. It's absolutely beautiful and turns it into a completely different place.

There are plenty of rides and things to do for kids of any age, and if you like rides yourself, you'll have a blast.

The only negative I can even think of is that it's very hilly. So if you struggle with walking up/down hills you may have a difficult time. But there are plenty of benches and places to rest if you need.

I will be coming back here again, no doubt.

Been going to Silver Dollar City for years. It has an amazing atmosphere, excellent rides, and tasty food. It's also where I proposed to my wife ( by the big Christmas tree). November/December is the BEST time to go to catch the beautiful Christmas lights. I highly recommend doing the Marvel Cave tour while there. If you're up for it, try the lantern tour in the cave. It's a unique experience for sure. If you're a coaster fanatic, definitely try Outlaw Run and Time Traveler. All the coasters are great though. There's also plenty of family rides and rides for the little kiddos.   Another great thing about SDC is being able to watch craftsmen and craftswomen make things right in front of you, and if you like the items, you can purchase them in their unique shops. This could be old fashioned candy, glassware, pottery, blacksmith goods, baked goods or even hand made tools and pocket knives. While there, definitely try a fresh baked cinnamon bread loaf and an apple dumpling with cinnamon ice cream. If you're there around Christmas, you can walk around the park sipping on some hot wassail or hot chocolate. Get there about 30-45 minutes before the park opens for best parking options. In my experience, they usually start letting folks in about 15 minutes before official opening time.

Always a blessed time to visit this clean park and hear the Name of Jesus praised publicly! Joined in a hymn sing about Him in the Wilderness Church building. The lights throughout the park were phenomenal- never had seen the display before - truly a minor glimpse of His glorious light!!  One of my favorite moments throughout the evening was actually right on the way in when we were waiting for the tram. The scenery...gorgeous... glorious shades of orange and auburn leaves, brown hues, and the light blue sky behind!

name: Six Flags St. Louis
address: 4900 Six Flags Rd, Eureka, MO 63025, USA

reviews.text:
Had an awesome time at Six Flags St. Louis! The park has a great mix of rides for all ages, from thrilling roller coasters to family-friendly attractions. The Boss and Mr. Freeze were absolute highlights—fast, intense, and well worth the wait! The water park was also a nice way to cool off, especially on a hot day.

The park was clean, and the staff was friendly for the most part. Food and drinks were a bit pricey, but that’s expected at a theme park. I’d recommend getting a dining pass if you plan to eat more than once. The mobile app was helpful for checking ride wait times and finding our way around.

Crowds can be heavy, especially on weekends, so getting a Flash Pass might be a good idea if you want to hit all the big rides. Some rides did experience temporary closures, which was a little frustrating, but overall, we still got to enjoy a full day of fun.

If you love roller coasters and a classic theme park experience, Six Flags St. Louis is definitely worth the trip. We’ll be back again for sure!

Went to fright fest and it was amazing..very crowded though. The best part was once it got dark. If you can afford speed pass definitely get it..the lines where super long especially the hunted houses lines. Plenty of rides and activities. Nice crowd plenty of entertainment. Parking is 30..bigger vans or 70. Food is very expensive though. Tickets are 55 dollars if you want to get into haunted house they are extra. Please be aware the lines are very long after about 6 pm. Had an wonderful time

We visited Six Flags St. Louis during their Fright Fest, and it was an exhilarating experience! While we didn’t check out the haunted houses due to the extra cost, the thrilling rides more than made up for it. The park was beautifully decorated for the spooky season, adding to the overall atmosphere.

The highlight of our visit was undoubtedly the newly added ride, The Joker: Carnival of Chaos. This ride is an absolute blast, and a must-try for any thrill-seeker visiting the park!

Overall, Six Flags St. Louis Fright Fest is a fantastic destination for thrill-seekers, and we can't wait to return for more rides! Highly recommend it for anyone looking to combine excitement with a hint of Halloween fun!

Want their Labor Day weekend and two weekends for fright fest. Had a really good time. I would like to purchase the food vouchers for my grandkid for Christmas. Considering I just bought 7 season passes. Now they need the food pass 😁

Visited this theme park on a recent road trip and I have visited it several times in the past as well. Compared to other destinations and theme parks, the pricing is reasonable. It cost about $40 per person for admission and another $40 for parking and there are deals online and elsewhere to get those costs lower. There is plenty of parking although it can be a walk depending on the crowd sizes. The day we visited was not too crowded and we were in the park within a matter of minutes after getting to the gates.

I liked that the park had convenient maps and wayfinding and they even had stations that told you the wait time of the major attractions onsite. This information was also accessible through the app. The lines were reasonable the day I visited and the wait time was no longer than 15 minutes, with most rides having no wait times at all. The food and drinks were expensive but that is going to be at any theme park you visit. It was easy to navigate through the park and there were plenty of places to rest, if needed.

Why did I deduct 2 stars? During our visit, a several of the major attractions were not working or continued to go down so we did not get to ride them. These being the main reasons for our visit, left us disappointed. I understand the nature of these being down is most likely maintenance and/or safety issues but it seems like something should be done for guests if this is going to be the case.

name: Lahey Family Fun Park
address: 500 Morgan Hwy, Clarks Summit, PA 18411, USA

reviews.text: We went for some fun with our girls, 7 & 3 years old. We started with mini golf, the girls enjoyed it as did we. They enjoyed the different holes and seeing the chipmunks running around, we even saw tappoles. We went inside and my husband took our 7 year old on the go carts while I stayed in the arcade with the toddler. We all had fun and we played more when they were done. We would've gotten food if they had it but looked like it was just ice cream and small snacks like chips.

I took my kids this past week and was really excited because it wasn't that busy, and as we started to golf our excitement changed to frustration as several of the greens were ripped up or missing completely.  There was trash in the water areas and ponds along the course.  We actually ended up skipping two holes completely due to the greens.  One of the clubs I received had broken plastic/rubber protection on the handle end and just had sharp metal ends. After seeing the mini golf course condition, we didn't stick around to do anything else. Also, the ladies' bathroom had toilet paper all over the floor of one of the stalls and hadn't been cleaned in a while from the looks.  $38 for 18 holes that weren't being kept up with wasn't worth it, in my opinion.

I haven't been to Lahey in a very long time and was excited to take my out of town guests there since we wanted to play mini golf and we were in the area. Let me tell you it was a HUGE disappointment. Most of the greens were ripped or torn, some even missing.  The water features were nasty with trash and a ton of leaves built up. The water was dark brown and nasty. It seems there has not been any kind of upkeep since I came her as a kid in the 90s. It was an absolute embarrassment to bring my guests here. There was all kinds of debris on the course. I understand it's in some trees but at least make an effort to vacuum the carpets.  Considering this is one of the only mini golf places in the area it sucks!

Went there today excited to use the go karts with my kids but the only thing available was the arcade… it was fun and the staff was nice. I will update once I’m able to come back and try the go karts and boats. Beautiful views outside perfect for parties.

My brother had a lot of fun on the bumper boats and I really enjoyed their "Falls" mini golf course. I also liked the go carts, with a nice track. I didn't get to go on the other mini golf course or the batting cages, because we ran out of time on our visit. I would come back again next time I can!

name: Worlds of Fun
address: 4545 Worlds of Fun Ave, Kansas City, MO 64161, USA

reviews.text: What a cute little park. Worth the visit if you have a day in KC and dont know what to do. When we visited it wasnt too packed and we were able to marathon most rides but that will be different for everyone.

We have been to World of Fun many times. They have really improved theming and added lots of plants and decor over the years. The food is pretty good and the employees are friendly. They have a wide variety of rides and some good coasters. Their ride operations could use some improvement.

This is the second year we came to Haunt and absolutely love that. They have 7 haunted houses, scare zones and shows.

I love most of the rides and coasters. The Timberwolf and Boomerang are particularly uncomfortable, so I avoid those rides. We purchased season passes this year, so we went to both parks and got refillable cups. Totally worth the price! Though maintenance on the drink machines could be better. I enjoy the Halloween haunted houses and stages performances as well.

I took my daughter for the Halloween Haunt. This is NOT a children’s event. The level of scary is above anything I would take a child too. Personally it felt over the top. As a single mom who was there basically wondering around while my daughter and her friends did their thing, I was targeted by every creepy monster that jumped out from behind a bush. At one point I was sitting in a well lit area and a person in a costume came up behind me and crashed cymbals in my ears leaving me in pain and traumatized. I did get some good photos but just be aware if you go with young children do not go on in the evening it is for 13 and above if that.
I will not go back to this event.

Drove from Omaha, NE in the morning and back at night in the same day. Don’t spend money on food here, prices are high and the food around KC is way better. Pack a lunch in and carry water bottles around to refill inside the parks for free. Travel light and wear shoes because you will be walking a lot. Try to go on weekdays for short wait times. Wait time for the Mamba was 5 minutes on Thursday. Parking is 30$ but you are able to drive over the median (more like a speed bump) if you go in the pick up/ drop off lane for free. Price for entry is 40$/person for both parks. Definitely worth it for how cool the parks are and the quality and speeds of the rides. My favorite rides were the Mamba and the new one called the Zambezi Zinger. The tallest ride in the park gives you an overview of the whole park which is very nice around golden hour. And don’t forget the smaller rides as they were a nice buffer inbetween the big rides because of how intense they were. Go to the biggest rides right as the park opens to reduce your wait times. Oceans of Fun is nice too however the concrete is scalding hot without shoes/ slippers and they won’t let you use tubes unless you’re taking it up for a slide. Great place to take an even number of people for a day trip. Great date spot too if you are prepared.

name: The Funplex
address: 182 NJ-10, East Hanover, NJ 07936, USA

reviews.text: Held my son’s 10th bday party here and we had a ball. I did the laser package and the kids absolutely enjoyed. Amelia was a great host and she basically gathered the kids from the party room and took them around as a group to enjoy the festivities. No stress or hassle for birthday momma. Will definitely be returning when the summer hits for the water park

I took my son and his siblings to this place for his 7th birthday. His siblings and friends were of different ages and they all had a blast. The older ones enjoyed the arcades, amusement rides go kart and bowling the younger ones enjoyed the foam frenzy, arcades, go kart and bowling. The food court wasn't too bad, the food was decent and had some good variety.
Only takeaway is one has to make extra purchases for arcade games even after paying for the unlimited rides. I feel there should be more credit allowances included in the ticket purchase. I spent $250 on total entrance tickets and only received 10 credits on arcade which equated to one or 2 games on each wrist band.

Outside of this, I would totally take the kids here again, next time in the summer so they can experience the outside water park.

Highly recommended but be sure to read what is offered and purchase accordingly to maximize on the fun. If you have older kids, the amusement, go Kart rides and bowling is all you need.

Not a happy experience, if you use Groupon, you have to wait until after 6pm??? Super crowded, parking was horrible, my daughter went on the go karts and was stopped twice because a girl got sick, so she asked if she could go again for the inconvenience and was rudely told no ?!? Anxiously was upset for waiting so long and not enjoy her ride!!! Had to purchase expensive regular price and went home not happy!!! Overall a terrible experience!

This was my 1st time back here in over 10 years. I forgot how small it was In the beginning. It was so hot! So crowded! And we came on a Sunday!! I can only imagine what a Saturday or any other day looks like. I didn't eat before I got there and that was a mistake. I spent a $45 on food! Their nachos with the works is a 10 out of 10. The pizza was pretty good! Churros was pretty dry. Pretzels and the drinks were good!! Depending on how many kids you're hosting, it's best to bring $100 minimum or more. I can't wait for the water park to open in May. I probably wouldn't go back on a weekend just because it was way too many people. Have to see what a weekday looks like. The bowling alley was a nice 30min-1 hour wait. I didn't realize it was a bowling alley until I went looking all the way around the place looking for my folk. This place has something to do for all ages! Super dope.

"I had an amazing time at Funplex! The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, making the experience even better. The bowling was so much fun, and there were so many other activities to enjoy. Whether you’re looking to play games, bowl, or just have a great time with friends or family, Funplex has it all. Highly recommend for a fun-filled outing!"

name: The Adventuredome Indoor Theme Park
address: 2880 S Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV 89109, USA

reviews.text: The kids loved the experience here. They were able to go on age appropriate rides and had a great time.  No complaints. The service was good, the food was a little pricey,but the park was clean and had lots of rides and arcade games. Parking was free. I'd definitely go back.

Great kids experience, 48” or taller for full ticket price of $60 per person to play almost everything except for the laser beam and some side games exchange tickets. Kids 48” or under pays half price $30 per person but limited heights roller coasters not allowed, open all week 10am till midnights.

Still sitting here waiting to fill out a security report 30 minutes later. The little train they run (wayyyyy too fast through tight corridors literally ran over both of my wife’s feet. (Not sure how that even happens by the way). There’s no tracks painted in the ground or anything. This thing is going seriously hurt a little kid or toddler. Hopefully Phil isn’t too busy trying to sell this thing and hires someone who can operate a decent business here.

To be honest I absolutely love this place. Been coming here since I was a kid 30 years ago. I’ve never or at least very rarely written a bad review,

but to see my wife who’s a very kind and patient nurse so outraged by this I just have to write this to hope something changes. I’m absolutely sure this has happened before and the next serious injury will be gross negligence.

Super fun experience! My kids had an absolute blast during our first visit here. The place was practically empty when we went, so there were no long lines at all.
