They even have a fast pass lane, but we were lucky enough that the kids could ride whatever they wanted without any wait. We ended up staying for more than six hours!

The park offers a wide variety of attractions, including roller coasters, laser tag, bumper cars, carnival games, carousel, arcades, and other fun rides like gondola, tea cups and airplane rides. The staff were incredibly friendly and attentive, making the experience even better. The kids had so much fun, what else can I hope for?

While it is a bit on the pricier side compared to other bigger theme parks, the experience was worth it. They used to offer per-ride charges, but now it's only daily or annual passes. We didn’t try the food, so I can’t comment on that. However, this is definitely a must-visit spot to add to your list if you’re in Vegas with kids.

This is a great indoor family amusement park with a good array of kids rides, two roller coasters, and several thrill rides. The Midway is also a great place with fun prizes and is a fun activity to share with family and friends. Some portions of the park are a bit dated; however, the rides are well-maintained. It has been over twenty years since I last visited and I was impressed that the quality of the older rides was quite good. The only problem I would bring up is that for some rides, they may not appear to be operating when they actually are such as the Angry Birds ride. Also an exterior window for the dome is still cracked even after 20 years. Other than that, a lovely visit.

name: Six Flags Darien Lake
address: 9993 Alleghany Rd, Corfu, NY 14036, USA

reviews.text: Six Flags likes to rob you if you get a membership. I canceled my membership a while back ago, and turned out they were still charging me, and they are refusing to reimburse me for the money that they took. I did everything that I was supposed to when I canceled and still they just let a loyal customer for years walk away in this matter extremely frustrated and feeling riped off.

Our Family was going to purchase season passes for 6 so i went online to pay for them. My husband was injured and needs a motorized scooter so we planned to rent one each visit. When i checked the price for the scooters, it was the same price for one visit as the season holder pass for the entire season.

To charge someone $50 per visit for a scooter is crazy. its almost as if they are saying they don't want disabled people to be regulars there.

We will never go back there again!

Elizabeth Jackson

It is always an excellent experience at Darien lake, I wish with the fright fest there were more scares around the park but Darien lake is always my favorite park to go too!! The staff are always so helpful and friendly, there’s some great rides that I love to go on there!! It’s a great atmosphere and a great location for it!! They also always have the best concerts and the perfect spot for them!! Just recently went to see Avril Lavigne and it was everything I dreamed of and more!!

Don’t bother going half stuff never running. And definitely don’t buy the passes I been trying to cancel after the year and here I am can’t get nobody to call back when u get an email they won’t give you your own info and still being billed The only thing more of a scam than these passes is the actual parks themselves. If you like waterslides go to Kalahari in PA beautiful place way better.

This company is a con artist. DO NO UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES BUY A SEASON PASS. They will try to get you to pay until the end of time. Park is a joke of what it was. Needs to be closed. All riff raff and people breaking into concerts causing fights and problems. Do not bring your child here. It'll be there 1st lesson in a rip-off. I'd give no stars if possible.

name: Canobie Lake Park
address: 85 N Policy St, Salem, NH 03079, USA

reviews.text: Amazing amusement park, we’ve been going there for the past 8 years and absolutely love it. Safe for kids, loads of fun, tons of activities for toddlers and teens. My 8 and 5 year old loves the water slides and train rides. Ample parking, good food and great ambiance. 5🌟Local Gem 💎

We visited for the first time on a Saturday.  The water park was closed for the season.  If it were open,  I feel like we would have needed another day to explore everything.  We loved the array of things to do...rides, arcades, lake view, etc. The food costs were reasonable. The rides were fun. There was something for all ages. We were impressed and had a really good time.

We went during screemfest on a Sunday and it was fun! Did a mix of rides and haunted houses and the only one I have any complaints about was Cargo, it just sucked. They need to improve the whole walk and there was barely any actors. LOVED the clown one though!
Overall, we enjoyed the day and the lines weren’t very long

What a lovely New England day! We had a great time!
Everything felt clean and safe. The staff were all so nice and helpful. The array of rides for all ages was awesome. The games and food selection was great. We all thoroughly enjoyed the water park! Our only complaint was that we wished we had gone when it was open later because we missed some stuff.

**Review of Canobie Lake Park**

Canobie Lake Park is a nostalgic gem that brings back fond memories from my childhood visits in the '90s and early 2000s. Recently, I took my kids for a day of fun, and while the park has maintained its charm, I noticed a few changes, particularly the new closing time of 7:00 PM instead of the previous 9:00 PM. Although this shift can be a bit disappointing for those who love to enjoy the park into the evening, it didn't detract from our overall experience.

The kids had an absolute blast, enjoying the variety of rides that cater to different ages. While they were a bit too big for the baby rides and too small for some of the roller coasters, there were plenty of "just right" options in between. It was delightful to see their excitement as they hopped from one attraction to another.

As for the food, it was your typical amusement park fare – think fries, hot dogs, and pizza. Not gourmet, but satisfying enough to keep the energy up for a day filled with fun. I appreciated that I could relax and enjoy a drink while the kids explored. They are old enough to stick together, so I didn't have to worry too much about them running off.

One thing to note is the price of admission, which is now $65. This is quite a jump from when I used to go, as it was only around $20 back in the day. While it feels a bit steep, I still believe it’s worth it for the memories and fun you create with your family. Just make sure you’re aware of the cost before you go!

The park was surprisingly not crowded during our visit, and the lines moved at a reasonable pace. Although there was a brief waiting period at one point, it was manageable, and the overall flow of the day was smooth. We made sure to stay until closing time, soaking in the last moments of our adventure.

The drive to Canobie Lake Park is also a plus – considerably shorter than trips to larger parks like Six Flags, which is a blessing for any parent. The little in-car entertainment with TV screens kept the kids occupied, making the journey even more enjoyable.

Overall, I give Canobie Lake Park a solid four stars. It has retained its nostalgic feel, offering a great day out for families. While I miss the extended hours and find the current price a bit high, the memories made here are priceless, and I look forward to returning again.

name: Santa’s Village Amusement & Water Park
address: 601 Dundee Ave, East Dundee, IL 60118, USA

reviews.text:
the place is old but it is a great attraction for the kids, it got a little of everything for all ages(kid)

$27.99 per person

$69.99 season pass (if you come 2.5 or 3 times a season it is worth it) also come with discount for food/drink, birthday and other events promotion

We came here 2018 and 2019, they welcomed ppl bringing their food to picnic but when we came here in 2024 no longer let you bring cooler, food.  They do allow kid snack and a water bottle person.

We normally there about 3hrs, got to play about 50% of the rides.  The lines are not bad at all!  Most of them you should get on it immediately or wait a turn…there are some it maybe 2-3 turns but those are worth the time!

Growing up as a kid my family would come here yearly and I’m happy they reopened it and now I’m able to bring my grandsons and nieces. The memories I have from this place are priceless and now my grandkids will have their very own memories. Love how they’ve expanded the waterpark and hope it continues to grow. The petting zoo is perfect for the kids and they love being able to interact with the animals. It’s busy on the weekends and I highly recommend purchasing your ticket online. They have a few vendors but nothing to brag about and you’re able to bring a cooler with certain items so check their websites for the rules and regulations as they tend to change.

This place was absolutely worth it. If you are thinking GO. The kids had so much fun during fall fest, can't give you insight to the water park, it didn't look that big but they had paintballing which looked fun but we didn't partake. This place is Good for the little kiddos and the donuts were fresh and apple cider was the 💣 10/10 recommend so much to do we literally went from 11-5 and surprisingly couldn't believe we did everything in that time frame and more than once. Would def come back looking forward to it, we even saw Santa!
Christmas lights drive thru was fun and entertaining for my sister's dog as well. You can't bring dogs into the park but we were fine with the car viewing .

The coolest thing about this place is that they have original rides from way back in the day for the little ones. There is literally a ride for all my kids ages and pretty much all 3 of my kids got away with riding everything together (that I was able to fit on too)..otherwise my 10yo was able to bring the toddler on rides with her. Ages 2, 5 and 10 it was a blast. VERY expensive and not practical at all. It's similar to the cost of six flags and for a local amusement park I wish it was a little cheaper so we could go more often. It's always clean there too.

name: Story Land
address: 850 NH-16, Glen, NH 03838, USA

reviews.text:
Bee-en There, Done This, WON'T Be Back....

First and foremost, if you have a bee allergy, do NOT come here. They are EVERYWHERE and ALL in your face, on your person, in the air. This place is a honeycomb. Sonny's family are HERE! I've never seen SO many bees in ONE place ever and I'm FROM New England.

This is not an amusement park for the WHOLE family. It's in the name. If you're someone that doesn't ride rides or a grandparent here for the kids, you'll be fine. It's for SMALL kids. If you have a kid under 8, they will love this place. It has cool VIEWS and fairy-tale vibes that my small relatives ate right up. It's a nice public park(?) to walk through.

And that's where the positivity dips. We got in early enough and saw a family already leaving. I was like, that's odd. But I've never been here, so I figured the park wasn't big, so they were in and out. That's not the case.

I have a pass that allows me to visit all the parks across the US and yet, I couldn't figure out if we were supposed to bring our home park cup or not. I called ALL of the other parks all week to ask, INCLUDING Storyland and NO ONE answered their phone. Rude.

Turns out, we were supposed to bring our original park cup with us, but from my research online, nothing but our pass gets us in and is transferable, so I wasn't sure IF said cup would work there, so I didn't bring it. I DID try to find out prior to coming. It should be better posted on ALL sites what each park policy is.

And with small kids, who wants to get their hopes up for unlimited soda and that's not the case? I figured it's just a cup, we can get one there. No, we can't.

The staff member was nice enough letting me down and tried to scan my badge to see if I could just get it and go. They also informed me some OTHER parks don't even ACCEPT sister pass cups! Bruh.

It's giving red headed step child. Do you all not have the same step-dad???!! These parks definitely call him by his first name, Parque. Another staff member at Guest Services was less than polite about informing me that I couldn't get a cup from Storyland, even though I have a pass! It's not the park, it's the person. The Dunkin's lady was super polite about it and didn't make me feel like a criminal for asking. Guest services? Made it seem like I was doing insider trading to their face. It's a CUP.

I get that some people just take to take, so can't give them out Willy Nilly with a budget and stock, but this was off-putting. Corporate Bureaucracy ruins ALL the fun. So that started the trip out on a sour note.  Bless Storyland 's heart.🙃🫠

ANYWAY, we walked around the park for Happy Hauntings and some cast didn't care how much you took in candy, but Mother Goose sure did!🫠 The websites all have everyone with these large pumpkin bags and we were given ...a gift bag. Like the kind for treats at a kids party. These are small children. The place is FOR kids. But with adult eyes, there were signs of "this could be better."

The teacups were fun though. And the train. That's it. It felt like it was an amusement park still being built, because, this can't really be it? Drained pools? The food vendor we went to wouldn't accept our pass for the discount since they said they weren't with the park, but they were IN the park. Go figure.

New Hampshire really leaned into that LIVE FREE OR DIE motto here. Free to be terrible.

I'm sure Storyland will reply with a very New Hampshire response, but Parques Reunidos may want to rethink this one. It COULD be better managed to make it...more pleasant for all and clearer to visiting pass holders what is and isn't ok.

The staff were more or less polite to us and it's the policies they're enforcing that are so..... disappointing. But execution is everything. Again, some....were better than others. Dunkin's lady said Storyland accepts sister cups, but I didn't SEE any

But again, this is through the eyes of a paying adult. My mother was not impressed with Discovery Zone and I LOVED it, so I get it.

Thanks for the fun day for my littles, Storyland. Don't call me, I'll call you!

Story land is a great place to take the family and have some fun rides. They are great for the younger kids. We have a 6 year old who enjoyed all the ride. The dinsour wooden Rollercoaster had him in his feeling, but every other ride was within his wheelhouse. Would definitely come back with the family.

10 STARS!!! Do NOT listen to bad reviews, please. I have a 5 and almost 4 year old, and we LOVED it, so did my husband and I. We both came here as kids. I think it is perfect for ages 4-8. It obviously depends on other factors, possibly 3-10. There is also a great place that serves food and drinks that is smart to hit up around 1pm for nachos and spirits 😋 We went here on a Saturday, purchased tickets online, open-close (you really need to in order to see everything if you even have time to do that) and on Sunday we went to Jackson Falls. Great weekend.

Magical place. Rides are suitable for young kids till the age of ~10.
Not all rides were opened which was disappointing.

Storyland is such a fun place for kids!! There are so many classic rides and a brand new water park!! Perfect for hot summer days. This park is geared towards elementary and younger kids but the whole family will have a blast. I made a video review with more info especially about the water park so go check it out below!

Storyland 2024 | BRAND NEW MOO LAGOON | New Hampshire White Mountains
https://youtu.be/7kkeAWz3Ux0

name: Casino Pier & Breakwater Beach
address: 800 Ocean Terrace, Seaside Heights, NJ 08751, USA

reviews.text:
Bravo! This water park has to be the cleanest park I have ever been to! The staff was friendly, dressing rooms were so clean! Tons of seating and I love the blue carpets so your feet don’t burn!
The rides were so much fun! Food was good too!
Thank you for our teacher appreciation day!!

What Seaside has become blows my mind.  I used to come to this beach on a regular with my family growing up, and now I'm here with my family.  The boardwalk & beach are clean, and I feel safe walking around with my family without any drama happening.  Spent the weekend here and a few blocks from the boardwalk.   Walked and biked every day.  Great time.  I'm so happy to see how much it's improved.  Loved seeing the kids laughing, running around, on a ice-cream fulled hysteria! Past bedtime and no one cared.

We just did a quick walk through after having dinner nearby, but there definitely was a fun vibe at this amusement park. We particularly took a liking to the colorful characters we found throughout the park. I would like to try some of the rides on a return visit.

This amazing place on the Jersey Shore is definitely the best place to be in the spring and summer months. They have everything, games, rides, attractions, restaurants, fishing, crabbing, water park, gorgeous views, fireworks, live music, festivals, amazing people, soft clean sandy beaches, a beautiful ocean on one side and a beautiful bay on the other side, sunrise, sunset, moonrise, Ferris Wheel, boardwalk food, amazing people, frog bog, jet skiing, surfing, kayaking, boating and so much more. You will never forget your time spent on the Seaside Heights NJ Boardwalk. They have done so much to the area in the last few years and really made it a place to bring the family.  I can't thank the owners of casino Pier and all the town workers enough for the many amazing memories I will cherish forever.
Seaside Beach Boardwalk is a must when visiting New Jersey! Fun in the sun with the grand kids on their first time here. Great time was had by all!

name: Clementon Park & Splash World
address: 4504, 144 Berlin Rd, Clementon, NJ 08021, USA

reviews.text:
I've been coming here for years ... my big kids use to love it , now my youngest loves it !
It's small but packed with fun !!
The wave pool was clean unlike some reviews I've read ! Lines for the water slides were long like always but moved pretty quick . Ride lines weren't so long when we visited on Saturday (8/10/2024)
Food prices were fair ... food was good ! Lots of options as well .
The prices at the gift shop weren't bad either !
Perfect for a fulfilled family day ☀
Most staff was polite & friendly except a few little girls with attitudes (don't get a job if you don't want one) but I'd rate it 4 out of 5 !! Definitely worth the ticket price !! We ordered our tickets in advance online to save a little time ... skip the line they'll scan your phone and you'll go right in after getting your bag checked (they check children's bags as well)
Hope this was helpful 🤗

I attended the park during the day it was utilized by many summer camps. The kids had a wonderful time all staff were welcoming. BATHROOMS were cleaned, the grounds were kept well. The shaded kiddie area was the best for my Grandson, he was able to ride more than a few times on several different things!! I was just SALTY, a/b the Lil wooden roller coaster, it wasn't working & the log flume took 4ever...all in all I was grateful & I  trust this park continues to get funds

Been here since I was little. Come here once in a while. Past two year I've stopped by. Water park is the main focus at least for me. It has most of the meat when it comes to the park.

The regular old amusement park is more or less lack luster just been that way. You'll never get a full six flags experience here. But it is a nice local place to visit if you want to get away without going far.

One big issue Ive had is rides are always down log flume in perticuler. Which sucks because that's the best one in the amusement park side.

To be honest I wish the whole thing would turn into a water park and get rid of the rides in my opinion. Only reason I mainly go is for water park.

Lazy river is relaxing no one rushes you to get out. Food is fine nothing crazy keeps you full. Tube rides are always fun.

Never too many complaints from me but they do have many times where it's just not the best place to be at but it never really happens that often for me anyway.

Like I said worth checking if you local or visiting.

We had fun this visit.  There were a few rides that were out of service.  My youngest son enjoyed himself and this was his first time to an amusement park.  He didn't care for the Wave pool but loved the lazy lagoon, the little train, everything in the kids section, Lagoona Kahuna.  I enjoyed myself as well.  I got on a couple of rides and enjoyed the Wave pool & the lazy lagoon.  Nice little outing for the family that didn't really break the bank

Thought let me get these summer passes   should have opted for diggerland or funplex ... Can't call email or speak to a human... All the other places are already open for amusement rides ..  get passes from another Park  unless ratchetness is your thing

name: Fantasy Island Amusement Park
address: 750 N Bay Ave, Beach Haven, NJ 08008, USA

reviews.text: Kids have grown up coming to Fantasy Island and at 9 and 11 are still not tired of it! Very clean and staff always friendly ❤️ Son was super bummed the lighthouse (both of their absolute faves) wasn't operating this year when we went, but he still has a good time

Great place to host my 7 year old's birthday party. It was so easy to schedule online and the ladies working the party were attentive and handled everything, from the games to the pizza and cupcakes. Everything was clean and new. All the kids loved the arcade and left with prizes. Would highly recommend visiting or hosting a party!

Feels like wildwood crest or ocean city amusement park but much cleaner and civilized.  Staff everywhere to clean bathrooms and pick up trash.  Mix of rides, arcade, games and food options.   Not the cheapest nor the most expensive.  Has parking too in the back.   All it needs is a beer garden nearby.

This is a cute place for kids.   The costs seemed to be a little high at first, but we found that $100 lasted about 2.5 hours for a 5 and 6 year old.   Lines were not crazy on a Saturday night, and the kids had a great time.

We had a great time here! We have a 3 yr old and he just makes some of the rides. 36 inches tall for kiddie some are 32 with adult and 38 to 42 inches for others. We got the wristband for my son and he didn't want to go on some of the rides...I told the attendant and she was very gentle with him. She sat him in a few and he loved it! They employees for the most part were great. The rides are 3 to 5 bucks a go for little kids. They are now card base so no tickets. So much better. They updated the park so if you haven't been...check it out again.

name: The Funplex
address: 182 NJ-10, East Hanover, NJ 07936, USA

reviews.text: Held my son’s 10th bday party here and we had a ball. I did the laser package and the kids absolutely enjoyed. Amelia was a great host and she basically gathered the kids from the party room and took them around as a group to enjoy the festivities. No stress or hassle for birthday momma. Will definitely be returning when the summer hits for the water park

I took my son and his siblings to this place for his 7th birthday. His siblings and friends were of different ages and they all had a blast. The older ones enjoyed the arcades, amusement rides go kart and bowling the younger ones enjoyed the foam frenzy, arcades, go kart and bowling. The food court wasn't too bad, the food was decent and had some good variety.
Only takeaway is one has to make extra purchases for arcade games even after paying for the unlimited rides. I feel there should be more credit allowances included in the ticket purchase. I spent $250 on total entrance tickets and only received 10 credits on arcade which equated to one or 2 games on each wrist band.

Outside of this, I would totally take the kids here again, next time in the summer so they can experience the outside water park.

Highly recommended but be sure to read what is offered and purchase accordingly to maximize on the fun. If you have older kids, the amusement, go Kart rides and bowling is all you need.

Not a happy experience, if you use Groupon, you have to wait until after 6pm??? Super crowded, parking was horrible, my daughter went on the go karts and was stopped twice because a girl got sick, so she asked if she could go again for the inconvenience and was rudely told no ?!? Anxiously was upset for waiting so long and not enjoy her ride!!! Had to purchase expensive regular price and went home not happy!!! Overall a terrible experience!

This was my 1st time back here in over 10 years. I forgot how small it was In the beginning. It was so hot! So crowded! And we came on a Sunday!! I can only imagine what a Saturday or any other day looks like. I didn't eat before I got there and that was a mistake. I spent a $45 on food! Their nachos with the works is a 10 out of 10. The pizza was pretty good! Churros was pretty dry. Pretzels and the drinks were good!! Depending on how many kids you're hosting, it's best to bring $100 minimum or more. I can't wait for the water park to open in May. I probably wouldn't go back on a weekend just because it was way too many people. Have to see what a weekday looks like. The bowling alley was a nice 30min-1 hour wait. I didn't realize it was a bowling alley until I went looking all the way around the place looking for my folk. This place has something to do for all ages! Super dope.

"I had an amazing time at Funplex! The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, making the experience even better. The bowling was so much fun, and there were so many other activities to enjoy. Whether you’re looking to play games, bowl, or just have a great time with friends or family, Funplex has it all. Highly recommend for a fun-filled outing!"

name: Gillian's Wonderland Pier
address: 600 Boardwalk, Ocean City, NJ 08226, USA

reviews.text:
This location is PERMANENTLY closed. Forever.  Due to the mayor - who owns wonderland sold it to another company a few years ago and since then has mismanaged this park and drove it into the ground. COUNTLESS family's memories are embedded I this part, generation after generation and all we got was a cowardly statement released on Facebook.

Selling and closing this park is nothing short of an insult and a huge disservice to ocean city and all who visit there.

And for what?  A luxury hotel with a possible liquors license? The property now belongs to Eustace Mita.

*you can look up all this info and more on public records of the sale*

5 stars only because this was a lovely place that so many people loved. This was the heart of Ocean City,NJ.  When you drove into the island the first thing you saw was the big wheel - and at night it was a sight to see.  This place will be forever missed by so many.

I hope the owners do the right thing. They probably won't tho 😕

Absolutely wonderful experience. This wonderland Pier has been part of the summertime culture in Ocean City and South Jersey for many many years and it will be sadly missed as 2024 as its final year it will be closing so you better get there while you can take the kids take their friends. Wonderful experience

Gillian’s Wonderland is the ideal family-friendly park for folks with younger kids. While my family has spent many more hours at Playland’s Castaway Cove, we’re very sad to see this iconic park close after the 2024 season. It truly is an icon on the boardwalk—its Ferris wheel towers over its surroundings, and its entrance facade is adorable and nostalgic for those of us who grew up coming to OCNJ every summer. I’m so glad I got to take my first and final ride on the Ferris wheel before Wonderland closes its doors. I just wish I had more pictures and memories to share.

Sadly, as of 2024, this place is apparently shutting down. They're finishing out the summer, but then that's it. It's a shame because I took my kids here every summer and while they sound like they were having some issues recently, it wasn't always that way. It was a nice place to go and we didn't have problems with the rides or waiting for anything very long. My kids will miss Gillian's as they would visit both big parks on the boardwalk each chance we had.
This was the hardest goodbye, I wish wonderland would stay open by a new owner❤️ had many great childhood memories here! If only I could take my own kids here…

name: Jenkinson's Boardwalk
address: 300 Ocean Ave, Point Pleasant Beach, NJ 08742, USA

reviews.text:
A phenomenal Boardwalk for families. The amusement area🎢🎡 is a super plus children toddlers/12
Plenty of food options and SWEET TREATS!!🍨🍦🧁🍪

Lots of fun, we visited on Friday night and if I remember visiting after 5 pm gives u a discounted pass for unlimited rides. There are many rides that kids above 18 months can enjoy and very good rides for adults as well. Only thing is you might have to pay for the parking as street parking is very difficult to find. I couldn’t find one even after spending 20-25 min.

Very beautiful place day and night! Ocean is beautiful,  palms and sand! Pretty moon 🌙 ✨️ all night, the beautiful moon is displayed on the ocean. It is so mesmerizing and beautiful. There are simply no words.  There is so much entertainment for children, my son always doesn’t know where to start))) What delicious food and ice cream 🍦 I really like Point Pleasant Beach ⛱️

From the lack of free public parking, it's at least $20 to park anywhere to buying a medoocre pizza slice for $7 the boardwalk is EXPENSIVE which takes the joy out of it, not to mension how dirty it is near benches . The good think i went was near the tiki bar they had a fireworks show which was short but fantastic and of course a beautiful beach view. How one family can own the boardwark is mind boggling.

A beautiful place for a family weekend or with your partner who likes fun and adrenaline. Clean place and above all very safe, there is safety all over the place. the only thing I don't like is that the waves on this beach are too high and strong and you can't enjoy with your kids . at the fair if you go in the afternoon after 6pm you don't have to wait long for your turn . apart from the arcade that you can win many prizes I recommend the one that is near the aquarium that is in this place .

name: Keansburg Amusement Park
address: 275 Beachway Ave, Keansburg, NJ 07734, USA

reviews.text:
My family has been coming here every summer since the early 70s, and we love it.

In recent years, it has been amazing to see the area being built up and the beach kept nice.

Keansburg is the beach to go to if you're from North Jersey, and you want to have some quick fun by the ocean with access to rides and an arcade. Keansburg captures the classic Jersey themepark by the water feel.

If you're interested in riding the rides, I would come on a Friday or Saturday during the summer.
Come and enjoy a free stroll by the beach of keansburg and if you are lucky you might find some music on the way.  The boardwalk is short but nice, you can enjoy walking by the sand along the water

We used to go there when our girls were young. They have a lot of rides for young kids and it's not that expensive. It's been a while so we took a ride down for old times. It's still the same. Brought back a lot of memories. There are some big Highrisers going up across from the Rides so the Town is expanding. That day the parking lots were full and people were enjoying the amusements and beach.

We have been to the amusement park and the waterpark at different times and each time, we had a great time. It’s a small enough park for young kids and they are sure to have a blast! Our boys enjoyed our visits there in previous years and we cant wait to go back this year! We found parking easily every time we have been there.

Edit: we went there on 4/28/24 to the amusement park and had a blast! It was their National Superhero Day event and they had Spiderman and Spidergirl - both of whom were amazing to the kids. It was a perfect spring day and we got to do the rides that the boys wanted - some like the go kart speedway or the bumper cars multiple times in a row. This time, we got lemonade from Holly’s lemonade stand, pizza from Pizza V and a funnel cake to end the day from CJs spot by the batting cages and everything was great! Pizza was better than one you get at amusement parks normally.
Was there for my granddaughters birthday party. Definitely a family clean atmosphere, and lots of rides for the kids

name: Land of Make Believe
address: Closed for the Season. Will reopen May 2025, 354 Great Meadows Rd, Hope, NJ 07844, USA

reviews.text: Great experience for kids. Definitely should visit on a hot day. The lazy river is relaxing, and the large bucket dumps all the water the kids loved standing under. Water slides the adults can experience as well. Fun carnival type rides that the kids loved and kept riding over and over. A train ride that bring you around the park. We didn't really care for the Safari ride. Also had a little Christmas touch. A maze, carnival games to win prizes. We did a family visit with lots of kids. It's a whole day experience . Bring your own food or buy food there. They have lockers to rent if needed. Very inexpensive as well. We'll worth the trip and price.

Awesome park! Plan on bringing cash or food to picnic with! My LO (3yo) had fun on every ride he was tall enough for! Then the Pirates Cove was a huge hit as well. Parking wasn't bad either but plan on getting there +20mins before opening just to get parking. Also would recommend buying tickets ahead of time to get through faster. May your memories be as magical as ours!

Great place for a visit. People of all ages can enjoy this park. Free parking, Inexpensive food stands, and all amusment rides, including train and little safari vehicle rides, are included in the admission. The land of Make Believe is ideal for everyone. The park has  newer rides, a lazy river, and several water slides and large water areas.  Perfect atmosphere, plenty of shaded areas to sit and relax or eat.  No glass bottles, alcohol, or grills are allowed in the park. However, you can bring a cooler, picnic lunch and snacks to eat inside the park. The only amenities you pay for are the concession stand food/drink, lockers, and souvenir shop.

BRING CASH BRING CASH

If you have kids, this is THE place for you. Plenty of things to do and everything is CHEAP. There’s plenty of food to choose from, but you can bring your own and have your very own picnic.

All the rides and attractions are very clean and very quick.

The staff was excellent at all stations! Must go for the family.

Wow, the best experience I've ever had, a beautiful place for children and adults, everything is suitable for children. What I liked most is that children over 36 in. can go up on some alone and others accompanied by an adult to the games. The important thing is that everyone enjoys it. A wonderful place and the food 10/10, games 10/10

name: Morey's Piers & Beachfront Water Parks
address: 3501 Boardwalk, Wildwood, NJ 08260, USA

reviews.text: I go here every year, amazing is all I got to say. Good rides and the wrist band is really worth it. The tram car is very convenient and you can’t say you’ve been here if you’ve never heard watch the tram car please. The rides at adventure pier is pretty overpriced though but mariners arcade is amazing. Easy to win tickets and good prizes, I have about 550,000 tickets and could get a lot of stuff.
This is a cute and fun place! The games and the rides are nice. I only gave a 4 star instead of 5 because of the concessions. I'd recommend getting something on the boardwalk and then walking over.
The piers have some decent rides. The water park attractions are fun too but close kinda early. Food is outrageously priced though. Even water was 5 bucks and that's just ridiculous

Great amusement park for toddlers. Very pricey. Each ride costs around $5 per person. Parents are permitted free on very few. My son loved everything though, and the rides are so nostalgic and well kept. The 2 story carousel was his favorite. We went later in the evening and the fireworks were easy to see from the Ferris wheel.

They are charging Disneyland prices for out of order, old rides! And I don’t mean Old Dominion. Some of the rides weren’t even operational because lack of employees! They have a limited option for children lower then 42 inches(Average 4-5 year old height)! I brought 3 all day all access wrist band pass for my 3 kids only to find out my tickets came with exemptions. No one communicated to me any exemptions or restrictions. Walked a mile to the other pier only to find out our wrist bands only worked for a few rides at this pier. When I asked guest services why wasn’t this communicated they replied” it’s on the signs.” What signs I inquired? “The signs as you enter the pier” The pier doesn’t s open to 5 I’ve been here since 12. Me:You mean I have to walk down here in advance to read signs for restrictions? “No the digital signs are posted at all piers” Me: I read that sign like 8 times looking at the confusing pricing. Show me that literature. It’s a digital sign with multiple flashing advertisements, we looked at it for 5 minutes! Finally it flashed in the finest small print I have even seen. Not only that but it lasted for a 3 second count and was buried! The manager couldn’t even read the damn thing because of how quick it lasted. And he works here!!! When asked for an accommodation so my son to ride it was No. At the end of it I brought additional tickets so my son could drive the go carts. This was the main thing he wanted. It’s all about family experience for me. We left afterwards. 4hrs, $250 and a good 12 rides accomplished, I realized Charlatans are offerings family experiences!

name: Mountain Creek Water Park
address: 200 NJ-94, Vernon Township, NJ 07462, USA

reviews.text: I went there for snowboarding and it wasn’t too bad. The have train for different levels of experience and I was snowboarding on easy green trail. I found it bit difficult for me and too many people. I don’t know if it’s normal or not. But experience wise it was not bad at all.

Be prepared to walk a little steep to some of the rides. The free parking is also a walk from the entrance. You can pay for better closer parking instead of getting sent to a dirt road as well but limited space. Don't recommend going on the weekend because it is beyond full. Just to get on 1 slide with a tube takes about 1 hr wait line. Bathrooms and changing rooms are super filthy. The slides and exhilarating and fun. The water is a bit cold for the little ones. Hard to get around with stroller, wheelchairs etc. Also came across a small snake that wasn't bothering anyone. Employees didn't know how to handle the situation because a group behind me made a ruckus about the snake. I'd love to return on a weekday in hope of less people and less wait time on the lines.

This is such a beautiful place. When we got here we initially passed the parking lot and then realized it was all on gravel which I feel like they could pave the pavement. But the walk to the entrance wasn't bad but the walk in the park is very exhausting. Going up the hills to every activity Will drain you out before you even get on the rides especially if you're unfit. The wave pool was really nice and so was the cliff jump. I wish they offered more lawn chairs for the guests to lounge around. The only issue that I have was some of the vendors only excepted Apple Pay and the other vendors only accepted physical card so there is no cash. I wish someone had told me if you had cash on hand you have to go to the lodge and convert it onto a visa card, which is at the beginning of the entrance. I don't recall seeing any signs in regards to this. I will say the price of the food was pretty high compared to a Six Flags considering they didn't have that many attractions. But the admission prices were decent on Groupon.
Amazing park! A lot of tubes, pools and other entertainment. We spent at least 5-6 hours to explore all territory. I bought tickets through groupon, so price was 30$ per person.

At first I was scared to come here because of all the reviews I was reading. I actually enjoyed myself . Yes it is a lot of walking up and down the hills. If your not use to the walking and using those leg muscles your body will be sore the next day. Not good to go with babies or kids that are in strollers. You’re going up and down  hills , going over bumps, not good to go with strollers. The water is freezing cold. There’s really no where to sit. So bring your beach chairs. We didn’t buy food there . We had a cooler with food and drinks and left it in the car. You can’t bring food in. It is a far walk from the car to the water park but it’s not that bad. We all just walked back to the car when everyone was hungry and came back in. Water shoes are not recommended, but I would definitely wear some water shoes or some crocs. The floor is very rough and hot. You can’t go down the slides with water shoes on they make you take them off, but you can come back and pick it up. I would go back . The whole family enjoyed themselves.

name: Nickelodeon Universe Theme Park
address: 1 American Dream Wy, East Rutherford, NJ 07073, USA

reviews.text:
What an amazing experience at American dream mall.  Jonas Brothers were great,  how they went from one location to the next to accommodate all fans. They will be traveling to more cities. So many families with little children were enjoying a free event. They did have vip up grades that were pricey. I would just get their early in line  and do the free events. Such an awesome experience to share with my daughter and her best friend.  As in the picture they both towel with Joe Jonas on it.
My daughter who is 21. First concert ever was at 6 yrs old a it was the Jonas Brothers and then again at her sweet 16. They are so talented and put on a great show!!!

Worth every penny! I recently took my kids to the Nickelodeon park, and we had an absolutely fantastic experience! This place is a dream for families, especially with young children. From the moment we arrived, we were impressed by how spacious, clean, and well-organized everything was.

There’s so much to do — rides, games, arcades, and even mascot appearances during the day. The variety of activities is perfect for different age groups, from toddlers to older kids. My kids loved the mini roller coasters and the soft play areas, while my preteens enjoyed the more thrilling rides.

What really stood out was how safe and kid-friendly the park is. The staff were friendly and attentive, and we always felt like our kids were in good hands. The attractions were well-maintained.
Now I didn’t find much food options at the park itself but it’s in a mall so we just took a quick break, walked to the nearest restaurant and had a bite to eat there before going back.

We ended up spending the entire day there because there was just so much to explore. It’s a fantastic spot for a family outing, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a fun and stress-free day with the kids. We can’t wait to go back!

Great rides for all ages.  Clean spaces all still look new. Bought the all-day pas. We got the bang for our buck. The lines weren't long. Plenty of sitting areas for those waiting and smooth surfaces for strollers. Restrooms could use some attention.

Nickelodeon Universe is one of the prime attractions in American Dream.mall, as it proclaims to be the largest indoor theme park in western hemisphere. It took me 4 years to finally visit this park, and I must say I was impressed at the vastness, rides and overall experience of the park. There’s a huge section for arcade games in the right corner of the entrance area.

I loved the fact that there’s no ticket needed to enter the park. Anyone can enter the park, watch the rides and  use the common amenities. Passes or points are required to get on rides or to access the Paw Patrol Adventure Bay obstacle course and play area.

They offer seasonal passes which are worth it in my opinion. Took my daughter on back to back days, and she had 4+ hours of fun and entertainment. There are more than 10 rides suitable for kids under 42 inches. They also have characters meet and greet. We got to see SpongeBob and Patrick.

But seasonal passes a mess. They print with the date of purchasing the pass, not the date of visit. On our subsequent visits the scanners failed to confirm our tags. Bunch of crew members gave us a hard time to get on ride. Some made us wait until they talked to the supervisor, others made it sound like they are doing us a favor. Some told us we were trying to use tags from previous days. Seemed like so many of them didn’t know how the winter/seasonal pass works!!!

Vending machines and snack stations are super expensive at the park. A water/soda bottle is around $4, a cotton candy is $13, and bowl of dipping dot is $11. On my second day, there were issues with our seasonal pass. Scanners were not able to verify our passes due to system glitch. A lot of the associates gave us hard time at the entrance of rides. In one case the supervisor had to come and clarify our passes were good.

What a great place for all ages. Parking isn’t bad, I usually go up to the top and it’s empty. It’s definitely overpriced however, that’s the city for you. Cotton candy was $15 from the machine, yikes! Tickets are $10 cheaper if you buy them in advance. The lines are not that bad. I did wait 20 mins for a baby ride.  The young lady running the ride definitely didn’t want to be there, to be fair what teenager really wants to be at work lol. I’ll definitely be back. It’s a great place to escape to with the kids or even adults.

name: Playland's Castaway Cove
address: 1020 Boardwalk, Ocean City, NJ 08226, USA

reviews.text: Very nice family oriented environment. Most of the rides were 2 to 6 tickets. Ticket bundles are available for purchase online and in the park. They had a very good selection of rides for all ages.

Fun for the kids (and some adults).  Not the biggest place, but they pack a lot of variety and rides in and make a good use of the space they do have.  The tickets are pricey, however, as they charge as you ride, with most being the equivalent of about $4-$14/each.

I've been taking my kids to Castaway Cove for years now. I missed last summer, but that was due to medical issues and not due to the park itself. The kids absolutely love going and usually want to go on the rides multiple times. When it gets dark, the park lights up nicely, as seen in my photos. It's usually crowded, but we still never waited too long for a ride. If you hit the times right like we have sometimes, you don't have much of a line at all. There are food stands such as a Dairy Queen right next to some of the rides, so you don't have to go far. Ticket prices are a bit high, but that's everywhere. I tend to buy tickets when they sell them for half price during the off season, but the kids like to go down so often we run out and need to buy new ones. Tickets you buy one year are also good forever, at least as of last year. There are bathrooms near the log flume ride and aren't the cleanest, but get the job done. It's also easy to find off of the boardwalk thanks to the large pirate sign.

There are two lands on the board walk, PlayLand and WonderLand. PlayLand is amazing in that it has all the rides you could ask for, from the thrills, to the kiddy rides, and best of all, at a great price compared to Wonderland. In fact, there are a couple of rides at both lands that are identical, and PlayLand is 1-2 tickets cheaper. When you multiply that by a couple of kids, that’s a huge savings.

The only downside I can think of is the crowds could be very overwhelming. You can barely move on a weekend summer night, BUT oddly enough, there is never a wait for a ride more than 5 minutes. Never. I don’t even know how that’s possible but it’s true.

Unforgettable Fun at Castaway Cove

Stepping into Castaway Cove is akin to entering a vibrant storybook brought to life, a place where joy, laughter, and childlike wonder echo in every corner. Tailored to delight little ones and the young at heart, the park boasts a delightful variety of rides and attractions, ensuring smiles all around.

The charm of this amusement park lies in its thoughtful assortment of rides. There's a well-balanced blend of gentle attractions for the littlest adventurers and more thrilling rides for the older children, providing an adrenaline rush without veering into the territory of the extreme. The carousel is a timeless favorite, while the roller coaster offers just the right amount of excitement for the small thrill-seekers.

Family friendliness is at the heart of Castaway Cove. With safety as a top priority, parents can relax, knowing their children are in good hands. Staff members are not only attentive and warm, but they also exude a genuine enthusiasm that contributes to the magic of the experience.

Extra perks, well-equipped rest areas, make this amusement park a breeze for families. Add to this a selection of eateries offering kid-friendly food and healthier options, and you have a place that's more than just a day out; it's a stress-free, fun-filled adventure.

In essence, Castaway Cove delivers what every family seeks—a day of effortless fun, bonding, and laughter. It's a place where children's eyes light up with joy and adults rediscover their inner child. Here, every family will find themselves creating memories that will last a lifetime.

name: Six Flags Great Adventure
address: 1 Six Flags Blvd, Jackson Township, NJ 08527, USA

reviews.text: Best amusement park I ever visited, one of most amazing amusement parks in the world, it has three areas, Rollercoaster, water and safari parks. The once tallest and fastest Rollercoaster Kingda Ka is the most thrilling ride, even though it last only 45 seconds from launching to stop, some even say only 27 seconds 😑, it is like rocket launches, shooting up right and down straight. Unfortunately after 27 years run, it was exploded early 2025 during closing winter period without pre announcement 😕, otherwise many Rollercoaster needs would take a ride before closing of 2024 season. There are super man ride, riders positioned like flying heroes,  Green lantern ride, players in a standing position. Water park and safari has their own entrance, you can pay in one shot or choose what you want to play.

Fright fest sucks. Overcrowded, nothing scary, very weak attempts.... the concept is great, the execution is weak.
Nitro is an awesome ride! Best ride there! El toro is also awesome, one of the best wooden roller coasters I've ever been on...
The great American scream machine was fun
Batman and Robin was a good ride
The free fall was also very cool
They need a makeover big time. There's still some fun stuff there.

Nice to return to a park of my childhood. It was always a yearly trip our parents would take us too. Nice to see some of the ‘classic’ attractions and rides are still around. Some of the attendants overseeing the roller coasters seemed a little too lackluster in their efforts. Grounds were clean but some of the walking areas have cracks and uneven. Getting a ticket was very challenging and should be a simple procedure for those of us not wanting a yearly pass. Expensive for my taste.

Enjoyed Six Flags during their fright fest.
The rides were all open, and everyone had a wonderful time. We enjoyed the show at the end.
Make sure to stop in if you are in the area. They have the best roller coasters.
Lots of food and rides and great memories to be made.
Parking was a lot, but it was definitely not stopping us.

Great Adventure is one of the better Six Flags parks. El Toro is the best coaster there, and is in my top 10 coasters of all time. The food is ok, I recommend trying Fatburger or Macho Nacho. The park will not be the same without Kingda Ka, but there is still plenty to do. This is a park for all ages, with big coasters and rides for little kids.

name: Steel Pier
address: 1000 Boardwalk, Atlantic City, NJ 08401, USA

reviews.text: I actually didn't get to experience this, because I visited in March..and I am bummed it was closed..but, it does look awesome, and I've heard great things! The farris wheel is beautiful at night all lit up too!

We had so much fun. It's a little dated but it has so much history. And the ride operators take their jobs seriously which is nice to see. They measure the children correctly each time to ensure their safety on the ride. I would say there is a good variety of rides for all ages. A few of the rides were not operational due to another roller coaster being built (which looks like it will be so much fun) but overall still tons to do. We are a family of 4 and 80 tickets was enough for us. The slingshot is an extra $35 to try and the wheel is extra as well but decent prices. The wheel was great to catch some good views 😉 would be pretty awesome at night. And if you're looking for one helluva good pizza, hit up the pizza food truck just at the entrance of the steel pier, one of the best slices I've had. Truly an awesome experience that the kiddos won't forget!

A carnival on the ocean. Be prepared to pay tourist prices and get ripped off. $40 for a slingshot ride, or how about $75 for a 5 minute helicopter ride. They literally have a helicopter taking off and landing every 5 minutes. I think I'm in the wrong business!!🤣

Just an all around amazing experience. The number of tickets per ride have gone up which makes you use your tickets way fast. It's definitely worth it to save up the money for all they offered. The ferris wheel is extra money and so is the sling shot. I like to go later in the day so it's cooler and all the lights are on! If you can walk, walk. Or find open parking for 10 or 20 bucks.
Definitely something to do with the kids not just watch them. So much fun!
Woman in the ticket booth was amazing. I wish I could remember her name. All the workers were wonderful and the rides were super fun and appropriate for my nine and two year old.

name: Storybook Land
address: 6415 Black Horse Pike, Egg Harbor Township, NJ 08234, USA

reviews.text:
Perfect spot for young kids. Beautifully maintained. It always feels magical with the trees and lined walkways between the rides. We call it our miniature Disney. We have been going for years and this place holds so many special memories for us.
Great for all seasons. Special events are a must do. The Easter egg find is perfect for little ones. The fall activities are well thought out. The pumpkin decorating for Fall and the trick or treating for Halloween runs so smoothly. Christmas is in a world of its own. The whole place is decorated from top to bottom. We love Santa and so glad he is able to visit Storybook Land. He truly makes it special and takes time with each child.

Thank you for creating core memories with our family!

We went to Storybook Land (again, have been a few times - including when I was a little kid) to see all their Christmas lights and decorations last week and were not disappointed!

Very soon after it got dark, the lights all kicked on in unison, and it didn't matter where you were in the park because you were surrounded by lights. Plus they decorated most everything they could. It was really a sight to see, and everything was incredibly cute and kid friendly.

Our little 19 month old had a blast taking it all in. We went on a few rides, ate some snacks, rode the train around the park (which you absolutely have to do while they have all the lights up), and enjoyed just walking around and checking out everything that was different there for the holidays. So many decorations, the huge tree near the entrance, the list goes on.

Even though the parking was almost entirely filled up when we got there, we didn't find the park too busy or wait times too long. The train ended up being the longest wait which was still under 30 minutes for us.

If you haven't been before, note there's many rides that you can take your little one on with you (before they're tall enough to ride on their own). Plenty to keep you busy for hours, including so many animatronic displays with buttons to press to start hearing the "story" and watching the display come alive.

Overall, Storybook Land continues to be an amazing place to take your kids, and despite how old it is, they continue to maintain it (several rides looked brand new) and keep it fresh. Your family will have a relaxing and enjoyable time here just like ours.

The largest display of Christmas lights outside of Disneyworld!
I  returned tonight with our grown girls and explored all their favorite places at this one of a kind park.  Santa himself lights the park at 5pm, complete with snow.
Family owned since it opened many years ago and the jewel of America!
Magical and fun !

Amazing.  We had such a great time.   Food prices nit a rip off.   I appreciated that I forgot gloves and they sold quilted gloves for $6.  In other words gift shop prices fair.     Bob on train so kind. We got to train as about to close.   My 3 year old was so disappointed and he said come on.   I'll take you.   And gave us our own train ride.   She is still talking about it days later.  Santa was awesome.  Personable and spends time talking to children.     Great experience.

Lots of fun for everyone. We visited on a Saturday. It’s well organized and attractively laid out. There are food options and less adventuresome rides for those who prefer something tamer. All of the exhibits are very cute and photo worthy.

name: Wild West City
address: 50 Lackawanna Dr, Stanhope, NJ 07874, USA

reviews.text: I took my 13 year old daughter because we have never been and I wanted to get out of the house. Not knowing what to expect, I was hoping that it wasn't too geared towards young children. My daughter had a really good time there! I was not expecting to  be there as long as we were...6 hours, from opening to closing ceremony. We also did the train....twice, the stagecoach ride and the mini golf. We had a lunch of burgers and fries for lunch at the Golden Nugget Saloon and bought souvenirs. Everyone who worked there was extremely nice and we both would recommend a day out at Wild West City.

Cheesy but cute theme park for your little buckaroos.  They even have an real bar in the saloon for the adults... Great addition.  Watch out for the yellow jackets this time of year.  Don't wear white... It makes them aggressive.
It's a fun time.  The pony ride was terribly short, 3 times around a 20' circle for five bucks?  Pass on that and go for the stage coach and train rides.
Old school, cute, fun for kids up to 11 or so.  Really best for ages 6-9.   Dress up in cowboy outfits.  Bring your six shooter, or buy them there. I wish I brought my kids a couple years ago.  The night time version of haunted wild West City seems fun too, probably for the older kids.  We went at 11am.

We had such a fun day! All of the staff were friendly and inviting. My son was a little scared but they "roped" him into participating and he had so much fun!  He won't stop talking about it. It was a great day! Such a hidden gem of a place.

Took my two boys (8 and 11).  It’s a fun little place to spend a half day with kids.  The actors were incredibly friendly and made my kids feel like they were a part of the production, which I really appreciate.

There’s a bar and restaurant for snacks and drinks, live shows, stagecoach rides and more.  My kids really enjoyed the shootout with the outlaws and the blacksmithing demo.  Panning for gold was less fun, but worth a quick look just to see what it was like.

We did not do the mini golf course, but did do the train ride, which was entertaining.  We will definitely go back.  For sure a pleasant surprise of a good time.  Def recommend if you have kids in the 6-12 range.

An engaging, fun experience for the whole family. From the live action on Main Street, to the barn full of livestock, to the train ride, and the historical displays, this place has something for everyone. You can spend all day watching shootouts and gunslingers, or casually walk around the storefronts that have been replicated and contain old flyers, photos, and more historical facts.

Hungry? Grab a snack, have a sit-down meal at the saloon, or bring a picnic.

Don't forget sunblock, and if anyone in your group doesn't like loud noises, keep in mind that the live shows all use blanks. (They sell earplugs if you forget)

name: Cliff's Amusement Park
address: 4800 Osuna Rd NE, Albuquerque, NM 87109, USA

reviews.text: 5 stars for not being the worst place actually. Many rides are pretty nice. I went on NM Rattler but I went once and not again, as it shakes so violently and my head was hurting at the end, so I give that 1 star. Unfortunately, the staff wouldn’t let me take my GoPro on the coasters, so I give that 2 stars. Screw you, staff! Cliffhanger is terrifying

My younger kids liked this place much more than Giant places like Disneyland.  We try to get here once a year this year was during a 105-degree day the park wasn't too busy probably from the heat! We had a full run of the place.  Always love bringing my kids to my childhood happy place.
Our kiddos love cliffs! The water park is their favorite place to spend hot summer days. The lines are short, there is something for all ages and the food court is not too shabby!

yes even though there sometimes long lines I have always had the best time on all of there rides it is sad  that some of them are closed but they have others it amazing great food and kind people .very suprizing compared to six flags

Our visit to Cliff's Amusement Park was a mixed experience. While the park has its charms, there are a few areas that could use improvement. One of the main concerns is the pricing structure. Charging the same rate for guests who don't ride as for those who do seems a bit unfair, especially for families who have members that are there just to supervise or relax.
Additionally, the selection of rides for toddlers is quite limited. There were not many options that catered to the youngest visitors, which made it challenging to keep the little ones entertained.
Despite these issues, the park itself has a fun atmosphere and offers a decent range of attractions for older kids and adults. However, with some adjustments in pricing and more toddler-friendly rides, it could become a much more enjoyable destination for all ages.

name: Western Playland
address: 1249 Futurity Dr, Sunland Park, NM 88063, USA

reviews.text: Pretty good. It was fun and the lines weren't too long. For a amusement park it wasn't to expensive. Not a whole lot of rides but for a day of weekend fun definitely worth it

I went Tuesday when it opened at 2:00pm. It was fine. Even though it doesn't seem like there are a lot of rides it was quite fun. Definitely go earlier if you don't want to wait for 30 minutes for a ride, cause in the evening a lot of people show up. I actually loved the food they served!

We had a great day at Western Playland because I spent the time with my family.

It costs about $35 per person for entry, and to ride all of the rides.

Unfortunately, all of the roller coasters were out of service with the exception of two, the kiddie one, and the log ride one.

The food is tasty and reasonable. They do not put enough ice into the drink, and then you have a warm soda. I did ask for more ice, but the young man only threw in a few cubes.

They really should install cooling stations with sprinklers because it gets extremely hot walking around. I know they do their best to “control the weather” but misters sure would help like some amusement parks around the country do.

I also recommend more benches and lighting into the bathroom entrances. It is completely dark, and difficult to differentiate between the male and female bathrooms.

We left as soon the mosquitoes started attacking us, which was about 9 pm.

I saw a lot of puke outside the swing ride and the boat ride. Very gross and chunky but other than that it was good. Not sure why someone got sick at both those rides because they are very tame. Good luck to them though. Perhaps that was why some coasters where closed— too pukey.
Popular amusement park in Sunland Park, NM, across from the race track and very close to El Paso (west side). The grandkids always want to come here when they visit us in El Paso. Reasonably priced.

name: Adventureland
address: 2245 Broadhollow Rd, Farmingdale, NY 11735, USA

reviews.text: Not a bad place to visit especially since it’s in Long Island. Not a lot of ethnic diversity either to be honest but still pretty friendly. This place is mainly for kids aged 4-10 years. Lots of kiddie rides and height restrictions like 44-48 inches in order to ride alone or at least with an adult 18+ years of age. Lots of classic carnival games to play like ring toss, basketball shot, water pistol shooter etc with tons of prizes for choose from winning which it should since it is an amusement park. Food is also ok but pricing could use a little adjusting. Plenty of car parking around and they even have special events and conditions for birthday rentals. Bumper cars were kind of boring and the arcades could use a lot more variety in games. Overall I did like the park but gave it 3 star because it reminded me of a much less mundane version of 6 flags. The wait times were the best part as I managed to get through the whole park in 2 hours. Summer time maybe much busier so I can’t really say for certain but this place does have its moments. Some of the rides was actually inspired by 6 flags like the fireball or tornado. The day pass was $40 and came with a silver wristband which looked pretty nice. Bunch of places to take pictures and make memories.

This is a Good spot to bring the kids, this is one of those go here to kill some time adventure parks. The rides are good, atmosphere is good, park is clean, bathrooms are maintained, food and drink are a bit more pricey then u would want, but since it’s the only spot, u got no choice. still worth it and will definitely be returning

Came here Sunday for a birthday party always have a good time at Adventureland. This is a Long Island staple it has definitely gotten better over the years. The rides are fun for all ages. The games are fun as well but a little pricey. the security guard Bob was wonderful very nice and welcoming. My only gripe is at the food. Isn’t the best in my opinion could use some work other than that I’d recommend family coming here to spend the day or even if you wanna have a birthday party this is a great location.

Season pass holder for the past 3 years to take my now 6-year old son during summer time. A lot of fun rides: bumper car, rescue boat, Ferris wheel, to name a few. They also have a nice indoor arcade with claw machines, video games, etc. Nice place to spend a day with kids.

name: Adventurers Amusement Park
address: 1824 Shore Pkwy, Brooklyn, NY 11214, USA

reviews.text: not a bad place if you live nearby and have small children. They will definitely be interested there. Most of all, it seems to me that children love to play a game where you can win goldfish. You can buy a snack (but they don't accept bills over $20, but you can change them at the cash register).

It was our first time visiting the Adventures Amusement Park. The have a lot of variety rides specially for kids, bumper cars as well go karte. They also have arcade area. Tickets seems a bit pricey to us , wrist band is almost the same price as big theme park ticket prices. Its a nice place to hang out with kids.

Children really enjoy but for adults it’s not really shaded in the hot weather ! The Lady that cleans the bathroom doesn’t stop cursing while working as soon as I come out, she’s yelling saying these peoples are animals and disgusting and more words I would not like to repeat… these kind of words should not be saying not in front of children and not in front of adults really not nice..

It’s not a super big park but still a lot of different rides. Mainly for little kids though. There is a small arcade, go carts, bumper cars, mini golf and some games including winning gold fishes! Not much food stalls but enough. There was a live DJ also, that was nice. The trash cans were quite cute. Clean bathrooms. No funnel cakes here but they have funnel fries which were pretty good. Prices for rides and food were very reasonable. Nice outing for families.

My daughter and I love going to this park. It’s perfect for toddlers and young children. The value of the unlimited ride ticket is so worth it! You get so much more than the money you spend. All the rides and fun and the park itself is very clean. There s free parking and almost no wait time in the line for the rides. It’s a hidden gem in Brooklyn between Calvert Vaux Park and Mercedes Benz dealership in off belt parkway west in Brooklyn.
Not less important fact is that the bathrooms are new and very very clean!
Stuff is very nice and courteous.
They also have a fun mini golf park and go karts!! You can take your child as a passenger (min height 42”) in a go kart! My daughter loves it so much.
They also have refreshing beverages, snacks, pop corn for sale and different games.
We used to go a lot to Coney Island rides and honestly the amount of money spent there felt like a robbery tbh, here I feel that I get so much more for every $ spent.
It became our favorite park. And my daughter enjoys going here every time.

name: Deno's Wonder Wheel Amusement Park
address: 3059 W 12th St, Brooklyn, NY 11224, USA

reviews.text:
Visited Jun 7, 2024 -Dad took me and my brothers 40 years ago and I finally took my 7 daughter here for the first time. My daughter had loads of fun at the kiddie park and we went to the adult side for the bumper cars. I had to sit with her on the  ride as she is only 7 so we paid double but it was worth it. Rides are $5 and the adult rides are $8. We bought the $50 card but it wasn't enough so we topped up a few dollars for the last rides. Overall, a great time 👍

I made a video on YouTube and my handle is @wilching. Take a look and if you like it 🙏 please like 👍 and subscribe🔔so I can continue to bring more great content 😊
Had a NY Pass and this was part of the package. Always wanted to go to Coney Island after watching the 'Warriors' film. If your a fan take a look at my Dinosaur Playground Riverside Park post.

Classic !!!!!
You have get on this on when you go down to Coney Island!
Probably the most intense and fun wonder wheel I’ve been on. Definitely have to try the swinging wheel!!

P.s.: Spike Lee is the man 🎡
Fun and classic rides. Great kiddie rides for my 5 year old.  We did the wonder wheel, plus the horror ride, then watched my son do all the kiddie rides. Great day.

Took my kids here all the time during the summer. I was having trouble getting around and there are very nice employees there that really helped me enjoy my time there. The roller coaster and the wonder wheel was very fun and the wait was not that long. I am definitely coming back next year and hopefully it gets even better.

name: Fantasy Forest Carousel Park
address: 5351 111th St, Corona, NY 11368, USA

reviews.text:
Cute little amusement park to let the little ones spend some time and be kids! Took my 6 year old son and he had THE BEST TIME! We went on a Monday so it was not very crowded. The staff was UNBELIEVABLY NICE and friendly!
Only down side is that they do not have any restrooms or any snacks or sell water or drinks. Also it is VERY small there were only 6 rides open. The rides are 1 tickets each and each ticket costs $3.50 or you can buy a wrist band for $25.00 and they can ride as many times as they’d like from 11 am until 4 pm Monday through Thursday. I bought the wrist band and it was WORTH IT because my son went on the roller coaster AT LEAST 30 times. If the kids are over 42” they can ride alone if they are under 42” one parent is able to ride with them for free.
Definitely recommend especially since the staff are so nice and professional..
Lastly there are restrooms by the ball field which is not very far from the amusement park, they are public restrooms so they are not very clean.

Fun of kids and even adults. Regular zoo with  small petting zoo plus a little roller coaster with few other rides for kids. Inside the flushing meadows Corona park so you can do picnic too after the zoo.
Great experience we did love it we going back again me my daughter and husband had so much fun

This a very cute and very small amusement park geared towards younger kids under 7 or so.  It’s next to the Queens Zoo and very close to the New York Hall of Science.

For $25, your child can go unlimited times on all of the rides. Otherwise, you can purchase individual tickets for each ride ($3). There are about 7-8 rides and one game booth.  My two-year-old nephew loved the small trains ride.  He’s on the tall side and the staff made him go by himself since we didn’t have extra tickets for the adults.  If you have children under the height limit, then the adults can ride for free.

There’s also an old fashion carousel ride that goes very fast!  It was a bit disconcerting how fast they make this carousel go.  If you have young kids, I would suggest you place them go on one of the stationary horses or inside one of the carriages rather than on one of the horses that goes up and down.

The only food option here is a hot dog stand and a Mister Softee van parked by the entrance of the amusement park.

Overall, not a bad place to spend a couple of hours.  There were just enough rides to keep my nephew happy.  And we got to spend time at the park afterwards.

It's clean and manageable, good for a quick round before or after the zoo which is just around the corner.  You can buy bill tickets, 100 tickets and spread it out for the season.  You can also get an all day pass, which is awesome if you have an off day to spend with you kids, non weekends and holidays for the pass.

name: Luna Park in Coney Island
address: 1000 Surf Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11224, USA

reviews.text:
I had a wonderful time at Luna Park! The atmosphere was vibrant and full of energy, with colorful lights, music, and the sound of laughter everywhere. The rides were thrilling—especially the roller coasters and the classic Ferris wheel that gave an amazing view. I also enjoyed the carnival games and managed to win a cute little prize.

The staff were friendly and helpful, and the park was well-maintained. Food options were pretty good too—classic fair treats like fairy floss, hot dogs, and churros added to the nostalgic fun
It was closed when I visited but it looked really cool. Except that some of the attractions looked a bit rusty. Not sure if I’d ride them but it’s such a cool view

Came here second time with my family, really enjoined the park. Lots of kiddie rides, and thrilling rides also.  I really enjoyed the Cyclone roller coaster. Have to pay additional $10 for it but it was worth it,  we did not wait long to ride. Kids will enjoy it.  Ride all you want.

Always wanted to see this place. Glad we made the trip. Very cool retro vibe. Prices weren't bad at all . Amazing fireworks show on the beach in August. It was neat to see  places/ spots I've seen in the movies scenes. I'd visit again. And yes Nathan's hot chili dogs were delicious ! Go! And enjoy
Its peaceful & tranquil in February. No crowds & beautiful ocean view..and Nathans is open for a hotdog or two

name: Playland Park
address: 1 Playland Pkwy, Rye, NY 10580, USA

reviews.text: A nice local amusement park with a little beach next to it. During the winter you can take your dog to run around the beach. An ice skating rink is open during the winter months also!

What a wonderful day! Haven't been here in years. We missed a great discount, but still saved with Groupon. Rides were fun, even for the older folks! Catch a Wave, Double Shot, both Flume rides were the best, and yes you do get drenched! Funnel cake was hot and delicious.  Soft frozen lemonade was hard as a rock, and vendor didn't have any spoons. Some employees were sour, but most were friendly. Chicken tender vendor workers was so nice, and helpful. Food was good, even had vegan options. We meet the GM, Mr. Barrett. He was very personable, and informative. Exceptional fireworks display too. A+ Can't wait to go back
Amazing experience. Majority rides open. Beautiful gardens and waterfalls. My kids had an amazing time. The beach, museum and so many other activities . Highly recommend .
Wonderful Park with great rides my twins love it. Great staff members, arcade games a super fun to play. I brought season passes for the Park, worth ever penny spent.. 2024 was awesome.

Very clean,  beautiful floral gardens with jugglers and butterflies on stilts. Still love the Whip for laughs and the mouse trap ride all scares me the most.  The Dragon Coaster is one of the old time wooden coasters and they still one of the "laff in the dark" rides.
I still think it has one of the best kiddie parks, with lots of toddler- friendly rides.

name: The Castle Fun Center
address: 109 Brookside Ave, Chester, NY 10918, USA

reviews.text: GORGEOUS new roller skating rink! Kids had so much fun in the crazy ball area and mini golf. We spent all day there! Very affordable. Didn’t love the food- otherwise it was crazy fun.

Warning must read this. Okay, let's get started. The place is upgraded and beautiful. No doubt. But and here's the butt. The place is outlandishly expensive to play? Play the games. You will literally go through $100 or more easily within 5 minutes. No joke. The games are overly overly priced. Also, which is unfortunate. Shame on you owners. The games are set to lose from the mechanical arms on the stuffed animals that our kids love. To all the other games that offer you points towards prizes all set to the lowest setting. So if you have multiple children with you, expect if you choose to go there and not listen to me to spend hundreds and hundreds and hundreds of dollars. Sorry to blow your bubble kids. And I will go further. If the owners read this and choose to contact me, I will love to talk to you.

Ideal, almost worthy of fighting the nearby Legoland for attention. The indoor arcade part is super well equipped, with massive attractions (eg bouncy area) that are varied, spacious, and well monitored by the staff. The arcade below is also diverse enough in terms of of themes, though it could do a better job at explaining what’s the “conversion rate” of dollars you out into the cards and the “points” you grt for spending on the machines

Very fun interactive space for all ages. There's bowling, laser tag, skating, billiards, arcade,  inflatable bouncy area, go kart racing, zip-lining, and more. Great space for a birthday party. They also offer adult nights for a set price that includes food and fun.

Fun but Pricey. The people selling bands don't give clear guidance on the terms of the bands. The lines for bands are too long. Not enough parking. We had fun, but way too Much money spent for shuch a short time.. 4$ for a bottle of water? Come on. Definitely won't be a regular thing.

name: Eldridge Park Carousel
address: 96 Eldridge Park Dr, Elmira, NY 14901, USA
