reviews.text: Stopped in for a quick visit on a road trip around PA and NY and I’m so glad I did. The carousel is beautiful and in wonderful shape. The park itself is in a scenic location with several flat rides to enjoy. We had a quick meal before getting back on the road and it was very good.

It's great to see part of the park restored. Tried to grab a brass ring on the Carousel, but I came up short. There's a small museum that has items from the original park, and you can sit in a car from The Whip, the Bumper Cars & more! Ahh, memories!

Workers and visitors at the Park are very friendly. A very nice place to walk/run also a place to take your dog has a dog park. Rides, put put, paddle boats and Jasper boat, restaurant and ice cream very family oriented.
It was always the best carousel in the world growing up.  It still is.  (Yes, carousel.  Merry-go-rounds are mobile and can be moved from place to place, carousels are in a permanent place.)
Awesome little park in Elmira with a very cool and fast carousel that has been preserved and definitely worth seeing.

name: Enchanted Forest Water Safari
address: 3183 NY-28, Old Forge, NY 13420, USA

reviews.text: We went for the first time in 20 years. The kids (5&7) had a blast, and it's just like we remembered. Lazy river, water rides, wave pool, enchanted forest, and dry rides! The locker system is very nice. We paid $12 for a medium locker for our things. The machine gives you a waterproof wristband to wear. You scan it, and the locker pops open. We rode the train to get to the back and front of the park multiple times throughout the day. Lines were kind of long, but we went on a Friday. Food was not as pricey as I expected.

Enchanted Forest Water Safari is such a massive park. I will be honest I had no idea that this park was this large when I went there for the first time. They have some really great slides that are a lot of fun.
I recommend going on the Curse of the Silverback ride. I probably waited a half hour for this ride in the hot sun but it was worth it. They have a family deal for tickets if you purchase ahead online that offers a pizza, ice cream cones and large refillable soda/water cups for all family members.

The park itself is massive so it is important to have a system if you are going with a lot of kids to make sure they are all supervised. They have a story time land for smaller kids with older still reenactments of classic stories from the Black Forest.

They also have a petting zoo which is pretty cool as well. The slides and the water park are spread out pretty much everywhere you go so you can’t miss it.

On top of all of this, they have a bunch of rides like helicopters, bumper cars, boats, Ferris wheels, and so much more. They also have a live performers at this large amphitheater outside as well, and a train that runs through the park nonstop as well.

There are beach cabanas for rent and the next time I go back I would definitely get one of those. Having shade during the hot months is something that is going to make you feel so much better because you will be able to enjoy your day more.

All in all, this is a large entity to take on as just one family but it can a lot of fun. There will never be a shortage of anything to do which is nice as well. It’s amazing that this park has held up so well over the years, the owners really do a nice job taking care of everything.

This place is adorable. We went in August 2023, my kids ask to go back all the time. They're 9, 6 and 4 and they all had a great time. My youngest especially loved the little fairytale statues, she wanted to go back 4 times to take pics with them all. Also the rides being included was so nice. We're planning another trip for this summer to bring my sister and her kids along.

Came in for brunch on a Saturday. Beautiful build out for this new restaurant. First off Bei our server was exceptional. For the food we ordered  wasabi lobster roll of the brunch menu which was delicious in flavor albeit could use a little more lobster. The sashimi was very fresh and the flavor was exceptional. Perusing the dinner menu there are a lot of intriguing dishes. It’s a big place with space for your big parties !

We loved our first time at this place! Weather was perfect! But a lot of the venders were closed & not every ride was open on opening week.  Their Nashville chicken sandwich in the main food vender wasn't bad either! A little dirty in the one lazy river but overall we will return because we stay at the old forge camp resort every year!

name: Greek Peak Mountain Resort
address: 2000 NY-392, Cortland, NY 13045, USA

reviews.text: We’ve already spent three weekends at this ski resort, and it’s been an amazing experience. The resort offers a variety of trails suitable for all skill levels, including a kid-friendly magic carpet area. Most of the trails are wide, providing a spacious and safe skiing environment.

We stayed the weekend this past weekend and the staff was amazing. The price at the restaurant was extremely ridiculous. $25 for a burger is insane. The rooms were very basic. We had a room with no microwave, mini fridge or anything special just a small coffee pot. We felt forced to have to buy food and drinks there because of not having the amenities to use for our stay. Overall a quiet place, but we definitely did not appreciate hearing children running through the hall ways late at night or a soccer ball being slammed off the floor for 2 hours. The beds were stiff, pillows flat but the view was great. We loved the theme of the halls, the rustic light fixtures. The view was incredible. Overall positive experience just hope that some minor things can be tweaked for next time.

We stayed here for an event and overall enjoyed our stay. The staff was amazing, the location beautiful, and the food good. The pool and hot tub was very nice, and overall it was a good location.

Our only issue was the bed, it was horrible. It was very hard and I probably would have slept better on the floor. I switched to the pullout couch bed and had a little bit of a better sleep.

The website doesn't give much information about the room amenities and I had to dig through reviews to figure out what came in the room. There wasn't a mini-fridge or microwave and that would have been nice to know.

Our 1st time on the slopes.

5 stars for Brad my snowboard instructor. I recommend Brad to anyone looking to learn snowboarding. His teachings connect snowboarding, to flowing through life in general. I appreciate his laid back, go with the flow method of teaching beyond words.

We found the a Trax pub and grill perfect for us to sit, get our bearings, and develop a first time on the slopes game plan.

We found Shannon & her crew in the Ski, board, helmet & equipment area to be the key to making our visit noteworthy. She was willing and able to help us to understand & navigate the system, classes & payment process.
We spoke to employees at the entrance whom were just not really able to do so.

Had a great time Skiing!  Quick and easy process getting outfitted with rental equipment.  My son's and I had a group ski lesson with Mike who was excellent!  Definitely purchase tickets, rentals and lessons online in advance, this made everything seamless.  Would definitely ski here again if in the area.

name: Huck Finn's Playland
address: 25 Erie Blvd, Albany, NY 12204, USA

reviews.text:
We took our two-year-old grandson and it was perfect for him. The rides were fun and the appropriate time.  We spent three hours there.  It was reasonably priced. What I liked most was no teenage rides and thus no wild teenagers in an amusement park!

The area around the park was pretty gritty, but it didn’t bother us.  Most of the people in the park were a little trashy, but acceptable.  The bathrooms also needed some attention.

They offer safe gluten free food (ice cream cones, buns, etc.) they will also have a dedicated fryer soon.

In addition, the rides are iconic. The same ones at least 3 generations have ridden! The new owner is doing a great job of making everything look fresh and most importantly, providing shade!!!

Great little place, especially for toddlers & preschoolers. We went today for a special birthday treat and it was $40 for 25 tickets and it lasted us (2 children) for over 3 hours. They have some food, drinks, and snacks there as well that are extremely reasonably priced. Cool train ride going every 30 mins twice around the park so about 5 mins. Bathrooms are all flush and decently clean. Easy parking and convenient location, we will certainly be back with friends! Thanks for a great day 😀

Today 7/23/24: I am glad that Mike and some of original workers are back! It was awesome.
I absolutely love this place. Mike, Kyra, another worker whose mother is a teacher, these workers treat my son Jason and myself with 100% kindness and professional behavior. I take my son there 3 to 4 times a week and I probably will have it replace all the other amusement parks that I know. Every time my son leaves the amusement park we know we had an amazing time🏆🎉
I Love this amusement park! It's my favorite place to unwind, relax and have a good time. The best thrill rides and best state fair food. Thank you Huck Finn's for your service! 🙂

name: LEGOLAND New York Resort
address: 1 Legoland Blvd, Goshen, NY 10924, USA

reviews.text: A must-visit destination for entertainment. It's certainly enjoyable for both adults and children. My family thoroughly enjoyed every moment spent there. The food was great and reasonably priced. I loved the exceptional experience at the 4D movie theater. There are numerous activities to engage in. I highly recommend this place.

Visited a year after they opened.  As an adult visitor I really enjoyed the Lego models.  Lunch in the hotel was good but service at the time was slow due to skeleton crew (Covid). Overall it was a nice visit.

Perfect thing to do with my daughter! Not too far from where I live. Every time I went, which is like 5-6 times, we had a blast!!!! We made sure to go for Bricktacular and Lego Santa. All the staff are super friendly . Food is good esp the pizza. Sometimes they have entertainment which is such a good time. I love legoland!

Our family raided Legoland, and both my 10 - and 6 year old boys loved it. The Lego sculptures around the park are great and help with the spread out layout, although be ready to walk. The rides are clean and staff all seemed very nice. We even found the elusive Mr. Gold. The drag is the food, or I would have given 5 stars. It is VERY overpriced, and the quality is substandard at best both in the park as well as in the hotel. Another drawback was that there are very little indoor activities, but overall, if your kids love Lego, they will enjoy themselves.

We stayed at Legoland this Fall during the Brick or Treat. This was our second time going to the park but first time at the hotel. What an amazing time. Honestly we could have just stayed at the hotel and had the best experience without even doing the park. The service was incredible. Special thanks to Oscar our server at breakfast and Benz at the front desk.  The rooms are so fun and the activities were perfect. The one issue is the food which I know pretty much everyone complains about. I had food at main area in the evening and it was pretty good but the breakfast was inedible! It was truly the worse food we've ever had. They must do better.  But other than the food it was great! The park is a lot of fun and they had a lot of treats. We especially enjoyed the spooky characters.  We will definitely be going back.

name: Midway State Park
address: 4859 NY-430, Bemus Point, NY 14712, USA

reviews.text:
What matters is what the grandkids thought, and they loved the park! Perfect for the six and two year olds. All the staff were friendly and helpful too!
The park is basically very attractive but needs renovation. Wonderful lakefront exposure!

Came back for a second time, and I was somewhat disappointed...
Half of the arcade games were out of order, and half of the games that were "working", just took your quarters with no prize! A couple rides were broken down (Ferris wheel, tilt a whirl). The food is super overpriced ($6 for two waters), but everything that was up was super fun. I would recommend coming, but skip the arcade and maybe eat outside the park.

We spent 5 hrs. there today with our Grandaughter and her 3 Toddlers. The 6 yr. old exclaimed it was the best day of her life! Everything was just perfect for a 10 year old or younger. Grounds and restrooms were very clean. Food was expensive as expected but good. All the staff were very pleasant and courteous with the Kids. Wristbands are the cheapest deal if you're staying all day. We were all very happy that we went there for our last Summer Fling! Thanks for all your hard work and efforts..

Wonderful place to take young children
We come here every year. The boys love it and request to go! We stayed for about 3 hours. Went on all rides had a picnic and played on playground.

Perfect for my kiddos ages! 2 and 4. I'm a single mom amd went solo which is always a little intimidating when going to a place like this but it was totally manageable! Kids had a great time!! My only gripe is that they should do a little work on the rides. The roller coaster was way to jerky. Anyway, we had a blast tho!

name: Dino Roar Valley
address: 1912 US-9, Lake George, NY 12845, USA

reviews.text: This park is worth the drive to Lake George. The dinosaurs are amazing and convincing. The park is shaded so the trip down dinosaur lane is enjoyable. The staff are friendly and helpful. If you want to eat or drink something, you can pay in cash, which is great. I recommend this park to every family.

My son insisted I leave a 5 star review. We visited this past week and were both big fans. Great little park and the dinosaurs are awesome. We had a great time. Love the fossil dig and the workshop was cool also. He did the clay dino option. We bought tickets online in advance to save $$. It's a fun place for kids and adults alike
Full of adventures for the toddlers. Dinosaurs are very well made kids will be speechless seeing the dinos roar and move. Staff is so friendly. Scavenger hunt for the teens is an awesome idea.

My children, ages 2 and 5 are obsessed with coming here for the rides and dinosaurs. So much so that they asked every day once it closed for the summer last year when it would be open again. The dinosaur experience is the best we have seen and the rides are so much fun them (and adults!). The concession options are good and reasonably priced. I highly recommend.
The price is high for the amount of rides that weren't operating but the Dino walk was awesome!!  The kids loved it.  My 4yr old had a blast and even my 9yr old said he gives it a 5 star!

name: Enchanted Forest Water Safari
address: 3183 NY-28, Old Forge, NY 13420, USA

reviews.text: We went for the first time in 20 years. The kids (5&7) had a blast, and it's just like we remembered. Lazy river, water rides, wave pool, enchanted forest, and dry rides! The locker system is very nice. We paid $12 for a medium locker for our things. The machine gives you a waterproof wristband to wear. You scan it, and the locker pops open. We rode the train to get to the back and front of the park multiple times throughout the day. Lines were kind of long, but we went on a Friday. Food was not as pricey as I expected.

Enchanted Forest Water Safari is such a massive park. I will be honest I had no idea that this park was this large when I went there for the first time. They have some really great slides that are a lot of fun.
I recommend going on the Curse of the Silverback ride. I probably waited a half hour for this ride in the hot sun but it was worth it. They have a family deal for tickets if you purchase ahead online that offers a pizza, ice cream cones and large refillable soda/water cups for all family members.

The park itself is massive so it is important to have a system if you are going with a lot of kids to make sure they are all supervised. They have a story time land for smaller kids with older still reenactments of classic stories from the Black Forest.

They also have a petting zoo which is pretty cool as well. The slides and the water park are spread out pretty much everywhere you go so you can’t miss it.

On top of all of this, they have a bunch of rides like helicopters, bumper cars, boats, Ferris wheels, and so much more. They also have a live performers at this large amphitheater outside as well, and a train that runs through the park nonstop as well.

There are beach cabanas for rent and the next time I go back I would definitely get one of those. Having shade during the hot months is something that is going to make you feel so much better because you will be able to enjoy your day more.

All in all, this is a large entity to take on as just one family but it can a lot of fun. There will never be a shortage of anything to do which is nice as well. It’s amazing that this park has held up so well over the years, the owners really do a nice job taking care of everything.

This place is adorable. We went in August 2023, my kids ask to go back all the time. They're 9, 6 and 4 and they all had a great time. My youngest especially loved the little fairytale statues, she wanted to go back 4 times to take pics with them all. Also the rides being included was so nice. We're planning another trip for this summer to bring my sister and her kids along.

Came in for brunch on a Saturday. Beautiful build out for this new restaurant. First off Bei our server was exceptional. For the food we ordered  wasabi lobster roll of the brunch menu which was delicious in flavor albeit could use a little more lobster. The sashimi was very fresh and the flavor was exceptional. Perusing the dinner menu there are a lot of intriguing dishes. It’s a big place with space for your big parties !

We loved our first time at this place! Weather was perfect! But a lot of the venders were closed & not every ride was open on opening week.  Their Nashville chicken sandwich in the main food vender wasn't bad either! A little dirty in the one lazy river but overall we will return because we stay at the old forge camp resort every year!

name: Niagara Amusement Park and Splash World at Fantasy Island
address: 2400 Grand Island Blvd, Grand Island, NY 14072, USA

reviews.text: It is sad to see the park has been stripped of so many rides by the previous owner. I really hope the new owner can revive it. The serpent is a very smooth, fun ride. Silver comet is a fun wooden coaster, too. To the owners, thank you for trying to revive it. Lots of work.

An excellent park for ages 2 to 12. My in-laws took their 3 boys back in the 60s and 70s. My husband and I have taken our children and now we're taking grandchildren! The new owners are serious about bringing this park back to its original glory but it will take time, money and people. Please go if you're in the area. We look forward to coming back next year!

A ghost town the Saturday before Labor Day weekend. Fully half of the rides weren't open. For the few rides that were, the short staff were forced to operate multiple rides. That created unduly long waits.

The only truly adult attraction, the roller-coaster, broke down around 4pm. The best water attraction, for most, was closed as well. About half of the shops were also closed.

Even our three and four year olds were unimpressed. Though the 18 month old had great fun in the kiddy pool. Worth maybe a $14.99 admission for adults. Talk about price gouging, kids over 36 inches tall pay full price, yet several kiddy rides would only allow children over 42 inches to ride. Full price doesn't guarantee full access.

Definitely DON'T recommend! The whole day was just creepy and weird.

But we parked right in front of the gate and there were no lines to get tickets.

This amusement park was so run down and not worth visiting at all.  These were just a few pictures of rides that were broken and not running.  We stayed at the KOA next door, called to make sure they were open and the train was running to pick us up at the station at the campground got told yes so we bought tickets through the campground.  I then called again while walking to train stop to make sure it was running because the gates were still closed and we hadn’t heard the train yet was told yes it ran every 15 mins.  We waited 20 mins and called again, to only be told that it ran 15/20 mins.  We decided to just drive and not waste anymore time, we get there and there was a sign at the train that said it was not running.  Communication needs attention, notice of how many ride closures posted online and even when calling would be appreciated.  We bought mochi icecream and it was $4.00 for just one little mochi.  The only things positive were the French fries and any staff we did interact with were very friendly and nice.

We had been watching over the last few years how our beloved Fantasy Island was falling into disrepair and actually closing. The new ownership is definitely doing something right! Sure, some rides are gone but many are still here and in good shape too.
The Wild West shootouts are still great! The train and the silver comet still are a major part of the fun. The food we had at the Steak place was excellent. The crowds were light and that worked for us just fine.
The saloon had ice cream, a decent beer selection and a stage show.
Above all, the adult workers and the younger student age workers were Pleasent and showed a sincere desire to make this a special day for my 12,10,4 and 2 year old grandchildren.
There are several rides coming back and new ones on the way. They are on the right track. A great day just before school starts up again!

name: Olcott Beach Carousel Park
address: 5979 E Main St, Olcott, NY 14126, USA

reviews.text: It’s a nice place for a day out with your family. The carousels are for small kids. They can enjoy the magic show here. The beach side walk is wonderful. There are small shops. There are enough parking spaces surrounding the place. People visiting Niagara Falls can keep this in your list if you have small kids.

Took my 2 yo. Her first time trying rides and she had a blast. The atmosphere was amazing. Super family friendly and love how affordable the rides are. All the staff were welcoming and friendly. Facilities were clean, including restrooms. My baby rode all the rides twice. Will definitely be back and 100% recommended specially for little ones!!
This is a quaint little spot on Lake Ontario. A definite must visit! We took our classic cars this year. We liked it so much we ended up renting an air bnb cottage nearby!
Great place for kids! Very well maintained and great staff. Only $0.25 each ride and a magic show. Great food options nearby and right on Lake Ontario.

This place was so cute and fun!!
My husband and I Took our 3 year old and costed us $2 for her to ride every single ride! We packed our own lunch and had lunch overlooking the beautiful scenery. Will definitely make this a casual trip to take on summer weekends.

name: Santa's Workshop, North Pole, NY
address: 324 Whiteface Memorial Hwy, Wilmington, NY 12997, USA

reviews.text: Very pricey. Same price for my 3yr old as it is for an adult. Hasn’t been updated since the park opened 75 years ago but nostalgic in that sense. The girl working in the hat factory though did not seem happy to be there as I walked in to say hello and got no smile or response when she looked at me. The little show they put on outside was cute. The Santa they have working with his helpers were very accommodating and friendly. The train,carousel and another ride weren’t working when we were there this past weekend which was a bummer. Really enjoyed seeing the live reindeer they had in their stalls though. Kids had fun so that’s what counts. Not busy there at all.

This Saturday we had breakfast with Santa and visited his home and workshop. My kids are 4 and 7 years old. They absolutely loved it. So magical. They both said "best day ever". To my children this was more magical than Disney world. Noel the Elf at the Photoshop was so kind, funny, and had such patience with my children. The lady at the toy shop was helpful and kind too. Santa and Mrs. Claus were as sweet as one would expect. Thank you Santa for having a heart of gold and answering all the children's questions. Thank you to everyone for making this day special and keeping their hearts full of belief and wonder.
This is an amazing expierence for the whole family. It’s an outdoor wonderland amusement park geared for children. If you haven’t been, I suggest you get there

⭐️very special time capsule of a place
⭐️#nostalgic
⭐️#imaginative + creative
⭐️welcoming + friendly
⭐️fun, #FamilyTrip

I went here as a kid and am thankful to be able to bring my babygirl here as well to make memories. The ride operators are so sweet…

🚂 before hopping on the train the conductor says each time “look to the left in the woods to see where the elves live in the trees” and then there they are ! Little doors on the trees. When we tried to tip him for the 3 times he took our gang on the loop he would not accept saying “you pay enough to come through the gate” (which at $30 dollars for adults and kids 2+ I thought was far beyond reasonable)

🥣we went on a chilly, Autumn day and were glad to have some warm split pea & ham soup to warm us up as we sat inside the lunchroom chalet. We arrived around 230pm and realized they closed at 3pm. Instead of rushing us out, the gentleman that runs the kitchen sat down and had a chat with us, reassuring us there was no rush for us to leave. After living in Miami for the last 8 years and NYC for 10 years prior to that…it warmed my soul to have genuine and kind conversation.

🛝there’s a (bit of a hidden) slide in the workshop (that even Mom’s can go down)

If you’re visiting the #Adirondacks be sure to stop by! #Kidfriendly
My kids had a great time. They truly enjoyed the park. I just wish the park was a little bigger.

name: Seabreeze Amusement Park
address: 4600 Culver Rd, Rochester, NY 14622, USA

reviews.text:
We loved this place! It has a good variety of rides for all ages, even the little kids. All the rides seem to be in good working order and look well-kept. In fact the whole park was very clean and fresh-looking. The employees were courteous and professional.
We went on a Thursday in late June so the lines for rides were very short or non-existent. We had no trouble buying tickets at the entrance and there was no line. We didn't go into the water park area so I can't speak to that part. Overall I definitely recommend it and if we lived closer I'd definitely visit again.

Took my six year old son for the first time a couple weeks ago. I grew up going to Seabreeze, and it was nice to see many older nostalgic things while there were also a bunch of new and improved rides and attractions, both in the amusement park and in the water park. Went on a Tuesday in July and the lines were so reasonable..didn't wait more than 10 minutes for some rides and many had no wait. The park is clean and well kept, and is definitely a must do for families in Western NY!

Today was our second visit to Seabreeze and my husband and I are thoroughly impressed with the staff. Everyone at this park is so friendly and smiling and professional! The park is very clean.  They have plenty of fun rides for both small children and older children as well as a great water park. The park is not massive which we enjoy because there is less walking and exhaustion to the parents. The food is good and they have clean restrooms. We will continue to enjoy this park for years to come.

Sea breeze is a family friendly amusement park! My sons liked the rollercoasters and other thrill rides, however they are more into riskier rides and adventure! The bigger chain theme parks unfortunately provide more fun for their tastes! That being said I like supporting small businesses more than chain theme parks! Of all rides that one should definitely ride is the Jackrabbit rollercoaster just for the historical history alone!

Our family loved our visit to Seabreeze. It was a fantastic experience from start to finish. Be aware that they check your bags and coolers, if you bring them, so you'll stop at the beginning for that. Then if you choose you can stow your items in a locker for a fee. There were some long lines for certain water slides and rides but we had so much fun that we didn't mind. All the rides and slides were so fun. The staff were all polite as well. The show that they had during lunch, with some really talented performers,  was an added bonus, as were the beautiful flower planters around the park. It was a lovely place to spend a day.

name: Six Flags Darien Lake
address: 9993 Alleghany Rd, Corfu, NY 14036, USA

reviews.text: Six Flags likes to rob you if you get a membership. I canceled my membership a while back ago, and turned out they were still charging me, and they are refusing to reimburse me for the money that they took. I did everything that I was supposed to when I canceled and still they just let a loyal customer for years walk away in this matter extremely frustrated and feeling riped off.

Our Family was going to purchase season passes for 6 so i went online to pay for them. My husband was injured and needs a motorized scooter so we planned to rent one each visit. When i checked the price for the scooters, it was the same price for one visit as the season holder pass for the entire season.

To charge someone $50 per visit for a scooter is crazy. its almost as if they are saying they don't want disabled people to be regulars there.

We will never go back there again!

Elizabeth Jackson

It is always an excellent experience at Darien lake, I wish with the fright fest there were more scares around the park but Darien lake is always my favorite park to go too!! The staff are always so helpful and friendly, there’s some great rides that I love to go on there!! It’s a great atmosphere and a great location for it!! They also always have the best concerts and the perfect spot for them!! Just recently went to see Avril Lavigne and it was everything I dreamed of and more!!

Don’t bother going half stuff never running. And definitely don’t buy the passes I been trying to cancel after the year and here I am can’t get nobody to call back when u get an email they won’t give you your own info and still being billed The only thing more of a scam than these passes is the actual parks themselves. If you like waterslides go to Kalahari in PA beautiful place way better.

This company is a con artist. DO NO UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES BUY A SEASON PASS. They will try to get you to pay until the end of time. Park is a joke of what it was. Needs to be closed. All riff raff and people breaking into concerts causing fights and problems. Do not bring your child here. It'll be there 1st lesson in a rip-off. I'd give no stars if possible.

name: Six Flags Great Escape
address: 1172 US-9, Queensbury, NY 12804, USA

reviews.text: We love a good waterpark! Six Flags water park was clean and had good customer service. The bathrooms were clean and the lines were not long. We had fun on the variety of slides and the lazy river. We like when you can swim without a tube in the lazy river which they allowed.

We are regular visitors to the New Jersey Six Flags but this was our first trip to Great Escape and we loved it! This amusement park is designed so well and kids will love it. Adults can have an amazing time too.. high thrill rides, and great options for food. There was about 10-15 minutes of waiting time for each ride which wasn't bad for a holiday week.  Our favourite rides were Comet, Flashback and Adirondack outlaw. The train and boat rides were super cute! The best part about this park is that the theme park and water park are connected and you can enjoy the best of both worlds, so carry your swimwear! Parking is a little far away and you'll have to walk from there to the theme park.

Six flags Fright Fest never lets you down. My family and I had a great time. We always enjoy seeing the employees dressed in scary costumes and the many haunted houses. It's also cool hitting the roller coasters at night!!!! 60 bucks a person for the entrance fee and access to the haunted houses is a pretty fair price for a great evening.

This is a great park! This park is fun for everyone, and it is the most family friendly Six Flags I've visited. There are plenty of rides and activities for kids. We loved the multiple waterparks. We visited on a Friday morning right before a thunderstorm, so there was no wait to enter the park and the lines were very short, which we enjoyed. We had a great time here. The Bobcat was my favorite!
Nice place we had fun with our 5 yr. Old gd...room were ok...wish the food was better breakfast buffet was horrible...pub restaurant and food court all bad and expensive...other then that fun time

name: Sylvan Beach Amusement Park
address: 112 Bridge St, Sylvan Beach, NY 13157, USA

reviews.text: This is such a nice area of NY State. I spent a few days in the area and took part in a ghost hunt - super fun! At night, the rides sure seemed spooky. There are a few cool restaurants too, I'll be back again, for sure.
It’s a window into a delightful old style amusement park. Get the unlimited ride wristbands and enjoy the day with rides and fun. Close to the beach to enjoy between rides.

I think we spent all summer here this year. Definitely going to look in to getting season passes for next year. If you're not swimming, then relax on the beach, or go fishing, or ride rides, or play games, or go to the playground  or eat..there's always enough to do in this tiny park. And then right outside of it as well either shops, bars, candy stores, wine slushies, ice cream stands and gift shops. It's free to enter, but $10 to park, if you park inside the amusement park/Beach.

Old school rides. .25 cent games. What a beautiful place!  Steel horse carrosel. Original Zotar. Love it!

7 8 2023
I absolutely love this park! If you want to enjoy an old school theme park by the lake take the time to visit.

8 29 2024
Still loving the old school theme park. Everyone is so friendly. I'm from South Carolina and hospitality is rare these days. I would definitely bring my grandchildren here and have no worries. Thank you for keeping this park clean and safe.

Just a nice place to do a lot of different things. The Casino, walks, fishing, boating, the beach.. food. Dog walking was popular.
The car show was well behaved, the breeze was perfect..

name: Carowinds
address: North Carolina, USA

reviews.text: We thought a weekday would be less crowded there, but there were tons of school kids on field trips there, we did may be 3 rides the whole time between 10 and 6 and once they started leaving were able to do more rides within a short time. Richochet was broken by the end of the day, and we couldn't ride it. This park is so similar to California's Great America.

We went March 23 ‘25. It was the 2nd week they were open for the season. Before noon lines went quickly, after noon it was awful. We ended up calling it quits after waiting over an hr for the kiddie balloon ride.
We enjoyed our visit for the most part. My kids got to ride probably 5 rides each. We also stayed at the Carowinds campground and really thought the campground was lovely. The staff was accommodating and super friendly. The cabin was lovely. Came with everything we needed for our stay and plenty of towels for our family of 5.
The shuttle bus drivers that took us from the campground to the park were awesome.
We will come back soon possibly get season passes. Just the lines were awful after noon-ish. We understand but for little kids it’s hard to explain the long waits in the kiddie area/
Amazing amusement park, loys of rides and great food..Fury 325 is incredibly tall.. Our visit was lots of fun and I definitely recommend it to anyone visiting NC/SC.

The park was clean. Go as soon as they open and/or get a Fastpass because it gets really busy by 1pm and wait times can be ridiculous. My only other complaint is that the funnel cake place near Starbucks is a cluster. They don't have a good menu displayed and don't know how to direct people to make a line. If you don't know what toppings they offer, they get sassy with you. The kitchen takes up 3/4 of the building, only giving a small area for people to order, pay, and wait.
We enjoy going to Carowinds all year long. Lots of fun different rides but much better priced than the amusement parks in Florida.

name: Frankie's of Raleigh
address: 11190 Fun Park Dr, Raleigh, NC 27617, USA

reviews.text: I loved that this place had a lot to do for kids and adults.  We went in July and it was so hot..but we had a lot of fun. The place is clean and well organized.  The kids had a lot of fun. We will definitely go back to take my grandkids they had a blast.

Review for Frankie’s of Raleigh Amusement Park

We recently visited Frankie’s of Raleigh, and while the park offered fun activities for kids, our overall experience was disappointing. Before arriving, we called ahead to confirm that the entire park was open, only to find out upon arrival that only one go-kart track was available. We were particularly excited about the drifting experience, but that wasn’t an option—a major letdown.

The staff was not helpful or informative. When we inquired about the closed tracks, we received vague responses with no effort to provide additional details. It felt like they were uninterested in assisting guests, which only added to the frustration.

While some attractions may still be enjoyable, the lack of clear communication and customer service makes it hard to recommend this place. There are plenty of other amusement parks and entertainment centers in the area that provide better service and a more transparent experience.
Not only did we have fun but the food and icee options were pretty good!! We had fun and it wasn't overcrowded, which is perfectly fine with us lol!
We always have a fun time at Frankie’s. They do a great job keeping the park clean. We loved the spinning coaster and laser tag!

I haven’t came here since I was a little kid but I decided to bring my younger cousins and I’m pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed it even as an adult. Go-karts and the spinning claw outside were so much fun, and everyone won enough tickets playing games to go buy something.

name: Santa's Village
address: 528 Presidential Hwy, Jefferson, NH 03583, USA

reviews.text: The park was beautiful, immaculately clean, and Very Festive! All the employees were very helpful and very friendly! The monorail stopped while we were waiting and in less than a minute, 7 men came to fix it. It was up and running within 2 minutes. That was Amazing! We loved the reindeer and all the fun activities and games. The cookies were delicious! This is a family centered park and although my daughter is in her late 30s and we are in our 60s, we had a BLAST! It's not just for little kids! We will definitly be returning!

An amazing place for children of all ages. It's all outdoors so dress for the weather. Fun rides. Food is very reasonably priced for an amusement park. And it's really good food too! We went in December and the fresh real snow made it extra special. We want to take our grandson back in the summer.

This was an amazing adventure! We arrived early afternoon and stayed until after 6pm.
The trees and lighting were impressive. The staff was really caring and helpful. We had hot food from a cafe that was quite good and not over priced. The boys got to see Santa and ride several rides. I was impressed that honor was paid to the Christ event at Christmas. The reindeer were handsome and close enough to see well. I enjoyed the train and the flying sleigh ride. Our kids were too young for the theater, maybe next year.

Great time with my niece. It’s a beautiful place at night. The pizza was really good. There was only a few lines for the rides. I gave it 4 stars because it was extremely cold the day we went. The reindeer were very cute aswell!

Very fun for the whole family at Winter Time. Would love to visit in the summer for the water rides. Interactive games are great, staff are friendly, rides are fun. Large variety of food and snacks as well.

name: Highlands Aerial Park
address: 9625 Dillard Rd, Scaly Mountain, NC 28775, USA

reviews.text: My husband and I did the full canopy tour & swing as an activity on our honeymoon in Highlands & we both had an amazing time! Our guides, Morgan & Malcolm, were hilarious, helpful, & clear about all of the safety things. We started off with 2 other parties, but we were the only people in our group to do the full tour, & let me tell you, the full tour was absolutely worth it. The views on the 5th & 6th zip lines were incredible!! I also called ahead because I was worried if the course would be doable with long acrylics & they said it should be fine, & I had no issues. So much fun!!

This was our first time ever doing a Zip Line. Our guides were amazing,  I felt so comfortable taking the leap off the platform.
I definitely recommend doing the entire course. The views were to die for!!!
Can't say enough about Brad/Darren.
We even hiked to the waterfall and found some Geo's while on property.

Highlands Arial Park was a fantastic adventure during our visit to Cashiers, NC. The short drive to Highlands led to one of our trio doing the challenge Zip line, while my friend & I watched the first 4 rides then walked the trail. Later the 3 of us experienced the adventure of the Big Swing, a rush of thrilling adrenaline giving way to the joy of slowly easing to a stop.I highly recommend taking time to visit the friendly staff who created an enjoyably memorable experience for me and my friends.

My husband and I went for our honeymoon. He was able to check zip lining off his bucket list. We did the full course, it was amazing. The best runs are on the second half for sure, and they prepare you for it during the first half.  Anna and Will were full of information,  positive,  and very encouraging for those of us who were nervous. We highly recommend this place.

We stopped in to check out the activities for our grandkids upcoming visit.  The place was so nice, as was the associate, we stayed for the waterfalls hike.  The afternoon was perfect for a hike to Middle Creek Falls and a lunch on the big rocks.  We’ll be back so the grands can experience the tree climb, kids course and zip lining!

name: Tweetsie Railroad
address: 300 Tweetsie Railroad Ln, Blowing Rock, NC 28605, USA

reviews.text:
A great place for families, especially with younger children! Much more affordable and family friendly than other, larger amusement parks.

Parking is FREE, it isn't too terribly busy unless a major holiday, and the staff is always friendly and welcoming.

We visit here from Florida once or twice each year and our now 5 year old daughter loves it. No real thrill rides or super fast, looping roller coasters here, just good, old fashioned fun with live shows and delicious fudge and a calm, laid back vibe.

Kids had a great time, it was cold but was still fun, I haven't been to Tweetsie since I was a very young kid so it was enjoyable for me as well, i believe we'll have to go back during the normal Tweetsie so the kids can see it during the traditional Tweetsie as well.
We took our family to Tweetsie and had a blast. From a 2 1/2 year old to a 67 year old, we had fun. Beautiful lights, singing Christmas songs on the train. It was great!

Tweetsie Christmas is the absolute best and well worth the cost of tickets! Staff is always so friendly and we enjoyed roasting marshmallows at the fire pits, the Christmas drum ride, blizzard tunnel, the train ride and all the lights. Don't miss out on meeting Santa at the Gingerbread House! ♥️

We took advantage of visiting Tweetsie this year as a family over our Christmas break.   The park was not overly crowded and so that enhanced our experience!  There was no wait for the train and only a small line at Santa.  Staff were super friendly and the park is very clean.  I’d recommend this place for a fun family outing.

name: Jellystone Park Camp-Resort in Caledonia, WI
address: 8425 WI-38, Caledonia, WI 53108, USA

reviews.text: We had a great time. We rented one of the glamping cabins and it was wonderful. We had perfect weather. The drone show and Silent Disco at Bear Paw were the highlights and we did every activity we could at Yogi too. I thought the HEY ride was super fun. We did not rent a golf cart due to the cost, but wanted to. I would just bring an adult sized scooter next time to get around. When I used my kids' scooters the distance from our cabin to the pool was much quicker. You can't get better than camping with a shower, toilet, fridge, oven, and microwave!

Went here for carnival of lights “pet night” on December 4th 2024. First of all it was negative 5 with wind chill and snowy. There were accidents on every intersection surrounding the place, no fault of their own but still frustrating to navigate. After an additional 30 minutes of driving around we finally get inside and pay $30 to see the lights. Lights were cool. Next we went to take pictures with Santa. No pets allowed inside the building, you had to go behind the building in the freezing cold with no professional camera. Whereas inside was obviously WARM had professional lighting and a professional camera. Absolutely RIDICULOUS to call something a pet event and not make it pet inclusive. SEVERELY disappointed and dissatisfied.

I was not expecting much being it was so close to home. It turned out to be a blast and so relaxing. Nothing there creates pressure. Staff was so very friendly and courteous. Kids playing and being so happy in the water and playground. There is so much to do. One staff member, Michael, was super courteous and talked with me for a few minutes which was nice of him to take time from his schedule to see how the trip was.

A HUGE facility with average sized full hook up sites, both pull through and back in, with both gravel and concrete pads.  This family oriented park has enough to keep the kids active and entertained with things like 3 pools, including water slides, miniature golf, jump pad, playground, large video arcade, and much more.  They have something like 300 sites and 75 cabins and rent electric carts to navigate the park.  When the Milwaukee airport is landing north we’re under the arrival corridor so the planes fly over at low power settings and the noise level is about the same as the kids make while playing.  I do periodically hear the trains in the distance but did not consider either of these to be noise issues.

There are very low loud planes every few minutes at night that keep you awake or wake you up. There is also a train siren several times a day and night. It does not feel like camping, people are packed in tight. We did have a spacious campsite which we were grateful for and enjoyed that aspect. However, we had rowdy neighbors who did not respect quiet hours and security did not enforce it. For this reason, we won't be back next year.

The kids had a blast with all the kids activities. The pool/water area was clean and fun! They loved walking up yogi bear and boo boo.

Bathrooms could use more cleaning. They were disgusting at times with no toilet paper.

Golf cart rental prices seemed a bit high, we did not get one and it was a lot of walking.

name: Lucy's Amusement Park
address: 5119 US-83, Minot, ND 58701, USA

reviews.text: Though never going as a kid, taking my son there for the rides and mini golf has been great. The rides are priced to be affordable and the mini golf is fun and challenging if you're not very experienced in golf, like myself.  Owners/workers are nice and informative. Repeat customer and grateful for  them offering something wholesome and enjoyable to do in town.
Nice that there is a place for mini golf in Minot! Fair priced.
Grandma spent her 77th birthday miniture golfing! The course was clean,  and everything was nicely set up. It was a beautiful day, and our family had a great time!

We like the mini golf here. It is a bit "vintage" here but that's part if the charm. This time the owners dog joined in - by watching the golf balls. The kids thought it was hilarious. We had si much fun we forgot to take pictures!

Wonderful experience.
Very clean and friendly staff. Would highly recommend

name: Super Slide Amusement Park
address: 500 Riverside Park Rd, Bismarck, ND 58504, USA

reviews.text:
No lines to wait in,  plenty for our 8 year old to enjoy... most of the attendants were friendly, but some stood in a group on their phones and seemed annoyed when we were wanting to ride things.  Also wish the height limit was not so minimal for Go-Karts, but the bumper cars made up for it!
It was nice to poke around and do something my mother in law used to do with my husband as a kid. Core memories!

We stopped here on our way through ND on our way to Glacier National Park. It was a fantastic stop to get out and stretch our legs and have some laughs! This park is super cute with friendly staff. We got to ride the ONLY roller coaster in ND while we were there. Worth a stop and visit when you are in the Bismarck area.

Could this place use some fresh paint? Yes. Could some of the rides be updated? Yes.
Do they need to be for the hour and a half that my toddler enjoys this park? No.

What I love about this park is its general easiness. No one is waiting long in line, the park isn't so big that you lose sight of your child, the workers all seem at ease, lots of shade underneath beautiful trees, everything is clean,  and there are plenty of places to take a seat and relax as your child runs hither and thither between carousels, bounce houses, swings, and tea cups.

I have fond memories of this place playing wacky basketball and cheating at mini golf, and I feel lucky that I get to share it with my kids.

What I expected for a family fun park. We wished there were enough workers to cover all the rides.  Some wait times were really month for the little kids rides. Batting cages were pretty outdated.  Overall fun and fair prices.

Yes there are better amusement parks in the world… but this place still is fun to go to. My friends and I are in our 20s and we still had a good time. The putt putt is a fun course with some cute holes.

name: Cedar Point
address: 1 Cedar Point Dr, Sandusky, OH 44870, USA

reviews.text: Been here multiple times and always have a great time. Just watch out for crowds this place can get busy but its Cedar Point of course its crowded its ohio's best tourist attraction. If you are spending 2 nights or more and are willing to spend the money you got to stay at the Hotel Breakers its a really nice hotel and gets you into the park 1 hour earlier for a couple coasters that open early for hotel guests.

My daughter and I are coaster enthusiasts and she wanted to go here for a birthday trip. I had been several years before and loved it. This time we got to go during their Halloween event and WOW! Shows and haunted walkthroughs were absolutely amazing, they updated some coasters, and had a good food selection. We ended up buying season passes, stayed an extra day and...even better...the passes are now good at King's Dominion AND Six Flags theme parks as of 2025, which are a lot closer us. We have another trip planned in 2025. Best coasters we've been on and best season pass value!

I’ve been coming here since I was a kid and love it. Prices have definitely increased a lot. Definitely try to come during slow season so you aren’t waiting in lines for hours on end in the sun. Also recommend bringing a cooler of your own food to save on money.

This place has a lot of rides and it is mainly geared towards thrill seekers. But there are 3 large family areas. But the live entertainment at Cedar Point is fantastic for families as well. They offer a wide variety from large spectacles to smaller scale shows. The coaster lineup here is impressive. But the flat ride collection here is also very large. Hotel breakers is on property and is very nice it is worth the price. Since cedar point does not pro ide transport from there other hotel locations stay at breakers to avoid the drive in every morning which can be chaotic. The parking lot at Cedar point is massive and rarely fills up.

Cedar Point is often hailed as the "holy land" of amusement parks, and after our visit, it's easy to see why. With the most roller coasters of any park, thrill-seekers are in for a treat, and the park’s location along Lake Erie adds a stunning backdrop to the adrenaline-pumping rides. The views are spectacular, and it's hard to beat the mix of coaster excitement with lake scenery.

We visited over Labor Day weekend, and arriving Friday afternoon was a smart move—it wasn't too crowded, so we got to enjoy several rides without long waits. However, the rest of the weekend was packed, and we only managed to get on a few more rides. If you're planning a trip during a busy weekend, I highly recommend getting there early in the weekend to take advantage of lighter crowds.

The roller coasters themselves are fantastic, but we were pretty disappointed that their newest coaster, which we were looking forward to, wasn’t open yet. After driving seven hours, we were hoping to experience it, so that was a bit of a letdown.

Food-wise, Cedar Point offers a good variety. While it’s solid overall, I’d rank it behind Universal, Disney, and Kings Dominion when it comes to theme park dining. Still, you won’t go hungry here, and there are some tasty options. The staff was always friendly, and the park was consistently clean, adding to the experience.

One regret from our trip is not taking advantage of the exit that leads to the beach on Lake Erie. It looked like a fun way to take a break from the rides, and I’ll definitely try to fit that in on our next visit.

Overall, Cedar Point lives up to its reputation with world-class coasters, great views, and a fun atmosphere. Just make sure to plan around the crowds if you're going on a holiday weekend!

name: Funtimes Fun Park
address: 12175 State St NE, Alliance, OH 44601, USA

reviews.text:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Highly recommend this place!

Such a great family friendly place! Affordable and enjoyable! The staff was so friendly!

Glow Tubing was an awesome experience! Just a short drive for some affordable family fun! 😁

They had glow tubing, Cosmic jelly ball shooting, bonfires, dance parties, an arcade, outdoor movies and a light maze! 🛟🔥☃️🎹🔫🎮

***honorable mention Pete the Penguin! Kids loved interacting with their mascot 🐧

It was a lot of fun! Pre-puchase your tickets in advance. Dress warmly if it's winter time! They only have porter potties available, so prepare for that. The slide is a ton of fun and they have fires throughout the park to keep you warm. It was a great time with my 4 yr old and 7 yr old!

Great Winter event!  The glow tubes are something you don't find anywhere, and to have something like this, in a place that obviously is run with guest enjoyment and safety in mind is what makes it a great experience.   The staff was very helpful and courteous and management was on-site making sure the attractions and staff were doing everything they could to provide a great evening of fun.   Policies and information about possible weather factors were clearly posted multiple times and the management even gave us some personal attention on various topics and the overall operations.  Very impressed with Jason's attention to detail and concern for not only his guests, but interactions with the staff members.   Definitely would recommend Fun Times for a unique place and experience not only in the summer months, but for Halloween and the Winter season as well.   Thanks to everyone for a memorable and enjoyable evening.

Great place to visit with my grandkids. Ages  13, 6 yr, & 3 years old. The park is small enough that the older two were okay on their own for a short bit while the 3 yr old & g-ma road the age appropriate rides together. The kids loved the dinosaur’s that were visiting. A bit of $$ but worth the memories!  Love a splash pad to cool off with.

Took my 4 grandchildren to the glo tubing.  They had an absolute blast. Even talked me into going down the slide. The lady checking us in was so sweet and patient. Kids loved the slide and shooting thing. I loved the light maze and penguin ( he did an amazing job).
So much for a great price. Will definitely bring them back again and telling family and friends to try this.

name: Hall of Fame Village
address: 2626 Fulton Dr NW, Canton, OH 44718, USA

reviews.text: The Hall of Fame is amazing!! The history of the game and teams is just incredible. There were some really neat interactive exhibits and videos to watch. The staff is full of knowledge! The woman at the Super Bowl rings exhibit can tell you in detail about whatever ring you are interested in!  There is an elevator so it is wheelchair accessible.

This place could have been great, but the lack of leadership and execution has made this place a virtual ghost town. The village feels as though it was built around the idea of a boutique event campus. It’s a one visit, special event only type of environment. It doesn’t feel like it was built with the idea in mind of having locals come and continuously frequent and support it, which is what it needed to be successful. Parking is atrocious, dining and entertainment is lacking, and mostly empty unused event space. Hope they turn it around, but it’s a huge disappointment at the moment.
Had an absolutely wonderful time!  Exciting times for the village as they are adding so many new venues and exciting attractions!
Absolutely beautiful place with amazing views. I love what they have done to the area. If you love sports this is a place to visit. You never know who you may run into.
The stadium is tiny and the game got rained out but at least the bears won.

name: Kings Island
address: Mason, OH 45040, USA

reviews.text:
Really love kings island. As many others have noted, it's reasonably priced admission but everything inside of the park is incredibly expensive. It makes sense to bring your own food and drink but then you have to lug it around.

The winter fest was AWESOME.  My kids had a blast and everything seemed so magical. I do wish there was a way to increase line speed but the fast pass is cost prohibitive.

They have a lot of really great coasters. Diamond back is one of my favorites. I enjoy stealing peoples watches and throwing them on the roof. Especially don Dunfee former anaconda protective concepts owner. Hey Don, I’m sorry about your watch. Orion is my absolute favorite at this park. I also love banshee. Theirs not a coaster I don’t like at this place. Unfortunately it’s 9hrs from Delaware so we don’t visit much but I would definitely recommend this park

It's a fun amusement park but has the potential to be so much more. The price for everything is so expensive! My family and I only went because we were gifted some tickets. Parking alone was $30, and they don't even offer shuttle service. Granted, we went to the winter fest, so there weren't very many rides open, but what we were able to do we enjoyed.

Great fun for kids and adults and really good value in a season pass especially if you live nearby. They have some truly excellent coasters in Mystic Timbers, Banshee, Orion, and Diamondback. The seasonal themed Haunt and Winterfest are very well done, offer seasonal dining options, and keep the park feeling fresh longer into the year as well. The all season dining passes can really increase the value of the park for folks who visit frequently.

Always a great time I grew up in kings island and this yr has been just as fun as all the others. I'm excited to experience winter fest for the first time! And I highly recommend the gold pass with food and drink pass because then you can literally spend all day at the park and the shops are always so cute with a variety of things to purchase in all price ranges.

name: Memphis Kiddie Park
address: 10340 Memphis Ave, Brooklyn, OH 44144, USA

reviews.text: This summer was our first time here. Buddy have we been missing out. The kids had such a great time. The roller coaster was everyone's favorite. A bit too bumpy for my old body but the kids rode it 4 times in a row. The concession stand has great options, healthy and unhealthy.

This was our first time visiting Memphis kiddie park and it was a good time. I’m not certain of pricing for tickets as we were here for a birthday party so we were given wristbands from the hosts. What I can say is the wristband is good for two hours. We were able to get on everything twice in that time frame. All of the rides are “kiddie” friendly where they are able to get on them without adults. So if you don’t have an adventurous little one I’d recommend bringing a buddy for them to ride with so they aren’t scared. Also another plus that entry is free. You only pay for what you choose to ride on. That’s right grown ups; if you don’t wanna ride you are free lol.

The concession prices are typical of amusement parks. Typical food options; hotdogs, popcorn, nachos and slushies. I’d imagine on a weekday it’s not as crowded as it was today but even with it being busy; we weren’t in lines for than 5-10 mins. All the staff that we interacted with were kind and helpful getting the kiddos in and out of rides. Overall I could see myself visiting here again.

This is a GREAT Amusement park for little kids maybe ages 7 and under. We went on Labor Day 2023. It was very hot and sunny, but they do have a lot of seating in the shade. They have a snack shack with food and ice cream, popcorn, slushies and much more. It is not overly crowded. Employees are helpful and very polite. There is plenty of close parking.

A small little amusement park just for little kids (maybe best for 7 and under). The staff are great (read, "patient, understanding and flexible") with the kids and work well with the parents.

The roller coaster (Little Dipper) was SUPER rough and jerked everyone around a ton. The kids didn't enjoy it. The rear seats were even worse than the front seats.

I LOVE that you don't pay for time in the park, so if the kids decide they need a nap, you don't lose your money. The tickets don't expire!

The Turtle Chase and the boat ride ended up being the favorites of the day. We are excited to visit again soon.

I highly recommend doing the train ride first so the kids see all the rides and get excited to try them.

It is a great place for smaller children.  It's just the right size for 2-5 years old.  The rides don't go too fast.  And the little dipper roller-coaster is great, and an adult can ride with them. I am so glad they kept this open all these years.

name: Columbus Zoo and Aquarium
address: 4850 W Powell Rd, Powell, OH 43065, USA

reviews.text: I've been going to the Columbus Zoo since I was a kid. Now that I have a family, we recently decided to buy season passes (ABSOLUTELY worth it if you plan on going at least a few times a year, even if you don't live in Columbus). My son loves it, I enjoy it. There are so many indoor areas for extremely cold or hot days, lots of animals and educational opportunities. I enjoy the events that they host, and obviously, the holiday lights are great. No other zoo I've been to compares (but I've been fortunate enough to live near Columbus my whole life). Cannot recommend enough. Great for family fun, and I'm so grateful we now have passes so we can go anytime!

I recently visited the Columbus Zoo and Aquarium, and it was an unforgettable experience that I cannot recommend enough. From the moment I arrived, the welcoming atmosphere and beautifully maintained grounds set the stage for an extraordinary day.

The variety of animals at the zoo is astonishing. From the majestic African lions to the playful sea otters, the exhibits are both educational and entertaining. The enclosures are spacious and designed to mimic the animals' natural habitats, ensuring their comfort and well-being. I was particularly impressed with the Heart of Africa exhibit, where I felt immersed in the savanna, surrounded by giraffes, zebras, and more.

The aquarium portion of the visit was equally impressive. The vibrant marine life and informative displays provided a perfect balance of fun and learning. The manatee coast exhibit was a highlight, showcasing these gentle giants in a serene environment.

What truly set this experience apart was the knowledgeable and friendly staff. They were more than willing to answer questions and provide insights about the animals, enhancing my understanding and appreciation for wildlife conservation.

Additionally, the zoo offers various activities and shows that are both engaging and suitable for all ages. The daily animal demonstrations are a must-see, providing a closer look at the zoo's inhabitants.

In terms of amenities, the Columbus Zoo and Aquarium has it covered. The dining options cater to a variety of tastes, and there are plenty of rest areas to relax and enjoy a snack.

Overall, my visit to the Columbus Zoo and Aquarium was exceptional. It's a fantastic destination for families, couples, or anyone looking to enjoy a day of wildlife exploration. I left with a deeper appreciation for the natural world and a commitment to supporting conservation efforts. I can’t wait for my next visit!

A wonderful place to visit with your family, especially around Christmas time. The Christmas lights are always so amazing. We saw someone propose by the lake with a gentle snow fall. That was pretty special. Don’t forget to visit the sting rays. It’s a fan favorite with my girls. They have a huge tree back there with Christmas music and a light show. Pretty cool spot.

My son and I enjoyed our day at the zoo. We were here 3/19/25 and with it being the off season there were many exhibits/shops/food stands closed. There was still plenty for us to see though and we had a ball! Loved the manatees and the river otters. It was a nice day and the staff was mending fences and getting the savanna yard ready for the zebra and giraffes. The gate was open and we got to see them poke their heads out a bit. They are hesitant since they have been in for the winter. It’s a lot of walking-by the end of the day we both had 14000 steps!

One of the best zoos I’ve ever been to. It wasn’t even open completely due to the weather and still took almost 4 hours. I will definitely be back in the future. I would note that for winter visits that not all exhibits are open and food is limited.

name: Scene75 Entertainment Center I Columbus
address: 5033 Tuttle Crossing Blvd, Columbus, OH 43016, USA

reviews.text:
Decided to have some fun during the middle of the week because we prefer less of a crowd, which was nice. Putt-putt golf was neat. Had a great variety of games & go carts were cool. Love the bumper cars in the back. Unfortunately the coaster was down so we couldn't try that. Employees were friendly. There is a concession area to get a snack or drink for the kids. We plan on visiting again!

Update: We visited on a Sunday evening & it was busy with limited staff who seemed a bit over worked & annoyed, dirty restrooms. Concession stand ran out of some food. They did have security. Escalator was still unavailable to use from a few weeks ago.

This was an awesome place to bring my toddler he enjoyed himself a lot he actually cried because we had to leave. I wish they would open up a location in Indianapolis. That would be awesome 👌🏾 for $25 .
My son played games for almost 1 hr. This is also a great place to have birthday 🎂 parties 🥳 or any kind of celebration 🍾

Amazing family entertainment center, with two levels full of all kind of games, attractions, and arcades. We had a blast at Laser-tag, go-karts, mini-golf, and beer-bee (throwing frisbee with a drink on the other hand). They have all kind of arcades, all entertaining and fun. There is also a full bar and restaurant onsite. Everyone was so friendly. I would definitely return.

I took my 2 boys ages 8 and 6 yesterday and they had a blast. We were there for 4 hours and still didn't do everything.  The prices are not bad at all for all the attractions like go karts, Bumper cars, roller coaster, laser tag, drop zone, and a whole lot lore. I will say the arcade will eat your money up the machines isn't over priced there is just so many machines that I kept reloading. I will not do that when we go again. We have went to urban air, get air, magic mountain,  chuckle cheese, ect, and this was the best place

Took a group of 20 and 30 year olds who wanted to feel like kids again and everyone had a great time!

We were able to do go carts, roller coaster, 4 rounds of Lazer tag (our favorite!) and even got some bumper cars in at the end of our 1.5 hour session! Definitely worth the price compared to other venues and the staff was awesome as well. Overall highly recommend whether you're 9, 29, or 49 years old!

name: Stricker's Grove
address: 11490 Hamilton Cleves Rd, Hamilton, OH 45013, USA

reviews.text: Stricker's Grove is a wonderful little amusement park.  The old school rides and games are a lot of fun, and invoke a feeling of nostalgia.  The mature trees help provide shade while waiting in lines.  It is a bit of a shame they are open to the public so infrequently, but they do have things well organized for those days, and prices are reasonable.  My daughter had her first carousel ride here, and in years past I have enjoyed the Independence Day fireworks show.  I even went to a nice wedding reception here, once.  It is just a real gem.

My husband's job did their company picnic here and my kids loved it.The park was only open to the company so it wasn't crowded.The lines had no wait time and they were all up and running.They had ice cream,pop(pepsi products),popcorn, cotton candy,icees,face painting unlimited all free for everyone.Their was plenty of rides for all ages,but not overwhelming.The rides were all together so there wasnt alot of walking to do,and the rides were big enough for the adults if kids needed to ride with one.The staff were helpful and friendly.I hope they continue to do theirs here.

A company day through the union my uncle retired from had a day reserved this specific day;  which brought my son and I to Stricker's Grove.  The amusement park deserves a 5 stars.  Well maintained and well kept it brought back memories of when I  was growing up visiting Stricker's  Grove.  It hasn't changed a bit!    It depends what day or what promotion the park has for that specific day varies prices and incentives of the park.  ON our visit hot dogs with sides were served & they were great!   All you can drink beer must present ID with arm band, all you can eat ice cream cones, snow cones, cotton candy.  Popcorn oh and pop several different flavors.  The rides were unlimited.  The 2 big roller coasters are always separate from the rest of the rides for instance you can pay for armband unlimited rides or single each times.  Prices vary for events.  I hope my review helps your descion on your future visit to Stricker's Grove.  If you haven't visited you should, you will have a very memorable moment with whomever accompanies you..

Awesome, family-friendly experience. Witnesses Staff members enforce proper ride safety measures firmly yet politely. Clean grounds, wholesome environment, friendly staff. My kids enjoy every time we attend. Perfect place to rent out for church function or family reunion.

They are only open 4 days a year so you need to plan ahead. The rest of the year is private events. This is a very fun, unique family owned park. They built both roller coasters on their own! The history is very interesting. The employees are great! The food, ride and game prices are very reasonable!

name: Frontier City
address: 11501 N I- 35 Service Rd, Oklahoma City, OK 73131, USA

reviews.text: Same shows and acts for the last at least 4 years. Magic and Gunfight shows are the same. At least some of the food prices went down since the merger. A lot of rides were not open. But there was 7 employees guarding the drink station. Its honestly not worth the gate price if you've already been. I got season passes for the family and you just don't get as much with it as you used to. More for less. Kid enjoyed it so thats why we go.

This is a smaller park... but don't let that fool you. The rides are more than adequate, the food is plentiful, the staff is nice, welcoming, and helpful. The rides are well maintained. The lines usually are not too long like other major theme parks. I recommend going here if you have kids, roller coater enthusiasts, theme park lovers. It's worth the visit.
Fright feast was fun but the long lines made the time to see the mazes and the haunted houses too short. They open at 8pm but close at 10pm only got to see 3 out five plus two rides

While the staff were great, that was about it! We just spent $400 on season tickets and 500 on food passes only to have fully HALF the rides not working, 2 of which stopped working while we were in line to get on them. The pirate ship stopped working after we were on it, but was working again later...not sure if wanted the kids getting back on it! The ferris wheel did what ferris wheels do and gave us a great view but...all-in-all it didnt feel like a very good investment of a thousand dollars!

We loved this park! We have a six flags season pass so while we were in town we wanted to check it out. The rides were fun but we really enjoyed the shows. Our normal six flags barely has any shows anymore so that was fun for us. The magic show was our favorite but we also enjoyed the gun shows too! There is also a small water park attached that we did not go in because we did not plan for it but it looks fun. It was a fun day for the whole family there and we will definitely go back. The park was smaller but we still really enjoyed it and it made it easier to get around inside the park. We recommend getting the season passes with the season cups to save money.

name: Kiddie Park
address: 3903 N St Mary's St, San Antonio, TX 78212, USA

reviews.text: Celebrated my daughter 5th birthday at the Kiddie Park. This review is strictly for the party experience. For the most part it was a good experience. There are some drawbacks to having your party here. Your guests will have a tough time parking. A few of my guests had to park almost a mile away near the Japanese tea gardens and BBQ restaurant. They were slow on giving wrist bands. If my party starts at 10:00am, then the kids shouldn’t be waiting around for 10 minutes for their wristbands. Especially since we are so limited on time. The contract states we will get wrist bands 5 minutes before our party start time. Also, they said they have a knife to cut the birthday cake but do not cut the cake. So, I was prepared to cut our cake but all they had was a little plastic knife. That’s not a knife and I couldn’t even cut my cake with it. I would tell customers you don’t provide a special cake knife and advise we bring our own. The kids seemed to have fun and of course they don’t notice these things. 4 stars because my daughter loved her birthday and that’s what matters.

To the right of the zoo's entrance.

There are five rides to choose from. It being our first time here, we settled with getting the unlimited ride option. My daughter enjoyed it, so that's what matters most.

No lines. Convenience of multiple food options (nearby gift shop with snacks, Starbucks, and hotdog stand that is on site). There is a spacious picnic area to the right of the gift shop.

It's a slight bummer that the mini amusement park is in need of a major upgrade (long overdue).

So much fun!!  Kept my kids entertained for a very long time and everything was really neat. Food and drinks were way overpriced, but we got the unlimited rides and lunch ticket for the kids which was totally worth it. Was not crowded, no wait lines for rides.

We paid over $500 to host a party here for 24 kids $400 for 6 benches and bracelets for the kids. $86 for 6 pizzas and $20 for 2 drinks options. When we arrived the party host asked when we wanted the food I told him 30 minutes and he disappeared after that. We never got our drinks or food till 50 minutes into our party. I could never find our host. I had to track him down. They were sitting in an air conditioned trailer talking and laughing. Multiple parties going on with everyone looking for their hosts. They didn’t give us enough cups or ice for 24 kids. The drinks were watered down and had no flavor. They didn’t tell us that you need to make your guests stand in line at the front ticket station to get measured in height to get their bracelets. The line was long and they had to wait cutting into our party time. They have 5 rides only and one was not working so only 4 options for our kids. Also parking is hard to find since it’s shared with the zoo parking. Suffice to say we will never book a party here again.
Not many rides at all for the price and they are outdated .. first time here with my 5 and 9 year old!!!  Very disappointing not have much at all.

name: Captain Kid Amusement Park
address: 2735 S Roosevelt Dr, Seaside, OR 97138, USA

reviews.text: We go here to play mini golf. The place is in okay shape but could use some sprucing up. Not bad price per person for mini golf.

Fun, small place. The go-kart track and cars are all new and the workers were great. The rock climbing wall was good. The roller coaster was fun for littler kids (maybe up to age 10ish). The park was under staffed when we were there, but they were all so kind and doing their best. I found it annoying to have to buy individual tickets for each thing. We weren't sure how many tickets to buy, so we ended up standing in line for tickets like 4 times. If that's how it is I wish there was more than one place to buy tickets!

We had a lot of fun playing 18 hole mini golf. 11 year old to 74 year old. Yes, the course is compact but has enough challenges to compete with a bigger course. The park was clean and everyone was friendly and smiling!

We were on our way home from Seaside and decided to stop. Cute place,friendly staff. Go carts and golf were fun. My only complaint was 1 person running the rides on a Saturday during labor day weekend. Otherwise it was a great time.

HAD AN ABSOLUTELY AMAZING TIME! LOVE LOVE LOVE THE EMPLOYEES! Both guys who ran the rides were kind and explained everything  very well. The girl who rocked the mic on the track was a sweetheart. She introduced us to the parks unofficial mascot "King" who loved our dog too. It was a fun experience and we went back 2 more times before we went home. Thanks for the memories!

name: Enchanted Forest
address: 8462 Enchanted Way SE, Turner, OR 97392, USA

reviews.text: The Enchanted Forest is as magical today as you remember it. Immaculately cared for, clean, organized, whimsical and fun, the park has picnic tables for picnics you can pack in, food for purchase, snacks, drinks etc. we saw the show at the theater and the Irish music. Both were wonderful. Stop by the museum and read over the history of the park. It’s an incredible effort of imagination and love.

Great park, nice for the whole family. Has some rides for older kids, teens can enjoy the park too. Great little exhibits for the littles to run around in.
