Plenty of good quality walking paths. plenty of good food, a little bit expensive but otherwise a great place to take the family. I would go again would recommend to families for a special trip.
First time coming! Enjoyed ourselves lots to do plenty of parking and it has places to eat! Rides for kiddos to enjoy!

I haven't been here in over 16 years it was so much fun, went with a group of friends and kids. The log ride was the best, we were all drenched! The food was definitely cheaper than the State Fair 😉. We probably spent about $150 for our family of three on admission rides and food and we were there from 10:30 in the morning until 4:30 in the afternoon.

Perfect for my 4 year old son! He had a blast exploring, and we saw everything we needed to in under 3 hours. I would highly recommend this place to parents with kids that are 6 and under.

My only gripe is the prices are a bit high for what it is.

name: Oaks Amusement Park
address: 7805 SE Oaks Park Way, Portland, OR 97202, USA

reviews.text: We came here for the ScareGrounds which we had purchased tickets for in advance. The side ticket shows was not quite what we had expected, but we were still able to do some fun activities. We purchased VIP so we did not have to wait in what looked to be about 30 minute lines. The actual ride selection at the amusement park was limited and there was only ride that we wanted to go on, which I could not ride due to size. Rather than purchasing a $40 bracelet we got a single ride ticket for $13. The carousel and the mini train ride are free to ride. We found parking easily and used the website to pay and skip waiting at the kiosk. Overall a fun little amusement park but nothing special especially for guests of larger size.

This review is for the new light show they offer. It is horrible. The only light tunnel is the entrance where they take your ticket. Pro tip- if you park in the back parking lot you can just walk in for free along the train tracks. Golf is an extra $20. I grew up living oaks park, but as a parent now, I would not send anyone here at all. Also the 1 open bathroom was flooded out. Massive rip off.

Oaks Park, located just 3mi south of downtown, is a small amusement park that has been operating since 1905, making it one of the oldest running amusement parks in the U.S. On the 4th of July, we decided to walk there since it's not directly accessible by public transportation. However, we got stranded on our way back due to the lack of transport. Thankfully, two kind strangers offered us a ride. While I didn’t get a chance to make new friends because I was busy enjoying the rides, my roommate did—she opted out of the rides since she doesn't like them. The pictures are from our walk on the way to the amusement park. This spot is often used for small corporate gatherings, including those by Moda Health.

Fun, lots to do kids had a blast. Could use a few more roller coasters. Kids rode a lot of the same rides over and over again, but we were there from shortly after open till end of day. My big complaint is the fun rides are not accessible to large people for reference I'm 6'4" and 🫣 330lbs I was just to big for the cost to push in hips and waist were to big. The spinning swinging ride I was to broad shoulder the over the head things could not push down low enough to close.

It's a fun local amusement park. There's not a ton of different rides but the ones that are there are fun and kept the kids riding them over and over. There are a few food carts, as well as, a food stand and an area to sit and eat. There are water bottle refill areas too. We had a really fun day!

name: Bushkill Park
address: 2100 Bushkill Park Dr, Easton, PA 18040, USA

reviews.text:
What a cool place! The owner accommodates everything you need for a special party just for your son or daughter and their friends and family. It is so cool that you get the whole place to yourself for a private party. The rollerskating rink is big and spacious and they have a woman that announces during the party and plays games with the children and plays fun music as well. This place offers different food packages and they have an option for unlimited popcorn for all of your guests, which is great because most people love popcorn. I know we do! They also have a separate party room that you’re able to come with your decorations and set up towards the end of the skating portion of the night. You can bring your own cake or cupcakes, whatever you’d like to serve and they offer a pizza place to order from if you’d like pizza. Which by the way, the pizza place that they order from is delicious I will say. The only thing that wasn’t ideal was the location of the bathrooms. The bathrooms are extremely tiny and they are right off of the rink so as you’re skating around, you go right into the bathroom. They kind of sloped down a little bit and the toilets are smaller, so it is definitely challenging with rollerskates on to go to the bathroom. Otherwise, this place is so much fun. The owner is wonderful and all of the kids love it here.
Not only is the inside so much fun but the outside where all of the rides are is so cool as well. They run all kinds of events there throughout the year like a haunted experience that you can ride a train through the amusement park with all kinds of zombies, walking around the park and other things like couples painting, and skating nights. The owner is always coming up with new and creative ways for people to enjoy the theme park throughout the year.
Definitely recommend!

This amusement park was everything I expected it to be. I first saw this park on American Pickers TV show and was like I am always in Easton PA visiting One day, I will pass by and take photos. One day, while in Easton PA, I was telling the people in the car about this amusement park n hiw we should look for it as I looked out the car eindow I saw the big clown face I remembered seeing on American Pickers. My friends did not want to stop.they all thought I was telling a tale. So they googled the story. I tell ya they were shocked. Still, we did not head back to see it.
While I was in Easton, I asked Google fun things to do with your pups on the weekend I was visiting... you won't believe this 1st thing that popped up was Doggie day at bushkill amusement park. So off we went my 2 pups n I went to bushkill amusement park n had a great time was to be had. They offered free salmon, beef, liver doggie flavored snowcones.
We got to ride the train n go on the carsoul. Truly a fun afternoon

What a cute place! Never knew it existed! The word "dinky" comes to mind, but in a charming way.  It's old and small, but that helps make it so cute.  We went for a birthday party there. What a great idea! Because it's so small,  we were able to stick together and ride as a huge group.  No charge to get in, which is nice.  The staff were not overly friendly,  particularly some of the young ride operators, but the kids didn't even notice.  Their favorite part of the entire day was the wooden slide inside the old- school funhouse. It was so cute.  Run down but cute.  Keep an eye on your young children, though. There were quite few instances where the operator didn't even notice safety hazards, like when one walked right by my young toddler "checking" all were ready to go as she was standing up in her seat out of her buckle already.  I let myself in the gate to take her off before he started it. All around great time, though.  We'll go back as something different to do.

Haunted house and tractor ride was very fun! Actors did an outstanding job! Roller blade area looked fun, food was very fair-oriented. Burgers, hotdogs etc. Rides weren't all active when I was there but looked fun for what they were

Went to this roller rink, best roller rink I’ve ever been too ever. Not because it’s the biggest rink but rather how homey it feels everyone there is super kind and friendly it feels so welcoming and the lady at the front running it is so sweet. And talk about inspiring. She got on her skates and it was inspirational. It just shows it’s never too late to roller skate or rollerblade. Would highly recommend this place!!! They also have super fun roller skating games especially for people just starting out you never feel not included. ☺️

name: Camelback Mountain Adventures
address: 243 Resort Dr, Tannersville, PA 18372, USA

reviews.text: I had an AMAZING time! The first time Ziplining...But the down fall was that few guest bathroom was down stairs in a  Dungeon there was throw up in the bathroom sink!  Disgusting the bathroom was so old. Needs renovated

The best advice I have for this place is go during the week when it isn’t busy. It’s cheaper to buy your tickets online but pay attention to what you’re ordering and WHEN you’re ordering it for. There’s also a waiver you sign online to just skip waiting in any line when getting there. I had a fun time in the mountain coaster for $23. There’s also different zip line courses. During the weekend it’s very busy but in the fall time they have fall fest. It’s cute with themed food and drinks but it’s VERY busy and kind of pricy in my opinion.

Unlimited fun at Camelback Resort! We had an amazing time enjoying outdoor activities like the zip line and roller coaster -mountain coasters (book online to get $5 off!). Although we stayed in an Air BNB, I highly recommend considering Camelback Resort for your accommodations - it's an imagine experience!

Unfortunately, our activities were limited due to rain, but we still managed to have some fun on the 1000 ft zip line, which was open despite the weather. This resort is a perfect one-stop destination for all, with plenty of shopping options at the Premium Shopping Outlet and unlimited activities around Pocono Hill.

We didn't plan to visit the water park since our kids are older, but I'm sure it would be an absolute blast on a sunny day! Overall, Camelback Resort is a must-visit destination for anyone looking for adventure and fun. We can't wait to come back and experience it all again!"
The ziplining and mountain coaster was definitely worth it.  Me and my kids enjoyed it.
Loooove the place BUT only for winter time… summer is not that fun IN MY PERSONAL OPINION

name: Carousel Water & Fun Park
address: 1018 Beach Lake Hwy, Beach Lake, PA 18405, USA

reviews.text:
Food is incredible
Service is good.
I’ve eaten everywhere in this area and hands-down this place has the best food. Menu is always changing and They use premium products and you notice it with every bite.
This place is exceptionally homegrown and the small details really make it comfortable.

Very nice food and coffee reasonably priced and served with kindness.
I had a horseradish cheddar omelet with spinach and tomatoes and that is now my go-to during our weekly visits to the carousel. It was outstanding.

Love this spot normally stop for a shake and a couple pup cups when the wife and I are driving out for a little drive with the dogs. Amazing ice cream or food if that is your want. Other activities are able to be found on site as well. Friendly and prompt service . Oh and did I mention go carts miniature golf and water park! Your welcome..

We had a great time. Went early today and had the place to ourselves for about 45 mins, kids loved go karts and golf. Corn maze was really well made and everything else was fun. Food was good, ice cream was very sweet; but good. Will be back in the summer for the water slide and bumper boats.

Just to say...BABABOOM awesome place to visit 😀 fun place with fantastic staff. The food is great! Omg the vegan gluten-free burger is the BABABOOM best!! You need to treat yourself with this delicious menu! The chef 👨‍🍳 has lots of knowledge seasoned to perfection everything in the menu. The staff is just wonderful ❤️ always with the smile 😃 and caring for you to have an awesome time at the carousel Dairy Bar & cafe old- fashioned fun park The staff at the restaurant and ice cream store are just AWESOME!  They are so welcoming! From the moment you step in. The ice cram is the best!! You need to treat yourself with everything they have. 100% I recommend this place for groups, family, and everyone to visit and share the experience of great food, amazing ice cream 😉 and fun time. Sending always positive energy to all.  Be all safe and keep healthy muuuah king size

name: Conneaut Lake Park Resort
address: 12382 Center St, Conneaut Lake, PA 16316, USA

reviews.text: It was fun while it lasted. But for anyone seeing this, the park effectively does not exist anymore. They demolished the historic blue streak, then did away with the rest. The new owner probably has no plans to restore it and just wanted the land to make like camper space or housing. All I know is there is some stuff on the beach and I think the hotel is open seasonally, but conneaut lake park does not exist anymore.

What a wonderful time we had today at the pumpkin festival. It was very nostalgic for us. We both used to go there as kids with our families during company and family picnics. It's a little sad to see the state that some of the rides are in but after all of these years it's to be expected. A fun time had regardless.
No place to wash off.  Decent bar, a little bit of food, great dock, super good people, good swimming area for kids.

Glad to see they reopened it! Water park is nice/updated....rides and buildings need some updating and work. Beach and boardwalk is cute. Looks just like an old street carnival.
Don't expect big amusement park because that's not what this is. You have to be ready to step back in time....the rides are oldies but goodies. $18 all day pass...or $10 just for water park. Food prices range from about $3-$5 an item. Small food booths scattered throughout park. Roads and walkways need fixed and patched.
Hotel looked interesting, didn't stay though.
Definitely a decent inexpensive day trip.

One of the oldest amusement parks in the country. Quiet charm with great fun for the little ones and a great little water park to go with the lake. A Tiki bar on the beach to keep the adults "happy" too! Very inexpensive and a blast from the past!

name: DelGrosso’s Amusement Park and Laguna Splash Water Park
address: 4352 E Pleasant Valley Blvd, Tipton, PA 16684, USA

reviews.text: Perfect size for a day trip. We were able to do everything in one day and it was a great first amusement park for my younger children. The wait to get into the park and to get food wasn’t bad. The longest lines we experienced were for the water slides due to them having one set of stairs for four slides and the line took around 20-30 minutes to get through. The park is stroller/wagon friendly as well as they have free life vests located throughout the water park. Only thing I wish I had brought was a waterproof phone pouch. They have signs that say you need to have them for the lazy river and to basically take them in the water (you can get them for $4 on Amazon).  All amusement rides and water park equipment was in working condition. Highly recommend for kids 5-14

Went on a Monday.... Hoping it's not that crowded.... Ha ha ha. It was packed. End of July we showed up after an hour the park opened. All the beach chairs were taken. The cabana's were booked. The place was hopping. You have to visit a few times to know your way around where to park. Where to eat. The water park was fabulous and the amusement park didn't have lines. We have payed double to stand in long lines in other bigger amusement parks ... Which is not too amusing. This was our first time here... But won't be out last. Kids will enjoy this 2 hour haul for years to come.
The kids all had a great time, ages 2-11. And the adults as well.  Prices for food and snacks weren't bad at all. We came during the off-season and will do it again next year!

We came on closing day. Last minute decision. 460 to walk in the door for three of us it was great the kid spent hours at the waterpark and now we're finishing with amusement side. I found the place extremely clean plenty of employees. What a nice surprise that was in 2024. I've yet to get anything to eat other than the cotton candy which is very economical at $5 for a large bag the games I thought were priced fairly as well. I'm looking forward to having something to eat later. I saw funnel cakes that looked amazing

I had a pleasant time here.  I rode the 2 rollercoasters which is all I really wanted to do and was able to buy tickets just for those rides. Nice view of the mountains. Friendly staff. Free parking. Shout out to the front ticket staff and the rollercoaster staff. Also the older man at the front of the amusement side. All super friendly and helpful. I got a free poster to top it off.

name: Dorney Park & Wildwater Kingdom
address: 4000 Dorney Park Rd, Allentown, PA 18104, USA

reviews.text: Had a great time as always, but maybe it's better since I go late on Sundays, so there are fewer people. The Halloween theme is awesome. Colors, music, and atmosphere are great. Shows are super cool to watch. Ride lines move pretty quick as well. The only issues I have are the high food and game prices. And the difficulties trying to get to handicap parking. There's no clear path or direction there for us to park closer.

The park has pretty slow operations on the rides and the food we had at the Burger Barn was absolutely awful. The ride collection is definitely dated but I actually preferred the thrill of the older roller coasters compared to the newer ones. The signage around the park was also very uninformative. I was looking forward to the park, but left at majorly disappointed.

Nice amusement park. Well rounded collections of roller coasters and flat rides including some rides you can only find here. Clean and well maintained and friendly staff. Quick operations make for short lines and ability to get in lots of rides in a single day. Iron menace is a great addition to the park.

Had a great time at Dorney Park! The atmosphere was fantastic, and there was something for everyone. Even though I'm not a fan of roller coasters, I still found plenty of other fun attractions to enjoy. The staff was friendly and helpful. Highly recommend it for a family-friendly day out. 🎢🎡

The park was very clean.  We rented a cabana which was great and the food attendant could not be nicer or anymore attentive.  The gift shops were incredible!  We found so many peanuts plush that are so hard to find and we purchased for gifts.  Who ever is their purchaser does an outstanding job an asset to Dorney.  We had a great day!

name: Dutch Wonderland Family Amusement Park
address: 2249 Lincoln Hwy E, Lancaster, PA 17602, USA

reviews.text:
I took my 5yo and 2 1/2yo there in early July. We had such a wonderful experience that I know we would come back some day.

First as a busy family, I appreciated the fact that we can use our ticket any day within the year. We had a last minute travel plan changes and we couldn't go to the park the day we wanted to.

Varieties - we have been to three other parks before but this takes the gold as to the inclusive of age and heights of kids. There is something for every young age. There was also so much to do and the lines were not terribly long, average wait time for us was 15min. Though there was a lot to do, the park wasn't awfully big. That is a good thing for young kids that are not in stroller and parents pushing stroller. We were not too exhausted to go on more rides. The water park was fantastic! Lots of seating area for everyone.

This is a cute amusement park. There are plenty of fun rides for kids of different ages. We enjoyed some of the more low key attractions like the spinning tea cups and the train ride. We had all the food and games there. We visited on a super hot day, and the highlight of the trip was Duke's Lagoon. This is a huge outdoor water play / splash pad area.

Went for the first time with 3 adults and 4 kids and had a blast- kids ranging from 4 years old to 12 years old and there was something for everyone. Parking (even in the non-preferred) was very close to the entrance still and easy to navigate in and out of- although a little pricey in my opinion $20. The wait times on the rides were very reasonable and there is a great variety to choose from. At one point they even had a dance party with the dragon and princesses in costumes and a bubble machine! Although a lot of the concession stands sold your typical pretzels/ dippin dots/popcorn we did find some good spots (I’ll review those separately) but my fave was the pretzel at Penley’s Pub! I also liked how they scanned adults IDs and only allowed 4 alcoholic drinks per ID, no obnoxious drunks at the park that is geared to kids! We also had a baby with us that nurses and the nursing facility for moms was GREAT, very clean, had AC (nice break from outside), a changing station and two rooms with rocking chairs to nurse your baby! I was very impressed with the park overall and it was a nice way to spend the day!

Great place for young kids, better than six flags if you ask me. Many rides, we didn't even have time to get on all of them, decent food inside, really a fun day for kids. The water park was packed,  more packed than the rest of the park, and ride lines, probably 10 min wait, which is bearable. Totally recommend!

A great park to visit with Family. Kids of all ages can have fun rides. There are quite a few family rides as well. We loved the sky walk, family rides, rail, Show. Sometimes online offers discounted price tickets, parking is $22 or $27.50 (opposite to main entrance). Food options inside the park is not so great, I would expect more options considering this as a family park. Plenty ice cream options 😄! Visit is worth the money and is recommended

name: Fun Fore All Family Fun Park
address: 8 Progress Ave, Cranberry Twp, PA 16066, USA

reviews.text: Their new Crazy Cars ride was more thrilling than I thought, which turned out to be a good thing. Go karts are still super fun. We did the lighthouse golf course, and it was a super fun course, except for the fact that the wind was blowing water on me sometimes. In the arcade, one of the machines broke down, so they refunded our money and gave us 500 tickets. Shout out to the staff for that one. They have a great menu of food and super good service as well. We never had to wait to get on a ride! I would 100% come again, thanks for the fun experience Fun Fore All!

I can't speak highly enough of the team at Fun Fore All. My company was looking for a venue to host about 250 people, and when this location came up as a possibility, I thought it was a fluke.

However, I gave them a call, and Tiffany helped me not only put together a wonderful plan but also made every step along the way simple, smooth, and straightforward. Working with Chris C. and Chris L., who run the show, was a genuine pleasure. The whole staff was friendly, helpful, and provided excellent customer service.

Not only was this option a HUGE upgrade from our other choice, which was more expensive and just a blank conference room at a hotel, but they also blew the team away with the huge variety of fun games, duck-pin bowling, atmosphere, and attentive staff. On top of THAT, I only had to bring my laptop for our slideshow! The technology was new and simple, and whenever we had questions, Mark was able to answer and assist.

My management team was so impressed that they want to bring the whole team back during the summer months to take advantage of the other options as well. It was truly fun for all, and it was awesome to see adults from a Medtech company kick back, enjoy playing games together, laughing together, and just spending time together at this wonderful venue.

In summary: economical, fun, outstanding customer service, a close-knit team, great management, a great food selection, a variety of games, flexible staff, technology and sound systems provided, and a unique venue for a company event that shakes things up.

A very deep and emphatic thank you to Tiffany, Chris C., Chris L., Mark, Haylee, Gabe, Luke, Jess, Ed, Wayne, and John. From the professional engagement over phone and email to the great senses of humor and bubbly personalities, I was humbled to work with such amazing people.

I am pumped to work with these people again and more than happy to give them my business. Whew! That's a wrap.

I took my kids here for my daughter’s birthday! It was our first time going. It was really fun, they enjoyed the go carts as well as playing all the games. The food was good as well!! Very clean environment, friendly customer service. Parking was good as well.

We absolutely love this place for our kiddos. We’ve had our son’s birthday party here for the last 2 years and not only is the price extremely good for a winter birthday kid, the customer service is amazing. We’ve dealt with the same party planner every year (I wish I could remember her name, she is wonderful!) and I couldn’t recommend this place more. We visit here often throughout the year, ages 2 through 32, and we all have fun!

Our 1st visit with our 6 yr old and 4 yr old grandsons.  Mini-putt golf was fun but of more note was the wonderful staffperson who serviced us.  He answered all my questions, was very helpful, and was patient with me.

name: Hersheypark
address: 100 Hersheypark Dr, Hershey, PA 17033, USA

reviews.text: Great park!! Had an amazing time with lots to do. Kid rides were all over so you could entertain them while you go to larger rides. Parent swap was awesome and easy on all rides. We went opening day 2025 which was perfect and all was running like it had been middle of summer with trained staff. The rides are fun, the park is thought out and themed well, the park was clean and looked great! One suggestion- wheres the chocolate in your Hershey’s themed park? It’s all outside of the park… I get it - it might melt but no hot chocolate? No chocolate glazed ice cream or chocolate milk shake? No Hersey chocolate any themed food at all inside the park?? So odd!!

A Sweet Escape to Hershey, PA!

My trip to Hershey Park, The Hotel Hershey, and Hershey’s Chocolate World was an unforgettable experience filled with fun, luxury, and, of course, chocolate!

Hershey Park is a thrill-seeker’s paradise with a great mix of roller coasters, family-friendly rides, and water attractions. The park is well-maintained, and the chocolate-themed atmosphere makes it extra special. Don’t miss Candymonium for an exhilarating ride!

The Hotel Hershey is pure luxury with its elegant architecture, top-notch service, and relaxing amenities. The spa treatments, especially the chocolate-infused ones, are a must-try! Dining options are fantastic, and the views of the lush gardens make for a peaceful retreat after a long day at the park.

Hershey’s Chocolate World is heaven for chocolate lovers! From the free chocolate tour ride to the interactive Create Your Own Candy Bar experience, it’s a fun and delicious stop for all ages. The massive store offers every Hershey’s treat imaginable—perfect for souvenirs!

Overall, Hershey, PA, is a magical destination for families, couples, and anyone with a sweet tooth. Highly recommend visiting!

We went on Saturday 10/19/24. The park had some great Halloween activities going on. I recommend getting there early and getting the fast pass. The later you wait, the price for the pass goes up. Average wait time for the rides were over 1 hour (without the pass). They have great rides. We stayed until closing. The Halloween shows were great. Definitely will visit the area again just to go to the theme park.

It was my first time! It was cold as it's winter and is to be expected. That did not stop the kids though, they had an absolute blast! There was a food court and few other places that served mostly fast food. Some of the rides were closed for varied reasons. The zoo was a lovely adventure. There are many different attractions at additional fees, lovely takeaway tokens too. Good for summertime fun!

We've been in PA for over a year and finally got a chance to come here. It was such a great experience. I got to see so many different types of chocolates that I haven't seen. We didn't have enough time to do the tour, so we will do this next time. Even though it was busy for a Saturday, there was enough parking. Long line-ups are to be expected if you want to buy items like milkshakes, etc. Overall the family had a great experience.

name: Idlewild & SoakZone
address: 2574 Lincoln Hwy, Ligonier, PA 15658, USA

reviews.text: We love Idlewild! It is such a great park, and we have made so many fun memories there! For our family, the season passes; they are so worth it! You can go as often as you want in the summer and fall with most of the passes. Their payment plan system they have is great and can make it more affordable for families. Another little thing I wanted to mention. Sometimes we have people in our group that need a wheelchair, and I noticed this year they are offering mobility scooter rentals now, which is great!

Buy your tickets online for special holiday visits. We saved $30.00 per ticket buying online.

It is a very nice, "kid friendly" park nestled in the woods with quite a bit of shade. There are a lot of classic rides and park food you will enjoy. There is also the Soak Zone and Storybook Forest.

All in all, a nice get away for a day.

Located between Latrobe and Ligonier PA.

Parking is free.

Had a great time at Idlewild & SoakZone with the family! This classic Pennsylvania amusement park really delivers on its promise of being great for families with younger kids. The mix of traditional rides and water attractions makes it easy to spend a full day here, especially during summer.

Highlights:
- Daniel Tiger's Neighborhood area is absolutely perfect for toddlers
- SoakZone was refreshing and well-maintained
- Staff were friendly and attentive
- Beautiful, shaded park setting with lots of mature trees
- Good variety of food options (loved the Turkey leg)

Pro tips: Arrive early to beat the crowds, bring water shoes for SoakZone

Overall, while it's not the biggest or most thrilling park out there, Idlewild offers solid family entertainment and good value for the price. Perfect for families with kids under 12

So much fun we picked up a season pass. It’s the perfect theme park for all ages, but mainly for children. Daniel Tiger has his own section and trolley ride. There is a storybook Forest plus historical locomotive that will drop you off at the front or back of the park. Definitely has a G/PG rated Kennywood vibe with mini sand castle attached. Rent a cabana if you want privacy and a place to escape by the water.

We visited the Sunday before Memorial Day. Was busy, but not overwhelming. This was my 3rd trip, 2nd bringing my own children. It’s a family tradition and close to home for us. Never disappoints. A great time for the whole family. Also the characters in the forest were incredible!!

name: Kennywood
address: 4800 Kennywood Blvd, West Mifflin, PA 15122, USA

reviews.text: Family/ friends had a great time here. We enjoyed it and had so much fun. You guys get parking free good food prices. We would highly recommend. One day wasn't enough but got most done we wanted too just wasn't able to ride all rides in one day it's big area.

Letting your automated security choose to separate me as a single dad from my two autistic children was totally lame. I had no bags, No metal. The humans had no say but to do what the robot compiter tells them? I will never come back here.  Being a family season pass holder, I am so disappointed. I see now what what everyone says is true about Kennywood. It is a waste of hard earned money, and no one cares anymore.  My last memory of Kennywood will be this at Christmas time. There was less and more relaxed security at the fall phantom fest this year than there was tonight.

Always a great time. Wasn't too crowded and we started some new traditions!!!

I've been coming to Kennywood now for 50 years.  I can remember using ride tickets.  We always brought a picnic lunch and stayed the entire day.  It was great to bring my kids to the park as they grew up as well.  We had plenty of traditions and now that they are adults, we have started some new ones.

Born and raised in PGH. I have been to Kennywood many of times throughout the years. I have to say that I was terribly disappointed with my most recent visit during Phantom Fright. The park is nothing like it used to be. It is very overpriced for the quality that is received. 95 minute waits to get on rides. Hour waits for haunted houses. My family spent over $200 with Groupon discount tickets.  Unfortunately, the park was so over crowded that we only rode just one ride. We only got to experience 3 haunted attractions. That is pathetic! They now offer you to pay more money to buy a fast pass that allows you to skip the longer lines. This is on top of what they charge you to enter the park. Sadly, the employees appeared to be truly miserable. They were unfriendly and visibly uninterested. KW used to be a loved family park full of traditions...a true staple in the Burgh. But, you can tell that it jumped on the bandwagon of trying to keep up with other thrill parks. While doing this...it lost its nostalgia of the pure authentic fun that it used to be! The templated response to guest reviews shows how KW doesn't value its guests. I will reach out as they suggest and I will give an update in the near future.

Kennywood Park, nestled just outside of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, is more than just an amusement park; it's an active piece of American history. Since its inception in 1898 as a trolley park attraction, Kennywood has evolved into a thrilling mecca of rides, games, and entertainment, while preserving much of its nostalgic charm.
The park's rich history is evident in its iconic wooden roller coasters, such as Jack Rabbit and Thunderbolt and Racer, which have been thrilling generations of riders. These classic coasters stand as testaments to the park's enduring appeal and commitment to preserving its heritage. Kennywood hasn't rested on its laurels, though. The park has successfully blended its storied past with modern thrills, introducing modern standout coasters like Phantom's Revenge and Sky Rocket and Black Widow. This perfect balance of old-school charm and adrenaline-pumping new attractions ensures something for everyone.
Beyond its thrilling rides, Kennywood offers a diverse range of activities to cater to all ages and interests. Families can enjoy classic carousels, gentle boat rides, and kid-friendly attractions. For those seeking a more adrenaline-fueled experience, there's a plethora of heart-pounding coasters, drop towers, and water rides. And for those who prefer a more leisurely pace, the park boasts beautiful green spaces, live entertainment, and delicious food options.
Kennywood's attention to detail creates a welcoming atmosphere that transports visitors back in time while offering modern-day thrills. Whether you're a thrill-seeker, a history buff, or simply looking for a fun day out, Kennywood Park is a must-visit destination.

name: Knoebels Amusement Resort
address: 391 Knoebels Blvd, Elysburg, PA 17824, USA

reviews.text:
It's one of our favorite places ever! We wish it was closer to home, but the drive up through the mountains is absolutely gorgeous with a ton of signage, so you know you're going the right way!
We always go for Halloween! The haunted house is a must. The line goes faster than in looks!
We love the fascinating game. It's a blast from the past!
The iced sweet tea and cider are the best sweet treats!
And if you go during the fall, you can't go wrong with the bread bowl of soup.
Thanks to the free admission and free parking, you can do as much or as little as you want! We love you, knoebels! Never change!

The amusement park is family friendly, plenty of rides for adults as well and being able to walk around in the park without paying an entry fee is a huge plus! The food in the park is above average for an amusement park and the pizza is a must have! My family goes every year in the fall and the Halloween decorations are always enjoyable!

Went to Knoebels Christmas light experience Joy Through the Grove for the 2nd year.. Great way to spend a holiday evening. The line moves quickly to get in, staff is cheerful and friendly. Lights are cute and range from simple and basic to digital programming. Highly recommend.

Pay per ride, it really makes it easier to enjoy the park without feeling obligated to do all the attractions. It does have a more homemade feel to it, feels like a locals' place. Weekend was very crowded (1 hour line waits), but Friday night waits were 15 min or less.
Free entry and free parking (with shuttles from the lot to the park).
Most rides were $3.50 to $5. The food in the park is very affordable too. The Flying turns "trackless coaster" was really fun.
Visited Oct2024.

Christmas in the Grove was beautiful! You'll want to make sure you go a half hour to 45 minutes before they open because you will wait in a looooong line😄 but there are two displays (I didn't show so not to ruin the best parts) you have GOT to see! Enjoy

name: Lakemont Park
address: 700 Park Ave, Altoona, PA 16602, USA

reviews.text:
This was our first time to the park. We came for the mini golf trying to relive our youth. The 2 courses were interesting and fun as well as challenging in areas. Even though my wife and I haven't played mini golf in probably 30 years, we had a great time and each of us even managed to make a hole in 1.

The rest of the park looks like it is very busy from the people in the bathing cages and on go-carts all the way to the basketball courts that were packed with players and games.

There is also plenty of parking and easy access.
My family and I went for the Lights on the Lake. Really had a wonderful time, our Mom really enjoyed it also. What a great way to end our Christmas day. 👍🏼👍🏼

This is a mini golf course with a neat little haunted attraction attached to it.

It's family friendly, so don't worry if the kids will be scared or not. Their actors will even take selfies with you. Very laid back and fun for the Littles.
Let your kids drive the cars. It's fun!

We didn't golf. We only went for the haunted attraction, which was more for my kids in my opinion, but none the least fun for all ages!

They do have bathrooms.

4 stars as we had to pay for golf and the attraction when all we wanted to do was the attraction.

I recommend.

Probably would have enjoyed it better if the rollercoasters, that I drove an hour and a half out of my way for were operating. I thought for sure that they would be running on a Friday evening in June, but the only thing open was the miniature golf and batting cages. The two wooden rollercoasters are beautifully built structures with some great photo opportunities. The grounds were nice also.

Now hear me out...Yea, the running coaster aka skyliner looks like a sure one way ticket to the next life. BUT She held together just fine and I feel the lack of paint added to the thrill of the old wooden coaster.
Sadly, leap the dips was down and the water park as well...what looks like has been for awhile.
You can still head out on the lake with the paddle boats, the train still going.
To top it off go carts and mini golf, 2 different courses of 18 holes .
I'll gladly come again and snag up the all day pass well worth the $20.

name: Sesame Place Philadelphia
address: 100 Sesame Rd, Langhorne, PA 19047, USA

reviews.text:
Overall rating: 4.9

As an adult, this place had always fond memories. I used to come as a child and remember it dearly. This time around I went with my 2-year old niece & somehow still had a great time. Standing in line is never fun, so if you’re not the parent and going - I recommend a book or strong earphones while you’re watching them stand in line. A fan is also needed.

Also definitely got Covid in the lazy river 🙄 still recommend!

Sesame Place was the perfect outing for my grandkids! From the moment we walked in, the magic of the park had them smiling from ear to ear. The highlight of the day was definitely the parade. Watching all their favorite characters come to life, dancing and waving, was pure joy. The music, the floats, and the energy of the performers were amazing, and my grandkids were completely mesmerized. They even got a chance to wave back at the characters, which made their day extra special.

The rides were just as enjoyable. Whether it was the gentle rides for the younger ones or something a little more thrilling for the older kids, there was something for everyone. They had a blast trying them all, and I loved seeing them so excited and full of laughter.

But the real fun began when we headed to get in the pool. They absolutely loved the water and my grandkids didn’t want to leave. It was the perfect way to cool off and enjoy even more excitement.

Sesame Place delivered an unforgettable day for my family. It’s a perfect blend of fun, nostalgia, and adventure. My oldest grandkid is already asking when we’re going back! He can’t wait to get back this place.

Wonderful place for a whole day family outing with lots of activities for everyone. The Sesame Street Parade was wonderful. My 8 years old daughter enjoyed all the rides. The water park is wonderful. The walking area surrounding the water area was very rocky, it hurts. I would request the park authority to look into this matter. Rest all I like everything about this theme park.

Overall a good experience for the children. Neither of my children religiously watch Sesame Street - however, they are familiar with the characters and enjoyed the character experiences.

The line for security to enter the park was long but moving. We had “Magic Queue” passes to pick up in the Welcome Center upon arrival and the line was not moving. We ended up going to pick them up in the “Guest Relations” office where the line was moving along more steadily.

We visited on a day where many of the water park attractions were not opened yet re slides. I believe the children would have enjoyed it more if the slides were open. The layout of the water attractions versus rides is very “unique” and they are in several different sections versus one designated spot.

We enjoyed the Dining with Elmo event as it was extremely kid friendly and the kids were freely able to jump about, dance, and move without it feeling as though they needed to be seated the entire time. The food is extremely casual but it was good.

The Parade on Main Street fills up very quickly and there are very few shaded areas. The pavement gets extremely hot so bring a towel or blanket and plenty of water.

Very tiny park geared towards kids. You get in free with a Bush Gardens pass. They have two small coasters that were pretty good. The employees were very friendly and helpful. The families seemed to be having a good time.

The bathrooms didn't have paper towels or hand dryers, there were dirty diapers on the floor and they desperately needed a good cleaning.

name: Waldameer & Water World
address: 220 Peninsula Dr, Erie, PA 16505, USA

reviews.text: Waldameer & Water World amusement park is an awesome place to take your family. There are rides for all ages. They also have places to sit and relax as your daredevil rides. You can bring a picnic or buy fair style food if you like. If you forget your swim suit you can purchase on there.  If you are in the area take a day and have some good old fashioned family fun.

Great, family-friendly park.  We visit in yearly.

Nice assortment of rides. It's wonderful that they have an attached Waterpark as an additional option.

We like that you can pay per ride or buy a ticket for the day. The park is generally clean and appears well maintained.

They offer a nice assortment of concession stand options with abundant tables, with shade.  We highly recommend the pizza boat and Carmel and candied apples. 🤣

This a nice park you can easily spend the entire day at.  Consider buying your tickets in advance online to save a few dollars.

We only went to the amusement park side of the park. The water park looked amazing. There are tons of slides and it's huge. Next time we will definitely go to both. There was no wait at the entrance and the rides had very reasonable wait times.

There are so many picnic areas and benches to sit at. We didn't bring food but most people did. The dining selection is limited but very affordable. The park was very clean and had lots of ride options. Both my kids are over 54" and could ride everything. Just an FYI, they don't accept cash so it's credit card or you can use the kiosk and load cash onto a card.

Overall a great place and my kids can't wait to go back.

Really fun everyone had an awesome time.
Some of the staff at a pizza place in there were #£◇○d~ *not great) and thats what I have to say about that.
Over all, really nice time kids loved the rides kids and adults loved the water park side! I would recommend getting a season pass over a wrist band for a day. You'd save a bunch of $$

Fun family park. Free admission.  There's rides and a water park both are different ticket purchases unless you buy a combo.
You can pack your own lunches and they have plenty of areas to have your picnic at.
There's also a arcade

name: Atlantic Beach Park
address: 321 Atlantic Ave, Westerly, RI 02891, USA

reviews.text: Great area to hangout for the day! Arcade is very fun and still hands out tickets, makes it feel more retro instead of using a card. Wonderful spot with lots of entertaining activities. Right across from the drive-in as well, which brings the activities into the night!

There is super dog friendly place with a puppy bar menu :)

If you are going to buy something in a bar parking will be free which is super deal.

Beach is super nice with a white sand. Definitely the best beach for dog owners!

What a great beach! Huge waves, great sand, and a clean beach. Convenient parking locations right near beach. Great food and snack choices up and down the strip. My family had a wonderful time and can't wait to visit Rhode Island again.

Clean bathroom, great music always playing and friendly people working at the snack shack. The beach is always clean. Trash is never overflowing. My kids always have a great time at all the rides and swimming at the beach.

Very crowded middle if week midday. Decent beach, but get there early for a spot, people plop down everywhere. Lifegaurds present. Parking is $15. Nice large bar and grill on beach. Arcade was cool. Bathrooms small, long lines. ATM on site. Wash station with showers. Overall fun place for kids.

name: Family Kingdom Amusement Park
address: 300 S Ocean Blvd, Myrtle Beach, SC 29577, USA

reviews.text: The wait for rides were not long at all.  They've made some upgrade since we went a couple years ago.  The ticket buying process is easy, they use kiosks, and affordable.  It's a really good deal for all day family fun.  There are quite a few kiddie rides.  Fun for all ages.
Such a great value this place is. Compared to most amusement parks, the lines are incredibly short. The sea breezes make summer nights very comfortable here. So many fun rides for people of all ages.

When going to Myrtle Beach, we love spending time at  Family Kingdom, especially at night.
All the rides lite up make it more exciting.
There are rides for the young & old, if you dare!
The best way to get your money's worth is to buy wristbands and ride as much as you want.
My grandson didn't want to leave. He was having
so much fun.
The only bad thing about this trip was that it was a bit cold.
If you've never been to Myrtle Beach, you'll have to spend time at Family Kingdom.
So Much fun we enjoyed the log flames and kept getting on that to stay cool. It was hot. They have a lot of rides we rode but I couldn't  take pics and ride lol

Outstanding family amusement park.  Friendly staff, super clean park and great rides.  Arrive during the first hour of the day and buy a discounted all access wristband good for the rest of the day.  Bring your ID and get your local discount!

name: The Funplex Myrtle Beach
address: 1405 N Ocean Blvd, Myrtle Beach, SC 29577, USA

reviews.text: Funplex is really nice. We walked in got a drink $17 from the bar and browsed around, had a seat. Love the colors, big screen television’s. The bartender was okay. Love the music. The restrooms are in the back. It’s a cool place to bring your kids but kinda pricey, $36 for a day pass and $99 for a week pass.

We went on reopening day this past friday. I will say i was not impressed at all. The SPACE…. It is nonexistent. Everything is too close to each other to the point where there is “static in the air” everything my family and i touched we got a small shock. If your child is under 44 inches… dont even bother going. There isnt any rides for them besides the swing. There was so many technical difficulties and employees who werent properly trained on equipment. This is a good place to stop if your feet are hurting from walking. My kids did enjoy 1 ride but all others they weren’t impressed or weren’t able to ride due to technical issues or the employee. We will be back to grab a drink only

We took my grandson and his friends to Myrtle Beach for his 14th Birthday and while there, one of the things we did was go to the Funplex. Event hough all the rides weren't open they had a good time. It wasn't over crowded and the staff was very helpful and super friendly.
Had the most amazing salad wrap while here and Spencer was beyond nice.

Lovely environment for ALL ages , isolated environment from the strip , with fun for EVERYONE , even those people who get over stimulated like me. The bar is huge and roomy enough for you to comfortably seat yourself, and your family. Revolving bartenders constantly checking in with you regarding your comfort and needs. With the cocktails it got me exactly where I wanted to be for the evening! The kids will love the rides , they’re  super niche in the way that makes all ages feel welcomed & keeps them wanting to come back because you won’t find any rides like the ones they have in Myrtle Beach. Lastly, the music is great and staff look happy, that’s important to me.

name: Action Park Pavilion
address: Broadway at the Beach, Celebrity Cir, Myrtle Beach, SC 29577, USA

reviews.text:
Just get the wristband! There's a coupon in one of the coupon books you can find all over Myrtle Beach. We did the fun park with my 5 year old. She loved it. It is a great size for that age group.

There's a fee to use a credit card, I think it was 4%.

It's nice a stop for the thrill seekers of all ages! So excited I only managed the one picture & the prices (so you avoid sticker shock), but the attractions are good for varieties of ages, gotta be over 42" for the big rides I think, but they have a decent amount of rides available for the little kids!

Visited on March 28, 2025. Friday.  Around 1 pm.  With another adult and my two visiting grandkids, 5 and 7 years old.  Military group.

Said I saw on-line cost to unlimited rides is $30 with military discount, for kids, at the pay booth.   Two individuals in inside the Pavilion amusement ride booth said no, cost is $39, a large $9 more.  One person, a tall young black male immediately said that’s “old information” on the internet.   He knows this?  Or just says to stop my questioning?

The other person, a black female said that’s not us, those are “other people” selling.   I asked well if we buy from these “other people” with the 25 percent cheaper price how does that work when we arrive to the park. How does that work, what do we do when we come to the park, what is the process ti get in and ride the rides? She said she didn’t know, “that’s them, not us”   Who owns the rides?   The park?

The problem:  Feel thus organization, this business,  just looks to scam people, as I see other complains have been noted about this park on the reviews here.   They simply lie to you, (old information).  Or,  one’s just getting vague information, or no information at all, when the women said she has no idea how buying tickets on the internet works when coming to the park, nor what the process is, and projected an attitude she simply didn’t care, so don’t bother asking me.

Bottom line, as a paying customer coming to this child ride park for the first time, I don’t have any faith in these two people being honest or providing accurate, trustworthy information.   Zero.  No faith in this business.  All grandparents want is  good, accurate information when taking the time to do something for our kids.  No BS talk and a feeling the business is a greedy and dishonest and have their employees project this.

Secondly, found the workers in the park running the rides lacking any energy and providing inattentive customer service and communicating very poorly.

Example:     My kids rode the race cars ride with the sharp turns on each end.  Next to it was the Cup ride.   No workers were at that ride.  Nobody there, vacant, no worker people.   No signs saying it’s shut down.

So I asked a lady who was at the race car ride   Is the Cup ride next door operating?   She said nothing!  No greeting. No eye contact.    She simply pointed to two worker women sitting at a bench between the Cup ride and the Carousel (horses) ride.  I had no idea what’s she was communicating to me.  She didn’t talk!   Did she mean, go talk to them?   Get them to get up and go man the ride like they should have been doing?   No idea.   So, my kids never got to ride the Cup ride, and they wanted to ride this ride.  You people really messed up here.

Horrible customer service. Horrible.  And where is the supervisor, when you gagged to employees sitting on a bench and nobody is manning the Cup ride?   Why does he or she allow this to go on, this lazy work behavior/horrible customer service  to take place?   Workers who can’t even talk to customer grandparents to provide basic information.

Parents, grandparents who are considering coming to this park, maybe their first the, take note of my comments.  They are all true.  Take note how well I have described my experience at this park.  The detail.

For me, with two small grandkids who love rides like any 5 and 7 year olds do, who will be coming to visit me for years to come in Myrtle Beach, I will never, ever waste my money at this park again.  Never.

There’s other child ride parks in the area that will gladly take my money.

We have come here every year for the last 12 in a row and have never had an issue. Make sure you come early enough to have time to ride the rides because they do close earlier than one might think, as do the stores. Staff have always been helpful to include trying to accommodate when the little ones need a parent to tag along on certain rides. Probably against policy but as much money as they make I would expect supervision to be ok with this because it’s not like the parents are having a blast on a train or tea cups. But all and all no complaints.
We had a great time at this park. Was so cute. The swings are a little over 2 mins long of ride. The tickets are 4 and 3. We bought 20 tickets for 37.50.

name: Pedroland Park
address: 3346 US-301, Hamer, SC 29547, USA

reviews.text:
If you ever have someone deride South Of The Border as a whole as a washed-up, abandoned place, they're more than likely thinking of this part in particular. As much as I love South of the Border, Pedroland Park has seen WAY better days.

But first, a bit of history. While I'm sure it was abandoned, there used to be a roller coaster here. From what I can tell wandering around the park, I don't think the roller coaster was the only ride that was taken down.

However many rides this place may have had at one point, the only three attractions you'll be able to use are the bouncy houses, the playground, and the miniature golf courses. That's perfectly fine by me, as the miniature golf courses are probably the only thing that my age demographic would want to use.

Lord knows when most of these motorized rides were last functional. The playground actually looks like fun, but the inflatable bouncy houses look rather worn out.

For years now, I had wanted to play at the miniature golf courses, and I was told that this place is only open during the summer. My first issue is the limited window of availability, as the miniature golf courses did not provide a lot of shade, but you're only able to play at these courses out in the ninety-degree heat; which will only get worse as climate change gets worse every year.

All the signage says that it costs $8 to access the entire park, so one positive about this place is that the attendant only charged me $4, AND because it is essentially an all-access pass, I didn't need to pay anything else to play the second course!

The golf courses themselves are in rather rough shape, as one of the holes is SUPER DAMP AND WET, and a lot of them have torn up carpeting, and in some places, the AstroTurf is absent altogether, but you could tell it is supposed to be there! If that wasn't enough, the actual holes have weeds growing in them, areas with water flowing are dried up, and the places that do have water look like a good spot to get Cholera. The attendant did warn me about the quality, and I did know this going in based on other people's reviews and photos, but I was determined to play these courses someday, as I had wanted to for several years.

Believe it or not, the poor conditions of the miniature golf courses were not detrimental to me or my score. The courses do not have any sort of par listed, and there is no scorecard, but I was still able to make most of the holes in three shots or less, and the course's roughness practically never interfered!

But like I said, it was hot, and I do not recommend playing these two courses back to back like I did if it's going to be at least ninety degrees; especially when the real feel temperature was 101!

I didn't ever feel nauseous, dizzy, or feeling like I was about to faint, but I think the heat did make my heart rate increase rather rapidly, and I could tell that I just NEEDED to get out of the sun; even though I was only out there for an hour. The two courses offered very little shade, and I had to rush through the second course a little quicker than I would have liked to, so I could get out of the heat ASAP.

There is a vending machine with cold water in the park, but that only did so much, as I still went over to the gas station and bought a Gatorade afterwards, as my arms felt tight from what must have been electrolyte loss. Besides, the vending machine costs $1.25 for a drink, and it doesn't seem to like quarters, so bring $1 bills.

I'd most certainly be willing to come here again and play the golf courses again, if they were open during a cooler part of the year.

Pretty cool park; the amusement park itself doesn't seem to be in operation, but even with workers and security in the area, nobody seemed to mind me walking around (there was a 'closed' sign in the lot, but the main gate was open).
Interesting to see the inactive rides and putt-putt golf course (with one active fountain); looks like there's still alot to do in the area, but it's hard to say if the rides will open up again.
Glad to see the Sombrero Tower open, too!

There is no way this place should be open. Personally  I think part of South of the Border's  charm is that it is a bit questionable, but this was  awful. Our clubs were sticky (really really sticky) . Both courses had torn carpet (the pictures below  are mild examples.. on most holes it was much  worse.)   There was either no water or filthy water. The bugs  were terrible. Weeds were growing in most holes.   Don't  waste your money.

Nice place for walking. Park have mini golf and playground for $8(cash only). We just walking around, found free playground near hwy. Fun sculptures everywhere outside park.
Shopping very cheap and big, have fun hat section ;)

They currently only have mini golf, 2 jumpers, bumper cars, and carousel running. + to the side a small playground! The workers allowed us to ride however long we wanted and were very kind! for 8 dollars it’s unbeatable and my kids had a blast! They have a lot Fun sculptures everywhere outside to take pictures by!

name: Funcity Adventure Park
address: 4671 Onondaga Blvd, Syracuse, NY 13219, USA

reviews.text: So many different activities for kids of all ages... trampoline basketball, trampolines, foam pits, games, ball pits and an amazing jungle gym, wall climbing, and so much more! . it's a little pricey, 1.5hrs $24, 2hrs $28 and 3 hrs for $32

Visited Fun City Adventure Park today and my son had a blast! There are all types of games for him to enjoy, and even the big trampolines are a hit. Adults can have a good time too. The staff are incredibly friendly and patient with the kids, making the experience even better. The price is fair, making it a great value for a day of fun. Highly recommend!

Disgusting and unsafe environment; If you are sending your child to a birthday party here or planning a birthday party for your child here, I would highly suggest that you reconsider. We walked in for my nieces 10th birthday party last night, only to be jumping for 10 minutes before a disgusting and vile fight broke out between a ton of adults who also involved their children in the fight. This fight went on for over 15 minutes before security, any of the employees, or police stepped in! Fighting and cussing and being disgusting right in the front lobby in front of all of the staff who were blatantly ignoring them and subjecting every child there to this trauma. When my family member asked for a refund for the $500 birthday party she just paid for, the staff refused and only agreed to partially refund her her money. They made her pay for jump socks and 4 pizzas that we weren’t even able to utilize and still kept over $200 of her money! Everyone who checked in at 5pm were forcibly removed from the premises, but if you had reservations at 7pm or later, you were allowed to come back and jump. My niece’s entire birthday party ruined for some ghetto disgusting fighting. Even more disgusting that all the staff and security just stood there watching a huge fist fight break out in their lobby in front of all these children! You will NEVER get my money again dirty fun city. Do not send your children here they are not safe!!!

Booked a party room and the room was not ready when we got there. The staff at the front told my guests that they needed to check in with the host in the party room and would get their socks at that time. Every time we would have to hunt down a host who then needed to go and find our host. They never asked what size socks the kids needed just gave them some and left the room. My guests had to go back upfront to get a different size because they gave them all small. They only provide one juice or one water per jumper. So if parents want something to drink they charge you $2.00 for a water and because we went on a weekend they charged $2.50. Their website says that the host will help with set up, service and clean up. They did not do any of that. While we were doing cake a host come in the room and took the utensil/plate/napkin hold her. I advised that we were not done and they responded with “I’m taking it to refill it”. It was returned after we got done. While picking up the room a staff member come in and asked who to give the bill to. While we were carrying things out someone else come in and asked us if we were using the card on file to pay the bill. They then walked me to the front counter to make sure we paid.

Very poor customer service. Would not recommend having a party here.

Plenty of parking. Nice place to bring the kiddos for a few hours or the day. It's $24 for 1.5 hrs $28 for 2 hrs or $30 for the day. If you pay $30 for the day you are allowed to leave and come back if you want. It also requires jump socks which are $3.50 a pair. They have a ball pit with slides and some tunnels to crawl through. This is a area for kids 10 and under. They also have different structures and wall structures to climb with a adventure course. This area also says for kids 10 and under. They have a foam pit you can jump in. A trampoline dodge ball area,basket ball area. Various trampolines and a foam pit obstacle courses and a small zip line going over one foam pit. The arcade they have costs extra and is not included
They have some massage chairs you have to pay for to sit at. Also various metal benches you can sit on. Definitely a place to check out. My kids loved it. They have ample parking this is located in a shopping plaza area.

name: Rush Mountain Adventure Park
address: 13622 SD-40, Keystone, SD 57751, USA

reviews.text: This was so much fun and well worth the money! The unlimited wristband was 25% off, so we got a deal, but we rode the mountain coaster at least a dozen times and got more than our money's worth on that alone. Pro-tip, go in early October before schools go on fall break to avoid lines. We even made friends with a crow that hangs around and is very sweet!

My family had a blast here! The cave was awesome but my favorite was the alpine coaster! Prices are a little high per person so if you’re going to be there for a little while, it’s worth it to buy the day pass. It lets you ride all the attractions as many times as you want. Make it a point to go!

My daughter and husband really enjoyed the coaster ride. I was too scared so I chickened out. There were a couple of people at each attraction which was great for us! My daughter and I rode zip line which I didn’t know goes back up but it was a lil fun adventure. You will have to walk up a steep hill and walk a few flights of stairs to get to the zip line attraction. The friendliest staffs name was Nate. I went back to ask bc I was think people should be recognized for their service.

Came here a couple weeks ago. Lots to do, and pretty cheap if you get the bracelet. Roller coaster down the side of the mountain, zip line, gunslinger, rope obstacle course, and cave tour. Great place to take your kids to have some fun. The roller coaster doesn't go super fast, but it's a scenic ride down the mountain. The zip line was pretty cool. It's also kinda out in the middle of nowhere, so there weren't very many people, and no waiting lines for the rides. The cave tour was very interesting and the guide was very knowledgeable.

Awesome experience at Rush Mountain Adventure Park! Great staff. Our almost 6 year old loved everything there. Great for any age. I chose this park over Rushmore Tramway Adventures bc our son just misses the cutoff on some of the attractions. I will say the coaster is so fun and safe compared to comments I’ve heard from friends that have been on the Alpine slide at Rushmore Tramway. The wingwalker challenge allowed our son to be accompanied by an adult as long as he was over 42” but if your child is under that height then there was a nice challenge for younger kids so they are not left out!
Took 4-5 hours for us and we brought a picnic which worked out great. Lots of seating for lunch.
There is some steep walking and no cell reception- just a heads up.
Visiting on a Monday was amazing!
Our family will visit again in future!

name: Storybook Land
address: 6415 Black Horse Pike, Egg Harbor Township, NJ 08234, USA

reviews.text:
Perfect spot for young kids. Beautifully maintained. It always feels magical with the trees and lined walkways between the rides. We call it our miniature Disney. We have been going for years and this place holds so many special memories for us.
Great for all seasons. Special events are a must do. The Easter egg find is perfect for little ones. The fall activities are well thought out. The pumpkin decorating for Fall and the trick or treating for Halloween runs so smoothly. Christmas is in a world of its own. The whole place is decorated from top to bottom. We love Santa and so glad he is able to visit Storybook Land. He truly makes it special and takes time with each child.

Thank you for creating core memories with our family!

We went to Storybook Land (again, have been a few times - including when I was a little kid) to see all their Christmas lights and decorations last week and were not disappointed!

Very soon after it got dark, the lights all kicked on in unison, and it didn't matter where you were in the park because you were surrounded by lights. Plus they decorated most everything they could. It was really a sight to see, and everything was incredibly cute and kid friendly.

Our little 19 month old had a blast taking it all in. We went on a few rides, ate some snacks, rode the train around the park (which you absolutely have to do while they have all the lights up), and enjoyed just walking around and checking out everything that was different there for the holidays. So many decorations, the huge tree near the entrance, the list goes on.

Even though the parking was almost entirely filled up when we got there, we didn't find the park too busy or wait times too long. The train ended up being the longest wait which was still under 30 minutes for us.

If you haven't been before, note there's many rides that you can take your little one on with you (before they're tall enough to ride on their own). Plenty to keep you busy for hours, including so many animatronic displays with buttons to press to start hearing the "story" and watching the display come alive.

Overall, Storybook Land continues to be an amazing place to take your kids, and despite how old it is, they continue to maintain it (several rides looked brand new) and keep it fresh. Your family will have a relaxing and enjoyable time here just like ours.

The largest display of Christmas lights outside of Disneyworld!
I  returned tonight with our grown girls and explored all their favorite places at this one of a kind park.  Santa himself lights the park at 5pm, complete with snow.
Family owned since it opened many years ago and the jewel of America!
Magical and fun !

Amazing.  We had such a great time.   Food prices nit a rip off.   I appreciated that I forgot gloves and they sold quilted gloves for $6.  In other words gift shop prices fair.     Bob on train so kind. We got to train as about to close.   My 3 year old was so disappointed and he said come on.   I'll take you.   And gave us our own train ride.   She is still talking about it days later.  Santa was awesome.  Personable and spends time talking to children.     Great experience.

Lots of fun for everyone. We visited on a Saturday. It’s well organized and attractively laid out. There are food options and less adventuresome rides for those who prefer something tamer. All of the exhibits are very cute and photo worthy.

name: Anakeesta
address: 576 Parkway, Gatlinburg, TN 37738, USA

reviews.text: My visit to Anakeesta was nothing short of amazing! From the moment we arrived, the scenic beauty took my breath away. The chairlift ride up the mountain offers stunning views of the Smoky Mountains, and once at the top, there’s so much to explore. The tree canopy walk was a highlight, offering a unique perspective of the forest. The variety of activities, including the zip line, observation tower, and charming shops, made for a fun-filled day. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable, and the food at the mountaintop restaurant was delicious. Whether you’re looking for adventure, relaxation, or just some breathtaking views, Anakeesta has it all. I can’t wait to visit again

From the cable cart ride to the amazing little town up in the mountain it was great. Once in the mountain there’s lots to do, music, food, coaster ride… lots of kids friendly play area… the kids will love it more than the adults. We were there like 5hrs. There was a long line to get there so we took the bus up but cable cart ride down.

Got in line for the chair lift/gondola at 1pm ... wait time was 70 min. Did nearly everything, non add on and was back down 6pm.

Visited on a Wednesday, last week in March.

60+ degree and sunny weather helped make the waiting tolerable.

At the top was a very unique "small city" experience. The views!!!! Beautiful! Very clean, lots of restroom options and at least one water bottle fill station. Also lots of seating.

A few snack options such as flat bread pizza and ice cream that we found.

We did:
🍃 tower
🍃 slides/bearventure
🍃 treetop sky walk
🍃 gift shop

Took time to enjoy all the views! And redeem our photos from the ride up.

Overall unique experience for our teens. Would say for other families considering, meant for elementary and up. Or great for adult day out!

Parked in city garage for $10, about one block away.

If we were to do it over again, probably would purchase zip line tickets (allows express chairlift line) a week in advance (sells out quick), as well as, the night light walk AND not go up until 4pm or 5pm. There was no wait to go up when we came back down at 6pm.

If you are a Tennessee resident I recommend buying the season pass at the beginning of the year. You pay for one day and get the entire year free. If you don’t have the season pass it’s still worth going!  We enjoyed our first trip up the mountain. We are excited to be going back. There are a lot of places for children to play. They sell alcohol as well that you can walk around the town of Anakeesta and drink. There are so many beautiful views and photo opportunities there as well. They also have bus transportation up the mountain for anyone who doesn’t want to ride the ski lifts up.

Beautiful!!!
Top of the mountain full of flowers and beautiful nature, breathtaking mountain views, perfect day while visiting Gatlinburg.
There is a playground with rope bridges and wooden swings.
You go up in cable cars or lift chairs.
They have a great restaurant, food truck and ice cream place.
Very well organized and clean, gets very hot in summer so be prepared to walk and get tired.
Perfect for a family day out, there is also zip lining and mountain roller coaster.
We loved it!

name: Lost Mine Mountain Coaster and Mini-Golf
address: 2509 Teaster Ln, Pigeon Forge, TN 37863, USA

reviews.text: As someone who is afraid of heights, I won't sugarcoat it. This is a TALL mountain coaster. The inclines are very steep and intense. The pictures don't do it justice just how steep they are. That said, the coaster felt very safe, even while going full speed. I really enjoyed the thematic elements and the creativity of the coaster. It was a much longer duration than other mountain coasters in the area, and the price is reasonable. I highly recommend this coaster, just be aware it can be intense for people who don't love heights. I suggest going at off-peak hours so you aren't in a queue with other riders.

Lost Mine Mountain Coaster and MINI Golf is a fantastic spot for a fun outing! My wife and I went there for our anniversary and had a blast playing putt putt. The course was both cute and challenging, offering a great mix of fun and competition. The layout was well-designed, making each hole interesting and unique. It's a great place to spend quality time and enjoy some friendly competition. Highly recommend it for a fun date or family outing!

Excellent mountain coaster with the best theming anywhere in Gatlinburg & Pigeon Forge. A long ride with plenty of different sections and a short wait of 15 minutes or so.

Mini golf course is clean, challenging and well themed. Be prepared to wait behind bigger groups at busy times.

This was an absolute amazing experience!!! I’ve never been on a mountain coaster before never even knew they existed! My first experience was with lost mine mountain coaster! The staff here was very very nice felt like home! They were very helpful and very informative on what you were about to take yourself through lol! Everything was well explained and its rightful place and very beautiful views! The best part is you can control your speed so if you’re not a roller coaster person like myself no worries! I had my eight year-old son in the cart with me and he thoroughly enjoyed it! We got the package to do mini golf afterwards, even though it was cold, it even started snowing, we were having so much fun it didn’t matter! The facilities were very clean as well! my daughter and I are very big on stones and crystals, and they are undeniable options for you to purchase those here! I grabbed a MotherLoad bag of fossils stones and crystals for my daughter. The first day we came! I was a bit hesitant because I thought maybe there were a bunch of little stones in these bags of dirt , but for $25 you can’t beat what you get out of these bags ! I definitely went back and grabbed another one before we left !!! I don’t have one negative thing to say about this place! We will definitely come back and visit this place for sure. It’s highly recommended!!!

I've worked hard after my surgery to lose weight because the mountain coaster was something I've been wanting to do, but haven't been able to because of weight restrictions.  Well, I am finally at a weight that works!  I was so excited to do this, and we came back and rode at night!  Push the handles down and go fast!  I did, and I had an absolute blast, and I would recommend Lost Mine to folks of all ages.  Played mini golf with my wife and girls, too.  We'll be back, for sure!!!!!

name: Dig'n Zone Theme Park
address: 1707 Veterans Blvd, Sevierville, TN 37862, USA

reviews.text: Great little attraction without all of the overly crowded tourists. I do wish there were more things to do for the price but my daughter had fun, which is what mattered. The arcade has just enough to keep the entire family busy indoors with a good selection of prizes. Restrooms were clean.

It's kind of ridiculous the prices that they have to offer for the little attractions they have. An adult ticket is almost $70. Absolutely price gouging. It isn't very fun here either. There are only a few fun "attractions". the pricing doesn't justify the park. I wouldn't go here again, especially not with older children.

We had a really good time as a family of 4. Definitely a unique experience and concept. Plenty to do to keep us entertained for 5 or so hours. Our 2 year old son loved riding on my lap and "helping" me operate the equipment. Our 5 year old daughter thought it was awesome that she could operate the machines and dig in the gravel. Would highly recommend for those with kids. So cool.

We had a great day at Dig’n Zone!! It was soooo much fun. Dad, mom and brothers (15 and 5) all thoroughly enjoyed themselves. Mom even said when we were leaving she thought she would be bored but really enjoyed the therapeutic side of completing tasks operating the equipment.

It was neat experience that you can’t do anywhere else. I can’t wait for them to continue to add additional experiences and thrills!!

We will be back!! Thank you so much for the tickets for Abram! #AbramsArmy

Dig'n Zone was amazing. The staff was so friendly. Our visit had minimal waiting. We were able to have multiple goes at every station. We felt safe and kids had a blast. We absolutely want to go back.
They did have seatbelt extenders. I was concerned since you need to have smaller kids with you. It was not a problem.

name: Dollywood
address: 2700 Dollywood Parks Blvd, Pigeon Forge, TN 37863, USA

reviews.text: This place really lifts your spirits, brings the happy back into your soul, and makes a grown-up feel like a kid again! I’ve been coming to Dollywood for years. It never gets old and continues to get better and better each and every time I come.
