Must try the cinnamon bread, I would get the VIP parking.. it helps you beat the long line at the front entrance, you have your own parking lot, you can go in and out of the park as many times as you want. Take enough money for food and souvenirs(it’s all expensive and you can’t not help yourself when you start smelling all that delicious food cooking). Bug the souvenir cup so you can refill it as many times as you like. Be sure to go by the Dolly Museum and her tour bus on the way out.. it’s cool to see her clothings she has worn and other memories she let us in on in her personal life! This place is better than Disney World (my opinion)! Almost forgot.. say hey to the chicken lady!! She is the most kind hearted, funny woman at the park.

First time.visiting here.  For some reason, I had always thought Dollywood would be a lesser sort of amusement park than, say, Six Flags.  I was super happy with this trip though and am glad we ended up getting season passes.  I look forward to going back soon.

The roller coasters were great, the lines were reasonable, and we had a great family day.   Didn't try the water park yet, but we will on our next trip.

All in all, I now prefer Dollywood over many of the other parks I've been to.

Do it! Dollywood has So much for all ages. Worth the price! All the shows are included; great rides! We did not do the water park… Dollywood has some water rides and a splash pad in the summer. Christmas is wonderful. We purchased a Knife making experience. The train was fun to ride once… we bought a year pass and loved all the seasons. I joined a FB group to find all the deals. Candle Dipping in interactive and inexpensive souvenirs! Food Pass was good in the Spring! Crowds are hit and miss. If it rains just wait…

I love Dollywood. I’m a diamond pass holder and I live in CA. I also have a Disneyland pass but Dollywood is my jam. I love it. There’s so much to do for everybody from the Eagles to the cinnamon bread to the carnival area with the new splash pad. The food is good and if it’s not made right, they’ll make it for you again. The only thing that sucks. is there so many strollers and EV vehicles that try to run you over it would be nice if they had a stroller size limit and didn’t allow people to bring in huge wagons for their children. Makes it a horrible experience for the rest of us whose children are grown 10 out of 10. Totally recommend if you haven’t been here you showed 100% plan a family trip. Dollywood is the best.

Best alternative to spend all day long with the family & kids.  You will enjoy since arriving, until the park closed.  A lot of rides for all the ages, a lot of restaurants, a lot of attractions, a lot of stores to buy gifts. Highly recommend, we came from Florida, and my family love it. Congratulations for 40 years of diversions for all the family.

name: The Goat Coaster at Goats on the Roof
address: 1341 Wears Valley Rd, Pigeon Forge, TN 37863, USA

reviews.text:
I enjoyed the coaster. It’s a fairly long lift up the side of the mountain and through the woods to get to the top. But once you crest the top it’s an exciting ride down.

The quirky little gift shop is interesting to browse. The goats on the roof (yes actual live goats) are entertaining to watch. You can even feed them if you choose.

This coaster is a bit off of the Parkway but the best coaster value in the area.

Go check it out!!

This was the best mountain coaster that I've ever ridden.  It takes you up pretty high and then it goes down hill from there, and you can go soooo fast if you want to. At night, it was decorated with tons of different colored lights and had music playing. Also had a little shop connected to it. They had food you could buy in a little cup to feed the goats, that were on the roof or in the gated area .The staff were very nice too. I would definitely do it again.

WOW. This ride is SO fun. Great customer service. Also the gift shop is phenomenal. I regret that I went shopping in gatlinburg before coming here. I would have spent half as much and would have gotten way more interesting and unique items here. The long and the short of it is: GO HERE!!

We had such a blast, fun for all ages. My 70 year old mother in law even rode the coaster. Our two year old enjoyed feeding and petting the goats. They also offer gem mining and have a packed gift shops. The staff if friendly and helpful. We can’t wait to go back.
This place is so cool! The workers are all so nice. Such a great time. Lots of fun stuff to buy. The roller coaster is a MUST. We will be back. Get the coffee and cookies!

name: The Island in Pigeon Forge
address: 131 The Island Dr, Pigeon Forge, TN 37863, USA

reviews.text:
What a fun place for all ages!  I'd like to stay another day just to explore this little gem.  Came for the Sky Fly.  It was so much fun, and I'd do it again in a heartbeat!  Of course, we hit The Old Smoky Moonshine tasting, and yes, we are bringing some back home :)

Free parking and free shuttle ride.

The island was a very cool experience. There are shopping centers ranging from restaurants to candy stores, plus build a bear, and many more! They have a free light/fountain show every 30 minutes throughout the day. Rides are $6/piece or $39 for an unlimited ride wristband. I’m not sure if it’s honored all year but when we went the wristbands were good for 48 hours! If you lose the wristband, you can get a new one for $5 with your receipt. The gondola Ferris wheel was unnecessarily expensive. Wrist band holders get on for free but otherwise it’s $17 a ride. If you want to buy tickets for your kiddos, as a parent you ride free for any rides that require  a chaperone (your kid doesn’t meet height requirement to ride solo for the ride). Parking can be challenging but they have shuttles for the free parking lot. We brought 3 young kids under the age of 5 and there were surprisingly quite a few rides for our 2 year olds, though none were solo.

This is a great place! There is a lot to do here, as there are stores, restaurants, and attractions! This is a place where all ages can go. There is the huge Ferris wheel, a drop tower, and more rides1 For parking, it will be farther than most people would like, but there is a shuttle bus that takes people from parking to the Island. And there is a huge fountain in the middle with lots of rocking chairs. I would go here again.

We truly enjoyed our time in Gatlinburg, Tennessee, and to go to the Island In Pigpen Forge it was beautiful and it has so much to do, for the kids and adults. So much to see we walked around ate, shopped, ate some more ride rides sat in the rocking chairs around the fountain, we just had the best time ever all the kids were sleeping by the time we got back to our cabin this is a great place for family vacation I loved it here !!!!

Great to see the water fountain show with lights and music. Every 1/2 and every hr. Lots of things to do . Parking is free a trolly will pick you up at a trolly station and take you to the main entrance.
Suggest to go at night so you can see everything illumined looks much nicer

name: Lumberjack Feud Adventure Park
address: 2530 Parkway, Pigeon Forge, TN 37863, USA

reviews.text: This was such a cool dinner and show. Very crowd interactive and the competitions are very cool to watch. We have experienced a few different dinner and shows and this one has been the best by far! 10/10 recommend. The food is pretty tasty as well!!!
A little bit expensive for what they offer, but the experience is totally different. The kids will love it, and for those who like the adrenaline it's just perfect
So much fun I loved the ropes course and the zip line was fantastic. I wish I saw the show

We purchased tickets online a head of time. The purchase confirmation email explained when to arrive which was plenty of time to eat before the show. The food was excellent. The show was very entertaining, dangerous and humorous. They do use loud chainsaws so be aware for sound sensitive children.

We had a buy one get one coupon, and because of this, we were told we did not get supper included. We understood their reasoning, but we were not told this when we bought the ticket from the ticket vendor. My ears are still affected 3 weeks later from the crowd being encouraged to make noise, stomp their feet, etc...on metal bleachers. I saw the show years ago, and enjoyed it more the first time. Overall, it is a "must see "

name: Ober Mountain
address: 1339 Ski Mountain Rd, Gatlinburg, TN 37738, USA

reviews.text: Recently visited for Spring Break on a Monday. We got to ride an empty tram because we got there right at the opening. We purchased our tickets the day prior but still had to wait in line with one attendant. Maybe two attendants would have been helpful. One for people who need to purchase tickets and one for people who purchased ahead of time. This place has the potential to be superior. However, you can tell some things do need major upgrades. First and foremost, the ice skates for kids are extremely used and need replacing. My kid had fun, but the ice skates were so bad and very difficult to put and stay on. We got to ride the coaster and only waited about 30 minutes. The attendants working this attraction were very vigilant and working well to get the line moving. The views on top of the mountain on the chairlift are absolutely breathtaking. This place needs to sell healthier options. For example, acai bowls, smoothies, or salads.  The food is very pricey and tastes like regular cafeteria food. I recommend bringing your own food. I do think the wristband is worth the $50 bucks because we got to do everything and spent all day from 10am- 4:30pm.

Over mountain was a good place. It is a little smelly inside, but you’ll get used to it. Taking the tram up to the building will sway, so I would drive up the mountain and park there instead if you have a fear of heights. There is a lot of things to do here, including an entire skiing park with chairlifts and real snow. There is also a scenic chairlift where y or can see as far as North Carolina. There is a mountain coaster that is pretty lengthy and fast, although lines can be as much as 90 minutes long. There is much more to do like Ice skating and bumper cars. Overall, this place is good. I probably wouldn’t go here again on spring break because much of the things you can do there are closed, but in the winter this would be a very good skiing place in the eastern part of the US.

Great place to visit for tubing. Although, getting in for parking is challenging, and if you’re waiting inside the lodge, it’s very cold. If you can find a heater or spot in front of the fireplace, it’s much more tolerable, but it can be tough to find a warm place to sit. Seats fill up quickly, and the doors are often left open. So even if you’re not planning on spending time in the snow, I’d still advise to dress warmly.

So much fun very high in the sky. They close at 8 I think 🤔 so don’t be late. It was $29.00 and they have military discount.
They have ski ⛷️ even in 70 degree weather here so much fun for the kids they make snow ⛄️ so much to see and do here.

New management is fantastic however, prices have gone up significantly. We spent over $600 for one day of fun with a three person family. Check out the new upstairs lodge, relaxation area. It’s over the top and very nicely done by an interior decorator.

name: Rowdy Bear's Smoky Mountain Snowpark
address: 2155 Parkway, Pigeon Forge, TN 37863, USA

reviews.text: Such great staff! Had the 3 ride pass from our cabin and just had a blast. The laser hanging ride was a ton of fun and added a new dimension to the ride experience. The mountain coaster was cool because it was not just pulled up the hill and gravity down, it’s powered up and down and you control the speed with a motorcycle style twist throttle. My 13 and 15YO girls, my wife and I all had a great time! It’s not a whole day thing so if you have an hour, two, or a little bit more to kill it’s perfect! The staff were super friendly and very welcoming, they made it even more fun.

We had a wonderful time!  11 year old son, 45 year old Dad, 47 year old Mom and 66 year old Granny!  We all were able to ride and we are all different sizes.  (Plus size friendly!). All age acomidating! Everyone had a blast.  Every staff member we had contact with was absolutely charming and helpful!
We had so much fun! Unlimited rides for 1 or 2 hours. I felt it was worth it, pay per person. Tickets build up for prizes at the end. The workers are friendly!

I wouldn't recommend anyone to go to this place. I paid $112.00 to get in and when I got there it wasn't anything like what it advertised. I tried to get my money back and I talked to 3 supervisor and they said the best they could do was refund me $11. The 3 lady after I've been on the phone for a hour she told me that because my time slot had passed she couldn't refund me anything even though I was in the parking lot and on the phone with the the entire time. That's no way to run a business. Do not go to this place or you'll be disappointed. If I could have given it no stars I would have.
Let me just say that Jason is super super awesome. This was an incredible experience and I can’t wait to come back. I would highly highly recommend.

name: Rowdy Bear's Smoky Mountain Snowpark
address: 2155 Parkway, Pigeon Forge, TN 37863, USA

reviews.text: Such great staff! Had the 3 ride pass from our cabin and just had a blast. The laser hanging ride was a ton of fun and added a new dimension to the ride experience. The mountain coaster was cool because it was not just pulled up the hill and gravity down, it’s powered up and down and you control the speed with a motorcycle style twist throttle. My 13 and 15YO girls, my wife and I all had a great time! It’s not a whole day thing so if you have an hour, two, or a little bit more to kill it’s perfect! The staff were super friendly and very welcoming, they made it even more fun.

We had a wonderful time!  11 year old son, 45 year old Dad, 47 year old Mom and 66 year old Granny!  We all were able to ride and we are all different sizes.  (Plus size friendly!). All age acomidating! Everyone had a blast.  Every staff member we had contact with was absolutely charming and helpful!
We had so much fun! Unlimited rides for 1 or 2 hours. I felt it was worth it, pay per person. Tickets build up for prizes at the end. The workers are friendly!

I wouldn't recommend anyone to go to this place. I paid $112.00 to get in and when I got there it wasn't anything like what it advertised. I tried to get my money back and I talked to 3 supervisor and they said the best they could do was refund me $11. The 3 lady after I've been on the phone for a hour she told me that because my time slot had passed she couldn't refund me anything even though I was in the parking lot and on the phone with the the entire time. That's no way to run a business. Do not go to this place or you'll be disappointed. If I could have given it no stars I would have.
Let me just say that Jason is super super awesome. This was an incredible experience and I can’t wait to come back. I would highly highly recommend.

name: SkyLand Ranch
address: 1620 Parkway, Sevierville, TN 37862, USA

reviews.text: What an amazing view! We enjoyed the ski lift, the mountain coaster, the petting zoo, the miniature horses, highland cows, live entertainment,  and so much fun sitting around the fires. There is plenty of room and time to explore and enjoy family time. The mountain coaster is my favorite alpine coaster to date. This was a great experience, and we will probably do it again.

Can’t say enough good things about this place! We had so much fun on the safari hayride… where else can you get up close to feed a Texas longhorn?! The mountain coaster was the best we have ever ridden and the animals were so cute and well taken care of. Food was excellent, not “theme park” food. We remarked many times how friendly every staff member we encountered was and how it really made our day.  Our son begged to go back every day of our trip! Getting to go back three days was a huge plus and we felt it was a good deal because of that. It was never super busy so we felt more relaxed than any other attractions in the area. We ended up enjoying this much more than any other place we went in pigeon forge/gatlinburg in our five day trip. We can’t wait to return!

BEST PLACE FOR ME SO FAR. The staff was so nice and I had the best time. It was cold when we went but I loved every minute of it. We rode a chair lift up, which was awesome. The view was breathtaking. My favorite thing that we did there was pictures with the highland cow Dozer. If you love the mini cows, you have to do this. They offered hay rides, and they were also expanding the ranch. On the way back down, we rode the shuttle and the driver told
us stories about the animals and how long he had been there and facts I found so interesting. That was a fun end to an amazing moment. Highly recommend. Fun for the whole family.

My family had a lot of fun.  We took the chairlift up to the ranch. The ranch was very well kept and so was the animals.  There were bunnies, baby goats, miniature highland cows, baby pigs, miniature horses, and sheep.  We didn’t get the hayride to feed them but we still got to pet all the animals at the ranch. There was live music.  The cafe had awesome baked goods and icecream.  They had fire pits, a playground, cornhole and an outlook.  We went at 6pm.  I think it would be be more enjoyable in the evening bc then the fire pits are going and they have a lot of lights which makes it even more enjoyable.  We rode the mountain coaster at the end when it was dark bc the track is lit up.  We only have a family of three so for us it was worth it.  We had a lot of fun and would definitely go back.  Major plus is that your tickets are good for three full days!!!

Perfect adventure! I loved every minute of it. The mountain coaster, skylift and the hayride safari! The adorable animals, lovely atmosphere and beautiful sights! The view is breathtaking. The cafe has yummy drinks. This is the perfect place for pictures!

name: Austin’s
address: 16231 N Interstate Hwy 35, Pflugerville, TX 78660, USA

reviews.text:
This is a great family fun center with tons of options for all ages! The arcade is huge and of course loud. There is a buffet and a separate bar with liquor. You can also order food and eat at the bar, there are tables too.

There is also so much to do outside. You can really make a day trip out of this place. The game tokens and tickets are stored on play cards, so you can save them up. They have package deals too for rides, the buffet and experiences.

If your child is over 44” plan to pay adult prices. It was busy when we were there. But they were also having an event and many kids were on spring break.

Great for parties, events, family gatherings and an all around good time!

Fantastic place to have fun with laser tag, bowling, go cart, different games and places to eat, huge place with lots of activities, but it’s very crowded and long long waiting lines especially for go carts and bowling, hours of lines. You have to come early afternoon to be able to go there otherwise you pay a ticket but with no sense as you will be waiting there for hours. It’s possible to buy game cards with different options as well. So earlier you come better is. And I wish restroom could be cleaned properly, too many people inside.

This place is fun for all ages, it has something for everyone.  It has a buffet and a couple of other bars and restaurants,  plus it has arcade games,  laser tag, bowling, golf, pool  and other rides inside and outside.   My kids enjoyed a lot.  Be prepared to spend money.  I've been coming here for years.
Its always a fun time here! The human claw is a fun addition as well as the tea cups! All you can eat buffet make it well worth coming early and staying all day!

Great place for all ages!  We took our 4 year old grandson, and he loved it.  There were fun arcade games and age appropriate rides outside.  Even though it was very busy because of Spring Break, it was still easy to navigate, and there was no waiting.   Perfect for family fun!

name: Camp Fimfo Texas Hill Country
address: 520 Whitewater Way, New Braunfels, TX 78132, USA

reviews.text: We've made it to Camp Fimfo twice, once during a completely dead week in October (highly recommend) and once during peak spring break with friends! We had a blast both times! There's plenty to do, accommodations are good, the staff is friendly, and the property is beautiful. We were there the night of the drone show and it was awesome! Don't go without renting a golf cart, that's half the fun! Food options are minimal so prepare to cook or eat out if you're staying several days. Overall it's a great family vacation spot.

We were extremely impressed with our trip to Camp Fimfo. The staff was very accommodating and were quick to ask if we needed help with anything. We stayed in an adorable Bluebonnet cabin and it was very clean and came with just about everything we needed. Great air conditioning (almost worked a little too well). Golf cart rental is a must! We will definitely be booking another trip soon. Thank you to everyone that made our stay so enjoyable!

The whole family had a blast, the cabins were nice and clean, the bathrooms were very slippery though. The curtains did not contain any water from the shower, I slipped in the shower our last day there despite great effort of trying to keep the floor dry with the towels we had. Other than the shower issue and the extremely slow golf carts, everything was good. I understand trying to keep everyone safe but 9 miles/hr on a golf carts is extremely slow.

The RV sites were big, flat, and clean. The bath house was very clean and the grounds were beautiful. They have so many activities on site and it’s still growing. We faced one challenge while we were there and Doran was quick to help us resolve it, which we were incredibly grateful for. The employees all seemed happy and were very helpful. One employee, Katie, was really fun and interactive with the kids. Sierra was another employee who we thought was really kind and fun. In the office, we mostly dealt with Tori and she was incredibly hospitable. We will be back.

Just finished  a 3 night stay in the Bluebonnet cabins with 50 high school band kids. Jody and the group sales people were amazing and took such good care of us. There was no shortage of things to do and it's a great location for exploring the whole area. We would definitely stay again.

name: Kiddie Park
address: 3903 N St Mary's St, San Antonio, TX 78212, USA

reviews.text: Celebrated my daughter 5th birthday at the Kiddie Park. This review is strictly for the party experience. For the most part it was a good experience. There are some drawbacks to having your party here. Your guests will have a tough time parking. A few of my guests had to park almost a mile away near the Japanese tea gardens and BBQ restaurant. They were slow on giving wrist bands. If my party starts at 10:00am, then the kids shouldn’t be waiting around for 10 minutes for their wristbands. Especially since we are so limited on time. The contract states we will get wrist bands 5 minutes before our party start time. Also, they said they have a knife to cut the birthday cake but do not cut the cake. So, I was prepared to cut our cake but all they had was a little plastic knife. That’s not a knife and I couldn’t even cut my cake with it. I would tell customers you don’t provide a special cake knife and advise we bring our own. The kids seemed to have fun and of course they don’t notice these things. 4 stars because my daughter loved her birthday and that’s what matters.

To the right of the zoo's entrance.

There are five rides to choose from. It being our first time here, we settled with getting the unlimited ride option. My daughter enjoyed it, so that's what matters most.

No lines. Convenience of multiple food options (nearby gift shop with snacks, Starbucks, and hotdog stand that is on site). There is a spacious picnic area to the right of the gift shop.

It's a slight bummer that the mini amusement park is in need of a major upgrade (long overdue).

So much fun!!  Kept my kids entertained for a very long time and everything was really neat. Food and drinks were way overpriced, but we got the unlimited rides and lunch ticket for the kids which was totally worth it. Was not crowded, no wait lines for rides.

We paid over $500 to host a party here for 24 kids $400 for 6 benches and bracelets for the kids. $86 for 6 pizzas and $20 for 2 drinks options. When we arrived the party host asked when we wanted the food I told him 30 minutes and he disappeared after that. We never got our drinks or food till 50 minutes into our party. I could never find our host. I had to track him down. They were sitting in an air conditioned trailer talking and laughing. Multiple parties going on with everyone looking for their hosts. They didn’t give us enough cups or ice for 24 kids. The drinks were watered down and had no flavor. They didn’t tell us that you need to make your guests stand in line at the front ticket station to get measured in height to get their bracelets. The line was long and they had to wait cutting into our party time. They have 5 rides only and one was not working so only 4 options for our kids. Also parking is hard to find since it’s shared with the zoo parking. Suffice to say we will never book a party here again.
Not many rides at all for the price and they are outdated .. first time here with my 5 and 9 year old!!!  Very disappointing not have much at all.

name: Marineland Canada
address: 7657 Portage Rd, Niagara Falls, ON L2E 6X8, Canada

reviews.text:
A lot of parking. A lot of space in the park. A lot of waking as well.  The animals were amazing. Feeding them was astonishing. I took my daughter there, who is one.

Some rides were out of order. The water park is small. I would say it isn’t for teenagers or order—only one food court. The train takes a long to get to stops and if you go on. A busy day it will be full most of the time.

Other than that, I would go back again. I would love to meet the owner. I got ideas!

3/5

We were looking forward to this encounter. However, on arrival we were told that the amusement park is shut down and most of the animals are not there. The only thing we saw were dolphins and Beluga whales.

As it was our first time seeing either, we took everything in stride. We spent about 10 minutes with the whales one of which was a cheeky bugger :) who kept trying to wet his good natured caretaker.

Then, we went back and spent a good while with the dolphins. I believed I was able to connect with one as it was a see through tank. They pass right in front your face and of course they love small kids and babies.

Suffice it to say, it's because of the dolphins and whales that brought the score up. Please Marineland, do better. Get things up and running quickly. The venue is lovely, but a lot is missing..

It was okay.  The deer park was closed and alot of the rides didn't work. The show is the same. I have been going for years and they haven't changed anything.  The kids like it. It's has a splash pad so that was cool. The price is on par with other attractions,  you can however upgrade your ticket to a season pass and come back to enjoy the park is you didn't get everything done.

We really enjoyed. buy 1 season ticket and you can walk at least every day. interesting dolphin and walrus show. Many animals. attractions for children were not all working, but we did not even have time to get around everything. Dragon Hill is a place for the brave. you can spend the whole day. we will definitely come again.

Great family experience. Lots of rides, both family friendly and for older kids. Beautiful scenery and parkland that encourages picnics. A train will take you around if you don't mind waiting for it. There can be a lot of walking otherwise but lots to see on the way. Educational presentation about marine animals was about 40 minutes and quite interesting. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. Place was very clean including the bathrooms. Some attractions closed due to Covid. A great deal if you can go more than once, as a ticket gets you a season's pass.

name: Morgan's Wonderland
address: 5223 David Edwards Dr, San Antonio, TX 78233, USA

reviews.text:
Morgan’s Wonderland is a one-of-a-kind park that truly lives up to its mission of inclusivity. It’s designed to accommodate individuals of all abilities, making it a fantastic place for families and friends to enjoy together. One of the things I absolutely loved was how seamlessly everyone interacted, whether you had a disability or not. There was no sense of separation. Everyone played, laughed, and enjoyed the park as equals.

The wheelchair accessibility was phenomenal, and even those with mobility challenges could experience the rides, which is something you don’t see at most amusement parks. The covered picnic area was another highlight
: clean, spacious, and perfect for relaxing between activities.

My only downside was the restrooms near the picnic area. They were small, with only two stalls, which led to long lines. If you needed to assist someone with toileting or changing, there really wasn’t enough room to do so comfortably. I hope they consider expanding or redesigning that space in the future.

Overall, Morgan’s Wonderland is an incredible place that fosters fun and inclusivity for everyone. I highly recommend it to families looking for a park that truly welcomes all.

Such an 100x underrated amusement park. I went today with my nephews and we had an amazing time!!! Even for a Saturday it wasn't even too busy!! I completely recommend bringing anyone going to this place for kids to have some fun. Definitely worth it, really great prices all around. The staff are also very sweet and very welcoming. I definitely going to come here again and again and let everyone I know with kids know about this place lol.

My Husband, three kids and I absolutely love Morgan's Wonderland! ❤️

We come to Morgan's several times a year every year and our two older Autistic children really love and enjoy it as it's so much fun and built around understanding and supporting special needs children and of all ages which is very appreciated and wonderful for an establishment!

Being judged as a Family with special needs children and what that entails can be hard enough on a day to day basis but at Morgan's you feel right at home because other Parents are in the same predicament and situation in life and actually understand with compassion and without prejudice.

All children are different and unique in their own ways and are blessings from God no matter what.

It's an absolute beautiful feeling and place to spend time together as a Family creating fun, loving and lasting memories!

I absolutely and highly recommend Morgan's Wonderland to all Families and especially those with special needs children!

It is definitely worth the drive no matter how far and always makes our three children so happy to go! We all love and look forward to it every time!! ❤️🙏

AMAZING place for people with Special Needs, even for neurotypical. Accessibility for all needs! A great place to let the kids runs free without the judgement and side eyes(even though we pay them no mind)  when meltdowns occur. Can’t wait for the splash park to open this summer and all of the other developments Morgan’s is doing to support the special needs community.

We had such an amazing family day. The splash parks are so much fun for the kiddos and adults. The zip line was so fun! I love the wheelchair accessible areas they are every where. Can’t wait to go back in October for the Halloween theme events .

name: SeaWorld San Antonio
address: 10500 SeaWorld Dr, San Antonio, TX 78251, USA

reviews.text: My visit this last week with my family was a pleasant experience. The only problem was that most of the rides were not available but besides that I could say I had a great time. The food and customer service was amazing. The food portions were great!! And the food tasted good. The performances were nice and the experience for feeding the sea lions was cool because you don’t really get to do that. The sea lions were cracking me and my family up by just making theses silly noises because they wanted more fish. The park wasn’t that busy for it being a Monday during spring break, and of course you would think it would be busy but surprisingly it wasn’t. Which made it more enjoyable for me and my family’s visit.
Great shows and rides. There were quite a few rides closed though. Always clean and friendly staff. Great place to take kids of all ages. Lots to do for little kids too
Great shows and park was clean! Rides were fun. Good for all ages. Park is a good size, but plan on spending some cash as food/ drink is expensive.

My son has been wanting to come here for quite a while. We purchased tickets via Groupon and it was a pretty sweet deal. There is a lot to do and I felt the price we paid was reasonable. Lots of rides and shows to enjoy. We will be back. Beware that food prices are just through the roof. It may be worth it to get a ticket that includes at least one meal. There are quite a few places to eat and choose from and the portions are decent. One bottle of Smart water was $10 with tax. These prices are to be expected, but just be prepared. Overall my son was delighted and he had a great time and that made it worth it for us!

We had an amazing time at SeaWorld San Antonio! The park is clean, well-organized, and offers something for everyone. The animal encounters were incredible—getting to see dolphins, sea lions, and orcas up close was truly unforgettable. The shows were entertaining and educational, especially the orca and beluga whale performances.

The rides were a blast! Wave Breaker and Texas Stingray were our favorites, providing just the right amount of thrill. The staff was friendly and helpful, making the experience even better. We also appreciated the variety of food options and the shaded areas to cool off from the Texas heat.

If you’re looking for a fun family-friendly adventure, SeaWorld San Antonio is a fantastic choice. We’ll definitely be back!

name: Six Flags Fiesta Texas
address: San Antonio, TX 78257, USA

reviews.text:
This amusement park is a must stop. Event on a Saturday over siting break and never waited more than 20 minutes for a ride and all rides were operating. The staff were very friendly. The carnival games were a little corny but that is a small part of the overall experience. Here is our list of favorite rides. Six flags coasters in order of best to worst. Sit in the front, definitely a unique and amazing experience.
Iron rattler - overall most exciting ride in the park.
Dr diabolical - extremely smooth ride. Get in front.
Goliath - smooth and no wait.
Batman - newest ride and very unique. Longest wait time and shortest ride but still a must do.
Boomerang - very interesting concept
Superman
Wonder Woman
Poltergeist
The joker
I loved going here, it was my first time at a rollercoaster park. When I visited they were having a Mardi Gras theme. Only one ride I didn’t go on and I went on all the others and had so much fun!

Was just there this past Sunday 12-22-24, had a great time.  Always fun, i did not feel like it was too packed but still a good amount of people.  Lots of different rides for any age.  Also have games but those need to be played with cash i believe.  Variety of food places, can be pricey but its all there is

We got the season passes, and it's so much fun. The lines move pretty fast. Food is like $20 a meal, so I'd suggest bringing an ice chest and just heading to your car for a brief lunch. We do that and will get dinner on the way home. Great place for all ages. My girls love coming here. We are eagerly waiting for the water park to open.

We had our company party here. It was rainy so I for sire thought the rides were gonna be closed. But ended up clearing up so everything was up. They had the lights on for holiday in the park. It was so pretty. They had places to keep warm. Liked they had a place to make stores, that was cute. And the huge Christmas tree was beautiful!

name: Tom Foolerys Adventure Park
address: 1305 Kalahari Dr, Wisconsin Dells, WI 53965, USA

reviews.text: Looked online for things to do. Turns out it was walking distance from our Hillside room. My kids really wanted to go try the human claw machine. Neat busy place!

Credits to play games were too high. The all-day wrist band includes laser tag, rides, and obstacles course. Not the arcade, mirror maze, or bowling. We went 2 days, and all my kids wanted their actual tickets printed bc they thought it was fun to feed it in the machines..however they all were shorted 100s of tickets. So, definitely opt to have them virtually added to your card instead. People there were not friendly at all. (The employee doing the human crane was nice actually, but that was it). My kids were able to blow throw 200 credits each in less than an hr. Which ended up okay bc the lines for everything else were sometimes an hr long. My kids had the most fun on the human crane and laser tag.

An Unforgettable Family Experience at Tom Foolery!

Our family had an absolute blast at Tom Foolery! From the moment we walked in, the staff went above and beyond to make sure everyone had a fantastic time.

Our 9-year-old daughter, who uses a wheelchair, was able to enjoy the rides thanks to the amazing staff who helped her every step of the way—even assisting her in climbing the rock wall, which was such a touching moment for us. Seeing her light up with excitement was priceless.

Our 22-year-old son, who is nonverbal and has CP, absolutely loved all the games. He was engaged and happy the entire time, which made the experience even more special for us. And my wife? Well, she found her own fun—she was completely hooked on the coin-pushing machine!

It was a day full of joy, laughter, and unforgettable memories. We can’t thank the team at Tom Foolery enough for their kindness and effort in making sure everyone, regardless of ability, had an amazing time. We’ll definitely be back!

Fun Times at Tom Foolerys Adventure Park! 🎉

We visited Tom Foolerys Adventure Park in August 2024 with our group of two adults and four teenagers, and let me tell you, we all had a blast—like kids again! 😄

The arcades were definitely a highlight—so many fun games to choose from. However, it’s worth mentioning that some of the games and the arcade area itself felt a bit dated. A little refresh would definitely take the experience up a notch.

We were excited to check out the bowling alleys on the second floor, but unfortunately, we ran out of time. From what we saw, it looked like a great addition to the fun, so we’re definitely planning to try it out on our next visit.

Another great perk is the plenty of free parking, making it super convenient to visit without any hassle. 🚗

Overall, Tom Foolerys Adventure Park is a great spot for families with kids, and even us adults couldn’t resist joining in on the fun! It’s a lively place where everyone can find something to enjoy. 🎮🎳

Thank you!
Val Milan Realtor

We go to Tom Fooleries fairly often. Usually we have a decent time.
Here are a few complaints and I hope by making this review, corporate will take our suggestions seriously.
For families who have young ones under 42inches tall, you get a $20 wrist band. They literally can only do 1 ride alone. The small rollercoaster and large Carousel , they have ti be accompanied by a paying adult which is $45. Not even an older child (we have a 12 year old) who had a $45 wrist band.
They also can’t do go carts even as a passenger with a responsible paying adult.
They have mini rides but those are credits, 12 credits for the tea cups which equates to roughly a $5 game card……… 1 min ride, it’s just mind blowing to me
Also the arcade, good luck finding anything under 10 credits to play. I bought a $10 game card and got 1 game out of it because it was 12 credits and the game needed two people.

It also highly bothers me that they have attractions (human claw) that require credits. As if you don’t pay enough with the wrist bands as it is…….the lines are long and it’s not fun to wait 30 min in line to be told you can’t do it, employees enforce these rules like their life depends on it, there is zero leeway.

As a parent, I don’t personally want to do any of these rides, but I’m forced to. They need to revamp their rules here, it’s a small theme park, it’s not that serious. They also need to re-evaluate how many credits these arcade games cost. It’s pretty much $5 per game, which is ludicrous.
Thanks for coming to my ted talk.

name: ZDT's Amusement Park
address: 301 W Kingsbury St, Seguin, TX 78155, USA

reviews.text: Unlimited play and rides!! It was the most fun we’ve had in awhile. Loved it!

It was alright. The kids had fun and the park is decent. The mosquitoes at the water area picnic tables were atrocious and chased us away for our lunch at a different area. You guys should contact Walt Disney World to find out how they keep 🦟 out of their central Florida location.

Highly recommend. The price was VERY reasonable for what you get. The food was good. The facility was kept very clean including the kitchen area and restrooms. The staff were very friendly and helpful. It's unlimited arcade games. We took our 3 year old and had a blast. Free for parents if not participating in play.

Great value. Activities are limited there are very few rides and they eliminated at least half of the video games they previously had. That being said for the price it is more than worth it. The entry fee includes go carts, a few rides including some water rides in warmer months, all the video games including a flight simulator, a rock wall, and I'm sure a few other things I'm forgetting. Concession prices are lower than most amusement parks and the staff is always super friendly. I highly recommend ZDTs for any family looking for reasonably priced fun. I would definitely rate 5 stars if they had more rides but they have so few it feels wrong to call it an amusement park.

It's a cute small place, I wouldn't say it's worth the money though. Not all the attractions were open. The power went out right when I got there so nothing worked and they took quite a long time to get everything up and running again. The rides only hold a small amount of people so the lines are long. It was fun for a day but I probably wouldn't go again.

name: Big Rivers Waterpark & Adventures
address: 23101 TX-242, New Caney, TX 77357, USA

reviews.text: I recently attended Big Rivers Christmas, and it was an absolute blast! From the festive lights to the fun activities, every moment was filled with holiday cheer. The atmosphere was magical, with beautiful light displays, holiday music, and plenty of things to see and do. It was well-organized, family-friendly, and provided entertainment for all ages. Considering the experience, the price was totally worth it. I left feeling the Christmas spirit in full swing—highly recommend it to anyone looking for a fun and festive outing!

We went for the Christmas lights and activities. It was our first time and we went because they had free admission for educational staff. We saw Santa, did archery, rode the hay wagon, petted goats, sheep and a baby alligator, and walked through the lights. It was nice but there were many lights out, several of the free crafts were also out and signage was not clear about where activities were located. People working there were very nice and it was only crowded during the wait for the hay ride.

We attended the Big River Christmas last night. It was fun but could have been better. The thing we were looking forward to the most, the bouncy house, was soaking wet inside. And they weren't telling anyone this, just letting whole families go in with their toddlers and nice clothes on to get absolutely soaked. We were lucky to have arrived at the entrance right as a family came out and the family warned us with a chuckle that it was wet inside, the woman glancing at me miserably to let me know they were understating the issue (she was soaked). The amusement rides were fun and included in the price, the staff with them were all so sweet and cheery. The food was ridiculously overpriced and not included in the price, so eat before you come. ($9 for a tiny chili dog) ($5 for below average hot chocolate). The only food I can recommend and was worth it was the festive holiday funnel cake, it was so fun! Picture included here. The hay ride line was long (30 minute wait) and fun but alot of lights were broken or missing. They need to do an audit of the hay ride lights, many are not working at all. There didn't seem to be any management present and the lack of oversight really showed. When we arrived the christmas lights out front on the main entrance building werent even lit. Axe throwing was awesome! 20 minute wait time and you sign a waiver. Archery line was way too long so we skipped it. We never found Santa and got lost in a wooded area looking for him. The paths are not well lit, I couldn't see any maps either. I was only able to find the restroom by screaming "has anyone seen a bathroom anywhere?!?" The actual maze was our favorite ride/attraction. Make the maze bigger, we loved that! Lafittes Fury was a fun ride, I recommend going to the bathroom first. Take deep breathes like your giving birth and you wont have a heart attack.🤣 2 amusement rides were broken. The gift shop was underwhelming. The price for this event online was $25 per person. I would say it was not worth that price if I had paid that. I received my tickets as a gift and only paid for food. Lines for rides that got long weren't really controlled by barriers or staff and there was some cutting happening and some angry dads yelling in a few spots. Paired with alcohol this seemed bad. Again I did not see one adult employee anywhere managing anyone. ALL THIS TO SAY WE WILL DEFINITELY RETURN FOR THE SUMMER. The lazy river looked fun and that massive climbing course thing seemed really unique and we want to try that out during the day in warmer weather.😄⛱️ One last thing, it might not mean alot but our family notices these things: I am pleased to report that this entire park seems extremely disability friendly and ADA compliant. There is seating everywhere, wide paths and ramps. So bring your grandparents and your disabled friends and family.🦽♿️👍

Adventure day was a blast! Lines were not long! However they did not have enough staff to open all rides at once so you had to wait for them to finish one ride and come over to another ride to operate it also!

We had a fantastic time this evening for the veterans and first responders night (my husband is a navy veteran) such an amazing thing for big rivers to do for the community! We loved the hay ride, lights, petting zoo and rides.

The only issue we ran into were the fairground attendants seeming miserable. I wanted to ride the small airplane ride with my special needs daughter, she’s a little bit anxious so she wanted me to sit with her- but she was excited. I only weigh 138 but the girl running it wouldn’t let me ride with her… there were no weight limits listed or height, and then later on I see a teenager who clearly weighs more than me on the same ride. It had me feeling like it was some weird form of discrimination, idk. I felt icky after that. I know the part time employees are not a direct reflection of the core of this park so we will definitely be back, I just want the owner to be aware this happened, as it caused my daughters overall mood to decline after we couldn’t get on.

She still rode her first ride ever, the Texas twister and she had a blast. Such a cool milestone and I’m happy we were able to do that one together!

name: Downtown Aquarium
address: 410 Bagby St, Houston, TX 77002, USA

reviews.text: Had a good time. The restaurant and its aquarium are pretty spectacular. Our waitresses was very knowledable about the food and the fish in the restaurant aquarium. The train ride to the sharks was enjoyable too.  At my age I have seen many aquariums and there were still several exibits in the main areas that we interacted with.  And last but far from least they 2 tigers which were icing on the cake.

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Amazing Experience at Downtown Aquarium Houston!

Our visit to the Downtown Aquarium in Houston was absolutely fantastic! We got to pet stingrays, see a majestic tiger, and explore some incredible sea life—it was both fun and educational. One of the highlights was the train ride, where we even got to learn about Houston’s history in such a unique way!

The rides were a great bonus, and the best part? They’re perfect for families—you can even ride with little ones and infants. The restaurant inside was top-notch, with great service and delicious food, making the whole experience even better.

If you’re looking for a fun-filled adventure for all ages, this is the place to go! We had an unforgettable time and will definitely be back

Great little aquarium, definitely smaller than anticipated but still an excellent attraction to visit.
To see the sharks you need to take a little train they have on site to get there- I wish there was an option for you to walk there for people with multiple children and are stroller dependent. Petting the stingrays and visiting the tiger was definitely a highlight for us. In addition to the aquarium, they also have a small amusement park outside which was a cool twist. Super fun visit for families or individuals looking to break up the day!

I’m sure you’ve read the reviews saying don’t waste your money for less than a 15 min walk through. We spent at least a couple hours here. Yes we did stop at each exhibit, took pictures, and enjoyed our day! We saw plenty of the animals. Including the tigers. We rode the train and got to see some sharks. That was fun! We rode the Ferris wheel and the carousel both fun and no waiting in line. We had some of the frozen Icees. They do have some food and prices are good but didn’t eat there. Entrance prices are affordable. Bathrooms were clean. Staff were polite all around. There was no wait time to get tickets. We went on a weekdays. Would definitely be back!

Stopped here for an early Valentine’s dinner while traveling through Houston. It was perfect! My wife and I loved the aquarium exhibit and eating next to the large tank was a lot of fun! Fun little amusement rides outside. Great place for a young family trip. We wished our two daughters had been traveling with us because they would’ve loved it! Reasonable prices. Restaurant is a little pricy for a family dinner, but it was a nice night out!

name: Whatz-Up Fun Park
address: 700 E Cedar Creek Pkwy, Seven Points, TX 75143, USA

reviews.text: Went for my son’s birthday and I had a great time!   Had kids from 2-18 and everyone walked away with smiles! They have great deals for this park on Groupon also. Very affordable! The only thing that I didn’t like was how long the line was for go karts and laser tag! It was like waiting in line at six flags!
Due to weather we had to change our party plan. They were able to help us out at the last minute and made our granddaughters birthday party a success. They went above and beyond.

Well cost $110.00 for 4 of us but we had 14 in all, nothing works! Machines are mostly broke, laser tag only had 7 working guns, go carts in need of repairs, don't know what happened but we spend about 450.00 and very disappointed, I do not recommend,
you will find a hard time keeping children happy here, rock wall was the only thing they enjoyed, only 5 bumper cars work, should be called ( What's used to be Fun park) NOT RECOMMENDED..

We had my sons party here today and although the pizza was decent, the place was a hot mess. The poor girl handling our party was also handling a few other parties alone, which is pretty stressful. She did a wonderful job of remaining calm and doing her absolute best to handle all our needs as fast as possible. I definitely think there needs to be a manager handling the parties with the employees because that was way too much for just one person. We had fun but a lot of stuff was broken or out of order and the lines were ridiculously long (understandable due to lack of staff). We didn't even have time to try everything because we were running so late on our party due to the lack of staff and only having 2 or 3 staff members running it all by themselves. We wanted to do the Go-Karts but so many of them didn't even work that the line wasn't moving very fast. Very disappointing. I wouldn't mind going here again if they repair things and hire some more folks, but they definitely should repair their broken things, and hire more staff or this place will be run into the ground in no time. Not worth what we spent due to the complications and lack of working machines/Go-Karts/etc. And you have to wait in line regardless of purchasing online. They should have a separate line for online purchases to move lines smoother and faster.

Terrible Putt-Putt coarse. I wish I could post pictures. Lots of grooves under turf from rain. Definitely not kept up. Good enough for 2 year old, I guess. Also, the tiny cars for kids are very hard to push the pedal for little kids. Some of the cars were not charged. Very underwhelming experience

name: The Funplex
address: 182 NJ-10, East Hanover, NJ 07936, USA

reviews.text: Held my son’s 10th bday party here and we had a ball. I did the laser package and the kids absolutely enjoyed. Amelia was a great host and she basically gathered the kids from the party room and took them around as a group to enjoy the festivities. No stress or hassle for birthday momma. Will definitely be returning when the summer hits for the water park

I took my son and his siblings to this place for his 7th birthday. His siblings and friends were of different ages and they all had a blast. The older ones enjoyed the arcades, amusement rides go kart and bowling the younger ones enjoyed the foam frenzy, arcades, go kart and bowling. The food court wasn't too bad, the food was decent and had some good variety.
Only takeaway is one has to make extra purchases for arcade games even after paying for the unlimited rides. I feel there should be more credit allowances included in the ticket purchase. I spent $250 on total entrance tickets and only received 10 credits on arcade which equated to one or 2 games on each wrist band.

Outside of this, I would totally take the kids here again, next time in the summer so they can experience the outside water park.

Highly recommended but be sure to read what is offered and purchase accordingly to maximize on the fun. If you have older kids, the amusement, go Kart rides and bowling is all you need.

Not a happy experience, if you use Groupon, you have to wait until after 6pm??? Super crowded, parking was horrible, my daughter went on the go karts and was stopped twice because a girl got sick, so she asked if she could go again for the inconvenience and was rudely told no ?!? Anxiously was upset for waiting so long and not enjoy her ride!!! Had to purchase expensive regular price and went home not happy!!! Overall a terrible experience!

This was my 1st time back here in over 10 years. I forgot how small it was In the beginning. It was so hot! So crowded! And we came on a Sunday!! I can only imagine what a Saturday or any other day looks like. I didn't eat before I got there and that was a mistake. I spent a $45 on food! Their nachos with the works is a 10 out of 10. The pizza was pretty good! Churros was pretty dry. Pretzels and the drinks were good!! Depending on how many kids you're hosting, it's best to bring $100 minimum or more. I can't wait for the water park to open in May. I probably wouldn't go back on a weekend just because it was way too many people. Have to see what a weekday looks like. The bowling alley was a nice 30min-1 hour wait. I didn't realize it was a bowling alley until I went looking all the way around the place looking for my folk. This place has something to do for all ages! Super dope.

"I had an amazing time at Funplex! The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful, making the experience even better. The bowling was so much fun, and there were so many other activities to enjoy. Whether you’re looking to play games, bowl, or just have a great time with friends or family, Funplex has it all. Highly recommend for a fun-filled outing!"

name: Galveston Island Historic Pleasure Pier
address: 2501 Seawall Blvd, Galveston, TX 77550, USA

reviews.text: The pier has a modern vibe, which is unexpected for a historic place. I was a bit bummed that they charge $12 per adult just to walk through the amusement park. But hey, if you’re a kid or someone who loves rides, it’s still a great place to spend a few hours!

We had a pleasant visit to the pier on a Sunday afternoon. It wasn't too crowded and the wait for entry or for the attractions was never more than a 5 minutes. The food is WAY overpriced but you expect that in a place like this, and the views are SPECTACULAR! Entry cost just under $100 for three adults, and you can complete your visit in 4 hours or less, leaving Ome ty of time to hit the nearby gift shops or the beach.

It's a small fun place in Galveston. We got there right when it opened and spent about an hour and a half there. Kids were able to ride all the rides that were opened at the time. The wristband price was decent for the activities though we did purchase it as part of one of those city packages. We would come back next time if we're visiting Galveston with friends and family that hasn't been to Pleasure Pier.

Perfect sunset location! Things to do for all ages! I recommend looking on Groupon. Was able to get full tickets for my kids for 85$, sounds steep but came with $50 voucher for food or recreation on the pier! Great deal. I got a 12$ day pass as I wasn’t going on rides. Kids had so much fun for about two hours. Then we took the $50 voucher in email to Bubba Gump Shrimp right at end of pier. Our meals came to 5$ and a tip … great deal, so much fun! Beautiful views!
Fun spot! Understanding the pricing was confusing though, but sunset on a spring day in Galveston was pretty perfect. Rides were great, clean and maintained well.

name: Gravity Park
address: 106 W Marlin St, South Padre Island, TX 78597, USA

reviews.text: Gravity Park is an absolute must-visit if you're in South Padre Island! From the thrilling reverse bungee to the classic Ferris wheel with breathtaking views of the island, this park is packed with fun for all ages. The go-karts are a blast, and the mini-golf course is both challenging and enjoyable. The giant stick thing was amazing too, probably the best thing! The only downside is that the prices can feel a bit steep, especially if you're planning to enjoy multiple attractions. *You can only pay to go on the rides once* that said, the quality of the rides and the unforgettable memories make it worth every penny. It's the perfect spot for families, friends, or even a fun date night! We'll definitely be back next time we're on the island. Gravity Park truly adds to the magic of SPI!

Super fun experience! The bungee jumping and swing are about $25 a person. The golfing and go karts are about $10. I did the double carts with my younger brother. The go karts do require a drivers license. The mini golf course was way longer than I thought and it was fun. It’s a little loud in the park but definitely worth the money!

I think the go karts were generally fun, but if the staff enforced the rules a little more I think it would have been a better experience for us. It’s hard to say though because I’m sure they are too busy making sure people are safe to make sure kids aren’t being jerks and idiots in the track.

My family wanted to drive fast and have a good time but the kids in front of us decided it would be great to block the whole track to film each other (despite the no phone policy) and give each other the middle finger.

Really this is more of a complaint about those kids than the place itself, I just really wish we got to have the full experience of the track without having to go slow and avoid getting anywhere near these kids so we weren’t responsible for knocking their phone on the track by bumping them or something
The go karts were fun. The arcade was much smaller. Checkout the candy/coffee/ice cream shop. The Que Padre coffee is a must try!

$50(ish) to get flung up into the air in a metal hamster cage and try not to have a heart attack. Youngsters rate it a 10 out of 10. The ferris wheel was significantly cheaper, maybe $8pp(?)...and a calm gentle ride.

Check the hours & factor in sunset for whatever shenanigans you hope to experience. My thinking is that during summer months the sunset would be lovely from the ferris wheel....but during winter break the hours were all "dark o'clock."

name: Kemah Boardwalk
address: 215 Kipp Ave, Kemah, TX 77565, USA

reviews.text: Expected some rain for April, but the weather was perfect. Rides for all ages and various thrills. Missed being 5 stars because the gift shops weren't open.  I am also not a fan of the wasps that were near the front entrance seating areas.

Came here on a weekend. Came before lunch and was not crowded yet.
Got crowded by lunch time.
Lines were not too long and fast moving.
Many rides cater for kids unlike other theme parks.
Many food options nearby.
Recommend to start off with the train ride which  goes around the whole
Theme park.

New Year's Eve afternoon visit. Parking is $25 but if you can find a street parking spot then that would not only be free, but lucky as well. Great accommodations for wheelchair access. The street food vendors are just a couple but the corn dog was good and the funnel cake was also good. $14 for the funnel cake and $8 for a corn dog. The area is very clean and there is a good amount of security. The square had a good 80's rock cover band and the atmosphere is friendly and festive. A nice place to people watch and grab something to eat.

Before coming to the Galveston area, I'd never heard of the Kemah Boardwalk. But, it's well known in the area. The first thing I noticed upon my arrival was how clean it was! It reminded me of a premium theme park without the huge admission price. It's free to walk around. Tickets are sold to ride the rides. And there are lots of benches to sit and watch the action. The rides are clustered together but it all seems orderly. There's an adorable train that weaves its way through and around the various rides. Restaurants are intermingled about the property as well. The actual boardwalk itself butts right up against Galveston Bay and affords a lovely view. The only thing that struck me as a shortcoming was the lack of public restroom facilities. For patrons not dining in one of the several restaurants, I only found one and even the Men's room had a line to get in. This is a very nice, family friendly park ready to make some nice memories for it's guests.

Came here for spring break vacation, we really enjoyed ourselves, was a fun experience, so many highlights the band was my favorite, they played really great music, the yacht ride was good, I would have liked if they had more food selections to choose from, the customer service was good, through out the venue we ate funnel cakes, icrecream, we visited the candy store, did face painting, got shirts made for souvenirs, visited the aquarium restaurant, this was another really great attraction, I loved this experience, the host/waitress named Cherry really highlighted this place and made it very special

Improvement
I ate the tenders & french fries, they were not fresh or hot, and the young man that worked there was not happy to be there, he was the only worker I encountered that had poor customer service

name: Outlaw Pass
address: 78 Tate Rd, Victoria, TX 77904, USA

reviews.text: Great place to have fun. We rode the go carts and did the sluice box. My 9 year old enjoyed her first go cart experience! She drove all alone. I gave a 4 star because the potty area none were working. 1 stall was BLOWN UP!! 2 others were locked. So, NO restrooms. With a lot of people there lol.

Great place for kids to burn off some energy.  Staff is friendly.  Food is pretty good, and bathrooms are decent.  It's not too expensive, but the bill can climb pretty high pretty fast with a few kids going there.
My Grandson had his birthday party here and had a great time.   I highly recommend this place to book any party or get together!

A great place for the young and young at heart to spend some time. They offer a variety of affordable entertainment both indoors and out. It’s also a great place to host parties, & the adults can purchase cold beer while enjoying the day!

I had a blast! Went with the Grand babies and my older sons and daughters. They had something for everyone! Fun place! Great staff and Christian oriented which means a lot to me. This place was a little nugget of gold that I didn't expect to be so nice but it was. I had a lot of fun playing miniature golf and riding go arts too. They have a sandbox area that doesn't cost anything and the little ones had a blast playing in it with other little children that were there. The game room was reasonable and had a good variety of family entertainment for everyone. I Highly recommend this place and had a wonderful evening, filled with precious memories.

name: Mainstay Farm
address: 1004 W Bethesda Rd, Cleburne, TX 76031, USA

reviews.text:
A Hidden Gem for Big Time Family Fun!

We had the most wonderful day at Mainstay Farm! This place is an absolute treasure for families with little ones—and honestly, fun for the grown-ups too. From the moment we pulled up and saw the colorful Ferris wheel and ladybug-themed car, we knew we were in for a treat.

The Easter-themed attractions were adorable and festive, with plenty of photo ops and things for the kiddos to explore. Our little one was obsessed with the animals—chickens, bunnies, sheep, goats, and even cows! The petting zoo area was clean, shaded, and just so sweet. Each animal had its own little charm, and the staff was so patient and kind with the kids.

The mini train ride was a huge hit, and the Ferris wheel gave us a great view of the whole farm. We also loved the big trampolines—they wore our son out in the best way. Food-wise, everything we tried was tasty and fresh. You can tell they put love into every part of the park.

It’s also a Christmas tree farm, so we’re already making plans to come back during the holidays. The staff was friendly and helpful all around. Mainstay Farm is the perfect mix of wholesome, Texas-sized fun. Highly recommend for families looking to make sweet memories together!
More than I expected in a good way!  Restrooms were clean, plenty of different food options and staff was chill!  If you haven't been here yet, it's definitely worth the drive and money!

We had a great time at Mainstay Farms. The amount of activities included with admission is amazing. Our girls enjoyed the jump pad, the sheep race, the slide and more. We look forward to our next trip.

We have been going to Mainstay farms annually for 5 years. My twin boys are now 11 and I don’t think they’ll ever lose the desire to go for Christmas 😊

The activities have expanded but the originals like the jumping pillows, the hay barn and Texas tubing are just total classics. I would encourage getting on the mailer so you can buy tix early and save 40%. We love Mainstay

My family and I came to Mainstay Farm for their Christmas Adventure and we had a blast! There was plenty of different things to do, and different things to eat! Plus they have their own wine they sell, and it tastes great! I wasn't expecting too much from their food but they had a wide selection of different things to eat and their churros were especially delicious! We took the hayride across the farm, and even saw some sheep racing! Santa was there as well, taking pictures with all the kids. We will definitely be back next season!

name: iT'Z Family Food & Fun
address: 4595 San Mateo Blvd NE, Albuquerque, NM 87109, USA

reviews.text: We brought an 11yr old and 10yr old for their VERY reasonably priced Late night special! I was AMAZED, I did not expect that even I would have an awesome laughter filled night! From a moms perspective this is what I noticed, First of all the arcade and rides area is totally FOOD FREE, you actually have to Look for the dining and food area, which is a huge bonus when you have small children with food allergies!, Secondly The establishment was CLEAN, it was not like many other places we have gone that are crammed in to to small a building and not properly maintained. Thirdly but very very importantly for us Old school parents was the Staff presence, they were Great, accommodating, quick to fix issues with games, no long process just oh here lets replace your points! The amount of staff really changed the whole atmosphere, it was not a Herd of screaming, misbehaving, unattended children! It was a Huge well spaced area of Fun where the children acted appropriately (While still having a blast!), waited their turns and did not run thru adults etc. Maybe it was just the late night timing but I will never pay more somewhere else when this center gave us such a great experience!!! The rides are great, not 2 minutes n over, but 5 minutes and little if any "lines" except the mini bowling.  We did not try the food, but with allergies we never will anyway so I cannot comment there but all around ITZ abq was one of the best experiences all around we have ever had at any fun center, clean, respectful, and Insanely fun! small price to pay for great memories! Classy all the way, even at closing time when the boys couldnt decide what to buy with their tickets, the staff did not get rude or rushed, and the 11 yr old said it was EPIC x3! You get MORE than you pay for with the late night special!

I used to love playing in this arcade until they start charging for the buffet even though I'm not eating. so I heard about 2 other arcades that are like this one. Hinkle family fun center and Dave & Busters those arcades nice and if you only want play games they don't charge you at all if you are not going to eat food

Avoid this unfortunate excuse for an arcade. The games are over priced, you are required to buy food or a useless pass, and dealing with hovering people for 4 hours is not my idea of a good time.

I'm not sure where to start.

First off, if you are a small child or have small children you may enjoy it.

Issue number one: only two days a week after 8pm can you go and only play the games offered. Otherwise you have to buy their buffet food too. I didn't have a chance to try the food but I find that premise ridiculous.

Second issue:I don't believe it is possible to go there without some sort of pass (late night pass for us, which included 5 dollars in credits to pay ticket and prize based games plus unlimited rides, bowling and shooting/racing games. Which sounds pretty cool until you see the types of games they have).

Largest issue: THE GAMES ARE TERRIBLE.  There are actually few games that you can actually pay on with the unlimited pass. Most of the games are the more entertaining, ticket and prize based games. All of the games for unlimited pay are rather old (4+ years and some I haven't seen for 10+ years), a good portion do not work or have parts that don't work (sound, buttons, etc), and In general there aren't enough games for every one to play comfortably.

I may not be 100% accurate with my claims, so be sure to check on their website if you doubt me in any way.

P.s. we did have fun playing DDR and guitar hero.

*MUST READ!! I took my 4 year old to itz today and my son had won and accumulated a large amount of tickets from hours of playing time. The game manager then ambushed us from behind well we were playing a game, grabbed my son's tickets and took half of them and stated "Our machines don't give out this much tickets you're stealing from us." My son of course cried hysterically, tears flowing down his cheeks, I told the employee are you seriously stealing tickets from a 4 yr old? Outraged and told the problem would not be fixed. I took my crying son away from that horrible place. If you want to punish your kids or ruin their day just take them to itz..

This was pretty disappointing.  Maybe I've just gotten too old.  Food wasn't even mediocre, the games were few and the atmosphere was almost depressing.  The staff looked bored and annoyed.  I'd rather hang out at the DMV.

name: Peppa Pig Theme Park
address: One Legoland Way, Winter Haven, FL 33884, USA

reviews.text: My girls 3.5 and almost 6 loved it!!! We traveled from Ohio to Florida for spring break and knew this had to be one of our stops. Our girls love Peppa Pig and absolutely loved the park. My husband and I also loved the park. It was very clean and well done! We loved seeing all the characters throughout the park. You can tell the park is very new and well kept! Lines were short, so the kids were able to ride the daddy pig roller coaster many times! We liked that we could ride the rides with our children and we enjoyed them as well! The meet and greets and peppa show were also big hits! We also enjoyed cooling down in the cinema. The only downside I could say was that parking was pretty pricey!

This is our second visit, and it's confirmed: this park is perfect for toddlers! My two-year-old loved the rollercoaster. It's truly the best place for little ones, and the whole family can enjoy the spacious dining and movie theater for relaxing. Adding a Peppa Pig resort would make it even more magical for the kids.

The place was incredible! The theme is exactly like the Peppa Pig show, and everything was fantastic. It’s perfect for kids aged 8 and under. The staff are very kind, and there’s even a swimming area for kids. Don’t forget to bring a swimsuit for your little ones because they’ll want to enjoy everything! The park is a bit small, but it’s packed with fun activities.

The kids loved it. It was so cute. Rides were cute. Lines were short. So much things for them to do and take pictures of. They really enjoyed it. Food was limited but the pizza was surprising tasty and crispy. It was a bit pricey but did come with juice and chips. So sad the hours were so short though.

Very Cute experience for my 4 yo niece. She saw this place on YouTube back when it first opened in 2022 and has wanted to go ever since! We were finally able to take her and even though she growing out of the “peppa pig” stage, she and we(me, her mom, and Mimi) thoroughly enjoyed the experience!

name: Bolder Adventure Park
address: 2324 W Warrior Trl, Grand Prairie, TX 75052, USA

reviews.text: The place is excellent for a family fun time. Went with my wife and kids and we all played and enjoyed it. It’s clean and has several attractions. Their Pizza is really good, a must try I would say. Other sides are good too, we tried dipper fries and tinders. I wish they offered a couple of dipping sauces but we were the last order so staff might have been tired of up selling already! I would have given it 5 stars but Leslie on cashier didn’t bother to give enough information on the difference between packages and timing that I need to go to attractions that I booked! More of a figure it out yourself attitude. I ended up paying $240 for a family of four while not using most of the attractions! Also Google maps wasn’t accurate, they close at 8:00 not 9:00, always check their website. On the other hand the manager on duty was nice to give us 4 Blue cards without an expiration date to come again as a make up for the misunderstanding.

We went into Bolder Adventure Park with high expectations, and we were not disappointed! The tickets are fairly priced for all that is included in them, and you can easily spend 5+ hours here.
I was also very impressed with the quality of food. Typically these kind of places have low quality food at high prices. We ordered a full sized pizza (for under $20) and the kids burger. Everything tasted amazing and looked delicious.
We visited in January and the temperature inside was comfortable. They do have lockers on site to hold belongings. The staff was friendly and helpful for all needs.
I definitely recommend giving this place a try when looking for active fun!

This place is incredible! Hands down, one of the most fun experiences for families in the DFW metroplex!

There truly is something for everyone.

We came on a Saturday around noon. We purchased tickets easily and were able to enjoy a super fun day here right away!
The lines for the attractions weren’t bad at all. In all honesty, we moved through the lines faster than I anticipated!

My boys (ages 5&7) really enjoyed the Tube Slide, the Shoot Out Range, the netted climbing areas, and the Ball pits. We purchased the Blue attraction plan and felt as though we had a GREAT experience even though the Blue plan didn’t include the rope climbing experiences.

The place is massive and maintained well. Good, attentive staff!

We had so much fun at Boulder Adventure Park! There's tons to do for everyone, young or old. The ropes course and rock climbing were really exciting, and there was a good selection of arcade games. We loved the bumper cars, slides, and the blaster arena. The ice skating wasn't the best, but everything else was awesome. Boulder Adventure Park is a really fun place to go, with lots of different activities for everyone to enjoy. We went around Christmas time and the decorations were a nice touch.

We had such a great experience at Bolder Adventure Park! There was a slight misunderstanding about the hours, but the staff and owner went above and beyond to handle it with professionalism and kindness. They communicated so well and made sure we were taken care of. The park offers a unique experience that everyone loved, from kids to adults! It’s incredibly clean, safe, and FUN! We’ll definitely be coming back and will be recommending it to all our friends. Thanks again for making it such a fun and positive experience!

name: Six Flags Over Texas
address: Arlington, TX 76011, USA

reviews.text:
Family enjoyed the rides at the park. Six flags has a good collection of roller coasters for all levels or riders.

Lines were long because of spring break. It seems like they let too many flash quick pass people go over regular lines for most of the rides causing the wait times to go up.

Several rides were down the day of my visit, but common at six flag parks that I’ve been too previously.

The parking lot is huge and pretty far away from the entrance. There are no trams so you’ll be walking.

Excellent place to go!
It recommended to buy the tickets before and the public parking price its better than the private parking.
The park’s opens at 11am to 9pm, so it recommended to be there at least at 10:30am
If you visit during holidays you can bye the flash pass, but it’s up to you to buy it.
You can download the app and gives you the map and all the info for all the roller coasters.
There is a lot of places for you can eat.

Over in the DFW area on holiday and love a coaster so 6 flags was a no brainer! Worked out cheaper to buy an annual pass than a day ticket plus parking so ive been twice in a week so far.
