Some really good coasters..... New Texas Giant and Titan are incredible! Pandemonium is a lot of fun too. Theres several big thrill rides but loads of family/smaller child friendly stuff too which is great. Id personally recommend the Flash Pass to give you an allocated ride time. The park is clean, rides are spread out and theres a whole tonne of food/drink options available including free soda refills if you buy one in a six flags reusable cup. Absolutely recommend checking it out!

I recently visited Six Flags and had an amazing time! The roller coasters were thrilling, especially the Superman and Twisted Colossus. The park was clean, and the staff were friendly and efficient, which made the experience even better.  I did experience some long wait times during peak hours, but the lines moved quickly enough to not ruin the experience. Overall, it was a fantastic day, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for an exciting day out!

This was our first time here and we totally loved it. So many rides for young kids, my kids had great time and wanna come back again. I would recommend to come early to avoid long waiting time. Definitely we are coming back.

name: Traders Village Grand Prairie
address: 2602 Mayfield Rd, Grand Prairie, TX 75052, USA

reviews.text:
WOW!! I’ve lived in Texas for …….a while now, and this was my FIRST (to best of my memory) time going. IT IS HUGE!!! I have limited mobility so I wasn’t able to cover much ground. But, based on what I DID see, there’s lots of repetition. Same stuff, different vendor. Prices were decent (everything has gone up so, can’t complain).
I will HAVE to go back to cover more ground.
I WAS impressed with the amount of seating and food vendors!! Very nice. But…..TEXAS??!! Giant OUTDOOR flea market?? Seems kinda silly to me.

Traders Village campground in Houston was wonderful. There is no shave that I saw so I'd say the summer would be more heated.
Traders Village flea market in Houston is probably enjoyed by many people. We came both days and didn't see much that was in her interests.
I came to the campground because of the flea market, hoping it was like Harry tornadoes flea market. There are  too many permanent vendors and it looks like they are selling pretty much the same thing. Don't let that stop you. It just isn't in my interest.
The church yard sale kind of saved our visit. More like a yard sale.
Lots of great restaurants nearby like Black Bear Diner

Trader's Village is the biggest flea market in Texas and USA, of course.
Here you will find everything you need.
From clothes, tools, watches, carpets, toys, cleaning supplies, mattress, furniture, wallets, tires, bedding sets, plants, antiques, deco etc....

In Trader's Village, you can enjoy your margarita or beer, and dance with the different groups and singers.

Fun time for everyone !!!
So much variety. You’ll need to shop around to get a good deal. Not all venders take offers. There are several food stands. The parking lot is huge.
I love this place! You can always find something you need or want. The rides are really fun as well.

name: Universal Kids Resort
address: Frisco, TX 75034, USA

reviews.text: Even though this is mainly geared for kids and families, I'm not going to be surprised if you see a lot of adults going too because to be honest we're kids at heart and it's going to be really neat to see how this turns out. And I know tons and tons of theme park enthusiast that are going that have already told me.
5th review!!! Even though I DEFINITELY do not fit the demographic for this park I’m extremely excited for it!!!
Very much excited! Can’t wait 🥳

Looking forward to the new theme park in Texas. Kids will be excited.
It's not a full theme park like in Orlando but should be a fun park for the kiddos.
The kids watch the construction in anticipation everyday as we drive by. Very excited for it to open.

name: Dutch Wonderland Family Amusement Park
address: 2249 Lincoln Hwy E, Lancaster, PA 17602, USA

reviews.text:
I took my 5yo and 2 1/2yo there in early July. We had such a wonderful experience that I know we would come back some day.

First as a busy family, I appreciated the fact that we can use our ticket any day within the year. We had a last minute travel plan changes and we couldn't go to the park the day we wanted to.

Varieties - we have been to three other parks before but this takes the gold as to the inclusive of age and heights of kids. There is something for every young age. There was also so much to do and the lines were not terribly long, average wait time for us was 15min. Though there was a lot to do, the park wasn't awfully big. That is a good thing for young kids that are not in stroller and parents pushing stroller. We were not too exhausted to go on more rides. The water park was fantastic! Lots of seating area for everyone.

This is a cute amusement park. There are plenty of fun rides for kids of different ages. We enjoyed some of the more low key attractions like the spinning tea cups and the train ride. We had all the food and games there. We visited on a super hot day, and the highlight of the trip was Duke's Lagoon. This is a huge outdoor water play / splash pad area.

Went for the first time with 3 adults and 4 kids and had a blast- kids ranging from 4 years old to 12 years old and there was something for everyone. Parking (even in the non-preferred) was very close to the entrance still and easy to navigate in and out of- although a little pricey in my opinion $20. The wait times on the rides were very reasonable and there is a great variety to choose from. At one point they even had a dance party with the dragon and princesses in costumes and a bubble machine! Although a lot of the concession stands sold your typical pretzels/ dippin dots/popcorn we did find some good spots (I’ll review those separately) but my fave was the pretzel at Penley’s Pub! I also liked how they scanned adults IDs and only allowed 4 alcoholic drinks per ID, no obnoxious drunks at the park that is geared to kids! We also had a baby with us that nurses and the nursing facility for moms was GREAT, very clean, had AC (nice break from outside), a changing station and two rooms with rocking chairs to nurse your baby! I was very impressed with the park overall and it was a nice way to spend the day!

Great place for young kids, better than six flags if you ask me. Many rides, we didn't even have time to get on all of them, decent food inside, really a fun day for kids. The water park was packed,  more packed than the rest of the park, and ride lines, probably 10 min wait, which is bearable. Totally recommend!

A great park to visit with Family. Kids of all ages can have fun rides. There are quite a few family rides as well. We loved the sky walk, family rides, rail, Show. Sometimes online offers discounted price tickets, parking is $22 or $27.50 (opposite to main entrance). Food options inside the park is not so great, I would expect more options considering this as a family park. Plenty ice cream options 😄! Visit is worth the money and is recommended

name: Yesterland Farm
address: 15410 I-20, Canton, TX 75103, USA

reviews.text: This place was adorable! We got there shortly after open for the Easter event. It was a Sun. Lots of photo ops, fun carnival type rides for the kids, animals, food and desserts. We had a really fun time. Ended up being there for over 4hrs.

YesterLand is fantastic! The kids loved the rides, the hot chocolate was perfect, and the real pines made for beautiful Christmas trees. Highly recommend buying tickets online! Be prepared to be outdoors and wear comfortable shoes for walking on grass and mud. A wonderful holiday experience for the whole family!

We went there on Black Friday 2024 (first day of Christmas carnival). We had a blast. The lines were not long. We didn’t have to pay extra for rides. There are more activities that you have to buy tokens to attend like pony rides, paint ball etc. food was good for the prices. Definitely recommend!

Great place to take 2 toddlers. The farm is spread out, plenty of entertaining choices. The kids loved the carnival like rides, the paintball and apple cannon area were awesome! It’s a great way to spend part of a day. We got there when it first opened, it got more and more crowded as the day passed….as expected.

We stopped here one day on our way through to Dallas after passing it the day before we got tickets online and went the next day. We went when they were running the fall special online for tickets and it was pretty well priced for what it was. They had a pumpkin patch, a petting zoo, some rides, games and a corn maze. We went during fall, so obviously they were doing Halloween and the scary corn maze, but they also do things during Christmas and Easter as well. The kids really enjoyed the candy cannon which shot candy out for all the kids to grab. The food that is there in the restaurant/store was good as well but if you didn't want that they also had a couple food trucks.

name: Evermore Park
address: 382 S Evermore Ln, Pleasant Grove, UT 84062, USA

reviews.text: This place is amazing. Even the unfinished buildings add a bit to the ambiance.  We went for the overnight Ghost tour and really enjoyed ourselves. The staff was really friendly but I wish all employees at least were in costume. Most buildings were not staffed for this event, but we are definitely going to come back often for the full experience. We are so lucky to have Evermore so close to home.

Our experience at Evermore park was a such a happy and memorable time! The staff was friendly and helpful. The decorations were awesome. The haunted tour was just right! The food was delicious, and the games and adventures added to the whole night. We left wanting more. We will definitely be back!

This place is awesome. If you’re into going somewhere that you feel immersed in a fantasy world this is the place. We went for the Halloween event and the story was super fun. We could become knights, or witches among other things. Each had their own 3 step quest line that kept you talking to the workers. You could tell the workers really enjoyed what they were doing. They stayed in character and made interactions really fun. The decorations are sweet and for $21 per ticket for adults it’s well worth it. They also had a bird show that had some rare birds and cool facts. and some shops if you’re interested in that. The offer food and snacks but we didn’t purchase any of those. I would suggest getting there early and signing waivers beforehand. It’ll save you time. It took about 24 minutes for us to get from the end of the line to enter to getting in.

I really wanted the winter Dickens experience at Evermore Park to be great. It wasn't. We bought combo tickets in advance and had to wait in line to get in because apparently entry was free on the night we went.

There were no explanations or maps on how to redeem our experiences - each seemed to have its own method  and taking a picture of the map by the front entrance wasn't helpful. The big map had names scratched off or didn't have the same names as the events. Fortunately someone in our group had been to the park for a different event and knew generally where things were. The park isn't large and is a loop.

The decor is quite good and the storytelling experience was lovely, with quality performances and scenery. The performers were the best part of the park. However, the ice skating experience was a joke. There was no skating, just walking/prancing on plastic sheets in dull skates. The train was not operating for the night. The wait for hot chocolate and an overcooked churro donut was 45+ minutes only to be told that they were out of hot chocolate and offered apple cider instead. We could've waited another 15 minutes for hot chocolate. The other activities (archery, knife/hatchet throwing, and battle (not part of the combo pass) were lacking and underwhelming.

The shops and craft booths were nice, but small and disjointed. There were stages and other venues that went unused.

This place has so much going for it, but fell flat on its face in terms of execution. It is a beautiful park. I hope that they can improve on the experience - there is so much potential.

Super fun! Great place to "live" in a fantasy world lol. Was there for all the cool halloween stuff!  Great for all ages. Even the food's good here. Have fun with the train.   There's some cool interactive stuff like throwing knives and stars and shooting bows and arrows .  Although the equipment was pretty trashed .   Having live acts on the main stage was pretty cool as well.
The only thing that really upset me and that really kind of ruined it for me was they ran out of ice cream... Like don't have that included in your combo ticket if you can't manage your inventory. Respectfully,  My son was really bothered by it. We're all excited about it and then they crushed our spirits.

name: Lagoon Amusement Park
address: 375 North Lagoon Dr, Farmington, UT 84025, USA

reviews.text: The memories made as a kid that I now get to replicate with my kids in the wonderland that is lagoon is absolutely priceless. I love this place and all it has to offer, which seems to only get better year after year. Thank you lagoon!

We went to the Bier Garten and it was delicious! Most people don't know they are open during the off-season. We were their first customer for the day, and it was so quiet. The food was amazing! I would recommend more sauce for the fries and tartar sauce for the fish and chips.

Park is clean and the coaster collection is good especially with Cannibal its the start attraction but the only reason i wont give 5 stars its this place is a little on the expensive side when it comes to amusement park's and i visited on a saturday so the park was packed.

My husband and I have both been coming here since we were kids. So there is a lot of nostalgia when we come here. Our adult children also have enjoyed many experiences here. Even though we enjoy all the rides we grew up on, like Colossus and the wooden roller coaster, we also enjoy all the new rides like Wiked and Cannibal. This was our first time coming here since the new ride Primordial opened. It was a long line, and we waited over an hour to get on. It was a blast, a little roller coaster mixed with a 3D interactive video  game. We also enjoyed eating in the Biergarten. The food there is much better than the regular carnival fare, but it's a little pricier too. We also like to wind down by walking around Pioneer Village, where it's a little quieter and laid back. All in all it's a great place to spend the day with family and friends and you can find something for everyone.  We just usually run out of time to be able to see everything and do everything we want to do. Just wish it wasn't so expensive, but they have no competition for 100s of miles.

My son rode the sky coaster today, and he said it was the best experience ever. And if you have a season pass, the x-venture rides are five dollars off, so that is a bonus for Lagoon season passes.
And then on the new ride, Primordial (It was my first time) We waited over an hour and a half just because it kept on braking down.
But other than that, it was an amazing day at the park. 👍

name: Ricochet Canyon @ Gardner Village
address: 1132 W 7800 S, West Jordan, UT 84088, USA

reviews.text: Went to Ricochet Canyon at Gardner Village. It used to be only a seasonal thing, but now it's open year round! It was a nice little place to take small children for a fun outing. It's entirely enclosed, so you don't have to worry about littles wandering. We took 3 little kids (ages 3, 6 and 8)  and they loved it. Favorites included the little roller-coaster and the pony ride. There were picnic benches with shade umbrellas (which was nice since it was a hot day).  It's next to all the shops and events center. Parking immediately  outside the park. Admission and petting zoo are free (but you can buy a cup of feed to give the animals). You can buy individual ride tickets or stamp passes (see photo). The employees were very friendly and attentive.  (Review written July 23, 2024)

We hired the petting zoo to come to our family reunion! They came to the park we were at and it was so great! The kids (and adults) loved playing with all the animals. Baby chicks, a pony, a goat, a bunny and even a baby cow! Such a fun day!

Such a cool place! It’s a fun getaway excursion in the middle of the city! The family can experience petting some animals, pony rides (the short or long version 😉) a rollercoaster, and train rides in the old west. You can practice your roping skills and have the kids explore a little old west town and get out some energy. There’s the Happy Camper deli nearby just a walk away in Gardner village that has some delicious items for lunch and bakery goods.
We love it here and that some of the staff are younger kids that are caring for the animals and putting in hard work.
The ponies are our favorite!!

We used the offsite services and had them bring a unicorn to my daughter’s 6th birthday party and it was amazing!!! If you don’t have a friend with horses willing to dress up, this is the next best thing. The price and service can’t be beat. Larissa has a love for animals and people that’s bright and uplifting. She not only helped keep the kids occupied but safe. If you have a kids that loves unicorns, I highly recommend ricochet canyon to make their birthday a blast!

A little hot for mid July but they had some misters going which was great. Petting zoo was free (until sept. I believe) and we had a free animal feed coupon with the get out pass. My son had a blast feeding the goats and emus then had a good afternoon checking out the shops at Gardner. Staff was super friendly and one was doing the ponies hair into cute braids which was fun 🤪

name: Killington Adventure Center
address: 3861 Killington Rd, Killington, VT 05751, USA

reviews.text: I do not recommend this place for a family trip. There are some fun things for the kids, but we encountered a few problems. The main attraction is the Near Mountain coaster. Unfortunately, when we were there, we only got to go on twice before they closed it for several hours due to maintenance issues. They will offer no refund, discount nor any rain check for this. When I went into the snack bar to buy two Gatorades the cost was $18.15. It was over nine dollars per Gatorade. The food prices are exorbitant. If you come here, I recommend you go to one of the local restaurants or bring your own food.

We were in the area and saw the signs for the place, the park is so cool and activities are so adventurous yet kids friendly! Unfortunately we went one hour before closing time so got a ticket for one activity only! The park is definitely on my list for next visit!

This is what $320 + tax gets you at the Killington Adventure Center: a small playground and an even smaller bike loop. Complete JOKE with several attractions closed for maintenance and the others closed for a wedding - with ZERO notice when you purchase tickets. We waited through a line for the Mountain Coaster so that the EMPLOYEES could take turns going on the ride themselves (pictured), just for them to only let half of our group go and close it before the other half could. They lied about having a military discount - which we also didn’t find out until after we bought tickets. Their solution for all of this? A $10 “Brighten Your Day” voucher. We had to talk to 3 different people and wait through a line twice just to get the tickets refunded. I will never return and would NEVER recommend this complete trainwreck to anyone unless I wanted to ruin their vacation as well.

I enjoyed my time here but sadly the conditions were not great while I was there. I was told to visit again during the best season of February - April. If conditions were better and all trails were open, this place seems to rock!

Hilariously bad experience. You can’t buy tickets with a person. You get in line for what looks like ticket sales, and they tell you to go off by yourself and buy them in your phone. Don’t know what you’re doing? Good luck. Unsure of what you want/need? Good luck. You’re in your own. There are ticket windows, but they’ll offer absolutely zero assistance other than telling you where you can find a QR code to scan and do everything yourself. Maybe it’s just a simple process to purchase the tickets online though. But nope, you have to create an account. It’s like they hired a PR firm and said “we want to eliminate all personal touches, we do not want our customers to feel like we care about them at all, we want a 100% transactional business. If you can make everyone super confused, that’s a bonus”. Horrendous example of where America is heading.

name: Atlantic Fun Park
address: 233 15th St, Virginia Beach, VA 23451, USA

reviews.text: Cool place. Very polite staff. WE had been planning this trip for a long time. The kids knew they would miss out on some local attractions, but then they would get unlimited access to this amusement park and they took full advantage of it.

If you have not taken your kids to the ocean front Fun Park  yet they are missing out on a good time. Went today and had a blast with my kids. Lots of rides and games for every age. Staff was really nice and helpful with any questions we had. They have several food options to pick from. Ordered the biggest fried corn dog I have seen with fresh batter. Make sure you get on the Ferris wheel what a view.
Small amusement park but fun! Kids loved it! Rides were alittle worn, but being near the beach it's understandable.

Perfect for ages 5-10 or older (38-48in ideal)!  Not the nicest or most put together park but staff is kind and friendly and bathrooms were not horrific.   Rides were safe and all were operating. Go earlier in the evening for younger kids before the older crowd rolls in!

We loved it!  Lots of things for families to do.  Teens & young adults will enjoy it also!  Plenty of games to play & snacks to eat.  Love all the lights at night.  It's Definetly something beautiful to see.  Fun to be had by all 😍🥰🎡💛🙌🫶

name: Busch Gardens Williamsburg
address: 1 Busch Gardens Blvd, Williamsburg, VA 23185, USA

reviews.text:
Being from Fl, theme parks are everywhere. This experience was a bit underwhelming. Maybe it was the “time of year” we went. They had a lot of the venues shut down and the rides were at half capacity so the wait times didn’t seem to reflect what was on the app. We didn’t see a ton of animals.
The over all countries seemed cool. The buildings matched and the aesthetics were nice. The food was what you would expect from a theme park standards $$$. We went to have ice cream and they were out of a lot of options.
Staff didn’t seem excited to be there. They weren’t rude just didn’t seem happy. The park was celebrating “member appreciation” but I’m not sure there were many whom felt appreciated from talking to locals in the lines.
Again maybe everyone was still in winter mode lol. I would maybe try again but not sure it’s on the top of my list.

Visited during their Mardi Gras celebration. Parking is paid so I recommend getting all your reservations taken care of early! Use the Busch Gardens app to just pull up and go. Security is a breeze and if you are a pass member, you can have your photo tied to your account or show id at each visit.

What else can I mention, the park is beautiful and clean always and vendors are full of surprises. We visited as a family of 6 and everyone had a good time. My favorite places to eat are FestHaus and New France's smokehouse. As with all theme parks, prepare to bring your wallet. BG is cashless, but there are few places in the park to turn cash into a prepaid card. You can refill in the park as you go. I used that as I do not like using my debit card everywhere. Overall, it's Busch Gardens. I love visiting and purchased a membership just so I can visit whenever I have a little extra spending money 💰

Beautiful Christmas decoration and atmosphere! Outstanding Christmas carols and music with  very impressive cast and performances! We visited after in winter time, and I was very pleased to see there are heated sitting ares through the park and multiple fireplaces scattered around the park as well! The rides were on, but we skipped them because of the lower temperature. But there are there for the brave! Check the schedule ahead at the time and on the day! When we bought the tickets online, the schedule was from 10 am. On the day, when we checked,  the schedule was from 2pm-10pm. It was perfect for us because we didn't care about the rides, and because of the cold weather, it would be too long to walk so long in the park. But from 2-10pm, was the perfect length to enjoy the daylight and the  Christmas lights! My favorite show: GLORIA!

Absolutely my favorite amusement park. The park is beautiful. With each different part of the country representing different countries in Europe is really cool. They make you feel like you’re in that part of the world. The shows are always fun And entertaining. The food is good. Roller coasters are super fun. And even if you don’t like coasters you can still spend all day there having fun..

We had a great day at Busch Gardens Williamsburg! We went on a Monday at the end of July 2024. We booked the VIP parking, which is conveniently close to the park entrance. We were there at park opening, and the wait time to get on the rides was minimal to none. We were able to ride most major rides, some twice, had lunch on-site, and we left the park mid afternoon. Pantheon was our favorite ride, followed closely by Griffon and Tempesto. We were amazed by how clean and beautiful this park is. I would definitely return.

name: Fun Land of Fredericksburg
address: 1351 Central Park Blvd, Fredericksburg, VA 22401, USA

reviews.text: It was super easy to host a party at FunLand. The staff were friendly and professional. The main “issue” we had was that you couldn’t add food other than pizza with your host. If you wanted to get chicken tenders or fries you would have to leave the party to order then leave again to pick up, which is difficult if you have a room full of young people. There was a lot of things out of order and some  machines would take ur play points, and the line to get help was too long.

We had a great time, was not crowded at all. We were there from about noon until 6:30 PM on a Saturday. Never had to wait longer than two minutes to get into any of the rides or laser tag. Staff was great and attentive when we needed help. Place was pretty clean. Food was decent.  Had a pizza (which is hard to mess up!  Definitely will return.
Due to the previous snowfall, everything outside was closed

We had fun And it was definitely worth the money.  The discount by using the app was great. It was not busy and everyone especially the ticket counter guy were great. He even gave us three extra tickets just to get my 5-year-old up to 75 credits so we could get a lollipop. I would have given a five star review but some of the games were down and some of the attractions were not working.

Amazing amazing place for dates, group hang outs and much more! A lot of the games were pretty cool even though I lose in half of them it’s always fun to be here! Highly recommend this place to those who just want a quick trip to Funland! Much better than Dave n Busters!🤩
Took my   15,12,7 year old they loved it fair price on family packages. This time we dint try the cafeteria so I left the one star open for our next visit.

name: Kings Dominion
address: 16000 Theme Park Way, Doswell, VA 23047, USA

reviews.text: Awesome time @ New Years Eve 2024. Weather was just perfect. The place was full, but it was still easy to walk around. The lines were long, but accessible to a few rides. Kids and adults had fun. The bands playing fav's for all ages keep everybody dancing and having a great time. Fireworks were top-notch.

Went for opening day today. Wasn’t too crowded given and it was a beautiful 80 plus degree day. Most of the r coasters only had one train running which made for long wait times. 21/2 hours to ride the all new Rapterra. IMO only 4-5 good coasters they rest are blah.  Happy 50th!!

We went to Winterfest for the first time on 12/14. The park is really decked out for the holidays and the lights are absolutely beautiful. It was not crowded, very easy to navigate. The one and only thing I would recommend is more places to dine inside. They have a lot of kiosk style places to grab something at the window, but very few indoor places. Other than that, zero complaints. Clean restrooms, friendly employees, some rides were running but don’t expect to go during this event and find all rides running. This was a great way to get in the Christmas spirit!

Came here for Halloween Haunt and had a blast! Decor was top notch, scare mazes were a lot of fun, and the actors did a great job keeping the scare factor going. The rides are a lot of fun, roller coasters are plentiful and high quality, and there are a lot of family friendly rides too. The ride ops were super friendly and high energy. Expect long lines if you go on a Saturday. The food is pricey (just like with any amusement park) but they have a lot of tasty options to choose from if you need a meal, and cater to certain dietary preferences as well. And they have alcohol too?? Say less. The park was very clean throughout, though some of the restrooms could use a bit more attention. This was my first time coming in over ten years and I was very impressed. Thank you for a great time KD, we will be back soon!

Attended Winter Fest 2024 and had a wonderful time! The park was beautifully decorated with lights and displays, vendors throughout the park and rides were open. If you're looking for a fun family winter activity (or great date night), add this to your list.

name: Motor World
address: 700 S Birdneck Rd, Virginia Beach, VA 23451, USA

reviews.text: Awsome and very fun, put out course was unique and pretty. The go carting was fun. Although it is annoying because some carts turn slower than others so you get a disadvantage when racing, but if you’re just racing for fun it does not matter. Drinks and food is pricy so bring your own. Most of the employees are chill and interactive except a few who look like they only work there because it’s semi easy, the employees consist of young men

Not worth it! Waaay too expensive and run down! It was highly disappointing to see a place that truly could, positively serve our community in a great way be so gross. Rides are sun bleached and worn down. Walk ways filled with trash and the surrounding area looks like a junk yard! Spend your money at the go-cart park in Williamsburg and do not waste your time or money at Motorworld in Virginia Beach!

We came out on opening day and we got there around 11 it was no wait and the staff were very nice and very helpful. My boys were in two different high requirements but near each older kids ride was a little kid ride which made it easy to watch both children will be back for sure

This is one of the most fun place in Virginia Beach. We come here often as a family and this place never disappoints, there is just so much to explore here. I really enjoy the friendly staff and the old-school vibe of this place. If you have kids and leave nearby, make sure you give it a try.

We had the most amazing experience at the go-kart track, thanks to Dylan and T-shirt, who went above and beyond to make sure our 3-year-old had an unforgettable time! Our little one was initially hesitant about the go-karts, but they were so patient and encouraging, easing all those worries. By the time we got going, everyone was belly laughing, and our toddler was having the time of their life! It’s not always easy to find places that cater to young kids, but they truly made the day magical. We can’t recommend this place enough for families – fantastic staff and tons of fun!

name: Leavenworth Adventure Park
address: 9342 Icicle Rd, Leavenworth, WA 98826, USA

reviews.text: Ever since this opened I had been wanting to try it out.  We finally had the chance this week. The ride is fun and exciting and the grounds are nice.  I will say though that $20 for a 4ish minute ride is somewhat expensive.  The only discounted option is to by a two ride pass for $36, four dollars off the second ride, but only when you purchase the first ride, you can't go back and get the $4 off. I thought the ride would be longer and take you farther up the mountain.  That being said, I loved it and was smiling during and afterwards. Wish they offered some kind of ride bracelet which gave unlimited  rides for the hour or day.

The coaster is an absolute blast but the wait was about an hour and a half. Fun but takes about two hours or of your day to go here. Wish they had a couple more for pits so we could have done the smores kit. With only one fire pit, it was always taken with a big group. Worth the experience though, it you have the time

The Alpine Coaster was so much fun. It took a while to get to the top, but once you start going down, the fun begins. You can control the speed with the two sidebars. I went full speed, and it was worth it. The price is a bit steep, $20 per ride. But you can buy an additional ride for a discount. When I finished, I wanted to go back on another ride. You can choose single or double cart. The views of the mountain while riding the coater were amazing. When you finish, you exit into the cafe and seating area.

So much fun! The workers are also very kind. It sells out fast so you need to get tickets as soon as you can.

I wish we would have gotten the deal for 2 rides, but we ended up getting a second ride because the person in front of us was breaking the whole way and it slows you down so you don't bump. When we got to the exit, they offered us another ride to make up for breaking the whole ride. For the most part they can control waiting on the person moving slow so they don't keep sending up riders until that person has gone through. You can also request to have a slower ride and they'll time it out for you. Going slow the first time was kind of nice because I got an idea for how it worked and got to enjoy the sights. I'd suggest getting two rides overall because it is so much fun.

They have 2 places you can get food (first and third floors) You can also buy a s'mores pack to make at the fire pit out front.

You can't take bags on the ride so we left ours at home, but we saw people leaving their stuff on the second floor where you get on and then coming back for it right after their ride.

I highly suggest trying the alpine coaster!!! So fun!

This is really nice experience to control your own ride.

I been to Sixth flag and Orlando Universal island of Adventures. Those rides are automatic. But Leavenworth Adventure park you can controls your own ride.

The First time when I inclined with full throttle it was smooth but when you’re coming down you need to apply brakes otherwise it will too fast(at least for me).

So if you’re looking for a little adventure in nice Bavarian town it’s nice place.

Notes: The Park staff is really helpful. They can answer all your questions. You need to sign up a liability before getting your ticket.

name: Remlinger Farms
address: 32610 NE 32nd St, Carnation, WA 98014, USA

reviews.text: We had the best time here this week. Our granddaughter had a school of rock concert here and we saw the small amusement park and, though we didn't get to go to the pumpkin patch, we may the next time we are in town. The food was great and the venue was pretty amazing. Lots of photo opportunities and we saw baby deer on the road on the way to the farm. Can't wait to go back when we have more time. This would be an amazing place for kids and for families as they have really gone all out with decorations and it's an authentic farm.

Is this place worth visiting?

A Yodeling YES!

Remlinger Farms is a family, friendly paradox.

It is a surprising mixture of humility and extravagance.

Why?

Well How extravagant can a farm truly be?

Well, this place has a petting zoo, a jumpy house, a train ride, and a small restaurant (think fast food court yet nicer). For me that is enough to make me curious.

Yet there is more !

This place is also an amusement park. Not a grand scale, one like Great America. Yet nicer than the carnival coming into town.

You can get tasty ice cream.

There is a Chuck E. Cheese style arcade room (a.k.a. a children’s gambling center).

They have live music.

They have their own brewery.

And they have a well sized shop with locally made items from jams, to sauces, to meats, popcorn, and more!

This place we certainly hope to return to soon.

Enjoy!

Hot tips.

*When we arrived, parking was easy. Yet I could imagine it’s getting packed here during nicer weather. So, you know, get here early during peak season.

*You should certainly hit up Snoqualmie and North Bend. Snoqualmie for the epic waterfall.
North Bend, especially if you’re a Twin Peaks fan (this place also has beautiful Mountain View’s) and wish to check out their famous Twede’s diner.

*For coffee and cold brew drinks  check out Huxdotter.

We love remlinger farms would get to stock up on ready to bake pies, with the berries from the farm. The children love all of the rights and of course the train that goes around the farm. Also we got a hay ride to the pumpkin patch at the farm and all of the children from the school were able to pick a pumpkin as part of the field trip. We also had a special time to get to pet all of the animals.

Beautiful and fun place, it has several attractions to share with your children. But be careful in the big restaurant where the little trains are. Do not give your card to the cashier. My family and I went to this restaurant for lunch and at the time of paying I swiped my card and the cashier asked me for my card to swipe it again because the payment couldn't be made, I didn't see a problem, but now that I see my account From the bank, I see that in this restaurant they charged me, in addition to what my purchase receipt said, $50 more dollars for two more meals that I did not order and do not appear on my receipt. Apart from that, he had given me the incomplete order. Well, but the kitchen did solve that, which was a missing sandwich. But the collection of those $50 dollars, that was a blatant theft. And now I can't complain because, obviously, I no longer have the restaurant ticket🙁😠 because I had thrown it away after leaving this place. So be careful, and don't give your card to anyone and save your tickets 🥺😢.

Remlinger Farms is a combination of pumpkin patch and amusement park. Buy tickets online ahead of time as you get a better deal than at the gate. Parking here is easy and they have lots of it. There are a few sections to the farm, with tons of food options, bathrooms located in the middle, fall activities, and lots of things for kids. They have rides here like a Ferris wheel, giant slide, and more. It's a great place to bring the family and we love coming here together!

name: Leavenworth Adventure Park
address: 9342 Icicle Rd, Leavenworth, WA 98826, USA

reviews.text: Ever since this opened I had been wanting to try it out.  We finally had the chance this week. The ride is fun and exciting and the grounds are nice.  I will say though that $20 for a 4ish minute ride is somewhat expensive.  The only discounted option is to by a two ride pass for $36, four dollars off the second ride, but only when you purchase the first ride, you can't go back and get the $4 off. So if you’re looking for a little adventure in nice Bavarian town it’s nice place.

Notes: The Park staff is really helpful. They can answer all your questions. You need to sign up a liability before getting your ticket.

name: Wild Waves Theme and Water Park
address: 36201 Enchanted Pkwy S, Federal Way, WA 98003, USA

reviews.text:
Booville/Fright Fest
We came 10/19/24. We had a 3, 4 and 10 year old. I was so irritated about the bag policy because it wasn’t outlined anywhere that’s easy to see on the website. It’s the smallest bag and every single person in line had a diaper bag, backpack, or like us, a tote with extra kids clothing and snacks/drinks. They made us walk all the way back to the car. Thankfully, we had a wagon so we could keep our stuff. Most people couldn’t and there were some pretty upset moms with diapers and wipes that had no other way to carry them. Our 10 year old had a mask on with his costume and he wasn’t allowed to wear it so we had to walk that to the car also. Most of the rides that were open, our 10 year old was too tall to ride and the 3 & 4 year old required an adult, which was fine but the height requirement that allows kids to just go alone is so narrow. Kids 36” and shorter require a parent and kids 42-48” are too tall for the “kid rides”.
My 4 year old was so excited to see zombies but we left around 7 pm and didn’t see one scary “monster” so he was disappointed.
We were there from 230-7 and the lines were pretty short, even on a Saturday.
All in all, worth the money, but check your bags and remember there is no masks or full face of makeup for kids over 48”.
There was also no trick or treating and only one person had a bucket of candy.

I've been during all seasons (Summer, Fright Fest, and back when they did Christmas lights). Fun rides, but they usually only have a section open during Fright Fest. Parking is up to $20 now and it's worth it to get a season pass that's a couple dollars more than one day. They also don't allow purses, but they do allow large backpacks. I don't get it.

Water slides and rides are just as fun as the dry rides. Lockers are sometimes hard to come by so it's often easier to just use your car as a locker. Food is a little pricey too.

They do a good job with the haunted houses during Fright Fest, but one of the houses has an extra fee to enter so we didn't do that.

Have gone once a year for the last 25 years or so. Untill this year. The price  has doubled since covid. At $180 for a family of 3 to enter plus 20 for parking. Thats $200 just to walk in... We always bring lunch and walk the long trek back to the car for lunch. Probably another $100 for the 3 of us if we didnt. There are less working rides since covid... a few specifically are always down. Why should I pay more but recive less open attractions? It might be a good deal if you get the seasons pass for only $15 more. But we live 2 hours away. For the price we have decided not to go this year for the first year. You can get a hotel room at great wolf lodge good for 2 days that comes with water park admission for LESS than a day trip to wildwaves. Sad to see what covid did to local businesses. Maybe new owners price hiking? No idea. If you charge more. We should recive more. Not less.

I am a season ticket holder. I get one for me and my daughter every year as it is a great deal. Honestly, if you plan on going more then once then its a no brainer to get a season pass.

Waterpark - There is plenty here to do for water play. There is a huge wave pool with cabanas for rent around it, lazy river, kid zone water area with mini slides, and multiple areas with water sides. On warm summer days expect long lines for the water slides. They do have white lounge chairs setup around pool areas though you will want to get there early to get a seat. Everytime I took my daughter and her friends there was always multiple life guards watching over pool areas and I feel they do a good job. This is a good place to bring the kids or friends/family to cool off on warm summer days.

Park Rides - This is the frustrating part. There is a decent amount of attractions here. Two big coasters and a variety of other rides for everyones liking. The issue I have is that there is always....always alot of rides that are not running which is disappointing because on some days its the ones you were wanting to ride. Example is the timber hawk ride, I think I actually seen that ride running twice out of the countless times I have went. Not sure if this is due to staffing or maintenance but it should be looked into and figured out. Being a season ticket holder I feel as though I am not ever able to get the full experience or value due to this issue. The wait times and lines are not too bad for the rides on some days.

Housekeeping - No complaints here. The park is pretty well kept and bathrooms have not been horrible the times I have been there.

Food - Food is pricey but that is to be expected  when eating at any theme park. You get a good deal on drink refills when you get a wild waves big bottle. I suggest you bring a water bottle with you and eat before you go or bring your own snacks.

Staff - The staff is primarily a bunch of younger kids/teens probably first jobs or just summer jobs. Some do well working the rides they are tasked to operate while others dont take control and call people out for not following rules, cutting lines etc.

Season Pass - Great value though I do want to point out that when it states it includes 2 friend/family passes that is mainly for weekdays. My daughter brought her friend with her on a  Saturday and I had to end up paying 42 bucks for her as the friend/family pass didnt cover weekends and that is not clearly outlined on the website. Just a heads up so you can avoid that frustration.

Its nice to have a local theme park to visit for rides or the water park. Not the best but its still a good time with plenty to do. I would still recommend to go and experience it.

They have closed the park early on us and kicked us out once when we were there because "it was too slow". Many times the rides are not working and are broken down for large parts of the day. There are bees everywhere and staff don't do anything about it. Sometimes the lifeguards have double standards. Overall, it's okay. Could be a lot better but I enjoy it and it's very fun. The food is expensive but Excellent quality and delicious!! The season pass is definitely worth every penny. I will come every year on a season pass, but not for a single admission.

name: Camden Park
address: 5000 Waverly Rd, Huntington, WV 25704, USA

reviews.text:
Camden Park is a very cool little amusement park. It is neat to ride some vintage rides that are 100+ years old. It goes to show that when things are taken care of, they can last for a very long time. Then again, today's products are take built like they used to be.
There are new rides there as well that are cool. I appreciated the little step back in time and strolling down my boyfriend's childhood memory land with him. (We aren't so young either.)

Our 2 friends, husband, and I all had an absolute blast here. We went in with low expectations and a love of Fallout. We were very pleasantly surprised. The rides were great, the atmosphere fun, and left feeling super happy. This is definitely a place worth going to when in the area during their open season.

Our family of about 20 people, adults and children went together to have a fun family outing and we did just that.
We purchased a group package, which was a great deal, and rented a shelter.
Everyone had an amazing day together, just laughing, playing, talking, and making memories.
We should always support our local places to continue to help them grow.

This place is pretty dumpy and over grown. Looks like it's getting ready to be abandoned. The men's room was especially scary. Ceiling falling down broken stalls with missing doors. The ones that do have doors are old pay toilets.  Did I mention they charge to park here? What kind of amusement park doesn't have bumper cars?

This has been a family tradition after each years family reunion we would stop here. This was thr first time my children got to experience the park. Our expectations were low but we left wanting more time for ride. We were a group of 13 ages from 8-60 years old. Everyone had a blast! We survived The Big Dipper!

name: Bay Beach Amusement Park
address: 1313 Bay Beach Rd, Green Bay, WI 54302, USA

reviews.text: It is a great place for families with younger children as well as a great place to take youth during the summer on recreational field trips. The tickets aren't expensive for the rides and the wait times aren't too long. There are a lot of dining option kiosks with your typical fair food options, but there's also a large indoor grill  cafeteriaThe big wooden rollercoaster, The Zippin' Pippin', was a favorite of Elvis Presley.

This is a wonderful old-fashioned amusement park. Entry and parking are free, but get here early because parking fills up fast! Tickets are 25 cents per ticket, and no ride is more than 4 tickets. This place is especially fitting for smaller children, but I think it would be fun for teens and older people alike. Bring your own picnic to enjoy at the many picnic tables. You can also bring grills because they have hot coal bins available. There is a small and very reasonably priced snack concession stand offering hot dogs, cheese pizza, various sized soft drinks, pretzels, popcorn, cotton candy, and a few ice cream novelties. I bought a hot dog, 32oz soda, large popcorn, and a pretzel with cheese, and it came to $18.25, which I thought was a good price. Lines are longer in the afternoon, but they move quickly. Almost all the rides are accessible if you are able to walk a few steps to get onto the rides. Unfortunately, these are older rides, so not all body types will fit comfortably on/in them. There is disabled parking at the front where the big white building is located.

Absolutely amazing amusement park! The tickets are 25 cents each and the most expensive ride is like 4 or 6 tickets! The rides are clean! And everything is so kid friendly! There’s rides for the whole family! We spent almost 3 hours there and just totally enjoyed it. My kids were exhausted but very happy. Would definitely recommend!

Was the first time I had been there.
I went with my 11 grandchildren ages 1 to 13.
There were rides and activities for every one of them.
Couldn't believe we spend under $20 for each one of them for an all-day adventure, which includes meals and snacks.
There's a big playground on both ends of the park.
The only downfall I saw is that they need a few more bathroom areas along with maybe a drink vending machine.
You have to walk alot to see everything.

Such a beautiful amusement park, perfect for everyone. Had a ton of picnic tables, restrooms, parks on both sides of the theme park, tons of rides. We could have spent 2 full days there! We will definitely be back!

name: Little Amerricka Amusement Park
address: 700 E Main St, Marshall, WI 53559, USA

reviews.text: What a fun little gem. I have been eyeing this park for a few years now and finally made it over to get some coaster credits. The classic rides were really fun. The Swiss Toboggan was not nearly as painful as everyone has said. I actually had no pain, just felt smashed into the boot car. It was fun though. Train ride was awesome. Staff was super friendly as well. We will be back!

This is Wisconsin's little hidden gem!!  It's affordable,  not long lines like other amusement parks,  great for families and kids of all ages,  even us is retired farts!!  We bought season passes for the whole family.   You can take in your own food and drinks.   The rides are very well maintained, no flattering or clanking!!  I've never felt unsafe on any ride!  We have taken our 8 month old grandson up to our 30 yr old granddaughter and we're 64 and 69 yrs old and always have a blast!  When they say all ages,  they mean it.   We have gone in weekdays and weekends and never wait over 10 minutes.   They also have mini golf and go carts at an additional cost.   We love the bumper cars and that's included with the blue ticket.   We love Little Americka!!!

Surprisingly fun, clean and good variety of rides. Nice carousel. Train looked fun, was full for the times we tried to board.  Inexpensive for tickets/wristbands compared to State Fair, Wisconsin Dells,  etc . Food was reasonably priced, small portions.
The reasons I gave 4 stars instead of five:
- concession line and wait for food was quite long. They have a tiny kitchen and need more efficiency in the staff.
- mini golf course was fun (if brutal) very good design! Needs to be cleaned and have a few repairs to the greens.
- restrooms . There is only a single stall in most of the restrooms and they are poorly labeled. They were clean though!

We visited on a whim, the place is awesome. It’s got free parking, we arrived there was a special $14 for the gold pass tax included. That gives you access to all the rides. We very much enjoy Meteor, the train and the hunted house. The food was delicious we had a burger, brat and mini donuts. I highly recommend stopping by little america.

Loved this little hidden gem. We have fun and it wa sa surprise to see they had something to fit all ages. The train ride was a nice surprise with how long it was. You seen so many great things during your adventure.  We will definitely be back!

name: Mt. Olympus - Water & Theme Park Resort
address: 1701 Wisconsin Dells Pkwy A, Wisconsin Dells, WI 53965, USA

reviews.text:
I have stayed in bad hotels before, but this was by far the worst experience of my life. We were there for just one night, and it was nothing short of a nightmare.

When we arrived, we checked in and went straight to the indoor water park, which was extremely disappointing. The water was dirty, and the entire place had a terrible smell. We were told that our room would be ready by 4 PM, so we waited. When we finally received our room key, our plan was to go straight to bed with our 2-year-old and 3-year-old so they could nap before we continued our evening. This was the primary reason we paid extra to stay at the hotel with the indoor water park—to ensure convenience and avoid cranky toddlers.

At 4 PM, we attempted to enter our room, soaking wet with two exhausted toddlers. However, the door would not open. We tried multiple times before calling the front desk for assistance. A staff member arrived but was unable to help. Another technician came, also with no success. Eventually, the manager showed up and suggested that someone might be inside the room, as it seemed to be locked from the inside. After forcing our way in, we realized that the main door lock was broken and needed to be replaced.

We were given two absurd options: either stay in the room the entire time and only leave at checkout (because if the door closed, we wouldn’t be able to get back in) or leave the door open. We refused both options. They assured us it would be fixed in 15 minutes, but 1.5 hours later, they admitted they needed to call someone else. By this time, it was already 5:30 PM. Another technician arrived and worked on the issue for another hour before finally telling us there was nothing they could do, and we would have to sleep with the door open.

This was completely unacceptable. I insisted on being moved to another room near our family. Instead, they relocated us to the opposite side of the hotel, forcing us to carry all our belongings while juggling two overtired and crying toddlers. My husband and I were beyond exhausted and frustrated.

When we finally reached the new room, my little boy needed to use the restroom. The moment he stepped inside, he slipped and fell badly. We then noticed that the ceiling above us was leaking, and the entire bathroom floor was covered in water. We had to take him to a doctor, and we are now considering legal action due to the extreme negligence and inconvenience we endured.

This was the worst hotel experience I have ever had. The lack of proper maintenance, poor customer service, and complete disregard for guest safety are unacceptable. I strongly advise against staying here.

I used to come here as a kid when it was called Treasure Island, and i still love it. It's changed a bit between then and now, but i still love it. We had so much fun! I love the family environment, and everyone is so nice. The water could be a little bit warmer, but overall, it was a blast! We love it here. This place gets a lot of hate, and I don't understand why. Other than the water not being that warm, and the heat could be higher, it was great. So much fun! Definitely recommend it!

Where do I start! First of all this is not a resort. This is a scam that this hotel is using to get more money from their guests. A resort should be a home away from home. This is not that. My room was ready upon arrival which was great but when I entered the room it was covered in dust. There was a glass table/lamp in the far corner of the room that I could write my name on because the dust was so thick. My daughter who is 8, pulled the blankets back and the bed was covered in black curly hair. So we all ended up sleeping in the other bed together . They do not offer coffee or tea in the rooms or in the lobby. Nor was there any body lotion which being a water park “resort” you should offer to your guests. My 1st night there an employee changed the garbage outside at 2am and slammed the trash and the door to the outside closed. No respect for the guests whatsoever. The people above us were so loud, until well after 3am. It seemed more of a party and get drunk motel than a resort. I was in building 10, they had mattresses in the garbage area, which reading the rest of the reviews tells me they also had a bug issue in that building. The walk to get to the water park was ridiculous. It was a confusing maze. We had a cabana for one of the days, there was a server who was supposed to come to us when we rang the button. It was a 45 minute wait before they would come. We ended up just going to get our own food and drinks. The life guards were not even paying attention half the time and I never saw a supervisor in the pool area. My daughter said Great Wild Lodge was better, and honestly with the “resort” fees you pay at Mt. Olympus it’s ends up being about the same price.

As our group was settling in for the weekend at Mt. Olympus, we discovered a live German cockroach in our room in Building 10. After calling the front desk, they relocated us to Building 1, which is connected to the water park.

The first night was fine, but Saturday night was a bit rowdy in the hallways. However, the real disruption came at 2:30 AM when we were all jolted awake by the fire alarm. With temperatures around 15°F, we had to bundle up and wait in our car for about half an hour. Strangely, no fire trucks arrived—only four police cars and later a single fire chief’s vehicle. They eventually silenced the alarm, but no clear explanation was given. From what we overheard, it was supposedly due to a “water leak”—quite the leak if it managed to wake up hundreds of guests in the middle of the night.

There was also no staff directing the evacuation (people were jamming up the stairs, had it been a gas leak etc things could have gotten bad) or informing guests if it is safe to re-enter, we walked back in once it was silenced 30 minutes later. After talking with some staff the next day it came out that kids pulled an alarm lever.

The next day there was a brawl at the water park and 3 police cars returned not even 12 hours later, this time adults got kicked out.

As for the water park, it was okay but very crowded, the spin slide was fun and we will go back but doubt we will stay at the hotel again.

Overall, the experience had its ups and downs, but the unexpected wake-up call and lack of clear communication from staff left a bad impression.

Yuck, yuck, YUCK! I’m so disappointed with this hotel and water park I would absolutely not recommend it to anyone. The level of dirtiness, disrepair, and lack of amenities just makes it a terrible experience. I’m lying in a bed here wishing I was back home.
We got early check in, and discovered we were in building 10 (out of like 24 buildings). When we came to our room, we were greeted with all sorts of debris and garbage in the hallways, like crumpled up dirty socks and chewed up gum. I thought maybe they just hadn’t vacuumed yet because we were early, but it has stayed that dirty the whole time.
The room is dingy and soooooo barebones. Some of the beds weren’t made- they just put folded up sheets on top and expect you to do it yourself. There are no hand towels. Or tissues. Or coffee maker. Or staff in the building.
It’s a literal free-for-all here. As we were coming back from dinner, we found a lost kid. He didn’t know his room number or his parents’ phone numbers, and I tried to help him find his room, to no avail- all the room numbers start with “2” and are 5 digits long, so it’s super confusing- he didn’t know what floor he was on. After we wandered the halls for a minute, I tried to take him to the front desk to discover there was no front desk, and no employees were to be found whatsoever in the whole building. So that definitely contributes to the fact that people are going wild and partying above me right now and it’s 3:00 am.
Ok, so the room and its building are bad- but we came here for the water park! Y’all, it’s so gross. You can smell the bathrooms from like 20 feet away. It was so poorly planned- there are areas where you have to squeeze between a pillar and the lazy river- like to come up or down the only staircase into the park- it’s not even wide enough for two people to fit through. And there are a million people at the park. People are everywhere. Crowding at the sparse number of tables, saving all the seats so we could only find one chair for our party of 10. Putting their stuff all over the floor because there’s literally nowhere else to put it. Changing in the stinky bathroom stalls because there’s not a changing room. There is ONE family room with a changing table, and I think a family was living in it when we were there. They kept sending people in and out of the room while we waited for it for about 25 minutes. We finally gave up and changed in a stinky bathroom stalls
But we didn’t come for the bathrooms- we came for the slides! Meh. My kids went down them for about an hour and then everyone was ready to leave. Our 10 year old called it a mediocre water park, and I think she was being generous. Do not come here. It’s seriously worth it to pay more for a more expensive water park. It feels so gross and dirty here.

name: Tom Foolerys Adventure Park
address: 1305 Kalahari Dr, Wisconsin Dells, WI 53965, USA

reviews.text: Looked online for things to do. Turns out it was walking distance from our Hillside room. My kids really wanted to go try the human claw machine. Neat busy place!

Credits to play games were too high. The all-day wrist band includes laser tag, rides, and obstacles course. Not the arcade, mirror maze, or bowling. We went 2 days, and all my kids wanted their actual tickets printed bc they thought it was fun to feed it in the machines..however they all were shorted 100s of tickets. So, definitely opt to have them virtually added to your card instead. People there were not friendly at all. (The employee doing the human crane was nice actually, but that was it). My kids were able to blow throw 200 credits each in less than an hr. Which ended up okay bc the lines for everything else were sometimes an hr long. My kids had the most fun on the human crane and laser tag.

An Unforgettable Family Experience at Tom Foolery!

Our family had an absolute blast at Tom Foolery! From the moment we walked in, the staff went above and beyond to make sure everyone had a fantastic time.

Our 9-year-old daughter, who uses a wheelchair, was able to enjoy the rides thanks to the amazing staff who helped her every step of the way—even assisting her in climbing the rock wall, which was such a touching moment for us. Seeing her light up with excitement was priceless.

Our 22-year-old son, who is nonverbal and has CP, absolutely loved all the games. He was engaged and happy the entire time, which made the experience even more special for us. And my wife? Well, she found her own fun—she was completely hooked on the coin-pushing machine!

It was a day full of joy, laughter, and unforgettable memories. We can’t thank the team at Tom Foolery enough for their kindness and effort in making sure everyone, regardless of ability, had an amazing time. We’ll definitely be back!

Fun Times at Tom Foolerys Adventure Park! 🎉

We visited Tom Foolerys Adventure Park in August 2024 with our group of two adults and four teenagers, and let me tell you, we all had a blast—like kids again! 😄

The arcades were definitely a highlight—so many fun games to choose from. However, it’s worth mentioning that some of the games and the arcade area itself felt a bit dated. A little refresh would definitely take the experience up a notch.

We were excited to check out the bowling alleys on the second floor, but unfortunately, we ran out of time. From what we saw, it looked like a great addition to the fun, so we’re definitely planning to try it out on our next visit.

Another great perk is the plenty of free parking, making it super convenient to visit without any hassle. 🚗

Overall, Tom Foolerys Adventure Park is a great spot for families with kids, and even us adults couldn’t resist joining in on the fun! It’s a lively place where everyone can find something to enjoy. 🎮🎳

Thank you!
Val Milan Realtor

We go to Tom Fooleries fairly often. Usually we have a decent time.
Here are a few complaints and I hope by making this review, corporate will take our suggestions seriously.
For families who have young ones under 42inches tall, you get a $20 wrist band. They literally can only do 1 ride alone. The small rollercoaster and large Carousel , they have ti be accompanied by a paying adult which is $45. Not even an older child (we have a 12 year old) who had a $45 wrist band.
They also can’t do go carts even as a passenger with a responsible paying adult.
They have mini rides but those are credits, 12 credits for the tea cups which equates to roughly a $5 game card……… 1 min ride, it’s just mind blowing to me
Also the arcade, good luck finding anything under 10 credits to play. I bought a $10 game card and got 1 game out of it because it was 12 credits and the game needed two people.

It also highly bothers me that they have attractions (human claw) that require credits. As if you don’t pay enough with the wrist bands as it is…….the lines are long and it’s not fun to wait 30 min in line to be told you can’t do it, employees enforce these rules like their life depends on it, there is zero leeway.

As a parent, I don’t personally want to do any of these rides, but I’m forced to. They need to revamp their rules here, it’s a small theme park, it’s not that serious. They also need to re-evaluate how many credits these arcade games cost. It’s pretty much $5 per game, which is ludicrous.
Thanks for coming to my ted talk.

name: Treetop Adventure Park at Snow King Mountain
address: 402 E Snow King Ave, Jackson, WY 83002, USA

reviews.text: Incredible experience riding the zip lines at Snow King Mountain.  Shannon, Tom and Jasmine were great guides helping us feel comfortable and confident on the fear inducing course.  Our family of four had a blast and will surely be remembering the adventure for years to come!

Our zip line experience was awesome! Shannon and Mel were friendly and patient. They explained everything, made us laugh, and helped ease any worries. Tom was also friendly when we first arrived and as we were returning. The view was spectacular and well worth the price also.

We actually did just the zipline, and it was great!  The guides are fun and knowledgeable. There were only 5 people in our group, so it went really fast. It was our anniversary, and Alex, the sweet lady  in our group, offered to take pics.
Overall very fun!

Whole family fun. Came for the Alpine Slide and saw all the additions (prior visit was 2012). Took the kids on the coaster and I stayed for the zipline. Highly recommend it! Our zipline guides Katie, Joanie and Shannon were extremely helpful and supportive, ensuring the group moved smoothly. Recommend online purchase of tickets for the discount, but if you book online for the zipline, do note that you need to arrive 15-20min ahead of your booking time to make sure and get checked in and suited up. Bigger riders fear not! I'm 255 lbs and everything is fine!

Rob, Riley, Joey, & Beau were our Zipline Guides and they are Fantastic. Rob was  my favorite guide because he was the most talkative and very personable but also more professional. All 4 guides were amazing, but we got to talk to Rob the most. The Zipline is absolutley amazing. We have ridden multiple Ziplines around the world and this was by far the best. No other Zipline even comes close to this one. The views are breathtaking. The ride is fast and fun. My two teenage girls rode it and had a blast. This is a must-do item when you visit Jackson Hole Wyoming.

name: Funcity Adventure Park
address: 4671 Onondaga Blvd, Syracuse, NY 13219, USA

reviews.text: So many different activities for kids of all ages... trampoline basketball, trampolines, foam pits, games, ball pits and an amazing jungle gym, wall climbing, and so much more! . it's a little pricey, 1.5hrs $24, 2hrs $28 and 3 hrs for $32

Visited Fun City Adventure Park today and my son had a blast! There are all types of games for him to enjoy, and even the big trampolines are a hit. Adults can have a good time too. The staff are incredibly friendly and patient with the kids, making the experience even better. The price is fair, making it a great value for a day of fun. Highly recommend!

Disgusting and unsafe environment; If you are sending your child to a birthday party here or planning a birthday party for your child here, I would highly suggest that you reconsider. We walked in for my nieces 10th birthday party last night, only to be jumping for 10 minutes before a disgusting and vile fight broke out between a ton of adults who also involved their children in the fight. This fight went on for over 15 minutes before security, any of the employees, or police stepped in! Fighting and cussing and being disgusting right in the front lobby in front of all of the staff who were blatantly ignoring them and subjecting every child there to this trauma. When my family member asked for a refund for the $500 birthday party she just paid for, the staff refused and only agreed to partially refund her her money. They made her pay for jump socks and 4 pizzas that we weren’t even able to utilize and still kept over $200 of her money! Everyone who checked in at 5pm were forcibly removed from the premises, but if you had reservations at 7pm or later, you were allowed to come back and jump. My niece’s entire birthday party ruined for some ghetto disgusting fighting. Even more disgusting that all the staff and security just stood there watching a huge fist fight break out in their lobby in front of all these children! You will NEVER get my money again dirty fun city. Do not send your children here they are not safe!!!

Booked a party room and the room was not ready when we got there. The staff at the front told my guests that they needed to check in with the host in the party room and would get their socks at that time. Every time we would have to hunt down a host who then needed to go and find our host. They never asked what size socks the kids needed just gave them some and left the room. My guests had to go back upfront to get a different size because they gave them all small. They only provide one juice or one water per jumper. So if parents want something to drink they charge you $2.00 for a water and because we went on a weekend they charged $2.50. Their website says that the host will help with set up, service and clean up. They did not do any of that. While we were doing cake a host come in the room and took the utensil/plate/napkin hold her. I advised that we were not done and they responded with “I’m taking it to refill it”. It was returned after we got done. While picking up the room a staff member come in and asked who to give the bill to. While we were carrying things out someone else come in and asked us if we were using the card on file to pay the bill. They then walked me to the front counter to make sure we paid.

Very poor customer service. Would not recommend having a party here.

Plenty of parking. Nice place to bring the kiddos for a few hours or the day. It's $24 for 1.5 hrs $28 for 2 hrs or $30 for the day. If you pay $30 for the day you are allowed to leave and come back if you want. It also requires jump socks which are $3.50 a pair. They have a ball pit with slides and some tunnels to crawl through. This is a area for kids 10 and under. They also have different structures and wall structures to climb with a adventure course. This area also says for kids 10 and under. They have a foam pit you can jump in. A trampoline dodge ball area,basket ball area. Various trampolines and a foam pit obstacle courses and a small zip line going over one foam pit. The arcade they have costs extra and is not included
They have some massage chairs you have to pay for to sit at. Also various metal benches you can sit on. Definitely a place to check out. My kids loved it. They have ample parking this is located in a shopping plaza area.

name: Nickelodeon Universe Theme Park
address: 1 American Dream Wy, East Rutherford, NJ 07073, USA

reviews.text:
What an amazing experience at American dream mall.  Jonas Brothers were great,  how they went from one location to the next to accommodate all fans. They will be traveling to more cities. So many families with little children were enjoying a free event. They did have vip up grades that were pricey. I would just get their early in line  and do the free events. Such an awesome experience to share with my daughter and her best friend.  As in the picture they both towel with Joe Jonas on it.
My daughter who is 21. First concert ever was at 6 yrs old a it was the Jonas Brothers and then again at her sweet 16. They are so talented and put on a great show!!!

Worth every penny! I recently took my kids to the Nickelodeon park, and we had an absolutely fantastic experience! This place is a dream for families, especially with young children. From the moment we arrived, we were impressed by how spacious, clean, and well-organized everything was.

There’s so much to do — rides, games, arcades, and even mascot appearances during the day. The variety of activities is perfect for different age groups, from toddlers to older kids. My kids loved the mini roller coasters and the soft play areas, while my preteens enjoyed the more thrilling rides.

What really stood out was how safe and kid-friendly the park is. The staff were friendly and attentive, and we always felt like our kids were in good hands. The attractions were well-maintained.
Now I didn’t find much food options at the park itself but it’s in a mall so we just took a quick break, walked to the nearest restaurant and had a bite to eat there before going back.

We ended up spending the entire day there because there was just so much to explore. It’s a fantastic spot for a family outing, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a fun and stress-free day with the kids. We can’t wait to go back!

Great rides for all ages.  Clean spaces all still look new. Bought the all-day pas. We got the bang for our buck. The lines weren't long. Plenty of sitting areas for those waiting and smooth surfaces for strollers. Restrooms could use some attention.

Nickelodeon Universe is one of the prime attractions in American Dream.mall, as it proclaims to be the largest indoor theme park in western hemisphere. It took me 4 years to finally visit this park, and I must say I was impressed at the vastness, rides and overall experience of the park. There’s a huge section for arcade games in the right corner of the entrance area.

I loved the fact that there’s no ticket needed to enter the park. Anyone can enter the park, watch the rides and  use the common amenities. Passes or points are required to get on rides or to access the Paw Patrol Adventure Bay obstacle course and play area.

They offer seasonal passes which are worth it in my opinion. Took my daughter on back to back days, and she had 4+ hours of fun and entertainment. There are more than 10 rides suitable for kids under 42 inches. They also have characters meet and greet. We got to see SpongeBob and Patrick.

But seasonal passes a mess. They print with the date of purchasing the pass, not the date of visit. On our subsequent visits the scanners failed to confirm our tags. Bunch of crew members gave us a hard time to get on ride. Some made us wait until they talked to the supervisor, others made it sound like they are doing us a favor. Some told us we were trying to use tags from previous days. Seemed like so many of them didn’t know how the winter/seasonal pass works!!!

Vending machines and snack stations are super expensive at the park. A water/soda bottle is around $4, a cotton candy is $13, and bowl of dipping dot is $11. On my second day, there were issues with our seasonal pass. Scanners were not able to verify our passes due to system glitch. A lot of the associates gave us hard time at the entrance of rides. In one case the supervisor had to come and clarify our passes were good.

What a great place for all ages. Parking isn’t bad, I usually go up to the top and it’s empty. It’s definitely overpriced however, that’s the city for you. Cotton candy was $15 from the machine, yikes! Tickets are $10 cheaper if you buy them in advance. The lines are not that bad. I did wait 20 mins for a baby ride.  The young lady running the ride definitely didn’t want to be there, to be fair what teenager really wants to be at work lol. I’ll definitely be back. It’s a great place to escape to with the kids or even adults.

name: Villa Campestre
address: Villa Campestre, Final Ave. Las Cubres (Carr #199, 44 Sector Los Ortega, Guaynabo, 00971, Puerto Rico

reviews.text: Phenomenal experience showing off this place has excellent customer service, such a Welcoming atmosphere, very Clean and organized to my Mexican in-laws. We were impressed how staff went out of their way to check on you for water or offer you shade/umbrellas, there were magic/comedy shows, we killed a cow, feed animals and had a bubble dance fiesta beyond other attractions.
We had a lot of fun playing, petting animals and watching the magic show. My son had the time to enjoy everything the tour offered, even the train ride.

This was a cute kids amusement park. Parents don't need to pay admission unless they want to ride the rides as well. Grownups on kiddie rides was not something I expected. You do not go at your own pace, however. You must sync up with an employee and move attraction to attraction with them and a group of kids / parents. A neat concept, but you don't control your time. Plan a minimum of 2 hours. Still quite a bit is not operational since Maria, but kids had a GREAT time. Everything happens in Spanish.

Loved!! This experience was amazing not just for my son and us ... great service , 5 stars for the tour girl Keyshla I think it is she had blonde hair , she was funny , great with kids and special ... loved her hope we came back and she's there for the tour.
Family friendly for the kids to enjoy. Our second time there and my son loves it. The Halloween event was a cool experience.
